author: {'steamid': '76561197967723388', 'num_games_owned': 1075, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 103, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 103, 'playtime_at_review': 103, 'last_played': 1711598498}
review:
This game plays like a VR version of the point and click adventure games. You go around interacting with the environment and finding the way to solve simple puzzles to be able to continue.

Personally, I found the very first puzzle to be the least obvious one. It was smooth sailing afterwards, but I was about to give up on the game altogether. I'm glad I didn't, because the story is compelling and well exposed. There are also times in which an annoying NPC keeps talking, trying to pressure the player to move forward, while you are trying to listen to a cassette.

Small issues aside, this is a very interesting short adventure that is well worth experiencing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198878776570', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 140, 'playtime_forever': 121, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 121, 'last_played': 1691683861}
review:
I got to stop buying old VR games.. They don't hold up at all nowadays. I'm sure this was good when it came out 7 years ago but now VR has evolved way beyond this game. 

The graphics are outdated and so is the gameplay. Puzzles are very simple and straight forward except the last one. That one was frustrating. First I had to search for 2 numbers from a lab with randomly floating objects. I tried to catch them but to no avail, some were stuck between some walls and created this irritating continuous bouncing sound. After trying to grab the logical items like a floppy disc and a tape recorder for fifteen minutes, I gave up and looked the answer online. I was shocked to read that the numbers had nothing to do with these floating objects. One of them was actually on a piece of paper stuck on a back wall of a table on a random spot. That's puzzle for you, find a note in a room.. 

I had several bugs and severe staggering while playing. For example on the first area, always when I looked up my VR head POV floated like 10 centimetres higher and the same happened when I looked down. This was very nausea inducing. I had to stop playing for a while and drink ginger infused water (it might helps some people in VR sickness) because of this.
Even worse was that in the relatively long narrative final where the player just stands still and watches and listens, my in game hand was staggering all around like crazy and a "Not being able to track" text and my Index play area grid flashed constantly in the screen. Pretty immersion breaking. 

The game is also very short so you will not get value for your money even with a decent sale. Absolutely no replay value. 

There were some positive things in the game. The overall setting and atmosphere were nice and the sound and music was OK. Overall I did not enjoy my time with this game. If this would have been free, I would have left a recommendation, but to pay money for this frustrating experience? No. 

I have unfortunately bough the chapter 2 from a sale as well. I really hope it's better and less buggy than chapter one.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970187929', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 208, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 208, 'last_played': 1685249503}
review:
Playing this for the first time in 2023.
This is an interesting look back to the start of modern VR and that is the main reason to pick this up today IMO
The game itself is very short and ends before it really gets going.
The movement is teleport only and is awkward by todays standards.
Compared to a modern game this feels dated.
I guess that shows how far we have come.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961017729', 'num_games_owned': 3004, 'num_reviews': 3428, 'playtime_forever': 267, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 242, 'last_played': 1708545904}
review: It's almost certainly time for me to replay this game. For 2016, this was more or less the most AAA thing out there. I wasn't insanely impressed, as is/was the case with games labeled as 'built form the ground up for vr', or in this case 'settings standards for movement and interaction for years to come'. I don't know about that. It's teleport and articifical locomotion. It's got tons of production value, which in and of itself is rare for VR games, but today, it might not seem so groundbreaking. Hard to say. Well worth 15 bucks, and should be completable in one full charge of a Vr hat, which is nice too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198113805058', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 130, 'playtime_forever': 160, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 160, 'last_played': 1678578322}
review: Played using HTC Vive Pro/Vive wands/RTX2060Super.A very nice game, looks great. The puzzles aren't that hard, except maybe for the last one with the transistors (I almost gave up on that). Could have had some more puzzles though and the ending of this episode is not really my thing, but we'll have to see if it fits right into episode 2.Liked the inventory system very well.I does show it age in the movement system as I like teleporting, but the way they implemented it seems a little bit off, but still works pretty decent (let's not forget this game is almost 7 years old and still much better as a lot of the current VR games).Got it in a sale a long time ago, and I must say that the 12,50 euro's it costs if not on sale would be too steep for me, but then again, I have a limit of 5 euro's per game, with only a very few exceptions.

author: {'steamid': '76561198110164823', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 38, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38, 'last_played': 1672583229}
review: Uggh, hated this.  It's one of those horrible so-called "puzzle" games where there's very little content, just a scene, an obscure way to get out of it, and basically no clues as to what you're meant to do, because most of the simple, straightforward, obvious things like "step over the fence" don't work in the broken physics engine.  Completely unrealistic and tedious.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970796864', 'num_games_owned': 309, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 17, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1669694255}
review: OK I guess. I couldn't get into it as the "blink"/teleportation is as accurate as a reporter for CNN. When selecting the destination (and pushing down and forward on the thumb stick) will teleport you ONLY to the furthest extreme availablwe in that direction. You'll find you'll have to do incremental hops (a nanosecond after pushing forward on the stick) if you don't suddenly want to find yourself on the extreme edge of the playfield in that direction. You can rotate direction before teleporting, sure, but pinballing my way around a level by using the background elements to limit/trick the game to letting me travel to the middle of a playfield instead of the edge all the time isn't my idea of fun. The oculus version doesn't work when using steamVR on Virtual Desktop but the Other version does (I used Quest 2 on Virtual Desktop).  I don't know what the text/game start options are as the question box's text is too large as to not fit into the question box (surely just Oculus/other/Open would be better then repeating the entire games name for both options?!). Frustrating. However I liked how the tutorial was planned (I was able to use your glitchy teleportation system by bumping into plynths) but annoying that I couldn't see a logical way to get the basket that disappeared into the ceiling for no apparent reason at the start of the game. The whispering guy behind the grate was atmospheric but, without a way to open the gate even with a lit torch, it was annoyingly creepy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030853115', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 164, 'playtime_forever': 118, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 118, 'last_played': 1661298142}

author: {'steamid': '76561199094092097', 'num_games_owned': 449, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 116, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 116, 'last_played': 1661291013}
review:
To be honest, I was very surprised with quality of this game. When I saw it's release date I was expecting very basic game with clunky mechanics and rather uninspiring gameplay. But it was on sale, so I grabbed both episodes for just a few bucks. And oh boy, I enjoyed this game so much. 

The synopsis of the story - you are going to an island to find your sister that left a message for you. Whole game is built around exploring this island. This may sound a little bit simplistic, but it's little details that makes such story works. And Call of the Starseed have a lot of them - throughout the game you will find maps, tapes, rock paintings that bit by bit tell you a story of this place, who was there, what happened to this place. Some things that you finding out at first glance does not have a lot sense or unrelated but in fact this is false assumption - everything you find out makes sense, but you understand this only after going throgh related stage of the game. I really like such small touches in games because this is what makes enjoyable to think about them after completion. For example, when you going down, you can see here combination of Chtulhu, dragon and alien - just a fan-service, at first glance, but only at first.

I also enjoyed visuals in this game. In fact, game looks better when you play then what you see on screenshots. And more to this, in 2 hours of gameplay there is quite a variety of location each with its recognizable design

Another strong point of this games are puzzles - this game combines a great balance between puzzle complexity and amount/quality of tips and the use of VR mechanics. Immersion is really strong here thanks to puzzles being built around VR technologies (I am looking at you, Doctor Who: The Edge Of Time). Also thanks to this, there is almost no situations when you don't understand, what game wants from you - most of the time it's pretty clear, what you need to achieve, the question is how you will do this.

As disadvantages, I have 1,5 points:
1. Controls - in case of oculus headset you need to press on stick of main hand to let you teleport. This is very unpleasant way to implement locomotion. My thumb was really hurting at the end of each session. Moreover, there is no reason for this to be implemented like this - you have buttons on your controller with no actions bind to them - why not to use them instead is a great mystery for me
0.5 Length of the game. I put it as a half of point because it's actually justifiable. First of all, this game is packed with action - something going on all the time, there is no fillers. And the second, title says that this is episode 1. And this game should be perceived exactly like this - this is not an independent game, it has episode 2 that starts exactly when episode 1 ends and they should be played together as one piece. It is also mirrored in price. If you will take a look at this from such perspective - this game as a whole is not so short and there is a major improvement for the second episode in pretty much everything

So, all in all, I definitely recommend this game to everyone who has VR headset. This game has interesting story, great pacing, puzzles, visuals, diverse set of locations and overall it makes a great experience. I will just add that I played this game after I completed Half-Life: Alyx and HL didn't ruin this game for me - I think it is kind of a result, especially for the game that was made at the dawn of modern VR era

author: {'steamid': '76561198883538639', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 13, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1659389337}
review:
In short, wonderful trash. Why? Well from the presentation/graphics side it all looks very slick.. But the minute you are in the game you will have two question. Is the person who developed the motion code still employed and if so why.. Just to thing the amount of effort spend on making a game to then completely f-it up on the movement code/setup is just bewildering.

Tried fixing the issues in the menu but to no avail. A well, just put it in the lemon folder and forgive and look at episode two to see if they perhaps learned... (see episode two)
developer_response: Greetings! Call of the Starseed launched alongside the HTC Vive in 2016 & was the first VR game to innovate & show roomscale "Teleportation". Here's a "making of" video from 2015 https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DwZt2jRE8PY . This was among a few firsts in the title (and VR in general) while we were all trying to find our "feet". Teleportation soon became an industry standard but of course evolved/improved over time. Episode 2 included teleportation & stick-move as things progressed. We hope this helps for context.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969615096', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 675, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 670, 'last_played': 1659197043}
review:
The Gallery Episodes 1 and 2 are often discounted pretty deeply, to the point where the question isn't if they're worth your money, but if they're worth your time.
In short, I think they are, though that's largely down to Episode 2, even with the knowledge that Episode 3 may or may not ever be released.
If you can pick up Ep 1 and Ep 2 together for under $10-15, I think they're worth it.  (Personally, here in 2022 I think they'd do well to give away Ep 1 for free, and sell Ep 2 for $10-12.)
Episode 1 was released in 2016, and Episode 2 followed in 2017.   One of the biggest improvements in Ep 2 was the addition of smooth locomotion control options, which are sorely missed in Ep 1.
Each game could be described as a "story-driven walking simulator with occasional puzzle elements", with most puzzles taking the form of mini-game style challenges, especially in Ep 2.
Ep 1 is mostly linear, and takes around 1.5 - 2hrs to complete.  Ep 2 manages to wring about 3-4 hrs of play from a similar number of environments because each area needs to be revisited at least once or twice  - sometimes to use an item found elsewhere, and sometimes to explore previously-inaccessible parts of the level.  That said, while there is a similar "volume" of world to explore in Ep 2, the areas are much more detailed and interesting than those in Ep 1.
While the dialogue can be a bit campy at times and story a bit vague, the performances are well delivered.
I hope that one day we'll see Episode 3 to close out the trilogy, but 5 years and counting since Episode 2, I won't be holding my breath.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993171889', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 153, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 153, 'last_played': 1658778337}
review:
CZAS GRY:
Ukończenie gry bez osiągnięć, to jakieś 2 godziny, ale jeśli chcesz wymaksować, to przyjdzie Ci grać dłużej.

GRAFIKA:
Grafika jest niezła, jak na ogół produkcji i rok powstania 2016, a klimat lochów i machin, oraz imienia protagonistki "Alex" przypomina nieco najważniejszy tytuł VR w historii od twórców Steam'a.
Gra oparta jest o historię, która ma kontynuację w drugiej części gry.

WYDAJNOŚĆ I STEROWANIE:
Na Oculus Quest 2  gra działa na maksymalnych ustawieniach, a jej wydajność jest zależna od karty graficznej (3060 Ti)
Na Oculus Quest 2 grę można uruchomić przez AirLink zarówno w trybie SteamVR jak i Oculus VR i ten drugi sposób polecam, bo sterowanie jest o wiele lepsze.
Nie da się włączyć literek, więc niektóre kwestie dialogowe oraz nagrania z kaset zawierające podpowiedzi mogą Ci umknąć.

CEL GRY:
Gra polega na przemierzaniu lokacji i rozwiązywania łamigłówek na podstawie obserwacji otoczenia oraz wskazówek na kartkach i taśmach. Nie ma wrogów i nie można zginąć.
Autozapis jest wykonywany co rozdział, czyli chyba około 5 razy w trakcie gry.

CENA:
Jeżeli lubisz gry eksploracyjno-łamigłówkowe, to ten tyluł jest do konieczny ogrania na VR, ale poczekaj na promocje cenowe - 20 zł za jedną lub 35-40 za obie części to uczciwa cena.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985130407', 'num_games_owned': 818, 'num_reviews': 198, 'playtime_forever': 98, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 98, 'last_played': 1657600804}
review:
Apparently this game was released in the early days of commercial VR, so the legal disclaimer that falsely assumes Call of the Starseed is one of my first VR experiences makes some sense.  Even six years later, it feels like a decent VR experience.

What gives its age away is limited locomotion.  Only "comfort" artificial movement is allowed: teleport and snap turning.  VR gamers today expect continuous locomotion/rotation for a game like this.

The game itself is an adventure game, but is very light on gameplay.  It has periodic puzzles, but is mostly moving forward and watching/listening to scripted sequences.  Silly and foolish people will call this a walking simulator, but that's a meaningless term nobody should ever take seriously.

The voice acting was distinctly Canadian, despite it apparently taking place in the United States with Americans.  If I can, as an American, pronounce "aboat," then surely a Canadian voice actor could pronounce it "about" if they're supposed to be playing an American.  Tom Clancy's Splinter Cell games has this problem in spades.

I was surprised at how quickly the game ended.  The developers seem to have focused on production values and wow-factor, and they did well in that area.  I'm sure this game was a treat back in 2016.  However, the story continues in Episode 2, and I think Episode 1 did a good job setting things up.  You all have got my attention.  I hope Episode 2 can follow through.

There are many complaints about controls with this game.  I had problems, too, when I tried running it with OpenVR/SteamVR.  Launching it for Oculus Rift worked fine, but I was not given credit for any Steam Achievements.  I ever-so-slightly care about getting achievements, so that was a bit of a disappointment.

Lastly, I want to mention that I had some vague Half-Life: Alyx feelings while playing this.  The motion-captured characters in the immersive "cutscenes" that play out in front of you, and the fact that the main character's name is ALEX.... yeah, some vague feelings.

author: {'steamid': '76561198174147317', 'num_games_owned': 339, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 81, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 81, 'last_played': 1657593523}
review:
Recommended on sale only.  

Got the game for a couple bucks, and it's definitely worth that.  But completed it in under 1.5 hours. 81 minutes to be exact. And that was with watching the credits for 3-5 minutes to see if there was anything after (nope).

Nothing hard about the game at all.  It's mostly a walking (standing) simulator with a few things to pick up and put together.  

Hoping for a little more from Episode 2...

Wouldnt say this is worth $15.  Not in 2022.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975290258', 'num_games_owned': 270, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 109, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 109, 'last_played': 1657357040}

author: {'steamid': '76561198087147552', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 11, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1656178878}
review:
Definitely no, do not want to play the game due to the control method and the object's hitbox. Can not configure to be usable.
Shame on you devs, and shame on you Steam too! Indicating a game as Index (or another headset) compatible which does not implement the specific controller (this is not the first game) is a fraud and you should be charged for misleading your customers (no, a refund is not enough, you stole my time and health too). Same for indicating a game as a PC game with poor or no keyboard and mouse support or for a bad mobile port too. No, not only the dev's responsibility, you Steam are also responsible for products and the quality of products you allowed to be available on your platform.
Can not understand why the devs had to implement such a s* movement method (maybe it works for other VR?) without the option to switch back to the well-working old way (then do a stat and see who wants to play the game with "blink")...

author: {'steamid': '76561197970895680', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 6, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1650306298}
review: WARNING DO NOT BUY THIS GAME UNLESS YOU HAVE CONTROLLERS WITH TRACKPADS (INDEX OR VIVE) THERE IS NO SUPPORT FOR TOUCH CONTROLLERS OR WMR CONTROLLERS AND STEAM REFUSES REFUND FOR UNPLAYABLE GAME.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967304590', 'num_games_owned': 702, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 71, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 71, 'last_played': 1651850779}
review:
about 1hour to finish.
pretty decent production value, not particularly exiting otherwise.
teleport movement only.

its not bad by any stretch of the word, but there are better ways to spend your time and money nowadays.
im still recommending it because there is realy crap stuff out there and this is still a half decent way to spend an hour.

author: {'steamid': '76561198148474523', 'num_games_owned': 1537, 'num_reviews': 144, 'playtime_forever': 145, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 145, 'last_played': 1647473621}
review:
Great game but, very short and the controls, teleport only which is fine I can live with that but no snap turn, rotate your analogue stick to point an arrow the way you want to go, if only they had updated the controls, putting all that aside this game looks great, upped the resolution in game to 130, for a 2016 game this looks amazing, few fun puzzles nothing frustrating, Had this game in my library ages but couldn't put up with the movement, decided I just put up with it and just finished it, 2022. Really enjoyed, still think this is up there with the best graphics wise, shadows and lighting look great, most VR games suck at this, loved how strange the story gets.
episode 2 next.
Played on the Rift S, Ryzen 7 3800X, 6800XT, 32 GB Ram, Win 10 64 with no problems.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992292854', 'num_games_owned': 825, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 108, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1652050741}
review:
Episode one will never get any form of rotation, so unless you're really lucky and have a room-scale VR setup you probably won't be able to play this. It's just not comfortable to navigate.
But otherwise this series is fantastic, I'd suggest starting with episode 2 which does have more locomotion options (you have to manually enable strafing tho).
A Sandbox version of Ep. 2 is available that has the same control scheme that you can try for free.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975101505', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 48, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 48, 'last_played': 1639574560}
review: Weird. Slow. Dark. Confusing. Lack of story driving. Bad movement controls. Poor performance.

author: {'steamid': '76561198272351250', 'num_games_owned': 760, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 95, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 95, 'last_played': 1639280394}
review: I enjoyed the game.  For the age that the game is, it still felt pretty good on the Quest 2.  It didn't have all the features that a newer game would have, but the visuals and sound made it feel great.  I did find it started a little slow, but as I progressed it really drew me in.  I'm glad that I played this, but sad that I was a little short.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998056243', 'num_games_owned': 816, 'num_reviews': 430, 'playtime_forever': 428, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 193, 'last_played': 1638021510}
review: The game is still fine in 2021. I mean it did not age really in the best way...but it is still enjoyable because the puzzles and physics are cool enough. Interaction and graphic-wise it feels VERY old (it's one of the early VR games...) and the teleport system is a pain in the wrists. But nevertheless I would recommend it still in 2021 during a sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010264309', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 604, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 569, 'last_played': 1636315646}
review:
Ok so I don’t normally leave reviews but it’s about time I did for this game. 
This was one of if not the first game I got for my HTC VIVE and I was wowing all the way though it. Anyone with a VR headset will probably relate to this lol.
Well I have just stuck it on again with my new Valve Index and  it’s even more wow.
This game has oodles of atmosphere and gorgeous colours and shadow effects the like of early Disney would be proud of. Some great puzzles, great story line, characters and much more. It’s on par in my opinion to Alyx but withought the shooting.
A must have in anyones VR library. 
I would dearly love to see another game in the series.
Just seen the price too. This game is easily a £20 plus game so for 11 quid it’s a steal.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025137198', 'num_games_owned': 377, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 276, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 276, 'last_played': 1632821065}
review:
This was one of my first VR experiences back with the HTC Vive, though early on it was easy to get caught up in the next "wow-factor" search -- and so I never finished it. 
It's a shame, too -- though this did allow me...many years later...to revisit it with an Oculus Quest 2 (via AirLink) and enjoy it through to conclusion. 
On to the next Chapter -- very much worth the journey, even today!

author: {'steamid': '76561199049803013', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 554, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 256, 'last_played': 1701279775}
review: Kinda short but the visuals and the interesting puzzles make it worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005404776', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 153, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 153, 'last_played': 1632119606}
review: Somebody gifted me The Gallery episode II and I had a blast with it, then I decided to buy episode 1 and I was expecting a 2016 VR game but... this game is still very nice, and the cinematic part of it is gorgeous! it's not that long, maybe 1 hour? , I took me 25 minutes just to finish one of the puzzles, I was so slow but i got it!  I also checked some of the steam achievements and they looked fun so I came back to finish some of them.  I played with Index without any issues. The moving was only by teleportation so a few people can get dizzy, I had no issues with it.  If you look for clues and listen to the tape the story is pretty good, the end is beautifully done. I kind of want to play Episode 2 again.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992975002', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 102, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 102, 'last_played': 1631431895}

author: {'steamid': '76561197960271496', 'num_games_owned': 918, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 42, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 42, 'last_played': 1624908451}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198141817061', 'num_games_owned': 227, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1757, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 335, 'last_played': 1625124189}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198058738717', 'num_games_owned': 210, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 169, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 168, 'last_played': 1623595515}
review:
Short Version:
I think the game is still in 2021 a nice experience because it shows how far VR has come in 5 Years and in some ways it was ahead of its time.

For Context:
i played the Game now for the first time on an Oculus Quest 2 via Virtual Desktop with a nearly 4k Display (+ oversampled) and 120hz.

Review:
If you played some of the major VR milestones the last 1-2 Years like Half Life Alyx or Boneworks you will notice the Age of this game for sure. Only Teleport movement, not every item is completly physics based, interaction is a little bit limited etc. My expectation was not very high because i knew how much VR has evolved since then. But the game surprised me, i think the movement and gameplay mechanics aged well. I got very quickly used to the teleport again and it wasn`t breaking my immersion as much as i thougt. I was very impressed how good hand and object interaction and the physical invetory were implemented. It reminded me much of the early Valve demos (these demos were industry leading masterclass in 2015/16) and holds up very well today. The Graphics looks aged but i think especially on modern Hardware the Enviroments, art Design and dynamic shadows looks still good. Sound Design and especially the voices sound great. The game is still after 5 Years immersive and have great atmosphere. Texture Resolution is very low for today's standard. The thing is, you have to keep in mind at what time in the industry this game launched. The Fact that it still holds up today means that it was 2016 an industry leading and shaping new experience. I have to give it credit for what it was in 2016. If i had played back then with high end VR Hardware it would have been a absolutly mindblowing experience.
A love Letter to The Gallery Call of the Starseed :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198811346082', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 47, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47, 'last_played': 1620739327}
review:
Ok this might be a good game...it 2016. Do not buy it if you are used to the "normal" movement controls in 2021. How you can use the analogue stick to rotate so you can look at where you want to look at and push it around to move around....you know...like how your intuition tells you. I played , and I should have said I suffered thru the first chapter. It's a story driven puzzle game and I really wanted to like this since I'm sick of zombie games. 

One thing this game does great is the puzzle factor I must say. It's a constant puzzle you need to solve to barely move around. I gave up at 0.8 hours appearantly after the first chapter. I just can't deal with it. So here is the thing. You can only move by teleporting and to teleport you need to press the left analog button - then move your head around to aim and also you rotate the pressed analogue stick to change where you'll face after you land the teleportation. But here is the trick: since you are moving your head to aim and most of the time you have to rotate your head/waist to do that, your rotation on the analogue stick does not let you face where you want to face because you were not looking forward when you initiated the teleportation. This becomes such a shitfest in close quarters especially because ,say, you want to rotate 90 to left, but you have little room to do that and so you need to look all the way down and also press/rotate the stick but you should not change the direction where you are looking at because you dont end up looking at where you want when the teleportation happens. So many times I had to look somewhere random where there is room in front of me, and aim backwards , teleport once, then now I can do the second teleportation which will end up where I want to be and miraculously looking at where I want to look. This is the main puzzle of the game. Go where you want to go and meanwhile be able to look where you want to look....in 2021.

As I said above, I really wanted to like this but it's unplayable now. I've also gotten the second game and I sure hope there is a way to change the control mechanics in that one. If there was a way to change the movement I could give it another try but I dont have my hopes high...

author: {'steamid': '76561199095803356', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 293, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 151, 'last_played': 1620159406}
review:
Ce jeu est âgé et très daté techniquement (surtout comparé à Half-Life Alyx et Hellblade Senua Sacrifice, mes 2 derniers jeux, même si je ne m'attendais pas à ce niveau de qualité ici). Le mode de déplacement est très peu pratique (surtout au niveau de la rotation). Certaines actions sont quasiment infaisables (lancer un objet vers le haut), du moins avec mon Oculus Quest 2 en mode Rift, ce qui m'a quasi fait arrêter le jeu lors de la première partie (sur la plage). La précision (attraper des objets en plein vol) est très mauvaise De plus, comme de trop nombreux jeux, les mains pénètrent dans l'environnement comme s'il n'y avait rien, A ne pas acheter à plein tarif (OK à la rigueur en promo, pour voir, ce qui est mon cas heureusement). Pour info, je ne suis pas encore à la fin. Il parait que le jeu s'améliore vers la fin, on verra.
NB : voilà, j'ai fini le jeu et c'est vrai que la dernière partie est facile car il s'agit en fait plus d'une démo technique (assez longue) où on n'a rien à faire qu'un vrai jeu. En 2016 ça devait être génial mais en 2021 on a vu mieux.

author: {'steamid': '76561198139344280', 'num_games_owned': 475, 'num_reviews': 209, 'playtime_forever': 202, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 202, 'last_played': 1616269794}
review:
[h2]Abenteuerurlaub mit dem verrückten Professor[/h2]
Call of the Starseed ist der Beginn der inzwischen zwei Teile umfassenden Adventure-Reihe The Gallery. Bereits 2016 erschienen, gehört es zu den früheren VR-Titeln auf dem Markt. Doch wirklich anmerken tut man das dem Rätselspiel nicht.
Das Know-how beim Einsatz der Bewegungssteuerung (gespielt mit Oculus Touch) stimmt bei Einwickler Cloudhead Games jedenfalls. Die Rätsel sind nämlich zum Großteil nicht sonderlich komplex aufgebaut, doch stellen unsere Fingerfertigkeit und unsere Aufmerksamkeitsgabe durch VR-Mechaniken auf die Probe, die einfach Spaß machen. Elegant ist auch die Inventarumsetzung gelöst, denn durch einen Griff über die Schulter verstauen wir nicht nur gefundene Objekte, sondern ziehen auch unseren Rucksack ins Blickfeld, um auf bestimmte Utensilien zugreifen zu können. Die Texturen wirken zwar teilweise relativ schwammig, doch die Spielwelt ist dennoch stimmungsvoll und hübsch gestaltet. Einzig die Fortbewegung, die nur durch Teleport möglich ist, hat sich ein klein wenig schwerfällig angefühlt, weil die Schwarzblende nach einem Port gefühlt einen Tick zu lang war.
Aber worum geht es eigentlich? In Call of the Starseed spielen wir als eine junge Frau in den 80ern, die nach ihrer Zwillingsschwester sucht und dabei an einem geheimnisvollen Ort an der kanadischen Westküste gelandet ist. Assistiert von einem nicht so einfach einschätzbaren Professor rutschen wir in ein Abenteuer, das deutlich größere Ausmaße annimmt, als es anfangs erscheint. Auch wenn mich die Dialoge oder die optionalen Audiologs in Kassettenform nicht mit ihrer Raffinesse beeindruckt haben und mir die Charaktere noch relativ egal sind, bin ich doch gespannt, wie es in Episode 2 weitergeht. Denn der generelle Storyverlauf und die angeteasten Hinweise während der etwa zweistündigen Reise lassen doch einiges an Potenzial zu. 
Schön waren auch die recht zahlreich vorkommenden interaktiven Objekte in der Spielwelt, auch abseits von rätselrelevanten Dingen. So kann man am nächtlichen Lagerfeuer Popcorn zu launigen 80er-Songs floppen (das andere Wort lässt Steam nicht zu..) oder Feuerwerk über die Küste steigen lassen. Das klingt erstmal nicht so spektakulär, aber wer die Vorzüge von VR kennt, wird wahrscheinlich verstehen, wie viel Spaß solche vermeintlich simple Dinge machen können. Gut zur geheimnisvollen Spielwelt passt zudem der cineastische Soundtrack von Jeremy Soule, der auch an Produktionen wie Skyrim, Guild Wars oder Icewind Dale beteiligt war. 

[i]Persönliches Rating[/i]: [b]75[/b]/100

[i]Fazit[/i]
[h3]Call of the Starseed überzeugt mit großteils simplen aber spaßigen Rätseln, trotz seines Alters elegant umgesetzten VR-Mechaniken und gerade anfangs mit tollen 80er-Vibes! Die Story darf das in diesem Teil aufgebaute Potenzial in Part 2 dann aber gerne noch besser nutzen.[/h3]

 [i]Wenn dir mein Review gefallen hat, freue ich mich über eine Bewertung.[/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561197960519707', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 112, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 112, 'last_played': 1617406581}
review:
I liked the game's [i]one[/i] puzzle, but that's all it offered.

Two bits of thirty-second (first run) physics frobs to advance the story (just [spoiler]throw something, then shoot[/spoiler] something), and a battery-draining constant-controller-rumble supervillain monologue.

The game - only and always during the last 'level' - kept losing tracking on my right Index controller, making it virtually flail around. Alas, continuing past that level requires steady pointing!

The End of chapter one. Really, that's it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198152514993', 'num_games_owned': 768, 'num_reviews': 315, 'playtime_forever': 170, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 170, 'last_played': 1616913582}
review:
[h1]类型[/h1]
虚拟现实互动

[h1]游戏内容[/h1]
根据指示进行操作不断前进。

[h1]感想[/h1]
这一部作品是我当初最早玩过有“背包”概念的游戏：把手放到肩膀后，物品会自动收入背包，需要时再从背后掏出来；现在这几乎成为了所有虚拟现实游戏的标配。作为第一批尝试制作VR游戏的作品，它有许多操作如今看来并不便利，比如移动只能传送，并且速度很慢，比如双手抓物品会发生冲突，比如不能原地转朝向等等，整体游戏内容也偏简单，更类似于体验，但是它也进行了许多有益的尝试：可以烤爆米花，可以放烟花，可以把蜡烛放进水里熄灭，可以用手玩投篮游戏，还制作了一个含有巨大建筑物、快速漂浮的结局，让初入vr的人体会到沉浸的独特魅力。由于目前虚拟现实大作仍稀缺，所以本作是一部说过时不完全过时，但确实已经可以归为吃螃蟹一代的游戏。

author: {'steamid': '76561198135756871', 'num_games_owned': 301, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 100, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 100, 'last_played': 1616552139}
review: 10/10 - Would play again, if only for the sick dancing through a tunnel at the end.

author: {'steamid': '76561198310533302', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 489, 'playtime_forever': 148, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 91, 'last_played': 1616503683}
review: (Vive) Играется уже неудобно по сравнению с более свежими. К сожалению, устарела. Короткая. Перемещение телепортацией. Неудобная система поворота. Предметы, которые надо схватить - в 90% попыток летят сквозь руки. Причем, вторая часть мне понравилась, играю после нее. Там интерес к истории перевесил недостатки, а здесь нет. Такой себе пустоватый удивительный VR, где можно, оказывается, оглядываться и брать предметы. Сейчас этого уже явно недостаточно. И задания типа, который я ненавижу - "мы что-то придумали, догадайся что" - не понимаешь ни цели, ни способа, ни того, как именно этот способ сработал. Из плюсов - персонаж, общий вид картинки, красивые текстуры и свет, озвучка.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067012399', 'num_games_owned': 2352, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 83, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 83, 'last_played': 1613326211}
review: One of the first "room scale" VR games. Very short (~1 hour long), but it's still pretty immersive. You can get a feel the devs weren't really sure what works and what doesn't in VR, so there's no smooth locomotion or physical hand presence like in Alyx. The very first puzzle relies on you finding a pretty well hidden item (you need to look up a bit more from time to time), so finding it was pretty annoying, but other than that the few puzzles in the game are short and sweet.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967587554', 'num_games_owned': 709, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 112, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 112, 'last_played': 1612954795}
review:
This was probably an amazing experience when it first launched in 2016 but playing it in 2021 it's a big disappointment.

Locomotion needs to be added, they've put that in Episode 2 so I don't see what is stopping them.

I recommend to skip this and go straight to the second episode, which is supposed to be better (I'm trying it tomorrow).

author: {'steamid': '76561198143476728', 'num_games_owned': 393, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 478, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 235, 'last_played': 1639698160}
review:
This was unexpected! I blindly purchased the game only knowing that it involved puzzles and remembering that I had played a free demo some years ago! I didn't watch the trailer or read any reviews. Simply bought it and jumped straight in. Immediately I hated the fact that it's teleport only but with room scale in mind and once I saw that the games prompts were Vive wands I realized that his must be one of the OG VR titles which it is! Apart from the movement system, the inventory system is decent and better and some of the more recent titles I've played believe it or not. The graphics are actually pretty good as well. I'd rate them an 8/10 given this was released back in 2016 and the fact that it's not an expensive title. It is short though you can complete the game in less than an hour and a half or so. I took longer because I enjoy messing with every little thing in games. Without spoiling anything, the very first puzzle actually made me use my brain and the last one was more of a guessing game but not hard either. And the ending.....ah man, that was a treat, and my right hand is numb XD. Overall I'd rate this game a solid 9/10, again, being as though this was released back in 2016.

Edit: Oh wow! After launching the game directly from Steam instead of through Steam VR I was prompted to chose between Open VR Mode and Oculus Mode. NOW I have more customizable options within the game and the controls are much better now! I'm able to adjust the size of my hands as well as the skin color. I however noticed that before (In OpenVR Mode) I was able to flick the lighter open like in real life but now I have to pull the trigger to do so. Whelp, time to play the game all over again as my first play through was rather uncomfortable, but finding this just changed everything!

Also, don't mess with the in-game super sampling if you're already doing so externally. When done while running the game in Oculus mode it immediately causes your video to become zoomed in with a fish eye effect and can only be reverted by restarting the application (the game).

author: {'steamid': '76561197991290328', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 480, 'playtime_forever': 139, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 51, 'last_played': 1609663270}
review: YO

author: {'steamid': '76561198010339486', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 338, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 262, 'last_played': 1638072200}
review:
The absolute best VR experience I've ever had; it is short but great! The game plays like a ride at an immersive theme park which is why I call it a "VR experience" rather than a game. Think about experiences at Disney parks or Universal where the characters really engage you whether you're standing in line or going through the ride (like star tours).

The mad scientist really feels alive; the motion capture is excellent and his interactions with you feel genuine. The environments feel grounded in reality and the few puzzles are not so difficult that you have to leave the game to look up the solution (looking at you Obduction and your base 4 math!)

There are also enough achievements to bring you back at least once even if it means leaving your VR headset on the ground for 8 hours unattended ;-)

author: {'steamid': '76561198133265077', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 55, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33, 'last_played': 1609207359}
review: Not really sure why I waited so long to get this game. It's an amazing game, it reminds me a lot of the Myst games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078784062', 'num_games_owned': 696, 'num_reviews': 116, 'playtime_forever': 103, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 103, 'last_played': 1609016692}
review: Very immersive and epic

author: {'steamid': '76561198073030946', 'num_games_owned': 25, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 284, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1621108243}
review: I held off on playing this game, so I passed the 2 week refund deadline.  I have an Oculus Rift S and advancing in the game requires throwing objects to hit certain targets.  The game presents a huge problem in this regard when using a Rift S.  It seems that the furthest you can throw an object is a few feet and getting it to go in the proper direction is almost impossible.  I played the game for 40 minutes or so and when I couldn't advance due to the "throwing" issue I requested a refund.  Steam offered no latitude since I owned it for more than two weeks.  That's the policy.  End of story.  Doesn't matter if I have made tons of other purchases from Steam.  I definitely do not recommend this game for anyone who is using an Oculus product.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002212477', 'num_games_owned': 177, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 212, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 212, 'last_played': 1608452003}
review:
OMG..........

This is what I got a VR setup for!!!

True, there is NO Shooting!

No violence. No spurting blood...

And no jiggly "Naughty Bits"

It really does take a page out of the good old fun movies like Goonies, or newer things like Stranger Things.

A fun adventure, brilliantly scripted, beautifully designed, with puzzles adding to the process without being overwhelming (I hate puzzle games... and yet, here I am).

There were times I wish I could have reached out and grabbed something to hold me steady the movement at one point was so believable.

I only wish some of these newer developers would play this game so they could see how it can be done.

The only downside is it's not too long... I think I clocked about 4 Hrs; but well worth the experience and the investment. Can't wait for Chapter 2, and I hope it continues from there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004037747', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 124, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 124, 'last_played': 1608083637}
review: Super short, and has a very weird locomotion mechanic. Doesn't have snap turning; you have to aim at the ground and rotate the stick if you want to turn. I had to use 3rd party controller bindings to make it at least a decent experience. I can't believe that these are the same developers who made The Lab.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053323861', 'num_games_owned': 224, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 5, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1606390566}
review: Can't grab stuff correctly in the tutorial. Got stuck at turning with Valve Index. After digging online I found this tutorial on configuring the Index (doesn't seem to be fixing the rotation). No thanks. I fix things all day long and here I just want to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981512128', 'num_games_owned': 444, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 34, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1605937172}
review:
The environment, and graphics in this game are decent, and the atmosphere is fun.  The puzzles are simple, and at the same time somewhat arcane -- you spend most of your time wondering what to do next, while you struggle with the constraining control scheme, and try to understand how you can face something properly, so you can manipulate it.

The OpenXR version of the game appears to have trouble judging the distance of the floor, and often places objects "underneath" the play area, making them unreachable.  I haven't tried the game on Rift, although I own an original Rift and will likely give it a go, at some point.

I can't recommend this game in the modern day, unless you really love VR adventures, are okay with clunky controls, and have a large free play area.  It's not a bad game -- just clunky, and once you get used to the cumbersome controls, it's decent fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198945272842', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 283, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 191, 'last_played': 1603548932}

author: {'steamid': '76561198027432378', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 90, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 90, 'last_played': 1602632036}
review:
Pros: 
Visually appealing 
Reasonably good physics.
Cons:
Very short for $20 (90 minutes)
The story is difficult to follow / not very engaging
The ending is kind of nonsensical
The puzzle are exceptionally mediocre.
I had a frustrating controller bug which took away from the ending

Was probably an incredible game for VR when it came out, but its 2020 and I want more than an extended tech demo. The story wasn't strong, and the puzzles weren't strong, so I didn't really get into the game

author: {'steamid': '76561197983043667', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 171, 'playtime_forever': 193, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 193, 'last_played': 1595041619}
review:
A bit under 2 hours of light puzzling in a well-polished VR world followed by some sort of Sumerian rave.

As VR games go, this is a fairly empty puzzler in an overstuffed world. Almost every object in the world can be used for something. It can be set on fire, or held up to an ear, or thrown or is important for the story. That adds quite a bit of enjoyment to the game.  This is good, because there's really not much in the actual game after that. The problem is that there's just so much world that you can be easily led astray overthinking a problem. For example, the flare gun appears to only be used once, and I can't recall if a paper note was ever important.

The puzzles, of which there are maybe three of note, are generally reasonably obvious or brute-forceable, even when they're somewhat broken. The water-wheel puzzle controls are wonky and the elevator control panel is internally inconsistent, but both have enough slop in them that it doesn't matter. The maze is easier to just stumble through than it is to actually navigate -- the 'blink' navigation is strangely languid, and it is incredibly easy to get your directions reversed. Lastly, the vacuum tube puzzle is ... not great.

Otherwise, controls are pretty good, although you're advised to make some adjustments to the locomotion system. The backpack mechanic is novel and works well. I'd like to see more games use it. I'd have liked to have been able to put a playing tape back in the pack, though, and still heard it continuing. The cassette tapes left all over the world are strange -- some of them appear to be vital, while others can be missed. They're usually entertaining, though, and add a bit more to the weak story in the game.

The end of the game, when it comes, is a bit of a surprise -- that's it? -- and ends with a thorough lecturing by another creepy guy followed by a credit sequence through a 90s gfx demo. 

It's just weird.

I don't think this is worth the full asking price, especially if you're going to end up picking up the sequel as well. On sale together in a package, might get a stronger recommendation from me.

In general, I enjoyed it, and would like to see more from the writers, artists, and developers, but this game alone is something that can be missed. We'll see if my opinion changes once I've completed the second chapter.

author: {'steamid': '76561198831453196', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 16, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1594868324}

Thanks now give me my money back.

It's very pretty and I absolutely love the use of a continuously visible play space and the ability to clearly see where you are moving the play space around. This game may well still be my favourite teleport locomotion implementation to date.

author: {'steamid': '76561198164554153', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 193, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 193, 'last_played': 1566274739}
review:
IF your the type of person that loves mystery novels and wish to be part of a deep lore series, this is the game that you will want. Take your time, explore around, this game is not to be rushed. Bought it, and never regretted buying the entire series.
One personal gripe with the game; at the end, when you get a *spoiler thing that shall not be named*, my HTC vive controller with the *spoiler thing* shaked uncontrollably until the end of the credits. This could be just me, but keep an eye out if you have an old controller.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014435327', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 92, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 92, 'last_played': 1588599177}
review: It's... okay, but very short and it doesn't really do much with VR's capabilities.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971224920', 'num_games_owned': 616, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 91, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 91, 'last_played': 1581968763}
review: This series (including the sequel, which is better but still underwhelming) hasn't aged well and there are plenty of better VR first-person adventure/puzzle games out there. The graphics still look great, but the puzzles are weak and the story is completely throwaway. Episode 1 in particular also feels very dated controls-wise and took me a grand total of 90 minutes to complete (Episode 2 took me about 3 hours, but with a bunch of tedious backtracking in exchange). Worth a look on a deep discount only.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017210143', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 86, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 86, 'last_played': 1588457663}
review: This is a short but fun adventure game with some amazing graphics, particularly when you consider some games in 2020 can't quite match up the climax of this.  Go in knowing it's the length of an average movie and get it on sale if you can because this is well worth experiencing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041664355', 'num_games_owned': 672, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 125, 'last_played': 1578240104}
review:
This first Episode of The Gallery introduces you to the characters and gives a background story to the much better second Episode. Since the price is relatively high compared to playtime (~2h if you like mucking about with the environment), I recommend getting this on sale. Or simply buy this to support the creators, they're doing an amazing job on keeping VR relevant. 

Personally I really liked this experience. The assets are gorgeous, the music is atmospheric and the world building is engrossing (you get a feel for the world through recordings, notes and subtle hints). There's a mystery to unravel and some (not too hard) puzzles to solve. Once you're done, be sure to check out the second Episode.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998784427', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 166, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 166, 'last_played': 1584894890}
review:
After seeing Episode 2 was available, I decided to buy Episode 1.
I was pleasantly surprised by the visuals and audio experience. For a small studio, they did an excellent job.
there aren't excessive interactions with objects, but you can inspect, combine, use, throw, etc., and basically follow the story line at your own speed. The "backpack" inventory system is very good once you adapt to it and it's fun to use. This game has good music, an interesting physics system, and delivers a great overall experience. I enjoyed it. I didn't expect any/much playability, so no surprise there except moving on to Episode 2.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981180543', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 209, 'playtime_forever': 276, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 276, 'last_played': 1583123638}
review: I first played this game in December of 2016. It was one of the first games I played that wasn't a glorified tech demo (or an actual tech demo). The quality of the game blew me away, and I knew that VR was going to be big. I beat the game, and put it aside, waiting for part II. When part II arrived, I was busy, and figured I would wait until part III launched and then replay them all. Unfortunately, information on part III seems limited, and at this point I'm not too sure that it will ever happen. With that in mind, I dusted this game off and took it for a spin over three years later. This game has stood the test of time and remains an impressive and immersive VR experience. It is fairly simple, with minimal puzzle interaction, but I still found it fun. The story is interesting enough and I'm curious to see what happens in part II.  The game is short and has a hefty price tag, but that seems to be the case with many of these highly polished VR titles. I'd keep it on the wishlist and wait for a bundle sale with part II, but I would definitely recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045133684', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 135, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 135, 'last_played': 1540149144}
review:
Das Spiel macht vieles richtig, die Umgebung ist schön und die Atmospähre kommt gut rüber.

Aber leider kann man selbst mit guten Englischkenntnissen der Story kaum folgen. Es gibt nur akustisch schwer verständliches Audiomaterial ohne Untertitel. Das was ich dann noch an Story mitbekommen habe, fand ich dann auch eher fad und an den Haaren herbeigezogen.

Steuerung OK, gibt besseres, gibt schlechteres.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961911485', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 163, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 163, 'last_played': 1581911871}
review:
10/10

This game was absolutely immersive and fantastic. It took about 2.5 hours to complete but it is well worth it, trust me. My wife even made a comment that it was "the first VR game I actually completed". Which is true. 

And for those of you who think this might have horror or jump scares, don't worry - there is none of that in this game. Simply a really good puzzle game with great voice acting and narration.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013232959', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 167, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 167, 'last_played': 1477421850}
review: Für kleines Geld oder im Bundle auf jeden Fall zu empfehlen, ein schönes Abenteuerspiel mit netten Rätseln. Mit 2 Stunden ist es nicht gerade so lang aber als Bundle sicherlich zu empfehlen, oder wenn man es für einen 10 € im Sale ist, kauft es.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992537386', 'num_games_owned': 727, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 17, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1580845138}
review:
The controls in this game are terrible. There are no options for smooth locomotion and not even an option to rotate you view with the controller (like just pushing the analog stick to rotate like in most other games). It was just completely unplayable for me on Index controllers.

So this review is based just on the controls but definitely can't recommend this. Dev's have been aware of this issue for a long long time, it's even listed in the FAQ as something that they will look at, but they never have, an assume by now they never will... Don't buy this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198217730749', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 89, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 89, 'last_played': 1578215711}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198120300416', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 89, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 89, 'last_played': 1577626561}

author: {'steamid': '76561198041673163', 'num_games_owned': 502, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 109, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 109, 'last_played': 1576835189}
review: when I think about adventure games in VR this will come to mind every time. Unfortunately while the game has very nice scenery and great puzzle mechanics, Its simply too short. The game puts you into a world that is surrounded with questions  that I wanted answers, and puzzles I wanted to keep solving. However its length while leaving you wanting more ends too early for a proper recommendation.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970067831', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 106, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 106, 'last_played': 1576451998}

author: {'steamid': '76561198417500346', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 141, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 141, 'last_played': 1575733203}
review: Awesome game, shows a lot of VR potential. The movement method is not easy to handle in the beginning, but you get used to it. Awesome atmosphere and sometimes you feel like you are really there, and forget you have a headset on the head. Played on Valve Index headset, with Index controllers, and it works fine. Definitely recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198121517840', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 437, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 437, 'last_played': 1563301393}
review: Amazing start to an incredible series, the game begins slow and seems to be a normal VR adventure game but soon begins to unravel and turn into the first episode of an amazing game. The world is immensely interactive and hosts a variety of immersive and entertaining things. The visuals for a VR game are the best i've seen by far. Although fairly short, personally completing it in a few hours. Its an incredible introduction and a must play in order to carry onto the second episode. As a player who has played both the first and second episode it is hands down the best VR experience currently available, the second episode starts of right after the ending of this one. It will blow you away. The movement in the first episode is ok, but becomes perfected in the second episode. The sounds, visuals and mechanics of this game series is amazing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027172836', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 209, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 209, 'last_played': 1573873486}
review: This game is all about story and environment and it delivers both well, but it's not perfect. I think the story didn't hold together very well in the end but I enjoyed the ride all the way up to that point. I hope there will be more content like this where the story really takes the focus and being in VR allows you to experience it in a more intimate way.

author: {'steamid': '76561197965470088', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 75, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 75, 'last_played': 1572142030}
review:
Game took me just over an hour blind to beat. The puzzles were fine, this is a bit out of my genre, but I usually figure out things relatively quickly.  Visually this game is gorgeous; and has top notch voice acting. The story was acceptable, but was not anything that 'blew' me away. I'll be checking out episode 2 when it's on sale though; and hope they finish the series off. 

I will say; I HATED that teleport is the only movement method. I get that when this came out that was the preferred method, and was following the VALVE 'Never make the player move' Idea. 

But as a VR vet of over a year now; it just feels limiting. 

I would recommend this game on sale; probably not if it is full price. (Unless you really want to support VR, or the devs)

author: {'steamid': '76561198087408844', 'num_games_owned': 263, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 181, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 181, 'last_played': 1571682948}
review:
***SÓLO EN OFERTA***
Cuando salió habrá estado entre los mejores juegos VR pero realmente está demasiado sobrevalorado, es un juego que no vale su precio; estaría bien comprar los dos episodios en una sola oferta del 50% de descuento porque ambos episodios equivalen a un solo juego.

Pros:
-Gráficas decentes
-Puzzles entretenidos
-Trama llamativa

Cons:
-Muy caro por dos episodios relativamente cortos.
-Pésima Jugabilidad.
-Demasiado corto y lineal.

author: {'steamid': '76561197974335729', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 218, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 122, 'last_played': 1584987523}
review:
This is difficult to review. The game itself is fantastic in what it does. It just does it in 2 hours. 

I couldn't recommend paying €20 for 2 hours. I bought it on sale and paid €5 and for that, it's well worth experiencing. 

However it's usual price is 20 euros and for that I'm afraid is just too much. 

The game itself is definitely one of the most impressive and immersive VR games I have experienced. Very good inventory system.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982160987', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 40, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40, 'last_played': 1571259320}
review:
INTERIM REVIEW

I am not sure whether I will be able to play this game and so cannot recommend at present. The controls are so clumsy compared to todays games.  I have an Oculus Rift S and with modern games I am used to smooth rotation to find the direction I want and then either a smooth teleport or natural walk option to get to where I want to be.  These modern controls are so subtle that its easy to forgot your in a game and that's how it should be.   However the controls for this game are very clumsy, I have to press the joystick in and then rotate to where I want to go and make sure that I then orientate the direction I want to face in and its not a natural flow of movement and not very accurate and so everytime I want to move and explore its a chore that I am not sure I can be bothered to endure. I am reminded everytime that I am in a game thats hard to control and thats no fun :(

author: {'steamid': '76561197975291280', 'num_games_owned': 455, 'num_reviews': 141, 'playtime_forever': 77, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 77, 'last_played': 1570991467}

author: {'steamid': '76561198002534054', 'num_games_owned': 2812, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 109, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 109, 'last_played': 1570869069}
review:
I can't recommend this for the price - even on sale. It's incredibly short and boring. You get a whole bunch of items that you only ever use once, such as the flare gun, which you use to shoot a couple targets at the beginning of the game and never take it out again. There are only a few puzzles and they aren't very engaging (and puzzles are the extent of the gameplay). You find notes and tape recordings around the level that are entirely useless and bring no substance to the story. The voice acting from the only other visible character is acceptable, but the dialogue isn't well written and, again, has no substance. There are some missing features and annoying bugs that have not been fixed and likely never will. You cannot switch to movement via the stick, only teleportation (which is fairly well implemented). During the ending sequence and credits, my right controller started vibrating endlessly. Throwing objects is somewhat difficult, and some items float around as if in low gravity when dropped.

It took me less than two hours to complete. This includes the tutorial (which I went through twice), the super slow scrolling credits (which was apparently bugged and never actually ended the game, wasting time), and being idle on the menu while eating. I would guess it had no more than an hour of actual gameplay. No joke, the entire game is shown in the trailer. The second half is THE ending "cinematic" that plays after you beat the final puzzle.

I know this review is harsh, and I don't mean to hurt the developers. I have no doubt they put a lot of time and effort into making the core mechanics... but the game lacks content in a huge way. I have not played the second episode yet, but I think it would have been better off as a free content update for episode 1. 

Also, I didn't know about the somewhat hidden option to launch the game specifically for Oculus headsets, which can be found by right clicking the game in your library. I would suggest a tip in-game, as it doesn't appear when you launch the game in SteamVR.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034452210', 'num_games_owned': 315, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 111, 'last_played': 1570650502}

author: {'steamid': '76561198084329921', 'num_games_owned': 571, 'num_reviews': 205, 'playtime_forever': 179, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 174, 'last_played': 1569603023}
review:
Отвратительное управление, нету даже английских субтитров, непонятно что делать
Update. Непонятно что делать только на первом уровне. Вот вам подсказки:
1. [spoiler]Посмотрите вверх[/spoiler] [spoiler]в пещере[/spoiler] [spoiler]над железным камином с дверкой в форме ☢ (рядом с кассетой) [/spoiler]
2.[spoiler]там сигнальный дробокетница с тремя дулами (патроны выглядят как для дробовика)[/spoiler] [spoiler]выстрелите им по колоколам[/spoiler]

В конце просто дух захватывает от красоты... на 10 секунд. Эти 10 секунд, к сожалению, не скрашивают всех минусов игры

Минусы:
* При запуске через Oculus, достижения не засчитываются
* При запуске через SteamVR некоторые функции контроллеров окулус не работают, либо просто настройки сбрасываются, не смотрел, потому что не смог открыть меню
* Нету перемещения стрейфом
* Очень короткая. проходится за 2 часа даже если сильно тупить на первом уровне
* нету субтитров

Мини-минусы:
* нету русского языка
* руки и объекты при взятии проходят сквозь друг друга и стены

Плюсы:
* хорошая графика
* можно телепортироваться касанием на джостик, не нажимая его
* Сюжет, наверное, если вы отлично воспринимаете кряхтящий или диктофонный английский на слух (в этом случае подробно распишите сюжет в каком-гибудь руководстве, мне, да и другим русским будет интересно почитать). В Lone Echo я почему-то достаточно хорошо понимал речь, а здесь меньше половины всей речи

author: {'steamid': '76561197965127215', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 162, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 146, 'last_played': 1570389153}
review:
The Gallery- Episode 1: Call of the Starseed. 

9/10 A spectacular intro. I'd recommend this for <$10 solely for the experience. By itself, it is not a full game, It needs to be played with 2nd half: Heart of Emberstone. Thus far it is an inspired and colorful narrative puzzle game. I look forward to experiencing the second half of the game. I bought both on sale for $15. Worth it if companion half Emberstone can keep up the mystery and intriguing story / environment. 

Pros: 
-Inspired and unique narrative.
-beautiful game design and lighting. 
-art design even make a sewer look like an adventure.
-Sci-Fi
-excellent sound and voice acting.

Cons:
-very short, not a full game on its own.
-control, particularly movement and turning around sucks. Only teleport movement. available.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057110444', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 106, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 106, 'last_played': 1563356100}
review:
It's a nicely polished little adventure, but 20 bucks for about 1,5 hours of gameplay? IMO that's too much to ask for. For 5$ it would be perfect. 10$ would be worth it for fans, but 20$?

Nontheless, the game itself is really well made, has a few little puzzles (nothing hard though) and nice audio. It's kind of lacking a story for being an adventure game though. IMO.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000774400', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 44, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1564332832}
review:
This is not a review yet.
This is a WARNING:
When playing this game, make sure to NOT have any breakable stuff at your ceiling or really anywhere near your play space.
I just managed to break one of the glass bowls of my ceiling lamp with a VIVE wand,
by trying to throw something straight up.
(And I even was thinking about, if my ceiling was high enough before doing it.
  I thought it was. But it wasn't...)
1 Year VR, and this game is the first one to cause casualties.
So be mindful, guys...

Review will follow. If I still have a light in my room by then...

author: {'steamid': '76561198137683769', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 207, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 207, 'last_played': 1561313702}

author: {'steamid': '76561198116057914', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 184, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 184, 'last_played': 1562539474}

author: {'steamid': '76561198013844936', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 94, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 87, 'last_played': 1562527890}
review:
The game is well named. It is much more interested in being pretty than being a game.

Pros:
1) Solid Voice acting
2) Stunning Graphics

Cons:
1) Way too much voice acting. Significant parts of the game where an npc talks over the audio tapes you also need to listen too resulting in being unable to understand either
2) Weak and badly designed puzzles. Several puzzles have bad and/or missing hints (last puzzle needs 4 numbers and only gives hints for 3 of them)
3) Buggy. Very buggy. Game crashed twice in just 60 minutes of play.
4) Inadequate gesture recognition. Several puzzles depend on putting puzzle pieces in the right place or catching items soaring through the air but gesture recognition frequently bugs out during them resulting in missed catches or picking up pieces when trying to place them. Also had puzzle pieces glitch through the surface and disappear inside the puzzle table.
5) Short. Only about an hour of play time even with glitches extending play time, at the price point, that makes it both more expensive and less fun a movie.

author: {'steamid': '76561198297759079', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 148, 'playtime_forever': 38, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38, 'last_played': 1562514135}

author: {'steamid': '76561197970138294', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 86, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 86, 'last_played': 1562458050}

author: {'steamid': '76561197963001712', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 133, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 133, 'last_played': 1562405192}
review:
VRという媒体はプレイヤーをゲームの世界に没入させるものである。それはクソゲーの世界であっても例外ではない。

どういうことかというと、本作は古き悪しき時代のアドベンチャー・ゲームをそのままVRにしたような内容なのだ。
最初のエリアの「パズル」をネタバレにならない程度に書いていくと、まず「ストーリー」的に説明が付かない上に何の思考も要求されないVR版ピクセル・ハントから始まる。本当にピクセルを探すわけではないが、VRではまずやらない行動を要求される（平面ゲームでもあまりやらない人が多いことで有名な行動である）。
その次の「パズル」も、何の理由もなく特定のオブジェクトを撃つというもの。当然「ストーリー」的にも無意味。

この時点で相当なクソゲーだが、VRの神髄を味わえるのはこの後だ。パラノイア（ということになっていて「私はパラノイアです」と口で言うだけで、実質的な個性は皆無）のおじさんがサイドキックとなり、「パズル」を解いていくのだが……。このGMPCがなんとも不快で、一々「まだ解けないんか？　オラもう待ちくたびれたぞ～」「もしかしておめえゲェジなんか？」「ひゃーっ、おめえこんな球も捕れないんか！　こんくらい悟天でも取れっぞ！」などと罵ってくる始末である。
しかも最後のキャッチボールに関しては、飛び始めはElder Scrolls顔負けのフワフワ物理演算なのに落下し始めると急加速するという、消える魔球を放ってきておいてそんなことを言うのだからもうどうしようもない。俺にクソゲーをけしかけたのは貴様だ、そんなこと言えるのかよ！
この浮浪者のおっさんは常にどうでもいいことや煽りをペラペラ喋り続けるのだが、その間にもオーディオログは登場する。なんとかおじさんの科白の隙間を縫って再生するしかない（尤もオーディオログの内容も等しくどうでもいいのだが）。
それとこのおじさん、一挙一投足がめちゃくちゃ遅い。CoDやなんかでNPCのドア開け待ちを強いられることがあるが、VRであれをやられると本当に時間の無駄であることがよく分かる。平面ならば鼻や爪をほじったり、埃を捨てたりする程度のことはできるからだ。

しかしこのおじさんもまだ序の口で、エンディング（というか第二章という名の本編の宣伝）にて登場する新たなおじさんは更にのろまで、科白の内容も更に作者の自己満足丸出しで中身が皆無になっている。このおじさんと同じ部屋に閉じ込められるシーンが何分あるのか分からないが、体感では40分以上に感じた。

操作性に関しても、テレポート＋ルームスケール移動という形式である以上必然と言えるが、とても悪い。この形式では（特に床に落ちたものを拾うとき等に）ゲームに没入するというより現実の部屋と格闘して、現実に開けているスペースとゲーム内で腕を伸ばしたいスペースの方向を合わせることに苦心する羽目になるわけだ（ケーブルに絡まるという問題もある）。それを軽減するために、スティック（トラックパッド）左右の入力で視界を回転させることができたり、テレキネシスが使えたりする……というのが没入感を削がないためのデザインである。
特に後者は見た目的にはリアルじゃないが、VRという媒体においてはあるほうが没入感がある。たとえ物理的にスペースがあっても、手にコントローラーを持ったまま床にあるオブジェクトを拾うという時点で極めて違和感のある行動だからだ。だが本作には、そういうVRならではの工夫などは一切見られない。

それどころか、積極的に没入感を削ごうとしている節すらある。というのも、私は下水道――なぜクソゲーは下水道に拘るのだ？――のシーンで片手に地図、もう片手に懐中電灯を持とうとしたのだが、（一時的には可能だが）それは不可能だった。
何故ならインベントリーはリュックサックの形になっており、それをしまうには掴んで背中に持っていく必要があるため、両手が塞がっていてはできないからだ。インベントリーから取りだしたアイテムを地面に置くことはできないので、両手にアイテムを持つにはリュックサックを捨てていかなければならないわけである。（ちなみに地図は大して意味がないので見る必要はないのだが、問題はそこではない）。

ところでbuilt-for-VRなどと謳っている本作だが、だとすれば浅はかとしか言いようのないグラシック演出がある。それはレンズフレアだ。平面ゲームでさえ莫迦げている演出だが、Virtual Realityと呼ばれる媒体では論外である。顔を振るとそれに合わせてレンズフレアが目の前でぐるぐるしている様には失笑もできない。
主人公は顔にディスプレイを括り付けて、カメラの映像をそこに映して見ているのだろうか？　そんな滑稽な人間がいたら見てみたいものである。

……このようにVRという媒体は、クソゲーの世界にプレイヤーを閉じ込めることで通常のクソゲーの不快感を倍々に増幅して与えることが可能だと分かる。水責めに代わる強化尋問技術として某国情報局がVRゲームの利用を検討しているとの噂だが、それも頷ける話である。

author: {'steamid': '76561197997373553', 'num_games_owned': 433, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 19, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19, 'last_played': 1562273438}
review:
The only form of "locomotion" (movement} in the game is a teleport system they call "blink". You turn when you teleport, and it's extremely wonky.

The developers have stated that an update to add free locomotion (aka. "artificial locomotion") would be considered, and in April 2019 a developer said that an update to add it "was delayed due to technical complications within the project." I don't know if they mean "delayed temporarily" or "delayed indefinitely", however if you can't stand teleport locomotion in VR games then I recommend avoiding this one (at least for now).

Also, if you're OK with teleport locomotion and get the game, then don't configure it to teleport with the right controller. It's completely broken. The first thing I did after the tutorial was configure it for teleporting with the right controller, and then almost immediately afterwards I got stuck inside a rock wall because you can't control the teleport feature when it's bound to the right controller...

author: {'steamid': '76561198041006400', 'num_games_owned': 719, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 246, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 155, 'last_played': 1560398592}
review:
Tl;dr: totally worth it if it's on sale. Think of it like buying a cool interactive movie. 

This was one of my first non-party, single-player-campaign-esque VR games that I decided to buy (after being really impressed with the telekinesis demo). There isn't a whole lot of necessary object interaction in the game, and it was pretty short- under 3 hours if you take your time. But the content that is there felt very polished and satisfying. More like experiencing an interactive movie than a game. I found the atmosphere and world to be very well designed, and the story to be very engaging, short as it was. In particular the ending was suspenseful and well executed.
