author: {'steamid': '76561198443121788', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 106, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 106, 'last_played': 1514422319}
review:
Video review can be found here: https://youtu.be/afK7RC85vb4

Summary: an excellent but short adventure puzzle game that should be bought on a sale or as a bundle with the second game.

I think its worth noting this is one of the first VR games released with the Vive and is showing its age alittle mainly in the fact its teleport locomotion. Has some great puzzles that are enviromental and really make use of being in VR with motion controls.

I think its an essential game for any puzzle game lover just not at full price. 

Check out the full in depth video review at the top.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970519052', 'num_games_owned': 200, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 66, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 66, 'last_played': 1480298563}
review: An early puzzler/escape room styled game. Nicely done with graphics and the story is ok. Catch on sale if these types of games interest you.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979626800', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 106, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 106, 'last_played': 1559205632}
review:
Really mixed feelings with this..

Pros: Good little story, Fun puzzles.

Cons: There is like 2 puzzles, 1-2 interactive things, and the story is maybe 40mins long.

The main length of the game is you just walking around and solving the puzzles. The creators are VERY talented and they should use that talent to make a full game! 20 Bucks for a story that would take 10mins to replay, 30 bucks for what I hear is more of the same. ugh.. It starts to feel like I'm being used.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991124354', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 139, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 139, 'last_played': 1558795709}
review: The whole experience is literally going through a beach and a sewer. After that the story has barely started to begin and they just roll the end credits. The fact that this was one of the first VR games also shows as the movement is a bit clunky at best.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993454734', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 155, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 95, 'last_played': 1564593567}
review: 20 bucks is a lot to ask for a short intro title like this. However, I enjoyed this quite a lot. It's truly a 1-2 hour experience that sets up the next episode. Idk how many episodes this plans to be but after the first I'm hooked. I got both on a whim on sale. Can't wait to start the second episode!

author: {'steamid': '76561197965820698', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 184, 'playtime_forever': 74, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 74, 'last_played': 1558275747}
review: This is a pretty game. It feels like more of a narrative introduction rather than an actual game though. There are a few things you can interact with and one proper puzzle but there isn't a lot of depth here. As a stand-alone product (especially at full price) I'd say avoid it. I've not played the next game in the series yet but this definitely made me want to, so as part of a larger story (and if you can get it at a good discount) then I'd say to give it a go.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072872267', 'num_games_owned': 525, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 74, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 74, 'last_played': 1558047216}
review: Well, many others have said their piece, and I can tell you mine will be no different. However, seeing as how VR needs good content, I'm going to chuck my review in as well. This game has an amazing atmosphere and story, I was hooked a couple minutes in. Some might dislike that it's not really a game but more of an "experience," if you will. I'd say that's fair, although it's a very enjoyable and immersive "experience" with a couple puzzles thrown in the mix (nothing too hard, but nothing too easy). Of course the main thing that's a drawback for this is the price compared to the length, and unfortunately there's no way around that with high quality, story driven, professionally voiced (or at least very well voiced), etc. indie VR games with great writing, music, etc. I look at it as a bit of an investment, saying "have some money, and make some fun VR stuff!" But for the frugal buyer, It's probably best to wait for a sale, as the fact that you get 70-90 minutes of (very good) gameplay/story for $20 is deterring to say the least. I'm looking forward to trying out the second episode, and you can see my review for it there (once I play it, only finished this one 5 minutes ago).

author: {'steamid': '76561197983774183', 'num_games_owned': 844, 'num_reviews': 138, 'playtime_forever': 186, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 186, 'last_played': 1557674639}

author: {'steamid': '76561198085413228', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 127, 'last_played': 1556979325}
review:
Cons: 
-short
-kinda clumsy hands
-not great object collision (I've been spoiled by Lone Echo)

Pros:
-great voice acting
-legit art direction
-fabulous inventory system
-good music

I got this %75 off and it was definitely worth 5 bucks. The shortness really makes it tough to recommend at full price, but this is head and shoulders above the usual VR chaff. I hope more people adopt their inventory setup.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971168834', 'num_games_owned': 303, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 113, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 113, 'last_played': 1556173867}
review:
Wait for a sale, but when it goes on sale grab it. It was worth the $2 I paid.

So, as someone with a Windows MR headset - the game is a little buggy like most others on steam that say they're set for MR.  The position of the hands that take the place of your controllers is really weird, like they're stuck on at a wrong angle - but you get used to that. It does mean that switching from look to teleport to pointing instead is awkward, but since it's a option you have to turn on i'll give them a pass.  Like most other MR games on Steam throwing is more awkward than it should be - but you only have to do it once in the game.  Weirdly enough, catching is really awkward and that is required some, but there's no penalty for getting it wrong so it's just a nuisance.  There was also a bug during the credits where the right controller would not stop vibrating.

As for the experience itself, it's great, and definitely gives that fun 80s adventure movie vibe.  Think a telltale game meets The Goonies. The game parts however... need some work.  Part of this is forgivable, since this is a very early VR game, but some really doesn't make sense.

For instance, there's a pretty long tutorial that covers how the teleport movement and manipulating objects works before the game proper starts.  That's fine, except there's another tutorial once you're in the game on how to interact with objects that stay in your inventory, and dealing with your inventory itself. Why not just cover that in the first out of world tutorial and let everything else happen in world?

The puzzle design needs some work too. It's so bad that I hesitate to call most of them puzzles until the last one which feels like something out of an old school adventure game, with all the good and bad that entails.  The biggest issue is that they need someone to better design them visually, since often the visuals of a puzzle don't match the solution.

(SPOILER WARNING FOR BASICALLY EVERY PUZZLE IN THE GAME) 
One early puzzle has you throw something at a box, but instead of simply pointing out the box and letting you figure out how to get at it the game explicitly tells you to throw something at it.  Once you have what's in the box it's clear what you're supposed to do but completely unclear as to why, and what exactly is going on when you do it.  Later there's a maze that they give you a map to, except the map is more confusing than just walking through the "maze" since there are arrows on the wall telling you where to go. Later you have to do a "puzzle" where you have to put some circuitry together that has color coded wires on it - except the wires and coloring don't mach up at all in the solution, which in essence makes it the baby toy where you put the shaped pegs in the holes.  After all these you finally get a real puzzle at the end and it almost feels wrong, it's such a weird massive jump in the difficulty of the puzzles.  It's an actual puzzle, where you actually have to find clues around the environment, except the visual design and the way the puzzle acts are really poorly designed.  You can brute force the first three numbers, but the last number can't be. There's spots on the board that need to be filled but there's nothing visually connecting them to anything. The same clue is in the environment in two places for no reason.  Oh, and there's no way to set anything down so that you can think.
(OK THATS THE END OF SPOILING EVERY PUZZLE BUT SERIOUSLY THEY ARE VISUALLY AWFULLY DESIGNED)

There are a bunch of glowing reviews of this game from when it came out, but as of 2019 it doesn't have quite the same shine.  Yeah, playing with the popcorn and roman candles in the first scene is still neat, but it's not groundbreaking like it was when VR was first coming out.  What this game has going for it is that 80s adventure movie vibe, setting up a plot that seems like could be fun, and feeling polished in a way a lot of VR games just don't.  As of right now there's a second game in the series i haven't played yet, but if it goes on sale i'll be snatching it up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069142694', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 91, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 91, 'last_played': 1555884269}
review: What you gotta remember with vr stories is that they are still in their infancy. Something made by a small studio strictly for vr is gonna be at best an indie ecxperience. This game is just that. Still, if you have five bucks to spare when this goes on sale, I recommend you trying it out. Dont forget about the sequel.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975012950', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 80, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 80, 'last_played': 1554523274}
review:
When I finished this game I was very much disappointed and considered refunding it - it's short, and ends the moment something interesting happens.

My recommendation is based on two things: Firstly, get this on sale. It's barely worth a sale price with 75%+ off. Secondly, get the second episode "Heart of the Emberstone" which is a much more complete experience. Without the second part, the  build up in this one is worthless, but the story does begin here and, on sale, this is an acceptable part of the larger story.

author: {'steamid': '76561198070129442', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 149, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 149, 'last_played': 1555113077}
review: With under two hours of underwhelming gameplay, force teleport movement, stupid easy puzzles, and set character animations that pace through solid objects, this game was not worth the sale price. I would't pay more that $3 for this rubbish.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036358445', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 111, 'last_played': 1554736922}
review:
Recommended for first-time VR players as its nothing amazing. Good game to get used to VR mechanics or to watch a friend play but nothing to really get the teeth into as the plot is very shallow.
Had a few bugs while playing such as the backpack not spawning properly which made using any items frustrating and at the end my right controller wouldn't stop vibrating and the game complained about losing tracking when it was tracking fine.
Other than that the game worked very well including some obscure things like soda exploding if you put it in the fire which was a nice touch.
Few design flaws around the game such as giving you 3 cassettes to listen to but nagging you to get on with the puzzle at hand, or the final puzzle at the end just seemed like a grab to extend the "play" time.
In whole it seems like another cash-grab just about big enough to not be refundable (I completed in just just under 2 hours) however if that doesn't bother you can you get it cheap then it might be worth it.

review: This is more of an interactive movie than a game; you continue on a set path with some minor puzzles on the way. I personally found the story to be pretty formulaic. It's a 1-2 hour experience; in my opinion not worth the $20 they're asking, and not even worth the $5 sale price that I paid.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019217695', 'num_games_owned': 309, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 81, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 81, 'last_played': 1552165286}
review:
30 minutes in : Hey this seems quite good. Nice atmosphere and puzzels.
45 minutes in : Ok, gliched into a wall and had to restart. Story has not really opened up yet. 
60 minutes in : There´s some (probably) interesting scribbles on the wall here, but it glitches out if I look straight at it. Also, the pieces of this puzzle doesn´t really fit toghether, but its solved anyway. Was this an early access?
80 minutes in : Ok now something happened! I guess that earlier part was the prologue. Let´s see what this game is made of.
84 minutes in : Game ends.
90 minutes in : My face is still angry and confused. 20e for a prologue? Is part two the tutorial? This is some EA class stuff this is.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986999150', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 436, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 436, 'last_played': 1552453482}
review:
Have you seen the goonies?

What about stargate?

Do you like the futuristic aesthetics of halo?

Imagine if all three of them got together and cooked you filet minon.

The Gallery - Episode 1: Call of the Starseed fails at one thing, and that's marketing. I think the name was a mouthful and confusing.

What this game should have been called is simply Starseed Episode 1: the Calling.

The game is about 2 hours long if you play it the way it was meant to be played. With a sense of wonderment. 
Explore and pay attention to the story, and check out some of the cool things that you always thought would be cool but you're too much of a b**** to do in real life like: Exploring sewers, Launching Roman Candles from your hand without the risk of blowing it off. Oh and Fkn board an alien ship hidden deep in the earth.

The characters are wonderful and believable, but few, which fits kind of nicely with the story actually. The sewer dwelling professor is an eccentric pretty much benevolent Ted Kascynski, who finds a mysterious artifact, and your sister who has gone on ahead through a cave and sewers to find out what he found. 

There are a few moments of genuine awe, in this game, and I encourage you to play it while you remember how fun it was to explore as a kid. 

Think of it as a really expensive Interactive movie.

It's worth the money, you can't apply the standard hours playable/$ equation that you do for pancake games here, because well, pancake games have gotten formulaic and bland.

This is the new frontier bois

It gets a little dark towards the end. No combat, this game is the story you always wish your boring life could have been lol.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041301654', 'num_games_owned': 419, 'num_reviews': 131, 'playtime_forever': 27, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 27, 'last_played': 1542748750}
review: VR games have a much higher interest barrier than other games simply because I have to be standing up to play them. If  a game cant overshadow my knees crying out in constant agony then there is really no point in me waiting around to see what it is about. Starseed is to short and to uninteresting to justify the $15, let alone my having to stand up for it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007223119', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 174, 'playtime_forever': 117, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 117, 'last_played': 1551625132}
review: Kurze VR- Story mit Rätseleinlagen.  Grafik ist immer noch ansehnlich. Auch die Vertonung ist gut. Die Steuerung war damals noch wegweisend und entspricht immer noch dem heutigen Bewegungscontrollerstandart. Nur die freie Bewegung fehlt, dafür funktioniert das teleportieren einwandfrei. Das VR-Erlebnis ist immer noch eines der besseren. Leider ist es auch mit etwa einer Stunde Spielzeit viel zu kurz. Dafür sind die 19,99 Euro zu teuer. Würde auf einen Sale warten und es erst dann kaufen, wenn es um die 10 Euro kostet. Also zum HALBEN Preis bekommt es meine volle Empfehlung. So bekommt es nur einen Daumen hoch, weil es halt ein sauberes VR-Erlebnis ist.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077412714', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 114, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 114, 'last_played': 1551600071}

I am f*cking speechless.....

author: {'steamid': '76561198075182890', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 135, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 110, 'last_played': 1557007461}
review: Good game but short. Would not recommend this game at $20 or more. I would say around $10 would be a reasonable price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084674911', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 97, 'playtime_forever': 128, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 128, 'last_played': 1551487057}
review: Short, but brilliant! the sounds and atmosphere are top notch and the voice acting, WOW,  is better than that!  Not only was it fun to play and explore, but the story is very interesting and the puzzles are very well made with a moderate difficulty.  The animation sequences just blew me away!  The sounds, lighting, each environment drew me in and I was THAT guy holding the flashlight.  When I got to the end, I was disappointed that it ended but I felt like I had accomplished something!   The "gift"... WOW! Cant wait to use it!  The whole sequence of getting it was awesome! Everything about this game is very well done and VERY professional and polished where it needs to be. The graphics are not lavish system hogs but are well done.  The inventory system is a backpack that you can grab from over your shoulder to grab something out, or drop items over your should to put them in, Its a pretty convenient system.  Movement default is directional blink with the thumb pad for NICE and easy locomotion!   This title is a definite MUST HAVE!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198191701346', 'num_games_owned': 76, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 110, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 110, 'last_played': 1551466750}
review:
Не смотря на то что я никогда не любил такой тип VR игр - головоломки. Но эта игра меня переубедила и мне она понравилась. По началу хотел бэкнуть так как тупо не понял что требуется от меня, но затем все стало продвигаться.
К сожалению игра супер короткая, с моим жестким тупняком я ее прошел за 110 минут, бэкать не буду, так как игра хороша и стоит потраченных денег по скидке. Графика в игре приятная хоть и простая (на скринах все красивее кажется). Головоломок не много и они не сложные (кроме последней). 
Прошел на одном дыхании, затянуло. Ощущение походи как будто ты смотришь фильм но при этом сам в этом фильме. Как сон, в котором ты видишь какой то фильм. Под конец эпичность нарастает и уже кажется что ты не в VR а реально на пороге нечто великого. И тут игра кончается. Хорошо что вторую часть купил сразу, буду завтра проходить.

review: I have never felt so scammed in my life. 20 dollars for a prologue that lasts 2 hours at a maximum? I got the fuckin bundle and I'm too far in for a refund, so we'll see if Ep. 2 is another overpriced 2 hours of gameplay. Even if it is, I don't recommend getting this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012639742', 'num_games_owned': 272, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 93, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 52, 'last_played': 1551614414}
review:
I dont usually like story driven games, but this game is freaking awesome for its controls and graphics alone!

My RX480 can run this game smoothly at 3x supersampling and the game is absolutely beautiful! (Actually it was running it smoothly at 5X until I went to fiddle with in-game graphics menu, after which I could "only" run it at 3x, but there isnt much difference between 5x and 3x to be honest)
And the physics are superb. The game gets controls and physics better than most VR shooters. I spent minutes just admiring the golden pocket watch and how its chain reacted with my controller like it was a real life object!

Im going to keep this company under my watch, one day they will make a VR game never seen before

author: {'steamid': '76561198006238716', 'num_games_owned': 1008, 'num_reviews': 97, 'playtime_forever': 100, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 100, 'last_played': 1549022010}

author: {'steamid': '76561198152689511', 'num_games_owned': 98, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 186, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 186, 'last_played': 1518373167}
review: Beautiful graphics and it shows a huge future for VR, I played this almost a year ago and I just realized I never wrote a review for this game! It is really well-done, and the puzzles are a little hard...but you will not be stuck for hours on one challenge.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990024108', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 82, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1548615558}
review:
Maybe back in 2016 this would fly, but now it's just too short, too bland and completely unengaging. 

It looks good enough (except the character model of the old guy) but the 'puzzles' are all solved for you through audiologs or written on objects in the game. It's just a slow simon says walking simulator. Play the second one, as the first one is completely not needed for either its gameplay or story.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985135736', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 134, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 134, 'last_played': 1548105956}
review:
Maybe worth a few dollars, but that's all.   The game was played on an Oculus Rift.

Playtime was max 2 hours, graphics quality was so-so.  Definitely not optimized, or even nominally updated for use on an Oculus Rift.  Trigger buttons are used to 'grab' instead of the Rift's handle button, you kind of have to guess and check on the rest of the controls since the tutorial keeps referencing what I assume are standard buttons for the Vive(?)

Biggest issue was that the the VR worldview would get 'stuck' fairly frequently so you would move your head and the view would remain static.  Very nauseating actually.  It would 'fix itself' after a few seconds and properly track head motion again.  This is the only game in which I've experienced this...
developer_response:
Hey Isoterra! 

Sounds like you had some issues related to the SteamVR version of the game... Just so you or any other Rift players know, we actually include the native Oculus version on Steam. Simply right-click the game in your library and select "Launch The Gallery in Oculus VR mode". Playing the game this way with Rift should resolve most of the problems you mentioned!

author: {'steamid': '76561197977564809', 'num_games_owned': 1316, 'num_reviews': 84, 'playtime_forever': 138, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 138, 'last_played': 1547445507}
review: Short, but brilliant. A wonderful experience in VR that I completely loved. Fantastic music by Jeremy Soule (Skyrim, Total Annihilation, Supreme Commander, 100's of others) and others, with some cute, short puzzles and fantastic set pieces, locations and characters that make you want to play the second episode as soon as you can. This will probably hook you in.

𝕺𝖛𝖆𝖙𝖘

Перевод:

Новая механическая головоломка, которая не является рутиной, которую легко решить, и в то же время ее непросто взломать. Звездный дизайн и реализация звука, до такой степени, что я начинаю моргать, лишь бы почувствовать, как изменилась атмосфера микса. Дизайн окружающей среды настолько хорошо выполнен, что я просто взаимодействую с его системами для удовольствия. Арка повествования, совершенно убедительная и полная радикальных, но подходящих поворотов, особенно ближе к концу Эпизода 1.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052353402', 'num_games_owned': 637, 'num_reviews': 860, 'playtime_forever': 161, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 161, 'last_played': 1544254034}
review:
Call of the Starseed is an interesting game, environments are very good looking and immersive, controls are intuitive. Hard to believe that it was made more than 2 years ago. 
Main thing that I didn't like is item interactions: there are very few meaningful combinations and most of them are showed off in the first location and are not used to progress in a main quest.

Overall, it's good game, but very short, so if you are looking for value, better buy it on sale or in bundle with the second episode.

author: {'steamid': '76561198839008241', 'num_games_owned': 257, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 152, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 144, 'last_played': 1585183762}

author: {'steamid': '76561198006972352', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 289, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 289, 'last_played': 1540325361}
review:
I'm a little torn in my opinion on this game, even though I would still recommend it.

Story:
The story is awesome and makes you want the episode 2. At first you are story-wise relatively thrown into cold water,  I would have liked a little intro.
-> 9/10

Gameplay:
Quite good and quite immersive, many great ideas, but you can tell the age a bit. 
What bothered me is that you can't set the tape volume separately and yet quite a lot of background noise is there. 
A big minus is the handling of mapborders, when stepping in a wall, which can happen by mistake because of the partially low ingame ceilings , the field of vision is blurred. Unfortunately, all menus are blurred, too, which has the consequence that you can do nothing more than hope that you somehow teleport back into the game area or restart the game.
-> 6/10

Price-performance:
Like most VR games, the game is not too long, if you take your time and look at the many small details, it takes about 4 hours for a playthrough. Rushed it's doable in about 1-2 hours. So far so good, but since the game is ONLY story-based, the re-playability is literally zero. So the whole thing is more of a unique experience.

I got episodes 1 and 2 in the bundle offer for  25 €, and I would buy it again anytime.

The list price of 20 € is understandable, because really a lot of development work was done. Especially in comparison with various other VR titles it can be considered normal, but it is still not cheap. I'm not too shure if I would buy it for the full price.
-> 6/10

Conclusion:
All in all, I give the game a rating of 6.5  maybe 7/10 according to today's standards. (A year ago, it would probably have gotten a 7.5-8.)
BUT: The sequel (episode 2) is definitely a lot more refined and is absolutely worth it (about 8.5 / 10)! For story understanding, this episode is still recommended/necessary!

author: {'steamid': '76561198066914879', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 269, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 269, 'last_played': 1541283310}
review: Like others, this game is simply unfullfilling, the cut scenes are painfully long, and the story is just not thought out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030134511', 'num_games_owned': 361, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 60, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1474218153}
review: Bundled with Vive. Tried it, and took my time. It had some cool interactions, but the puzzles dead-ended in more or less the starting area before it explained what I was looking for or what my purpose even was. Every single interactable was a dead end. I'm not about to take off my headset to look up a guide to figure out where I'm going. I would have just read a book if I wanted that. I completed both portal games solo and multiplayer just fine without a guide, so the blame here is squarely on this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986040862', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 62, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 62, 'last_played': 1540478280}
review:
Played through episode 1 and 2 and I cannot in good conscience recommend a game with such an unfulfilling ending. There's no conclusion, no explanation to anything.
I need closure.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051872198', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 232, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 232, 'last_played': 1540672166}
review:
This game was amazing. The artstyle, the gameplay, the voice acting. It really shows the potential in VR. I got this and episode 2 for 15 dollars, which I think is definitely worth it. It's short, 2-3 hours if you spend time playing around and exploring everything. 1 hour if you rush around, but why would you do that? Definitely worth it and a much more memorable experience than a cinema ticket for the same price. And you get to support the development of amazing VR content.

Make sure you play on the Oculus Player when you launch the game (you, or at least I, can choose between two, choose the bottom one). For some reason it has better customization and controls.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002461328', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 114, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 114, 'last_played': 1540546151}
review:
Schönes Spiel. Allerdings sehr kurz. Ich hatte es nach knapp 2 Stunden durch.
Bereuen tue ich den Kauf jedoch nicht. Die Fortbewegung ist mit einer art teleportation gelöst. Beim Teleportieren kann die Blickrichtung neu eingestellt werden. Scheinbar geht jedoch das ausrichten des Headsets nicht. Was mich dann dazu gezwungen hatte, das ganze Spiel durch zu stehen. Ist allerdings bei der kurzen dauer nicht wirklich ein Problem.
In diesem Spiel gibt es keine Kämpfe oder horrorähnliche Szenarien. Was ich als sehr angenehm empfinde(bin dann doch ein kleiner Feigling). Es wird durchgehend Englisch gesprochen. 
In einer Szene hat sich das Spiel "aufgehängt". Ich musste das Spiel beenden und neustarten damit es in der Story dann weiterging. Dafür musste ich dann ein Rätsel wiederholen, was dann aber auch nicht so lange gedauert hatte, da einmal gelöste Rätsel sich leicht und schnell erneut lösen lassen.
Da kommen wir dann auch zum Wiederspielwert. Der ist so gut wie nicht vorhanden. Es ist eine Story mit hoher Immersion und einigen Rätseln. Ich freue mich riesig auf den zweiten Teil, den ich in den nächsten Tagen starten werde.
Viel Spaß mit dem Spiel!

author: {'steamid': '76561198099841240', 'num_games_owned': 2347, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 13, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1540093832}
review: The lack of traditional movement is a huge NO for me.  I have always hated games that have this "blink" crap.  Fine, keep it for those who get sick, but offer a second option.  I read a dev say they stuck with Blink to prevent people from getting sick.  I get it, but why not add the option for others to just walk?  That along with how short this game it, just not worth it

author: {'steamid': '76561197998734777', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 13, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1539779088}
review: Wat ik minder leuk vind aan dit spel is, dat ik hem heb geinstalleerd en dat er maar voor de helft op mijn beeldscherm te zien is. Voor de rest heb ik nog geen mening over het spel. Als iemand met het zelfde probleem zat hoe heeft hij of zij dit opgelost?

author: {'steamid': '76561198832001481', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 145, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 145, 'last_played': 1537950518}
review: Stunning graphics, soundscape, voice acting.  Just extraordinary.  Loved this and the sequel is even better.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988197432', 'num_games_owned': 509, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 93, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 93, 'last_played': 1537746213}
review:
First of all i would like to say that i did like the game and the mechanics.
Having said that. I fell kind of cheated, an hour game play with not much real happening for 20€ is very overcharged, maybe i had to high hopes :( after reading the description. 

I wish they could write a better description. And write the description conserning this as an episode and not the game as a  whole for the missing episodes.

So i wouldn't recommend this game, If there isn't a steam sale for about +60% atleast. And specially 2 years after it's release.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979613236', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 139, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 139, 'last_played': 1537532785}
review: Relatively short but worth it during steam sales. The game has been around for a while and you can tell, but that is by no means a turn off. It's a fun play through with and well thought out. The only negative I can mention is the controller vibration in the last scene. I unplugged my controller and just put up with "tracking lost".

author: {'steamid': '76561198065552125', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 128, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 128, 'last_played': 1536670058}
review: Storyline is lame and puzzles are frustrating.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972321969', 'num_games_owned': 189, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 51, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 51, 'last_played': 1536438150}
review:
В 2018 году довольно посредственно, что в управлении, что в сюжете/механике.
Только телепорт.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964646136', 'num_games_owned': 216, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 64, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 64, 'last_played': 1535918536}
review: Ich finde nicht das Preis und Leistung stimmen. Das Spiel hat knapp eine Stunde gedauert, hat keinen wiederspiel wert und auch wenn die Story gerade erst intressant wird, werde ich keine 25€ für den 2. Teil zahlen. Da gehe ich dann lieber mit Kollegen in einen echten Escape room da habe ich dann mehr von.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075793494', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 363, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 224, 'last_played': 1535652386}
review:
Ce jeu est vraiment bien réalisé la VR y est tres bien prise en charge. certain objets inutiles (donc indispensables) interagissent avec l environnement de facon amusante. L'histoire est bien construite et se termine en apothéose. Le jeu est quand même assez court compter 3 heures. Les dialogues et les textes sont uniquement en anglais et sont essentiels à la progression. 
Je vous recommande ce jeu

author: {'steamid': '76561197967672119', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 59, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59, 'last_played': 1534769457}
review: Enjoyable enough but it is a one hour experience, and that experience wasnt as good as a decent movie. Go to the theatre instead.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991858068', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 88, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 88, 'last_played': 1534552579}
review: This game blew me away. It is the first VR game that felt like a real game created for VR. If you are tired of standing still shooting arrows at waves of unity engine stock assets, this game might be what you are looking for. This is the first game that I've felt like I needed to write a review for. It's an intruiging story in the vein of 80's adventure movies like the goonies. It is short, only around an hour and a half but absolutely left me wanting to play the next episode. Well worth the price of admission.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980128364', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 214, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 214, 'last_played': 1533746694}
review:
Fantastic. This is like the old point-and-click graphic adventures, but in VR. The user interface is mostly great (especially the inventory/backpack system. I prefer aiming with controller for blink/teleport movement instead of aim with eyes, but they fixed that in episode 2)

But the story, atmosphere, graphics and sound quality are all top-notch. Feels like The Longest Journey meets Stranger Things. But the VR environment also makes it feel a bit like an escape room.

Puzzles (if you can call them that) could be a little more challenging, but still very fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003117833', 'num_games_owned': 1217, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 202, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 202, 'last_played': 1533238926}
review:
On the fence about this one. Cost me £3.75 in the Summer Sale and although I think its good, there's basically atmosphere and two or three puzzles, and some nice VR experience to be had. I spent 3 hours in it, taking my time. The equivalent of a long movie for about the same price. I want to play the second half, however that is much more expensive and I will have to wait.

I would have found a locomotion option much more immersive. Teleporting makes the whole thing like one of those point and click games and I didn't buy into VR for that. The main NPC in the game was entertaining enough, and it was very pretty. Just not enough content I feel, but possibly my expectations are too high this being my first VR adventure experience.

I would vote in the middle if I could, but as I can't, I vote positive but only if you pick it up in the sale for just a few quid.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970425431', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 199, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 199, 'last_played': 1533214674}
review: Excellent VR product (on Vive). Could have done with a few more 'puzzles' but overall a pleasant way to spend a few hours. Looking forward to Ep. 2

author: {'steamid': '76561198104680381', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 236, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 162, 'last_played': 1543016531}
review: This is a truly immersive VR puzzle game with beautiful graphics and a compelling story.  I was a bit disappointed that the game was over so quickly (2.7 hours including the long cinematic ending), though that's my only notable complaint.  Looking forward to picking up the next episode (but not likely at $30) and checking out the locomotion mechanics.

author: {'steamid': '76561198130322265', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 125, 'last_played': 1530294722}
review:
Une expérience VR un peu courte pour le prix selon madame ^^, les graphismes sont très beaux et l'ambiance est au rendez-vous. La prise en main et l'intéractivité de l'environnement est vraiment poussée.

Nous avons un HTC Vive, 1080Ti, i74770 et tout ronronne parfaitement.

Un beau jeu, très intéractif, qui pour nous se joue dans une pièce 2m x 2m.

Attention, comme beaucoup de jeux en VR il n'y a pas d'interface Française ni d'audio en Français, cela ne nous pose aucun problème mais il y a des instructions difficile à comprendre pour nous qui comprenons facilement l'anglais pourtant.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073187377', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 156, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 128, 'last_played': 1533661649}
review:
虽然没有中文可能要让一些英语苦手受苦了，但是总体而言这是一款不错的游戏。（但是第二代我非常不喜欢）
地图是线性的，气氛渲染等方面我个人觉得非常棒。无恐怖要素可放心哈哈。
算是一款解密游戏，但是解密谜题相对于比较简单并不费时间。
要说什么缺点就是流程太短了！！！但是如果您是刚接触vr，这是一款很不错的入门作品来感受vr的魅力。

author: {'steamid': '76561198255177832', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 138, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 138, 'last_played': 1534012038}
review:
VR is evolving very slowly but this early title already feels dated. Maybe it was amazing when it was released in 2016 but now, even considering the limited game library available for VR, this game is not very good. Bad graphics, bad character animations, basic level design.

I fell like I'm complaining about how lame the first airplanes were... Kudos for the developers for being one the first out of the gates and moving VR forward.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991477148', 'num_games_owned': 621, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 650, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 650, 'last_played': 1531055763}
review:
I would only recommend this game when it's on sale. The experience is really cool, but as many other reviews have mentioned, it is very short. Some attributes of the game do just feel like a showcase for what VR is capable of, but perhaps that's because of when the game was released. It equates to about an hour of gameplay.

I am looking forward to playing episode 2. The story has just begun in this game, the atmosphere is really cool, there are still many questions, and I am interested in seeing where the story leads. There is a backpack inventory system which works surprising well despite having to reach over your head to use it. I've had some experiences in other games where anything over-the-head or behind-the-back is buggy and unreliable, but this one is solid.

I would recommend this on sale if you're interested in seeing the kind of immersive and story-driven environment that VR has to offer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020169469', 'num_games_owned': 1370, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 148, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 148, 'last_played': 1530979195}
review:
A good point'n click/walking simulator, with an emphasis on "cinematic experience".

Wouldn't buy it for its full price, for there is little to do in the end and much to see in the next episodes.

Played it on a WMR, with some issues with catching stuff in middle air (wasted more fusibles than there are props in the entire game). Yet, I was able to finish it. So it's ok I guees.

Overall, I recommend it for the narrative obsessed and wannabe-detective VR enthusiasts.

author: {'steamid': '76561198142614844', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 119, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 119, 'last_played': 1530935987}
review:
Nicely detailed graphics and immersive atmosphere. Enjoyable puzzles that can be solved if you explore a little, and think about the provided clues.
I wish it had the option of free locomotion instead of "blink" teleportation so I could enjoy wandering around this beautifully made VR experience instead of skipping the journey, but the quality of the game mostly makes up for it.
Switching off the boundary in the options was an improvement, since they often cut into solid objects, ruining the immersion.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994209383', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 172, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 113, 'last_played': 1530751120}
review:
Советую! Если вы вживаетесь в роли - вам понравится. Стоял с открытым ртом в конце, хосспади, для таких штук VR потрясающ. Еще я пугливый и в конце старался не смотреть на *спойлер*, мрачный уж больно.)) 
Короткая, но вы ведь покупаете игры для впечатлений, верно?

author: {'steamid': '76561198020964942', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 299, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 299, 'last_played': 1501720048}
review: Short but very Good.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040644553', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 147, 'playtime_forever': 115, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 115, 'last_played': 1530457835}
review:
Although the game has interesting parts and visually well done in relation to the interaction in VR, due to lack of subtitles even in English, it is difficult to understand the audios of the game that are only in English, for those who do not speak English. The subtitles would help a lot. I'm not going to buy Episode 2 myself because of it.

Embora o jogo seja visualmente e tenha interação em VR muito boas, é uma excelente aventura, a falta de subtitulos mesmo em ingles dificulta e prejudica muito o envolvimento com o jogo, porque tudo praticamente é passado por audio e muitas vezes dificeis de se entender durante o jogo. Os desenvolvedores disseram ha mais de uma ano que estavam trabalhando nisso, mas até agora nada. Não vou comprar o episodio 2 por conta disso tambem. Uma pena.

author: {'steamid': '76561198398512043', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 112, 'last_played': 1540643598}
review:
I realy don't know what to say. It's one of the most immersive VR games, this episode is ruined by lack if content. The whole series is just too slow to release, and still no episode 3 (does this remind you of something?). I recomend this game , if you get it on sale, otherwise its just not worth it.
The game has so little content and it tries to mitigate that by (atleast for me) frustrating puzzles.
Plot:
[spoiler] Your sister gone missing, find her. Start out on a beach, look around, shoot some bells, find key, enter maze, exit maze, catch some stuff without it falling, fiblnd some stuff and put it into right place, collect stuff in zero G (COOL) and put the stuff into the right sockets (frustrating for me). And a cutscene, after wich the credits roll. [/spoiler]

Performance is very good on a min spec. GPU (GTX1060 6 Gb). Other specs. are ab i7 7700k, 16 Gb RAM

TLDR: Good game, but short. Not worth the asking price. Get it on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970124254', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 235, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 231, 'last_played': 1570120232}
review: One of my favorite experiences in VR so far, fantastic visuals, great puzzles, interesting story.

author: {'steamid': '76561197965731855', 'num_games_owned': 767, 'num_reviews': 144, 'playtime_forever': 97, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 97, 'last_played': 1530023872}
review: I wish there was more of a buildup before you-know-what, but other than that, a great experience!

author: {'steamid': '76561198008181656', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 82, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1529835287}
review: Extremely short game at 83 minutes my first playthrough. Having said that I really enjoyed it and recommend it. I got it for $5 so it was worth it to me, and I will have fun finding the many achievements I missed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198271947563', 'num_games_owned': 36, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 80, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 80, 'last_played': 1486311279}
review: bu oyun ne la ne ara envanterime düştü

author: {'steamid': '76561198101985123', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 158, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 89, 'last_played': 1530493897}
review:
The atmosphere of this game is incredible, the puzzles are challenging, and the audiolog storytelling is incredibly immersive.
This game is at its weakest when it glues you to the spot and has you listen to monologues that go on for minutes at a time.
The ending was anticlimactic but I would absolutely play this again for the atmosphere alone.

author: {'steamid': '76561198354996742', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 118, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 118, 'last_played': 1529070931}
review: consider only 2 puzzle?

author: {'steamid': '76561198070823568', 'num_games_owned': 225, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 132, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 132, 'last_played': 1529079534}
review:
** NO STORY SPOILERS **

Got this game with the vive for free. It's a unique & interactive game, well, episode! 

You are to figure out where your sister went as she is missing & on the way find clues & tapes. 
You get a backpack to store important items in, which you equip reaching over your shoulder which is a pretty neat mechanic, I would say.
This backpack is a 3D object with slots on it & it's easy to use, haven't had problems.

The game has a nice atmosphere to it, which ofcourse plays a big role for VR! 
Since I won't go into the story at all I'll just list some pro's & con's:

+ Nice atmosphere
+ Neat backpack mechanic
+ Some parts are very interactive
+ Love the light sources
+ Mysterious & interesting story

- Quite a short game (ofcourse it's only 1 episode, but 20 euro's... idk)
- Teleportation can sometimes be annoying (you aim with your head, however I believe you can change this in settings)

So overall, It's a nice game & I'll be sure to get the next episode, but I feel like the price is a bit too much for only 1 episode of about 2-3 hours of gameplay. Hopefully the story gets even more interesting in these other episodes!

author: {'steamid': '76561198013820306', 'num_games_owned': 740, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 114, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 114, 'last_played': 1528669207}
review: Built from the ground up for VR, it plays and feels incredibly immersive. The total gameplay time feels a bit short, but for a single epsiode it's probably about right. It definitely makes you want to come back for Episode 2.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012399536', 'num_games_owned': 116, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 54, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 54, 'last_played': 1518635571}
review: This is a great VR experience, although it felt like it needed more puzzles but overall, a great example of what VR has to offeer graphic wise

author: {'steamid': '76561197970754094', 'num_games_owned': 455, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 77, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 77, 'last_played': 1528054025}
review:
Warning up front: This game will only take about an hour to complete. Take that into consideration when you buy it, and how much you're willing ot pay for it. 

This is a VR exploration/puzzle game, kind of like Myst or similar games. You're dropped into a world with no real explanation and then solve a few puzzles and interact with a couple of characters, then before you know it it's over until the next episode comes out. 

There's a neat inventory system that uses a backpack, and parts of the story are told through cassette tapes that you play in your 'Tony' walkman. 

The universe is sci-fi and has an 80's feel (see the walkman mentioned above, as well as the soundtrack is a little Synthwave sounding).

I'd like to play more, the story was just getting interesting when it ended. 

Not sure I'll buy future games if they are this expensive and this short. Maybe once the entire series is complete and they charge about $15 for it, it would be worth it. 

It's a neat experience, just depends on if it's worth the money for you for such a short experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000102731', 'num_games_owned': 860, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 97, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 97, 'last_played': 1526615533}
review:
플레이시간 1시간 ~ 1시간30분정도로 가격에 비해 많이 짧다

퍼즐요소는 영어만 된다면 많이 쉬움

이동 수단이 텔레포트밖에 없어서 아쉽다

그래픽은 예쁘게 되어있고 성우 연기도 나쁘진 않음

정가에 사긴 좀 그렇고 할인할 때 사면 후회하지는 않을거다

한번 끝내고 다시 할거같지는 않고, 친구들한테 VR 체험시켜주기 딱 좋을듯

author: {'steamid': '76561197979698239', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 111, 'last_played': 1526308752}
review: Short but immersive VR adventure. A few puzzles, Myst-like in a sense, I didn't need to refer to any online hints which was satisfying. Not quite AAA but definitely AA+.

author: {'steamid': '76561198143989359', 'num_games_owned': 255, 'num_reviews': 161, 'playtime_forever': 90, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20, 'last_played': 1575809366}
review: Скучная

author: {'steamid': '76561198015387817', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 76, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 76, 'last_played': 1525031738}
review:
This is what VR was meant for. This game takes all the elements of Virtual Reality and combines them for an extremely rich, albeit short (1 hour) experience.

Narrative: Excellent, engaging story that is told to the player through a variety of mediums, which is very important in VR. The voice work is phenomenal, and a great way of ensuring the player absorbs necessary information without reading walls of text.

Visuals: Beautiful environments, however some areas would benefit from lighting retouches. 

Puzzles: Very intuitive and fun - they are very tactile-orientated. The player is given the chance to utilise different physical elements of VR rarely explored in other, more arcade-like titles.

This game has a strong element of adventure, sci-fi, mystery and slight-horror. This game shows what VR offers beyond conventional gaming.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000870312', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 101, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 101, 'last_played': 1524504128}
review:
POTENTIAL SPOILERS MARKED AT END OF REVIEW

This is an amazing, immersive experience that I would recommend to everyone with the hardware, assuming you can warrant paying the frankly absurd base price, due to the length of this episode, get it on a good sale for sure.
It took me just a couple hours to complete, at a relatively slow pace. (Although in VR this easily felt like 5-6 hours.)

If I can make a suggestion, it would be that teleport locomotion helps to combat motion sickness, but for those of us who have already gotten over that issue, teleporting becomes a massive immersion break, so please, please, add a walking/sliding style locomotion system for the large amount of people who can handle it. Of course make this a toggle, with teleport being default.

Now on to the tricky bit:

I adore VR, I think the immersion value alone, if the game has the most basic support, is phenominal.
[i]That's the problem, I can't tell if the game itself is fantastic, or if it is simply being carried by my love of VR.[/i]

I think it does a good job of immersion, and scale, and takes advantage of almost every opportunity given for more immersion, especially in the lighting department, however, you will find a flashlight within the first few minutes, before it is even needed. This means that all the other lighting options are null and void from the start, such as the lighter used in a GIF in the description, that scene simply wouldn't happen, because you have a flashlight.

Last thing to remember is this an episodic game, so if you want to continue the story, you will need to pay for the other episodes. I have not done this at time of review, so cannot comment on the other episode(s).

[b]TLDR: Game/story is epic so far, but very short for the price, get it on sale. Highly recommended for less than $10.[/b]

~~~###~~~POTENTIAL SPOILERS AHEAD! YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED~~~###~~~

[spoiler]
The end of this episode sees you activating an alien relic, and being transported to a strange ship looking thing to meet with some ?alien dude who seems evil, but friendly, but evil, but maybe friendly, and then the credits for this episode roll.
This ending, from the moment you activate the relic, to the credits rolling, is EPIC, making perfect use of VR to create a sense of scale. The ship for example, is HUGE, and it's in a massive underground cavern that is filled with flowing magma.

I won't go any further with spoilers, as I have given only experience spoilers, the story is yours to explore. (Cause I have no clue where it's going. XD)
[/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198062701896', 'num_games_owned': 481, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 101, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 101, 'last_played': 1471131226}
review:
Is it fun the first time? Yes.
Is it pretty? Yes.
Are the puzzles challenging and fun? Meh. 
Is it worth $20, or even $5 on sale? Not in a million years.
If you've got a functioning brain all the puzzles should just breeze by and you're left with about one hour of gameplay, maybe 2 and a half if you explore and do everything. As much as I like the aesthetics and the world they've set up, I feel like a price tag of $30 (What I paid for on release) should get you 5 episodes, not one.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970418151', 'num_games_owned': 124, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 122, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 122, 'last_played': 1513522901}

author: {'steamid': '76561198025099752', 'num_games_owned': 289, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 131, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 131, 'last_played': 1523760657}
review:
Just finished trhis last night (finally, it took me a lot of off/on playing over what was probably a year) and dang. Really good. Talking about the ending at all ventures into spoiler territory but I am SUPER excited to continue with Episode 2.

Highly recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064798301', 'num_games_owned': 288, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 90, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 90, 'last_played': 1523597956}
review:
It's a very short game, ill start with that. What you think is the start of the game, might just be the end. HOWEVER, this is clearly because of the developers plans with the Eposidic style. You should consider this an intro. That being said, the 20$ price point is a little rough ONLY because of the length. Every other aspect of this game has me blown away and so exteremely excited for the future. The mechanics of this game really utilize VR controls and potential, something other games seem to struggle with sometimes. This game makes you throw, catch, move, investigate closely, and do things simple things that reinforce the immersion. At one point i was kneeling only the floor for over 20 minuets playing with a massive electrical board making fine adjustments, another point i was hanging a latern on a hook to look over some notes, and its awesome. I wont say anything but that because the wow factor of just the inventory tutorial is enough for me to not spoil it. 
Also, i went in expecting little of the Voice Acting, but was plesently suprised. Humor is subtle and enjoyable, and the voices dont stick out as being particularly bad or unbelievable like some games (Sarentino VR).

Finally, This is by far the most immersed ive ever been in VR, and its the first time ive ever spent more then an hour in a single play session. Again, the issue comes with the price point. I'm not sure how many episodes are planned in this series, but if they are all priced as full games thats a little shady. By the time every episode is out id be happy to pay 60 for the full collection, but its likely to price in at more like 100+. 
In conculsion, if your tight on cash buy it on sale. Nothing about the gameplay of this game is lack-luster and its how vr is ment to be played. Not these repetivive wave shooters. I look foward to experience the story in the next episode, and ill write another review there when im done that you can check out if your considering buying the episode bundle like I did. If you have any questions add me and message me, ill be completely honest about any game ive played.

author: {'steamid': '76561198150725768', 'num_games_owned': 241, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 142, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 118, 'last_played': 1527199797}
review: This game is the perfect introduction to a grand adventure. [i]Call of the Starseed[/i] provides promise in these developers and their franchise; promise which they kept and evnetually delivered with the [i]Episode 2: Heart of the Emberstone[/i] and will surely deliver again with their upcomming episodes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198189596059', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 119, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 119, 'last_played': 1521002853}
review: A beautifully realized and engrossing game. As far as graphic quality, this game is definitely one of the best that I've encountered on VR. The game is creepy and cool and funny. The characters are engaging, and the mechanics easy to master. I can't wait for the second chapter!

author: {'steamid': '76561198795422038', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 112, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 96, 'last_played': 1523772651}
review:
This is a Myst style game done perfectly in VR. It's BY FAR the best experience I've had in VR so far, and BY FAR the best build of a game FOR VR. Every little detail is attended too. Just the right amount of stuff is interactable. I can't recommend this enough for people looking for a spooky adventure game into an unknown world with puzzles.

Just the interaction with the Backpack alone makes this game worth the experience. Every game should look to this one for inspiration. Can't wait to try the next installment.

Cheers to the team!!

author: {'steamid': '76561197967998805', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 317, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 221, 'last_played': 1556993496}
review:
Great VR experience! The controls are very simple, limiting at times but always simple. Blinking is done slightly different than in other titles but does not take long to learn. And gameplay elements such as the backpack and the various riddles are very nicely solved. Graphics is good and fluid.

The only issue I (still) have with this title is that it crashes from time to time. Reading through the forums shows that others have similar issues. In my case it always crashed in the same level and I finally fixed it by starting over. Not sure if it was the save or not but I managed to finish the game this way.

Highly recommended!

author: {'steamid': '76561198325261156', 'num_games_owned': 90, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 1100, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 703, 'last_played': 1543172845}
review:
The Gallery - Episode 1: Call of the Starseed is so far the best VR storygame I ever played.

It is a puzzle story game which has no action in it but the athmosphere of the game is great. Graphics are stunning and gameplay is very smooth. Soundtracks and voiceacting are also very neat. 

Achievement hunting is quite entertaining as well. 

The only thing which made me sad about this game was that I was able to finish it within 3 hours - pretty short but very well made.

I strongly recommend this game.

xTzharkz [Eric]

author: {'steamid': '76561197968004669', 'num_games_owned': 360, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 290, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 290, 'last_played': 1498966257}
review:
This game defined the potential for VR, for me, as a storytelling medium.

I have shown it to friends and family and they've all been blown away.

If you can play on your own and give this game a straight hour or just a bit more, you'll have a very compelling experience and you will probably feel that this might be what future VR movies will feel like.

This game reminds me of The Goonies meets Myst, but without such crazy hard puzzles.

It's also one of the few games that tries to tackle a "real" environment - this feels like a place within our reality rather that some other dimension. I loved that it really did something unique there, especially with all the other VR games that stay as far from a realistic setting as possible.

If VR games had an Academy Awards, this would win for Best Picture.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971524889', 'num_games_owned': 2425, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 249, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 249, 'last_played': 1498846026}
review:
Really immersive, one of the few games that supported full roomscale and motion controls on release.
But I am still waiting for that subtitles patch promised over a year ago.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993472726', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 289, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 187, 'last_played': 1636550579}
review:
A nice game with a decent story, fairly decent graphics, but way too short. I paid €8 for this on sale and I still felt it was too expensive for the 2½ hours of gameplay (being in no way in a hurry). But all-in-all I was entertained and is curious about where the story goes from here.

It's annoying though, that you can't get it to start in Oculus VR mode automatically. I have to use my mouse to right-click in Steam and select "Start in Oculus VR mode" from the menu.

Seeing that the followup is 4-5 hours of gameplay I'm definitely not going to buy that before the price comes down significantly...

author: {'steamid': '76561197970268522', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 112, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 112, 'last_played': 1519090625}
review: Way too short, puzzles too easy. Another reviewer said it best, I thought the game was just getting started but it wasn't, it ended. They want another $30 to keep playing..

author: {'steamid': '76561198327480737', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 29, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1518896108}
review: The game appears interesting, but I got immeidately stuck and had no idea what to do.  The game options are noticeably lacking.  The locomotion method of using your head is cumbersome and counter-intuitive compared with other games.  I could not tell where the game save option was.  I found casette tapes but the only player was in the beginning of the game and inaccessible from deeper levels from what I could find.  There is obviously some kind of method to this, but I couldn't find it.  Having a game this frustrating to play so early in, is not good design.
developer_response:
Hey Mystick, thanks for giving the game a go! You can change your teleportation settings in the options menu. It also auto-saves at checkpoints, so there is no manual save. 

You also have a casette player in your backpack, (remember you can pull it out at any time in a level by reaching over your shoulder and pressing the trigger) :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198065259078', 'num_games_owned': 109, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 122, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 122, 'last_played': 1497405156}

I'm probably gonna buy Episode 2.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998183742', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 141, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 141, 'last_played': 1517510538}

author: {'steamid': '76561197992190579', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 75, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 75, 'last_played': 1517274546}
review: A non-combat, story-driven puzzle game,  It's not a tremendously long game, but has really solid mechanics and good implementation. The only gripe (aside from length) that I have with this is that you can discover and listen to audio tapes which, if you try to listen to when discovered, are often talked over by scripted dialogue in the second half of the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198149623316', 'num_games_owned': 79, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 104, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 104, 'last_played': 1516576668}
review:
The game is too simple. The puzzles are too easy to solve and the game is too short. Probably a better choice for new VR players just to have a one time experience. 

There are a lot of dialogues where you can't move and have to listen to something that is not really helping in explaining the story. What's more annoying is at the last part when you put your hand into the thing, my controller starts to vibrate and it is vibrating throughout the dialogue that lasted about 10 min (prob not that long but it definitely feels like it since the controller is annoying you and you just want to skip). 

One thing that is a bit innovative is that when you move, by circling your finger on the touchpad, you actually can change the angel of view. This function makes it possible for me to just sit down on a chair throughout the game play without turning. Which, I don't know if in turn proved that this is an awfully boring game.

About the inventory items. You cannot put them down again after you picked the blue item up. You can only put them in to your backpack. I think the intuition for this setting is to not let players loose important items. But when you are holding one item you cannot do anything else with the controller you are using. For example, you cannot move when you have anything in your left hand.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993568822', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 203, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 203, 'last_played': 1516506844}
review: I quite enjoyed the experience here.  I like how this game handles walking out of bounds.  First the music/sounds quiet, then the screen darkens until it teleports you back within bounds.  I've experienced a few others, this was one of the best so far.  Ones that just bounce you back can be pretty nauseating.

author: {'steamid': '76561198232440356', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 145, 'playtime_forever': 120, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 120, 'last_played': 1515048028}
review:
Definitely one of the better games I've played in a while, particularly on VR. Would love to see more things like this come out for windows headsets. It has a Myst like atmosphere although is lighter on the puzzles (it runs like an interactive story with occasional puzzles): I found I ran into trouble occasionally when I overthought some sections thinking they were more puzzle like than they were (like the sewer) and there was one time I missed a clue and had to hunt around for it/the solution, but overall it was a lot of fun. 

The graphics are amazing and the voice acting is solid and fits the characters. The atmosphere in the magnetic field to blue danube was great, it really felt like I was there. I had to watch that I didn't hit the walls when tying to catch objects in other scenes as well, it's easy to forget it's not real. I found the blink movement fine to use, and the backpack system was great. I got this on sale and was definitely worth (more than) the price I paid for it. 

Pros: 
Beautiful immersive graphics and sound. 
Adequate tutorial to get you started. 
Liked the backpack as an inventory system.
Enjoyed the way the story is heading.
Plenty of bottles you can break lying around if at any time you're feeling frustrated. 

Cons: 
Only took me about 2 hours to play through. (Definitely not complaining about this as I got it on sale though.)
Limited replayablity (although I do plan to run through it again some time. It was fun enough that I'd like to see it again and have more of a look around some areas.)
I found the aiming of the flares frustrating and occasionally it was hard to pick up objects from the floor as they were lower than the floor of the real life room. 

Anyway really enjoyed this game, recommend you consider picking it up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119020132', 'num_games_owned': 243, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 24, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1512082203}
review: This is a really cool game... took me awhile to figure some stuff out though. ( I marked it as free because it came with my vive headset ).

author: {'steamid': '76561198098143668', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 132, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 132, 'last_played': 1489643567}
review: compelling story, fun application of VR in a mystery adventure game. I'm excited to play the other episodes.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984785481', 'num_games_owned': 414, 'num_reviews': 139, 'playtime_forever': 195, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 195, 'last_played': 1515961787}
review:
To make a long story short: Extremely epic atmosphere towards the end, but a very short gameplay. I'm someone who tries to find every secret, I look behind every corner and in every barrel in order to find something special. I made it through the game in about 3 hours. I guess it is possible to rush in maybe less than 20 minutes.

But... I WANT TO KNOW HOW IT'S GOING ON INE THE NEXT EPISODE! Damn cliffhanger...

author: {'steamid': '76561197971417681', 'num_games_owned': 578, 'num_reviews': 238, 'playtime_forever': 168, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 168, 'last_played': 1515872788}
review:
Although this is a puzlle game, the ammount of puzzle in it were disappointing,

Couple of minor ones near the begining and one bigger one near the end.

The last puzzle I really enjoyed and It left me wanting more, but sadly it ended all too soon. 

Textures were low in places despite settings on high.

The immersion worked well for the various locations.

I'm glad I didn't pay full price because this needed more puzzles.

Only giving it a thumbs up because there's no in-between button, I enjoyed being in the world, but it needs a lot more puzzles.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983238446', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 109, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 109, 'last_played': 1515367294}
review: The content in this game is extremely limited. This is a VERY short game. That said, what is here is of a high quality and quite interesting. Buy this game on sale for a short, fun VR experience - just don't expect too much from it. Don't pay full price for this game, it isn't worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047348073', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 543, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 235, 'last_played': 1610090106}
review: Great VR and Puzzle Game.  Addictive!  All my friends love the game too.  The puzzle isn't super hard where it gets frustrating, but also not too easy where you lose interest.  The perfect balance.  Plus the music is amazing too!

author: {'steamid': '76561198005607214', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 156, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 156, 'last_played': 1515193608}
