author: {'steamid': '76561198243446654', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 135, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 135, 'last_played': 1515120002}
review: The backpack mechanic worked well.  It felt like a modern day version of Must, especially with the teleportation movement.  I finished it in a couple of hours. I really liked the way they told the story through tape recorded messages. Music was good.  Get it on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987200278', 'num_games_owned': 445, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 141, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 141, 'last_played': 1514760769}
review:
When I bought my VR headset, I searched for games on steam that I could play. The Gallery looked cool, so I was excited to try it.
Unfortunately, it left me quite disappointed. Mainly because after playing it, I can't even call this "a game". "Demo of a game" is more fitting.

The Gallery part 1 can be completed in less than two hours of casual play. And most of this time player will spend waiting for an NPC to finish talking and open a path forward. What's worse - those dialogues have little to no substance to them. No real story will be told until Part 2.
There are total of three puzzles in the whole "game", but only one of them is truely interesting and requires observing your surroundings and items in order to solve it.
Other than that, the gameplay consists of wandering around, grabbing random junk and throwing it at something in order to entertain yourself, listening to audiotapes and reading pieces of paper lying around.
On top of that, The Gallery has some performance issues. My PC is powerful enough to run moden AAA games at high framerates, yet this game, apparently, is too much. Fortunately, there are multisampling options in-game, to fix stuttering in the most un-optimized areas.

Pros:
+Nice graphics.
+Good atmosphere.
+Good music.

Cons:
-Under 2 hours of casual gameplay.
-Only three puzzles in the entire game.
-Performance is not great at times.

I would ONLY recommend buying this on sale for 50-70% discount.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971460302', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 126, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 126, 'last_played': 1514947406}
review: Muy buen juego, demasiado corto y sencillo, pero es un capitulo inicial, si las graficas estan sencillas, la historia regular, las escenas hay unas que si aprovechan muy bien lo de VR, vale mucho la pena comprarlo si se compra con oferta,

author: {'steamid': '76561198121243641', 'num_games_owned': 2405, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 300, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 300, 'last_played': 1515132363}
review:
Just got my Vive last week and this is definitely my favorite VR experience so far! Highly recommended!

I completed the game in ~ 3 hours, including some time stuck on 2 of the puzzles along the way. Probably could (and will) spend another 1 ~ 2 hours knocking out some additional achievements. So it's short (which is a persistent feature across the current VR market), but that wasn't necessarily a bad thing for me. For the length, full price of $20 may be a little high, but I got it at 75% off on the Winter sale, and at $5 it was worth every penny.

The story is an enjoyable mystery/adventure, and it was also mildly frightening to me, at least at first when the plot direction was still unclear. Exploration reminded me of Firewatch or other "walking sim" games, while the backpack/tape recorder mechanic sort of reminded me of a survival horror game like The Last of Us. Basically, this game (and many other VR titles I've tried so far) provides a somewhat short/simple genre offering, generally a little worse than its established counterparts, but becomes immensely more enjoyable due to the incredibly immersive VR environment, movements, etc.

If you are a "serious" type of gamer, have played any of the titles I mentioned above, and/or own a VR headset, you should definitely play this game and I think you will really like it. I personally can't wait for Episode 2. I was waiting for a better sale, but I'm not sure if I can help myself. May just pull the trigger and get gaming again asap...

Thank you devs for this wonderful experience!

Enjoy!

author: {'steamid': '76561197977013240', 'num_games_owned': 550, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 159, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 159, 'last_played': 1514775673}

oh and an german localisation would be nice

author: {'steamid': '76561197995327062', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 115, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 115, 'last_played': 1514547140}
review: Good VR controls, good story, interesting environments. Recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960280220', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 99, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 99, 'last_played': 1514530057}
review: This game is pretty good and has some slick production values, but it was really short.  I beat it in an hour and 45 minutes and that includes a little while fooling around with settings to get the Oculus SDK version running correctly.  The puzzles that are in there are good, but there's really only like 4 puzzles.  A coded message puzzle, map/labyrinth puzzle, a spatial puzzle and a logic puzzle.  I got it for 3 bucks bundled with episode 2, so it was worth it for me, but I'd say anything above $5-7 is a bit much.

author: {'steamid': '76561198446464596', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 266, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 266, 'last_played': 1511693950}

author: {'steamid': '76561198116235908', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 98, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 98, 'last_played': 1514446510}
review:
This game is beautiful and the story is great. The puzzles are challenging enough to be entertaining and sometimes hard to solve (in a good way).

It only took me 1.6 hours to beat this game in my first run through, so don't expect a huge amount of content or anything.

Even still, I think it's totally worth it for the great story, immersion, great visuals (cool animations when traveling in last level) and challenging puzzles.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025889213', 'num_games_owned': 663, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 94, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 94, 'last_played': 1514416000}
review: i love it

author: {'steamid': '76561198026926832', 'num_games_owned': 1200, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 95, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 95, 'last_played': 1514326310}
review: I would defiantly recommend this, it is a VERY good-looking game and the mechanics, although there aren't very many, are good and well polished. It is defiantly a must play experience for VR if you have the money for it. Speaking of money, you do however need to consider if this is worth the price. I got this at a discount for only five euros and feel it was totally worth it, but the game is only about two hours long so if you buy it at £20 you would have payed around £10 per hour of playtime. However, this is extremely well spent time, in my opinion.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048031809', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 130, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 107, 'last_played': 1548460802}
review:
nice game, great looks but after i finished a big puzzle i thought the game was about to start. shit was going intense and i realy looked forward to the next puzzle but no..it ended. finished. in just under an hour! i played again to fool around to see if i missed anything. a fast gamer would finish the game in 45 minutes. buying on sale for $5 is nice but full price is a whaste! already bought episode 2 and hope it will be longer or else it would be a very expensive game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042933096', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 112, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 112, 'last_played': 1514136775}
review:
This is clearly a solid attempt at showcasing VR games, but it is just not very fun. The puzzle difficult is all over the place. Eventually I gave up 2 minutes before the end due to a game breaking bug in the last puzzle. 
I honestly had more fun horsing around in the Steam Home...
developer_response: Hey there Aaxnox, we're not aware of a game breaking bug with the last puzzle-- it would be great if you could bring it to our forums or submit a bug report so we could help determine if you resolve your issue!

author: {'steamid': '76561198034949604', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 83, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 83, 'last_played': 1513530526}
review:
This is one of the more... unique VR games. A story driven puzzle experience with an underlying set of secrets to discover and find out. 

It's a little buggy in places, but still extremely fun and you'll be wanting more.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960555050', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 148, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 148, 'last_played': 1509569075}
review:
The game is well made technically and graphically.
But it's way too short.
I got it for free with the Vive, but it still feels like a demo, since I finished it in less than 2 hours.
For 5€ on sales you should get it, but 20€ is a bit much.

If you like this kind of games, you absolutely should get [u]Obduction[/u] by the creator of Myst Riven Exile Uru.
Obduction is way way more impressive, with huge worlds, huge machinery, many things to solve, a lot of mistery.

author: {'steamid': '76561198388195171', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 95, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 95, 'last_played': 1512785921}
review: I couldn't believe how fast this game ended for the asking price. But on sale it is a great experience. Can't wait for the next episode to go on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042554095', 'num_games_owned': 459, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 75, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 75, 'last_played': 1513950383}
review:
One of the most athmospheric games I've ever played, and the story is very in-depth and really draws you into the mystery and makes you want to find out more. I love the inventory system and the puzzles that do require quite a bit of thought. Also the characters are very genuine feeling, although i would wish the player could interact with the in-game characters in some way, instead of never being able to approach them and having no dialog for the player

All in all it is one of the best games I've ever played, and I can't wait to play Ep. 2

author: {'steamid': '76561198056049121', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 181, 'playtime_forever': 131, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 131, 'last_played': 1513746315}
review:
So I found this adventure game immersive and amusing, and worth the $5 I paid, but no more. It lasts maybe 15 minutes lol. So yes, I like this game, but let us hope that the later episodes are beefier. I DO NOT recommend this game at a price more than 50% off. Just saying. The replay value is zero, unless you have an achievement erection, so it needs to be engaging and last. (The game, not the erection.)
I did start the second episode, and it seems almost a different game. Odd. But strangely satisfying.
Still, I recommend this overall, but it does seem rushed and cobbled together at times, with some story ideas and details just dropped in favor of chasing new ones. This seems to be a malady of a lot of VR games, though, as the genre is still so new, and the games have no idea what they want to be in tone or style. They are worse than M Night Shama-lama movies in those respects.

Anyway, if you like adventure without stuffiness, then try this game out. It's fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198132244318', 'num_games_owned': 1113, 'num_reviews': 114, 'playtime_forever': 197, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 197, 'last_played': 1513464820}
review: 3.5/5. Really well done game, however puzzles were very simple and the game was very short, i beilieve i finished the game to about 75% in 30 minutes and played for an additional 30 minutes to get most of the achievements. the additional time is me being afk, for 5 dollars it was 100% worth it and i enjoyed the experience. The implimentation of the backpack was very well done and i look forward to trying the next installment.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006690931', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 81, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 81, 'last_played': 1513913051}
review:
I usually dislike puzzle games, but I couldn't resist the Steam sale on this one.

I enjoyed it, it's definitely an hour to an hour and a half of game time depending on how well you do in puzzles, but they weren't too hard coming from someone who gives up pretty easily on most puzzle games.

The environments were well done and I liked the voice acting. There is a lot of interactable objects as well.

Overall, it was a fun experience and definitely immersive. It feels like your the center of a classic adventure kids movie.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003004915', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 215, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 215, 'last_played': 1513551189}
review: It's just flat out amazing.  It's the original VR game to have.  Even coming back to the game after a year, I am still in awe of how amazing it looks and plays.  The sequel is out now too, and it looks just as amazing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085347225', 'num_games_owned': 349, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 93, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 93, 'last_played': 1513461546}
review:
This game is way overhyped and not even worth the $5 that I got it on sale for.

Pros:
The game is atmospheric and immersive in some aspects.

Cons:
There is really only 3 "puzzles" which are basically just there to slow down your progression.  The nearly nonexistent story makes no sense and the characters have no depth.  The whole thing took about 90 mins to complete and I took my time (and I mean exploring every corner and examining/throwing every object).  Most of the game is spent sitting through boring cutscenes and simply walking from point A to point B.

I honestly have no idea why this game is rated as positively as it is.  Do yourself a favor and skip over this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977197408', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 101, 'playtime_forever': 154, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 154, 'last_played': 1513566016}
review:
Bon jeu, mais trop cher.
C'est vrai que la fin est magnifique et colle une belle claque, mais 20€ pour ça...
Par ailleurs, quelques gros points noirs: pas de traduction FR, alors que l'histoire semble être un gros atout du titre, et des archaïsmes dans le gameplay. Loin de nous faire oublier le chaperonne, le jeu nous en infllige un 2e, et on a l'impression de se déplacer avec toute sa pièce. Pour tuer l'immersion c'est assez efficace! Les commandes sont souvent approximatives, avec des objets qui nous échappent sans cesse, et un inventaire vraiment lourdingue à utiliser. 
Au final c'est beau, avec des puzzles sympas, mais court et pas vif, voire fastidieux, niveau gameplay. A acheter en soldes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025580826', 'num_games_owned': 461, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 78, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 78, 'last_played': 1513537020}
review: Got this on sale, was worth the $5 I paid for i, but I would not pay more than that for the game due to its short length. Besides the length, its an amazing time for VR and is the single best single player experience I have seen for VR. Worked well on my Rift, used the 2 camera roomscale and had no tracking problems that impacted gameplay. Overall I loved the story and gameplay and would give this game a 10/10 for its sale price, but if you had to pay full price its a 4/10. it just is not worth $20.

author: {'steamid': '76561198257293417', 'num_games_owned': 297, 'num_reviews': 125, 'playtime_forever': 113, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1595470812}
review:
Overall this was a good experience, and now that Heart of the Emberstone has actually come out I feel good promoting this as a series. $20 is a bit expensive for a game this short, but if you can pick it up on sale for around $10 then that's probably fair. 

Pros:
THERE ARE OTHER PEOPLE!!! - I don't know about any of you, but I have been getting excessivly lonely in VR games lately. There just aren't many out there that have other NPCs for your character to talk to and interact with (obviously not counting enemies or monsters that are all over the place but you're just supposed to shoot at them). Games like Twisted Arrow and The Deus Helix are currently some of my favorite VR titles because there was someone talking to me over a radio the whole game and it really helped the immersion and gave me a "friend" so I felt like I was a part of the world and not just a visitor. Call of the Starseed took this to the next level by letting the player actually get to see the other characters and interact with them face to face.
The Graphics - They are some of the best you'll see in VR right now
The Plot - For starters, there is one and I couldn't be happier about it. Even though it's clear that this game is really just setting things up for it to really get interesting in Heart of the Emberstone it's still nice to have a story and objective to follow.
The Sequel - There are several VR games that are being released episodically. However, many of these games release their first episode and then seem to never release the promised  second even if the first one is very well recieved (looking at you Vanishing Realms). Call of the Starseed certainly waited a while for it's follow up, but it has one now and from what I've read it's pretty amazing.

Cons:
The Loading/Checkpoint Screens - There aren't a lot of these throughout the game, but there are at least five and they are seriously immersion breaking. Especially for me because other than the planes directly in front of and behind me I just have dead white space above, below, and to my sides. I really wish these chechpoint screens could be taken out and the transitions between areas could be made much more smoothly, but considering how long this game has been out I doubt that is going to happen.
The Motion Controls -  I don't know why, but I had some serious issues with the blinking thing. I had to set the location to "point" instead of "look" immeadiately because I simply could not get to where I wanted to go through the "look" setting. Even with the pointing, the control was glitchy in my left hand and flat out would not work in my right hand. I kind of expected a lot more polish from a game that obviously had so much work put into it.

Amazing Experience, what all VR Games should be like, at the time of getting this I also got fo4 VR, and overall this was the better experience, it wasn't broken at all for me and had some challenging puzzles. author: {'steamid': '76561197960342180', 'num_games_owned': 276, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 220, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 220, 'last_played': 1513445277}
review:
One of the first VR games that were released around the time when the Vive came out on the market, and to this day I'd say it's also one of the best. It's a story-driven sci-fi / mystery that spans 1-2 hours in length depending on your personal pace. Borrowing from Valve's toolbox, a lot of the story and background can be found on various audio-casettes, papers, graffiti and signs that are littering the world.

The game has some dark (as in light) moments that requires the use of a flashlight, and an shadowy adversary(?) that appears in the end, but further it's not a scary game and IMHO completely suitable for ages as low as 12. The game contains no scares or violence of any kind.

Highly recommended!

author: {'steamid': '76561198054902179', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 311, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 311, 'last_played': 1513586774}
review:
Holy Cow this game was good!
This game is so highly polished, and the mechanics become so natural to play (even has different control schemes and plenty of other customizations).

I enjoyed every minutes of this game. The sound, the visuals, the controls are amazing. 
To be honest, the plot almost didn't matter anymore. 
It was more of a curiosity driven game ranther than a plot-driven game. I had fun picking everything up and it just felt so cool using my backpack. 

I can't wait to play Episode 2, and hopefully much more to come. I'm glad this game went on sale, or i wouln't have stumbled on this hidden gem (hopefully soon to not be so hidden, and well known).

author: {'steamid': '76561198396224689', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 341, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 341, 'last_played': 1513831662}

author: {'steamid': '76561197960455246', 'num_games_owned': 1528, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 100, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 100, 'last_played': 1511492914}

author: {'steamid': '76561198259429055', 'num_games_owned': 160, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 155, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 155, 'last_played': 1506139637}
review: This game was one of the first VR games I played and it blew me away.  The game is short but supper polished and extremely well done. It is worth playing just to get to the end scene which was a total shocker and really set the game up for the second episode. I highly suggest it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993331006', 'num_games_owned': 341, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 146, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 146, 'last_played': 1512355082}
review: A solid Myst-like experience for VR, with simpler puzzles and more expressive characters. Years from now, I think this will be remembered as the very first really good adventure game for VR.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981369663', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 205, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 173, 'last_played': 1550352857}
review: So freaking amazing!  I'm buying Episode 2 right now!!

author: {'steamid': '76561197970889439', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 217, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 130, 'last_played': 1514664774}
review:
Very well made. Graphics and setting/atmosphere are excellent. The story, is ok, in my opinion, and it is a rather short game (and yes, I know that it is episodic) for a normal pricepoint of $20. Yes, this is a VR game, and they usually are short, and was one of the originals around when the Vive came out, but asking a lot for minimal content (think of how much content you get from a game like Halo, even though it was a AAA game and sold way more, due to the exposure of such a well-known franchise...but when you total up even 4 episodes at a cost of even $20, that's $80 for a whole series, which I can't imagine would have as much content as a Halo game, which at launch are the typical $60. I know I'm also somewhat comparing apples to oranges here for game types, but I hope you get the context (content and length of play experience and story VS cost $$$). 

But yeah, I'm glad I got it, but at the price I got it...Steam sale for $5. and I feel that it is even good enough at around $10 to $15 per episode, depending on general length of each. 

Anyway, what this episode 1 lacks in overall content and length for a single episode, it makes up for in experience for VR.  It's a great way to feel the presence of the game, being in the game and interacting. I loved the section with the puzzle you had to "gather" and put in the vacuum tubes for voltage.  I won't say more, for anyone who hasn't played it, so they can have a bit of a cool surprise, but wow, that was something else.   

I do look forward to trying the next episode, but at a discout as well.  Again, $10 or upwards of $15 for the next episode is doable, for me (even as it's said to be longer than episode 1).  I am glad for the devs to have had such success though, as it is another title to give more longevity to the VR market, which is still a niche market, but growing and evolving steadily.  Cool stuff is here, and will continue to come around, again, due to great experiences like this one. 

My opinions on price are based on a fairly tight budget, so for many others, the price is not an issue, and I would recommend anyone not as worried about price to just dive in and get the experience on!

author: {'steamid': '76561198041070607', 'num_games_owned': 605, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 124, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 124, 'last_played': 1512009572}
review: Game looks very good and has neat tech that should be standards. However, it is very short, and I'm not a huge fan of the Blink teleporting, but this game was made early on so I'll forgive for that. Worth $5 but not much more than that now.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009401952', 'num_games_owned': 560, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 71, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 71, 'last_played': 1511897050}
review:
Beautiful but short and far too expensive.

They want £15 for episode 1 alone which took 1:15hr to complete and consisted of 3 logic puzzles. Good puzzles, great environments and a nice taster of a story but not worth what will likely equate to £80 for 5 hours gameplay.

Wait till all episodes are released and buy it when its in the steam sales. Worth £20 for those 5 hours i'd say.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019698116', 'num_games_owned': 205, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 104, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 104, 'last_played': 1466854256}
review: Absolute best VR story so far. A must play. I can't wait to pick up part 2.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011944883', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 316, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 316, 'last_played': 1468285250}
review: This game was my first totally engrossing VR experience. Gives a great representation of what VR should be. If you have a headset I would 100% recommend the purchase. Just remember to pick your jaw off the floor when you are done.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963772125', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 310, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 310, 'last_played': 1511736689}
review: This has to be one of the better VR adventure titles available.  While episode one is rather short, the puzzles are straight forward and fit with the story line.  The graphics, storyline, music are all top notch.  Movement is via “blink” which some may complain, but with the ability to set orientation  makes it acceptable.  Moving on to Episode 2 which continues the story with great anticipation.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032192961', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 158, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 158, 'last_played': 1511731231}
review: I don't have a huge amount of time in VR. Infact I have own my vive for just a few days. The price was 600, and the investment in a new computer and a new monitor (because why not?) cost me around 4 grand. While the vive alone is an incredible product that has proven itself worth the investment, this game is the pinnacle of what I wanted from the vive. A game that is so imersive, so beatiful that you just get lost in it. I almost cried at the end of this game because it took me so far from the realm of reality. Incredible game, not your typical shooter action packed thing, but a new and different reality with a story. Absolutley incredible.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016172723', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 70, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 70, 'last_played': 1479866748}
review: Very short but it is still one of the best ways to showcase why VR is amazing.  A beautiful world to explore and the game does a great job of creating the feeling that you're actually there in this place.  Don't be disappointed if you only get 2 hours of gameplay though.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008067028', 'num_games_owned': 914, 'num_reviews': 239, 'playtime_forever': 108, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 108, 'last_played': 1511700437}
review:
Nette VR Adventure Spielerei, mit ansprechender Grafik. Für mich war die Story allerdings deutlich zu langweilig und habe im Endeffekt auch keine Lust mehr Episode 2 zuspielen. Schade, ich kann nicht genau mit dem Finger drauf zeigen, woran es genau liegt.

Leider ist das Spiel nach guten 80 Minuten auch durch. Alle, der wenigen Rätsel, bis auf eines sind relativ gut und schnell zu lösen.

Für 20€ ist dieses Spiel aber deutlich leider zu teuer für mein Geschmack. Daher keine Empfehlung.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015229121', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 123, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 121, 'last_played': 1581857332}
review: This is a very nice looking game, very polished and very atmospheric. However, it has terrible value for money. Episode 1 is just under 2 hours long and just includes a couple of (admitedly clever) puzzles. Don't get me wrong, I think it's a fantastic VR experience and it's doing everything right, except the pricing. If the trend continues, by Ep 3 you would have paid more than for a AAA title but for far less content.
developer_response: Hey Shader. Happy you enjoyed the game. Just wanted to clarify that Episode 2 generally takes players 2-3 times longer than Episode 1-- it's more of a sequel than your traditional episodic. On top of that, we do offer discounted prices to owners of previous episodes via the "Complete the Bundle" option on Steam!

author: {'steamid': '76561197972384272', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 142, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 142, 'last_played': 1493257608}
review:
Un jeu idéal pour la VR, qui vous plongera dans un monde fantastique, avec une très bonne qualité graphique pour un jeu VR.

Seule ombre au tableau, l'absence de sous-titres alors que le jeu est intégralement en VO.

Le jeu est un peu court, mais la sortie récente de l'épisode 2 compense un peu sa faible durée de vie.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013377777', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 155, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 155, 'last_played': 1511639912}
review:
This is really a must play game if you have a VR headset. It's one of the few made-for-VR, story-driven, singleplayer games out there.
If you've just bought a VR headset I'd advise this be one of the first games you play, because it's really going to stand out from all the arcade-style games out there. It's well polished, great soundtrack and voice acting, nice puzzles and is the start of what looks like will be great story for the whole series of games.

I really like the whole magical/fantasy adventure feel of the game and I think it fits well with the VR experience, particulary if you're new to VR.

Having said all that, I only got around 2.5 hours gameplay out of the game, including spending some time picking up achievements, which I'm not criticising given the game was released in mid-2016. However, if you're thinking of getting the game beyond 2017, definitely pick it up in a sale. It's currently very cheap and in a bundle with Episode 2: Heart of the Emberstone, so I'm guessing it'll be easy to pick up cheap from now on.

As for me, on to Episode 2...!

author: {'steamid': '76561198049208175', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 100, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 39, 'last_played': 1601871741}
review: Enjoyed the "game" but I took my sweet time and there was less than an hour game play? When I bought it I had been under the impression that you would recieve part 2 and so on when they were released. Turns out.. no.. you have to pay another $20. So in the end you will pay $40 or maybe $60+ for under 2-3h of game time. Not worth it at all
developer_response: Hey Vennomm, glad you enjoyed the experience! Just wanted to clarify that Episode 2 is a markedly bigger experience, generally ranging between 3-5 hours playtime itself. It's really more of a sequel than your traditional episodic game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025346865', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 83, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 83, 'last_played': 1484748735}
review: Possibly one of the best VR games i have played, with an interesting storyline that makes you want to play more. Bring on episode 2

author: {'steamid': '76561197967594380', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 110, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 110, 'last_played': 1511564285}
review:
Awsome game and story, fantastic show case for VR to boot. I got goose bumps at the end and had a 'My god it's full of stars' moment at the end which was a fantastic feeling. Very well executed. I hope the 2nd episode is just as good. 

More please! :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198016334652', 'num_games_owned': 747, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 173, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 173, 'last_played': 1492367179}
review: An amazing an exhilirating experience!

author: {'steamid': '76561197972737301', 'num_games_owned': 604, 'num_reviews': 95, 'playtime_forever': 172, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 131, 'last_played': 1527382086}
review:
If you're looking for a game to test out your room-scale VR and also to showcase what VR can do as far as a medium of gaming without leaving a puddle of urine on the floor, this is what you're looking for. There's tension occasionally with the well executed Sci-Fi, but the developers were not going for horror, and I can say it doesn't stray into that genre. Rather we have a linear game that honestly feels like you're somewhere else. The kinetic controls and inventory are just right. I found myself jumping into a ceiling fan to catch something I needed because I was so transported by the game and the technology, and since it's on sale right now for $5, just get it if you have a Vive. Just. Get. It.

The unskippable credits were kind of a drag though, since you're stationary for once, and they just fly at you, I had to sit on the floor because it was a bit disorienting.

author: {'steamid': '76561198326940328', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 709, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 596, 'last_played': 1586022015}
review: Quite likely the most immersive thing in VR to date.  Puzzles are great, art is incredible.  The feeling of being in a real place is second to none!  That ending....shivers up the spine.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980327677', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 596, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 596, 'last_played': 1511523539}
review: Great music, great atmosphere. Could be longer but what it does it does very well. One of the earlier games I played and it is a game I compare other VR games to in order to determine if they were good. Excellent immersion to the point where I took my controller out of my (real) hand before reaching into the water (in game) because I didn't want to submerge the controller!

author: {'steamid': '76561198026420021', 'num_games_owned': 128, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 203, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 203, 'last_played': 1510434917}

author: {'steamid': '76561198027647796', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 222, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 222, 'last_played': 1510645209}
review:
URL Review - http://www.htcvivegamereviews.com/all-review-list/starseed-review/

FULL Let's Play - http://www.htcvivegamereviews.com/all-video-list/gallery-episode-1-call-starseed-full-game-edited/

7/10

I have a fond place in my heart for The Gallery – Episode 1 : Call of the Starseed. It is one of the first VR games I played and likely the first game I completed that had any sort of length to it. I recently revisited the game to see how nostalgia holds up before I think about delving into Episode 2.

Let’s start with the goods – Visually, the game is one of the best. I love the music, especially the “bumper music” in between levels and loading screens with the dialogue. The backpack system/inventory is perfectly done and a lesson all games should consider. Puzzles are very fair and don’t involve messing around trying to figure out a “eureka moment” as much as other puzzlers, such as the escape room games. It may be potentially too easy for the parts of the game but when you get stumped – expect to chew up time trying to figure out what is next. I’m fairly sure the last puzzle consumed 80% of my playtime – EVEN when playing through again(idiot mistake second time.)

There was a lot of effort put into a narrative by the game developer and it is noticed. There is writing on walls, notes and cassette tapes that attempt to flesh out “what’s going on” besides the character you meet. In a way, this game plays more like a narrative than an actual puzzle/game but the puzzles can still make you think.

Some of the negatives/mixed perspectives – The first time I played this game – I actually felt fairly creeped out and still was motion sick but after having my “VR feet” now, I kind of wish they had a slide movement option rather than teleport. The teleport feels slightly delayed when you move compared to a lot of games I played. I felt I’d “blink” and then take a breath before the next scene loaded. It’s not nearly as bad as something like Perfect‘s movement but I am hoping in the next game it feels a little more fluid.

End of the line is – you probably won’t play this more than once unless you’re like me – re firing it up to get used to the story before possibly buying the next game installment. Knowing the puzzles definitely can decrease your playtime dramatically and choosing to ignore the narratives can cut it down to a fairly lean, short game. The visuals and music are always welcome but at a point, it’s more like watching a movie when you’ve “cracked the code”. As I write this, the game is $19.99 which you’d have to dramatically LOVE this game/genre or have multiple family members who may play through it rather than just a single playthrough. Personally for the price, I’d prefer other genres but if you’re more of a player who prefers Myst style games and narrative heavy – this might be for you.

The Good
Backpack
Music
Visuals
The Bad
Slow movement when teleporting
Limited movement options
Very short game

author: {'steamid': '76561198012043263', 'num_games_owned': 901, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 143, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 143, 'last_played': 1510594383}
review:
The Gallery - Episode 1: Call of the Starseed is an excellent emmersive adventure and it's easy to recommend.

However. It's very short. There's only a couple of levels and it took me just over 2 hours to complete. So you'll have to decide how much you are prepared to pay for that.

Even though I enjoyed the game, I'll only buy the second one if it's heavily discounted. It's just too short for how much it costs.

This game has so much potential if only there were more of it. The graphics are great and you can pick up and use all kinds of things. It has an interesting story and it's one of the most immersive experiences I've had in VR. It just needs more content.

Oh and just a heads up, the achievements didn't work for me on an Oculus Rift.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972609948', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 86, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 86, 'last_played': 1506184214}
review: Really good puzzle adventure game.  As of late 2017, its still the best one on the market excluding its sequel.  As long as you're not a complete sociopath, this game will give you feelings.  The antagonist succesfully irritated and unnerved me and I started getting invested as me as the character.  Extremely well done vr game and game game, all around.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971027540', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 307, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 149, 'last_played': 1542122042}
review:
I really enjoyed this and i recommend this for a first game into VR. (Along with the excellet "The lab" of course)

This game plays similar to old point and click adventures such as Myst. The visuals are excellent and it is great to explore, However VR is what makes this game shine the most as there is nothing complex here. There are only a few puzzles which are very simple and this game is very short, too short for the cost asked which is a shame. Having said that I really enjoyed the story and was left wanting more. 

Im glad I purchased this game (bought as a set with the second part) but I only recommend this game if its on sale due to the length.
 
I am now going to start the second part. the videos look great and hopefully is fleshed out a bit. PLease make more :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198047159181', 'num_games_owned': 280, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 149, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 96, 'last_played': 1483520407}
review:
I cannot recomend this game for the price of $20, at that price this game is actually nothing more than just a cash grab.

Since I got this game for free, everything past this is my review for a FREE game.

Pros:

Immersive, it grabs your attention and makes you care about the story it tells.

Great gameplay and ideas for gameplay.

Cons:

Disrespectfully short. 

Zero ability to replay

Short.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966819278', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 149, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 74, 'last_played': 1595511163}
review: Not very long, only about 1.5hrs, but enjoyable.  Glad I got it on sale for that length, but it was a fun experience.  Not much in terms of gameplay, but a very good ride.  Interesting story and characters, with a lot of really good visuals, voice acting, and sound design.  Definitely going to consider getting the next episode just to see what happens with the story development.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035202032', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 136, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 136, 'last_played': 1509765828}
review:
Where to begin. At first I thought it was your bog standard adventure game but then it got lost in it and it felt like I was in my own movie by the end of part 1. I haven't bought the 2nd part, yet.  Definately will though.

Play time was 2hrs which was about right as my legs are getting tired. lol

author: {'steamid': '76561197994188263', 'num_games_owned': 1619, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 89, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 89, 'last_played': 1509376482}
review:
[h1]Like a setup for a movie. It's very short, but with the other chapters maybe worthwhile. A promising start but by itself not recommending it. Get it only with the other chapters. First one is very short.[/h1] 

[h1]Good sides:[/h1]
- A very good VR starter game, shows what VR movies could be,
- Good voice acting,
- Story has potential, chapter ended promisingly,

[h1]Weaker sides:[/h1]
- Alone, the game is short and without much gameplay,
- Only 1 truly worthwhile puzzle,
- Could be prettier to look at,
- Felt the silent protagonist unfitting (my opinion).

Overall, a promising prequel of an interesting story. But alone I can't personally recommend it. If you plan on buying it, do that with more chapters out, preferrably as a bundle.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006448894', 'num_games_owned': 310, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 152, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 152, 'last_played': 1477880821}
review: Immersive, atmospheric, tense and suspenseful in a subtle way I appreciate. This is an adventure game for VR, a great one, though it does feel like it is just the beginning. I enjoyed the puzzles very much, though they weren't over the top challenging, I was intrigued by the story and the enviornment the whole way through, and I really enjoyed the surprises the game offers. This game is really great, and I think it is under rated in the VR community.

author: {'steamid': '76561198394802749', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 104, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 104, 'last_played': 1508619311}
review: A good way to spend a couple of hours in VR.  Nice visuals, cool plot and decent puzzles... Nothing too challenging.

author: {'steamid': '76561198393832440', 'num_games_owned': 53, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 481, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 204, 'last_played': 1553882251}
review: The Gallery is an immersive adventure game with amazing controls and a huge, interactive world. The game only takes a few hours at most to get through, so $19.99 is a high price, but it’s still an interesting game and definitely worth buying if it’s on sale. Go Tarheels! @House Undergraduate Library

author: {'steamid': '76561197973878558', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 227, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 227, 'last_played': 1509065392}
review: Played this again for a refresher before playing Episode II.  Still an amazing game.  The environments and interaction are what really make it great.  Instead of just interacting with the world by shooting, you interact in a more varied and life-like way... throwing, looking at maps, lighting things on fire, plugging things in, etc.  I didn't like puzzle adventure games until VR came along.  Now I love them!

author: {'steamid': '76561197971672045', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 96, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 96, 'last_played': 1507135875}
review: Very short with nothing in it other than following a line with one puzzel that makes no sense and one that does and thats it the rest of the time your just watching not worth the money unless its on sale for under £5.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991262689', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 119, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 119, 'last_played': 1508692836}
review:
An sich sehr gut, aber viel zu kurz !
Auch im Sale für knapp 10Euro kein Schnäppchen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067038041', 'num_games_owned': 4188, 'num_reviews': 221, 'playtime_forever': 89, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 89, 'last_played': 1508640602}
review: Very nice VR experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198144974649', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 213, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 213, 'last_played': 1508615665}
review:
I shot roman candles on the beach with a campfire and music...then I grabbed the radio and headed down the beach to my tent, laid down on my back on a sleeping bag, and listened to tunes while gazing at the stars and night sky through a tear hole in the tent roof. 

10/10 screw gameplay I'm chillin like a mf.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993048791', 'num_games_owned': 368, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 109, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 109, 'last_played': 1504916523}
review:
Great game with solid animations, voice activing and story. World interation is intuitive and satisfying. 

I assumed buying the first released episode about a month ago, I didn't realise how long it is between episode releases. Now seeing that it is an aditional $30 for episode 2 on top of what I have paid. Usually an episodic game gives you the option to buy 1 episode or the full game. Seeing as there wasn't a section option of a full game, I assumed that is exactly what I was receiving for $35.

Saying all that, having to pay an additional $30 for episode 2, makes me wonder how much will this game cost by the time all episodes are released.

I would expect this from a EA, WB or Activision...not from an indie dev.

Sorry you've lost me on any further purchases. Getting a refund

author: {'steamid': '76561198010860327', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 128, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 128, 'last_played': 1507265101}
review: Good game, great ending, a must have for VR. Buy the second one, it's even better!

author: {'steamid': '76561198424767973', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 143, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 143, 'last_played': 1508183404}
review:
Grafisch ein Leckerbissen gibt es Abzüge in der B-Note:

-Schwache Rätsel der ersten Generation, schade bei so einem detailreichen Spiel. (FORM z. B. zeigt wie es geht.)
-Gutes Inventorymenü, nur braucht man die Dinge die man sammelt nicht mehr.
-Story wirft viele Fragen auf, die nicht beantwortet werden. Das Spiel endet einfach mit dem Hinweis: Weiter in Teil 2

Wer nicht alle Teile kaufen will, der brauch diesen hier auch nicht. Als Einzeltitel leider nur viel Rauch um "Nichts".

author: {'steamid': '76561198309690316', 'num_games_owned': 70, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 553, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 553, 'last_played': 1505954624}
review: This game was one of the first VR games I played. I must say, when I first played Call of The Starseed (over a year ago now) I was absolutly blown away! The first thing I noticed was how well done the voice acting was for a game like this. The second was the graphics. Absolutly amazing! I don't know what people who give this game a thumbs down are thinking. I want to say thank you for such an awesome experience and I can't wait for Episode 2!

author: {'steamid': '76561197975387329', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 215, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 155, 'last_played': 1525313490}
review: Too little content for the price. It is very short and lacking in gameplay. After seeing all the positive hype, my faith in reviews has been shaken. I won't make the same mistake with Episode 2.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031564332', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 249, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 249, 'last_played': 1479287644}
review:
I received this as part of the bundle that came with my HTC Vive. I love the concept of this game, world is immersive and feels really deep. Story is pretty good but there is only 2-3 hours of actual game play, but even that's being generous because I wandered around and looked at everything.

All of the assests are really well developed and behave exactly how I would expect them to in real life. This is less of a game and more of a holo-novel. On the whole, it's an experience much better than a night at the theatre but at a comparable price.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997034862', 'num_games_owned': 130, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 99, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 99, 'last_played': 1507675288}
review: This game is exactly what VR was made for. Story driven, atmospheric, surprising, beautiful and compelling. The puzzles aren't super difficult, but it doesn't matter because all you want is to know what happens next. This is only episode one, but it plays almost like a prologue to a larger story, one that I can't wait to experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966741825', 'num_games_owned': 466, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 75, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 75, 'last_played': 1507491425}
review:
Pros: 
Great graphics and visual effects, 
fantastic voice acting, 
interesting storyline.

Cons: 
1 hour of gameplay for 20 dollars (I have 1.3 hours but ate lunch while the game was loaded), 
objects clipping through each other or disappearing, 
I think there was 3 puzzles and only 1 made me feel happy by solving it (the first one), 
character talks while you are listening to tapes.

If you find the game on sale for 9.99 or lower then go for it, but I seriously thought I just finished the tutorial when the credits started rolling. It's interesting how all of the top reviews have 5+ hours of playtime. I won't refund, but I am definitely not buying the next one until it's about 7.99 and seeing how Chapter 1 has been out for a year and is still 20 dollars? I'll probably never get to play it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970405629', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 141, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 141, 'last_played': 1507470420}
review: Es ist ganz nett. Es biete eine tolle Atmosphäre und gute, wenn auch zu einfache,  Rätsel. Im Angebot für 9,99 € hat es eine akzeptable Länge von ca. 2 h. Für 19,99 fände ich das Spiel allerdings zu kurz. Ich hoffe der zweite Teil wartet mit schwierigeren Rätseln auf.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964210206', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 166, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 111, 'last_played': 1510428571}
review: Beaucoup trop court mais la VR rend la fin juste magique : vivement la suite.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056602470', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 96, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 96, 'last_played': 1506809685}
review:
This is one of the games you use for show off when you have visitors who test a VR headset for the first time: The graphics are nice, the beach with the small interactions (eg popcorn over the fire) quite cool and the atmosphere promising.

Yet I give a thumbs down for that game, after playing for only 1.5 hours. 

Why? 

Well, this is the play time until you reach the end of the game. That is 10 bucks (originally 20) for 90 minutes of sightseeing, therefore I can not recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993474789', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 6, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3, 'last_played': 1507242500}
review:
The voice acting is good, particularly Heather Green's performance. But the story is bland, there are no interesting gameplay mechanics and the game has little character or personality.

I appreciate the Rift support, but when trying to aim objects the rotation is off for the touch controllers.

I like the collectable tapes, you can't really hear them over the looping dialogue from the old guy though.

Hopefully episode 2 will be much better.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079438426', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 70, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 70, 'last_played': 1507234034}
review:
I got this game for free with my vive and I would not recommend this at all. Especially not for 20 dollars.

The first issue I had in this game was, that the sign that tells you what to do with the flashlight got bugged. It didn't tell me I had a backpack and that I had to put the flashlight in there. I restarted it and then it worked properly.

The second issue was that I got stuck on the first puzzle because I found the solution to be too hard to execute. I did look it up on youtube. I guess this is just my own stupidity, but a little bit more feedback on this from the game would have helped immensely.

To top it all off, the ending glitched and instead of showing the final cutscene I got stuck on a black screen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198350812242', 'num_games_owned': 115, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 175, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 100, 'last_played': 1552057517}
review: когда будет руссификация?

author: {'steamid': '76561198061375604', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 93, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 93, 'last_played': 1507135186}
review:
A very polished experience but I cannot recommend it due to the obvious greed of Cloudhead Games.
20$ for a 1,5h walking simulator with 1,5 riddles is just obnoxious.
Even for the 10$ in the sale it's still way overpriced but I thought maybe the next one will have some discount and overall it will be worth the money.
WRONG! The second episode is going to cost 30$ with 10% discount.
So, all 4 episodes are probably going to come to around 100$.
EA would be proud...
Do yourself a favor and rather buy Raw Data or Arizona Sunshine.
Their devs at least give you some content for the money and don't try to rip you off.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999023529', 'num_games_owned': 767, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 71, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 71, 'last_played': 1507152544}
review:
It was good. I got it for about $5 on sale and it was worth that. Too short, and kind of a tease. But I really enjoy the time that I had playing! 
I sure hope that the next game is a lot longer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198186879938', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 38, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38, 'last_played': 1500372518}
review:
Voll Geil das Beste VR Spiel das ich bis her gespeilt habe.
Freue mich auf Teil 2

author: {'steamid': '76561198043858196', 'num_games_owned': 414, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 109, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 93, 'last_played': 1521335401}
review: I thought this was a game I could skip on my VR wish list. I WAS WRONG! If you value story music and atmosphere this is the game for you, first VR game to give me goosebumps and get me invested in the story. The Next EP comes out the 17th of this month so get it sooN!

author: {'steamid': '76561198089918857', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 134, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 120, 'last_played': 1585990997}
review:
Very good game and its a shame its so short, First part had a feel of halflife to it which is a good thing. Willl be getting part 2 when it comes out on the 18th! and i hope that one is alot longer.

Also, very smooth game play with good quality graphics, very well made in terms of moving about, no real glitches etc

author: {'steamid': '76561197994730659', 'num_games_owned': 572, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 91, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 91, 'last_played': 1506742087}
review:
The puzzles show lots of potential, the graphics are nice and the interactability of the world is excellent.

Episode one was short, but the story setup grabbed me and I am now waiting with bated breath for the second.

Cheers for great VR content to come!

author: {'steamid': '76561197998048706', 'num_games_owned': 183, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 169, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 138, 'last_played': 1508572086}
review: This game is fun, great eye candy - especially as you approach the end. However, I'm giving it a negative because it's too short for the price. I'm still going to get episode 2 when it comes out, as the story is good. I hope part 2 is longer though.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032651335', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 82, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1506667369}
review:
I cannot recomend this game at the price listed.  If you're curious then wait for a heavy discount.  I'm thinking 80%.  The story doesn't become compelling until the very end and as an episodic game there is not enough story for the first episode.

The puzzles are extreamly simplistic.  This wouldn't bother me if there was any challenge at all in this game.  In fact the only thing this game will test is your patience when moving.  The movement controls hold your hand way to much.  It takes ages to get anywhere in game world.  I'd like the opption for locomotiv controls.  Yes I know that they make most people sick but a large number of people do just fine in them.

I'm sure the develpers are nice people and I wish them the best but this effort leaves a lot to be desired.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072350122', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 189, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 189, 'last_played': 1506640893}
review: Buying and trying an awful lot of VR games and experience at the moment and this one is in the top 5. Combines decent grapical experience, a sense of adventure, a (potentially, it's the first episode after all) good storyline, some puzzle interest all in a fully immersive way with no locomotion issues (an option to loose the chaperone would be good). Looking forward to ep 2 in October.

author: {'steamid': '76561198254052268', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 296, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 163, 'last_played': 1509741229}
review: Amazing

author: {'steamid': '76561198093601128', 'num_games_owned': 179, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 320, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 320, 'last_played': 1506547494}
review:
Best looking VR game, graphically to date I have played; surprising given it's not the latest.

Controls a little strange at first but got used to them. Has the usual adventure game quirks and the beginning was a lot more challenging than the rest of the game.

Sure I read somewhere that each episode would be self-contained but clear at the end, this is the first part of a much wider story.

Look forward to playing the next instalment.

author: {'steamid': '76561198368742721', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 219, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 215, 'last_played': 1536516136}
review: Totally gonna buy the second episode.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970400192', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 100, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 100, 'last_played': 1506284514}
review:
OMG what a game,just an amazing experience.
As you can tell i loved the game.
I bought it when it was 50% off,for 9,99.
It is not very long,somewhere about 1 1/2 and 2 hours.
Longer if you want to get all the achievements.
The ending of this game is just......WOW.
Sound is fantastic and the graphics are also very good for an VR game.
Can not wait for Episode 2.
Lovin it ...lovin it.

review: Very poor technical execution, not very compeling, terrible cliffhanger. Also fairly short.

review: Got this on sale ,starts to get interesting then ,,its over ,,,to short for me ,everything else ok ,,solar project is 10 x longer if second part is same price and just as short it no but for now

author: {'steamid': '76561197995418122', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 391, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 391, 'last_played': 1475448125}
review: This game is the reason why the Vive and VR was invented. So immersive, by far one of the must have for any VR system. Can't wait to see what episode 2 brings.

author: {'steamid': '76561198170830398', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 493, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 394, 'last_played': 1530378630}
review:
I purchased this at full price and left a negative review due to the short length of the game.  At that time I refunded the game as I didn't think the small amount of gameplay represented the price.

I received a warning from Steam regarding abuse of the refund process, which I would dispute if I could as I thought this was the purpose of the refund process.  I think their logic was that I had finished the game, but my logic was that I shouldn't have been able to finish a game in that time at that price point...

I've since seen the game heavily discounted, played it again to completion and not felt butt-hurt by the price, so a positive review this time.

There's a lot of atmosphere and it feels quite epic at the end.  Looking forward to episode 2 when it's discounted.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989590693', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 246, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 193, 'last_played': 1510075642}
review:
Well, I've tried plenty of demos and things in VR, but this is the first experience that really blew my mind. I mean, I literally dropped my jaw at one point. 
Technicaly, it's wonderful. Everything is so well thought through, all the little details and mechanics are just right - natural and logical. It's wonderful to explore the beach, finding objects and playing with them. The story is interesting and locations beautiful. 

VR could be the thing that brings back adventure games in big style - it's just perfect fit, as this game demonstrates.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067824795', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 114, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 114, 'last_played': 1482982293}
review: Once you make it past the opening area... This game is great. Story was fun to follow and the immersion just grabs you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198247691348', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 390, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 92, 'last_played': 1514799931}
review:
WOW! This is why I bought a Vive! Full Immersion into a great story.

I would highly recommend this game to anyone who values the art of the medium that is video games. Is it a game where you shoot people's heads off and blow up building for hours? No. But the Gallery is incredibly well crafted, thought through, and engaging by its own merit. 

More than any other vr game thus far, I was struck with mystery and wonder. 

A must have for you VR library. 

As far as the negative views because of the price: please remember that these guys aren't billion dollar production companies. Yes, the original price of $30 was pretty steep but I doubt these guys are pricing it that way just to screw us over or be greedy. They spent countless hours with a small team of creators  (not a hundred of hired hands) and created something beautiful for us to enjoy. I don't think it's unreasonable to want something back for that effort (so that they can keep working on more products!). You won't find a good painting being sold for less than a $100, so why not support these artists with $30? I'm just so tired of people complaining about artist's high prices because they are comparing those prices to mass production goods. They can't compete with those prices! This is why good artists starve while we complain about "nothing good/original coming out." Invest in what you want to see more of. That's the only way they are going to be able to keep making good products.

Ok, rant over. 

Good work guys!

author: {'steamid': '76561198036894971', 'num_games_owned': 726, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 99, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 91, 'last_played': 1506491726}
review: Wow. Great environments throughout the game. The story was a bit odd, but by the end you feel quite engrossed. Really, by the end you are in awe. Can't wait for the sequel later this month!

author: {'steamid': '76561198000680012', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 55, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 55, 'last_played': 1505941120}

Like many VR games its waaaaay to short even for 10 bucks. 
Story is just meeeehh, it doesnt take real advantage of the VR possibilities.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971202571', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 192, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 192, 'last_played': 1505924939}
review: Awesome

author: {'steamid': '76561197970329288', 'num_games_owned': 2788, 'num_reviews': 1451, 'playtime_forever': 29, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1504864688}
review:
VR | GTX 1060 (6GB) Gameplay (With Commentary) :
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1WAtOlOVJIc

My Thoughts:
Fantastic visuals and stunning VR locations greet you in this mysterious first person adventure, full of awe and mystery. Puzzle are logical and really satisfying to solve. I'm eagerly waitng episode 2. Watch my 1st Impressions video above for a full review!

Game Details:
Your missing sister, an ancient machine, and a sinister presence await in this first chapter of The Gallery, the groundbreaking built-for-VR adventure series inspired by dark 80’s fantasy films. Join the VR adventure, and answer the Call of the Starseed.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963386845', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 360, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 314, 'last_played': 1508683894}
review:
Just an an amazing, polished game. I'm 47 and got goosebumps playing this. I've been waiting 20 years for this game. This is what VR should be like. How the hell these guys set such a high benchmarks on what was really an emerging system is incredible. The story, acting, graphics, sound scape, immersion are outstanding. The in-game user interface, the backpack system all so clever and well thought out. Everything works. It's easy to get stuck on the beach but really after you solve it you see it was pretty simple. I just love everything about this game, it is short but it is so high on quality I don't really care. I hope Valve have their eyes on these guys for HL3 VR. Becuase you can easily see how they could pull that off after this work. I'm just glad I only just got it, I have a short wait for chapter 2!

Thanks Couldhead for fullfilling my teenage dreams of future tech.

Get it! Get it now!

author: {'steamid': '76561197979208588', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 222, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 222, 'last_played': 1504573557}
review: I'm very new to the VR.  I played a couple of sit still and shoot some bows, then let it my Vive sit in a closet for a year.  Just pulled it out to see what new things are happening and found this short game.   Holy cow.  I was blown away.  The blinking movement took a second to get used to reorienting what I was looking at, but the interactive puzzles and storyline had me hooked right off the bat.  Even to start the game was it's own simple puzzle.  I can't wait for the next episode to come out.  I'll be immediately buying and playing through it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198083978612', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 85, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 85, 'last_played': 1499199423}
review: Short but very well done VR adventure. Definitely top game in this early stage of VR. Eventual buyer should consider the price as it is just one episode of 5?, I think? And apparantly the future episodes aren't going to be free.

author: {'steamid': '76561198247371564', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 285, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 113, 'last_played': 1511200960}
review:
What an incredible game. Arcade style VR games are a ton of fun, but this story-centric puzzle game just completely blew me away. It is so beautiful, immersive, and detailed -- there were several moments in the game where I genuinely found myself just standing slack-jawed in total awe. Starting about 15 minutes in, I pretty much just completely forgot I was playing a game until the end of the episode. 


Waxing a little less poetic-- the story was engaging, the puzzles were tricky but not SO tricky that you'll find yourself getting frustrated, and though the atmosphere and characters were often somewhat spooky/ creepy, it was never so scary that I felt I needed to take a break. It was exciting to find a story-based mystery VR game outside of the horror genre. The price is steep for around two hours of gameplay, and I don't think the game has much replay value . . . but what a game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970882112', 'num_games_owned': 61, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 342, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 326, 'last_played': 1631242276}
review:
I just finished playing Call of the Starseed using my brand new HTC Vive and man I gotta tell ya it was AWSOME.
Not only was it well done as a game for VR.... VERY detailed environments and built just right for 3D but also the game itself was engrossing and it kept me wanting to play more. Even the audio was fantastic.
The only down side I noticed (as other players mentioned) it was a bit short.
Anyway I hope they are ontime with part 2 because I can hardly wait.
If you like immersive games like Riven and Myst and you have the Vive or Rift VR rigs then this game is well worth the $20.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960863918', 'num_games_owned': 612, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 93, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 93, 'last_played': 1502512115}
review:
Come on, $20 for 93 minutes of gameplay? Obduction was 30 and I got 11 hours out of it.

The worst part about this is, that 93 minutes was the best VR experience I've had to date. The art and sound design are fantastic. Not to mention the best inventory system I've seen in any game. The story draws you in with intrigue and mystery but as soon as it feels like it's getting started, it ends.

I'm psyched about the next episode, but I'm absolutely waiting for a sale before picking it up, if each episode is only going to be under two hours.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016632416', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 295, 'playtime_forever': 111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 111, 'last_played': 1491455620}
review: This is a pretty game, but not overly long.  It is basically 3D point and click.  There are some fun characters and a few puzzles, along with a couple unexpected turns.  The atmosphere is fun and adventurous, with an 80's feel.  Not one of my all time favorite VR games, but a little quality entertainment.  Plus, the graphics are better than all but the best VR games out there.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997801929', 'num_games_owned': 2918, 'num_reviews': 407, 'playtime_forever': 205, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 97, 'last_played': 1531879266}
review:
[h1]Price too high for a short first glimpse at a fascinating story.[/h1]

Call of the Starseed, the first and currently only episode of The Gallery, costs $20 and gives you less than 2 hours of gameplay.  The collision detection in this game is rather questionable, and the controls are showing their age a year after release.  Episode 2 doesn't even come out until September 2017, more than a year after this brief experience.  Let's hope episode 2 is longer and gives us more to play with.

Many of us, myself included, got this game as a bonus with our Vive purchase.  As a bonus, it's a great introduction to VR content.  If episode 1 had the promise of future episodes being free updates, I would even recommend getting this game once more content was created.  Unfortunately, it's just a single episode, an unfinished experience, and it's short.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987535580', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 350, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 350, 'last_played': 1500842309}
review: This is a must play for VR enthusiast. It is the best adventure VR game I have played. The story and voice acting are superb. The teleportation and interaction controls are very well executed. This is the first VR game I have played where I can say I can't wait for the next installment.

author: {'steamid': '76561198367246922', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 818, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 818, 'last_played': 1489874926}

author: {'steamid': '76561198020574524', 'num_games_owned': 768, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 120, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 120, 'last_played': 1484347820}

author: {'steamid': '76561197991269066', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 254, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 254, 'last_played': 1488773990}
review: Yes. All the way yes. This was bundled with my Vive, and really showed off what adventure games can be in VR. Sure, it visually looks great, and most items are interactable, but it's the way you do things that make it cool. Want to use an item in your inventory? Instead of a regular game where you press a button to open a menu, you reach back and pull your backpack off, and you can see the items in it. For a puzzle involving putting circuit board pieces together, you don't navigate a menu and select items and rotate them to fit, you just walk over, pick them up and put them in the places they need to go. It's a regular game, but VR makes it refreshing. I won't spoil the ending but I had ZERO idea the game was going in that direction, and it's got me mega pumped for the second episode. Can't wait.

author: {'steamid': '76561198096404863', 'num_games_owned': 704, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 151, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 151, 'last_played': 1501433060}
review:
This is my first review so this review shouldn't dictate whether or not you buy this game but, I'm going to be honest and say that what you see in the trailer is what you get, BUT don't get discouraged it is a great game albeit it a short one (I finished the game in 2.5 hours) with how VR is today don't expect to finish the game in one sitting. This is a great game and probably shouldn't be your first because it sets the standards for VR games too high considering the technology for VR is in the begging stages it would make sense that games aren't as realistic looking as AAA games but Cloudhead does a great job of working with what they got and i cannot wait for episode 2.

8.5/10

pros
-good puzzles
-looks better then most VR games
-interesting story line

cons
-puzzles can seem hard at some points (more specifically the last puzzle)
