author: {'steamid': '76561198042113113', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 195, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 195, 'last_played': 1499566550}
review:
Before you guys rip my head off, please let me explain.
This game was released somewere around $35CDN if you didn't get it free with your VIVE.
Don't get me wrong. This "experience" was pretty neat and very well done however I just can't recommend it at the full retail price. 
The story was nice and engaging, the acting was good. The grafx were amazing. 
What shocked me was the length of the game "or lack of" and of course the fuse puzzle.
Everytime I tried manipulating the fuses they would fall through the panel then I'd try grabbing it and end up unplugging another one. I'm really surprised that they haven't developed a proper collision system for VR games yet. The game has literaly 3 puzzles. the rest of the game is audio tapes and minimal interactions with 2 characters. 

I really wish STEAM had a MAYBE option. 
I would be rather disapointed if I purchased this game at full price. luckily it was "free" with the Vive. 
Maybe my expectations were too high with all the hype and promo.  
Lets hope the sequal will be longer and reasonably priced

author: {'steamid': '76561197979998129', 'num_games_owned': 526, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 87, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 87, 'last_played': 1461986760}
review: I wanted a lot more from this game but what is there is pretty good. I like the backpack inventory and the puzzles in general. The world is very beautiful and feels very spielbergian but it's very short. It also seems like they're almost scared to show the one character you really interact with. He's always in the distance and you never get a clear look at him. One of the biggest things I wanted from VR was characters I could get attached to and grow to care about. I thought this game would be that, but it turns out it's another pretty lonely single player experience. I hope the second chapter has real characters that you can interact with. The end of the game gives me hope for this when you meet the last character in the game which is actually pretty intense.

author: {'steamid': '76561198132865037', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 135, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 135, 'last_played': 1499187546}
review: Pretty good VR puzzle game. Took me 2.3 hours and I'm very slow and take my time in games. 1.5-2 hour playtime IMO. Ppl built up my expectations for the so-called "crazy ending", but it was pretty much what I was expecting. Don't expect too much and you'll have a great experience. Looking forward to episode 2.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076575106', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 129, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 56, 'last_played': 1499422950}

author: {'steamid': '76561198028144672', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 108, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 108, 'last_played': 1498451862}
review:
Very short episode taking me about an hour and 45 to get through it. It also has its fair share of physics glitches that pop up here and there. Things like fuses (in one of the puzzles) turning invisible when I grab them sometimes, objects glitching through others and being flung across the room, etc. 

All that said, this game is still absolutely fantastic. The movement is very smooth, the interaction and inventory system glorious, and the varied use of depth-of-field was actually done extremely well; that being something that, at least conceptually, I would have thought would clash with VR.

There is full voice acting and the actors did a fine job. None of the acting came off as cheesy or amature. The graphics are very good as well and the story thus far is certainly intriguing. I wouldn't say the puzzles were all that difficult. The fuze puzzle to me  was the "hardest" and did take me a couple minutes which I rather enjoyed, but it was mostly just a linear walk-through after the first checkpoint.

Even so, it is a very enjoyable and atmospheric world that I highly recommend to anyone with a VR headset.

author: {'steamid': '76561198216707479', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 165, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 165, 'last_played': 1498401791}
review:
2017/2月にVIVEを購入時にクーポンで無料入手。
日本語化を待ち望み積んでいましたが、その前にEp2.のアナウンスが来てしまったので思い切ってプレイ。
一応クリアしてのレビューとなります。

お勧めなのです、が…
[b]「お勧め出来る様になる予定」[/b]のようなので、もう少し待ちましょう。
字幕要望は多かったようで、Ep2.の開発を優先・完了した（？）ので九月に字幕対応予定だそうです。


私個人としては
　・「FranBow」（英語字幕のみ）
　・「TheCatLady」（英語字幕＋英語音声）
は楽しめたのですが、これはまったく聞き取れませんでした。


[b]「良い点」[/b]
　・VRゲームとして、戦闘等ではなく体験型アドベンチャーを極める方向。これは良い方向だと思います。
　・リリース時期にしてはパフォーマンス上の工夫などが秀逸。
　　※視野の中心を緻密に描写、外周は低解像度にするなど。
　　→これにより、「観るだけ・綺麗なだけ」で有名になってしまった「theBlu」のような画質でゲーム体験ができます。

[b]「悪い点」[/b]
　・どうにもこうにも、ネイティブイングリッシュ聞き取れないとほぼ意味不明


3D映画では字幕は今一不評だったので、VRでもそこが心配ですが良い案で解決される事を願っています。

author: {'steamid': '76561197963405228', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 101, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 101, 'last_played': 1496082727}
review: I'm not one for puzzle games in general, and this was no exception.  VR did make it better, but it's so short, and the puzzles so easy.  Some interesting visuals, but for full cost, no thanks.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970521264', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 129, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 129, 'last_played': 1498355520}
review: I enjoyed this game very much and would highly recommend it. Although it does seem a little short, It is a great experience with interesting puzzles and story. I am looking forward to the next episode.

author: {'steamid': '76561197976153210', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 119, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 119, 'last_played': 1498339237}
review: Must-have VR title for 10€ (summer sale), should-have for 20. Very well made and polished adventure, great atmosphere, many little details and a nice story. It’s a little short though.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040554039', 'num_games_owned': 935, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 153, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 137, 'last_played': 1508523822}
review:
Took me about 2 hours to complete. Visually this game is stunning. Cool story but it ends right when things start getting explained. Yes it is a bit high pricewise ($20) but still if you are comparing this VR game to other VR games and not regular AAA titles (or even regular non-VR indie titles) then the $20 price is fine.

Can't wait for Episode 2. Also there will probably be a sale when Episode 2 comes out (just a guess) so if you don't have the game yet I would wait a little longer, unless you have nothing else to play in VR and are itching for something quality.

author: {'steamid': '76561198335465084', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 402, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 402, 'last_played': 1485065803}
review: Fantastic game, despite its unexpectedly short gameplay (par for the course for the current state of VR, though). Graphics are stunning, was surprised to see this was a Unity game. Music score is great and fits the scenes perfectly. The puzzles were easy enough that as a non-puzzle person, I wasn't frustrated. My major gripe with this game (besides the short length) was the blink teleportation- I would really prefer directional locomotion as teleportation breaks immersion, and when the environments look this high quality and detailed, you really want to stay immersed. I actually shelved the game for a few months after starting it because I disliked the teleport so much. Lack of facial animation on the characters was a bit disappointing and immersion-breaking as well. The backpack inventory system was really innovative. Voice acting was great. Overall, one of the best, most highly-polished games out at this time., with really nice detail in the environments. I am on the fence about purchasing Emberstone if there is no directional locomotion (and hopefully it is much longer, with more puzzles).

author: {'steamid': '76561198093694653', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 210, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 208, 'last_played': 1524878112}

author: {'steamid': '76561197966485793', 'num_games_owned': 79, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 119, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 119, 'last_played': 1497197430}

author: {'steamid': '76561198063456617', 'num_games_owned': 423, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 155, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 155, 'last_played': 1497113257}
review:
I picked up this game after hearing about it containing "the best inventory-system VR, likely to set the standard for future titles", and I must say that I'm in agreement; although there's much more to this title than a satisfying way to manage what you're carrying.

This is an incredibly atmospheric game with intuitive controls and really good use of controller feedback throughout - everyone who's played this will agree that shooting off fireworks by the beach at the start feels amazing - and the set design is wonderful.

I completed this game over 3 play-sessions (although if you're going into this then I would recommend setting aside 2 1hr play-sessions for this to complete it), which in hindsight seems like a good length for an episode of a game.  That said, at £14.99 I am very much hoping that subsequent chapters are £1.99 each otherwise I will feel a bit hard-done by after forking out this much for a 2hr experience.

Can definitely recommend, though - particularly to those that love puzzling and exploring.  This game has poised itself to be the gold standard for VR puzzling, and I'm now looking forward to playing the next, and picking up Obduction too, whilst I'm at it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198060502104', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 101, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 101, 'last_played': 1496294155}
review:
So good, too short.

This is the theme song of all my favorite games on the HTC Vive.

This is 'episode 1' so I know that more is in the works.. which makes me super excited!

The play is very well tuned, albeit short.  And the end cut scene lasts forever... But I would buy it again in a heatbeat!

Controls work great and voice acting is superb.  I found it to be a better 'myst style' puzzle game than Oblivion out the gates but it is also quite short.  It's only really a series of 3-4 puzzles.. I don't remember because I just blew through them so quick

author: {'steamid': '76561198062381886', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 100, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 100, 'last_played': 1495985831}
review: Poor quality textures in many areas, and unrealistic design, make it difficult to be fully immersed. In many occasions it felt more like a cheesy Universal Studios ride, waiting for the next sequence, rather than a virual reality experience. The ending is a lot of eye candy and upbeat music, that contrasts with the gloomy main part of the game. This explains why so many people liked it. But my feeling is the main part of the game needs to be upbeat and stimulating, and if they must use gloomy scenes, they can make it the filler in between the main sequences.  Still, given the poor quality textures everywhere and poor design is some areas, I would not pay $20 for this experience, $5-10 is a more fair price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198284753782', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 140, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 140, 'last_played': 1471188024}

author: {'steamid': '76561198027147123', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 112, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 112, 'last_played': 1495925744}
review: Best room scale game so far. Excellent graphics and immersion. Good inventory and control system. Music and SFX also appropriate and well done. author: {'steamid': '76561198282493048', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 231, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 231, 'last_played': 1495747966}
review: Still a little buggy in some areas. There was one spot in a cave where I feel through the floor twice. But the few bugs were not enough to get in the way of the amazing experiece of the game. Game play was great. I would have liked more puzzles, but this was also a first chapter and a introduction to the world, so I look forward to the next chapter being even more immersive. I will buy the next chapter the second it releases.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983791422', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 209, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 141, 'last_played': 1497719585}
review:
Wunderschönes VR Spiel, welches die Möglichkeiten der VR sehr gut präsentiert. Es nutzt die Funktionalitäten der Vive sehr gut aus und es gibt viele kleine Gimmicks, die man unbedingt entdecken sollte. Außerdem verliert man sich in der Welt und möchte jeden noch so kleinen Winkel erkunden. Die Athmosphäre ist sehr gelungen!

Das Ende kam für mich sehr überraschend, wenn gleich auch ein bisschen zu früh. Ich freue mich auf den zweiten Teil.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068315883', 'num_games_owned': 211, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 87, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 87, 'last_played': 1495282002}

author: {'steamid': '76561197972940198', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 121, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 121, 'last_played': 1494996747}
review:
I received this game from when I bought my Vive headset but for once, I wish I had paid for it. 
There was real love poured into it and you can tell by most of the credits saying something like, Im thankfull for my wife whom I havent seen in a while lol. Poor guys, I look forward to an episode 2 if there ever is one, if not, then thanks for the trip! I could feel the end happening and it freaked me out in a good way, also, the girl in the voice acting was very endearing so good pick! I give it a must buy for the vive.

review: Took me about 2 hours to complete. Exploration and puzzling are the main gameplay components. Story is well thought out and soundtrack is fantastic. It feels like a very polished game. I would buy the next episode and I would recommend this as a great VR experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993421909', 'num_games_owned': 712, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 21, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1492409449}
review:
It looks like a good game, I'd really like to play it for more than a few minutes. As someone who is deaf but uses hearing aids, I really need subtitles to properly understand spoken languages. I can't in good conscience reccomend this game, as I know even people with good hearing find subtitles valuable. 

The developer stated a year ago that adding subtitles to the game was a priority, but nothing has materialised yet. Other VR games have done this quite well, so I don't see what the holdup is.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972110461', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 227, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 138, 'last_played': 1574826431}
review:
This is what I want from VR games!

Short game, but I found it worth the price. 

I just got my Vive less than a week ago a have been playing a bunch in it. This was not my first purchase, but rather the Rick and Morty VR game. I was still looking around and deciding on my next game I picked this up based on all the reviews. I am am very glad I did!

This game seems to truly get "presence". I really felt like I was in the world they made and was engaged with the story and the game all the way through. You might see that people who like this game always say they love the ending and I am the same way. I think I have replayed the ending sequence three times already and it won't be my last. I will also be playing it through again to find all the tapes I missed and to explore more!

I am already planning on picking up the next episode as soon as it is out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084767807', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 528, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 304, 'last_played': 1564862675}
review: This game is a work of magnificence. An engaging, mysterious plot and thick atmosphere serve to make the rather short story a satisfying one to venture through, but, my god, I have never before seen a game with such seamless VR user experience tuning as this title. This is a must buy for any headset owner, and I cannot wait for the next installment. Excellent work, Cloudhead.

author: {'steamid': '76561198161064869', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 175, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 175, 'last_played': 1483808532}
review: Meh, not very remeberable. It's alright I guess. author: {'steamid': '76561198052376009', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 156, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 156, 'last_played': 1500516034}
review: Cannot wait for Episode 2.  The visuals were top notch.  Great story and amazing environments.  A very memorable experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968853217', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 237, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 154, 'last_played': 1536629940}
review:
Excellent game! A great first VR experience: very immersive and the slow pace allows one to explore the environment and experience what a VR adventure should be.
Some complain that the game is to short. Indeed, it can nn be finished in less than an hour if "finishing the game" is tot main goal. However, this is not only a game but also a demonstration and, as such, it should be enjoyed! My advice: take your time to explore the"Easter eggs" in the game and to experience what a good story and immersive ambience in VR should be. 
Now, I do agree that the promotional video is terrible in revealing to much about the game... Try not to watch it, if you can, and get the game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198009792083', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 173, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 173, 'last_played': 1493462267}
review:
THIS REVIEW CONTAINS SPOILERS

Just finished this episode earlier today.
Tutorial was made fun and had pleasure listening to the one teaching you the game, very energetic.

My experience with this episode -

-most objects are highly detailed while others look like poor imports from less graphical capable games, Blurry textures.
Which isnt bad, really but noticable even from far away.

-Some settings doesnt seem to do a whole lot like Anti Aliasing. Objects far away are blurred out more but most of the game is up close and personal, thus far not very useful. Maybe in future episodes..?

-The end where your hand is changed into a different model makes my HTC Vive flip out and lose synchronisation with the controllers. (right handed makes the right controller lose sync which is off putting, especially at the end)

-Characters aren't very shown too much at the start, the end guy was the most memorable cause I was able to see his face.. He was up close. While the first one after the sewers always kept distance, only close moment was him pushing the elevator button but the lighting was right behind him. It's a good character, you'd want to emphasize his looks over the "bad" guy at the end.

-Tapes for some people are a bit too quiet, I ended up putting my Tony Casette player to my ear too many times to properly hear what's being said, which isnt a problem for other characters that speak to you in person.
Background ambience doesnt really help either, I forgot to listen to other tapes cause I chose to listen to them away from the rain or loud sounds.

-The last puzzle gave me back aches for staring down too much. I normally don't have back aches.
Maybe I'm too tall...? (186 cm)

Overall The game is awesome, the cliffhanger makes me excited for what is to come :D

author: {'steamid': '76561197999600638', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 180, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 85, 'last_played': 1496075678}
review: Call of the Starseed is a really short game with very little challenge. There are only a handful of puzzles and at least to me the puzzles were trivial. Outside of the puzzles it is really just a walking, or should I say a teleportation, simulator with some items you can mess with. The story and the immersion are the good parts about the game. It is probably worth picking up during a sale if you like slow paced, story driven games where you can take your time to mess with items. Hopefully episode 2 offers more in terms of gameplay while maintaining the good aspects of the first game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198300593361', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 310, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 240, 'last_played': 1525010616}
review:
Superbe expérience VR.
Très court, très simple en revanche. Mais aussi très beau et très VR (prise en main des objets etc...).

Mais le gros point noir: absence de version française ET même pas de sous titres en anglais... 
Or les audios sont des "cassettes", autant vous dire que c'est juste incompréhensible.

On attends la suite, mais pour moi sans sous titres, ca sera exclus.

=> "WITHOUT ENGLISH (OR EVEN BETTER FRENCH) SUBTITLES, NO EPISODE II"

author: {'steamid': '76561198118789045', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 117, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 115, 'last_played': 1515508643}
review: One of the best VR games out there until now. Nice story, great graphics, good physics, good controls. I really recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042767606', 'num_games_owned': 988, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 118, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 118, 'last_played': 1492775733}
review:
文句なしにお勧め。

まずグラフィックが素晴らしい。
最初の海岸の時点でも十分綺麗でその後次々と移り変わる場面が
それぞれ全く違う雰囲気を醸し出している。
終盤は怒涛の展開に驚かされるばかりでなく
VRであることを活かしきり前後左右のみならず
上下まで利用しての演出に完全に引き込まれてしまった。

ゲーム部分は探索＋パズル。
最初の海岸だけはちょっと何をすればいいのか分かりづらいが
基本的には要所に落ちているテープのヒントで解ける。
このパズルもVRであることをうまく生かしており
楽しめるように作られている。

移動はワープであるが、ワープと同時にワープ後の
自分の向きも同時に指定できるようになっており
ぐるぐる回りすぎて体にコードが絡まる問題が対処されている。
ワープモードで視線を向けた位置に移動するシステムは
最初戸惑うがすぐに慣れることができるだろう。

ただし字幕などはなくテープやＮＰＣとの会話で話が進むため
ストーリーの理解には多少のヒアリング力が必要。
コミュニティにガイドもある(英語)ので詰まったら参照すれば
ヒアリング全くなしでもクリアするだけなら可能と思われる。

クリアまでのプレイ時間は１時間半ほど。
まだエピソード１しか無くこれからというところで
終わってしまうのが残念。
次のチャプターのなるべく早いリリースを期待。

author: {'steamid': '76561198080803377', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 85, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 85, 'last_played': 1492540685}

author: {'steamid': '76561198031622867', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 153, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 153, 'last_played': 1473655925}
review: One of my favorite VR games. Beginning is a little on the slow side but that's because their tutorial I built around being in the game so you get that they are trying to teach you how to play the game so they cannot be faulted for that. The game kept getting better and better. The ending of this chapter was a surprise that makes you want the next episode now.

author: {'steamid': '76561197965806165', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 207, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 124, 'last_played': 1524434337}
review:
Honestly I will give this game 9/10 but thats just me being really picky, its an absolutely amazing VR experience! Everything looks stunning and love how you get to do so many things away from the shooting games etc. 

Pros:
- Great storyline to keep you interested
- Details are exceptional
- Nice little puzzles throughout (although are easy)
- True sense of being in the game and actually moving in certain parts of the game
- Love the backpack and how everything is easilly accessible 

Cons: (Bare in mind these don't really affect the game)
- Game was a bit too short if I'm honest but it is 1/4 parts
- The blinking to positions, it would be so much nicer if your charachter walked to that position

Overall I would recommend anyone new or who hasn't tried this game to give it a go! You will not regret it one bit. I'm glad I received this with my Vive as it has now made sure I will purchase the follow up parts!

author: {'steamid': '76561198267466634', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 157, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 157, 'last_played': 1491092857}

review:
This is by far the best VR game that is available today.   The ending of this game was one of the most memorable things I have ever experienced, it is beyond belief.   No other game comes close to what the ending of this game manages to achieve.  

The whole game is amazing with great atmosphere and story, but even if this weren't the case, the ending alone makes the best VR experience you can have.  A must buy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040924200', 'num_games_owned': 484, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 125, 'last_played': 1478775047}
review:
I got this game when i bought the vive.

I'm going to answer questions I would have like to see an answer in those reviews:

Movement:
teleporting and room scale

Lenght: 
The game is quite short: i took me 1 hour completing it and exploring (second hour was my wife playing it)

Replayability:
Once you completed it once, I really do not see the point of re-doing it, as it will be exactily the same.

episode 1 it's pretty nice, game got released long time ago, but still no episode 2 :|

In terms of story:
story seems interesting and misterious, a pity we do not get to know anything longer.

Graphics are as you see in the screenshots, pretty nice.

Cons:
Short, you have a sensation of not finished :(
No episode 2 yet


If i would have to put a vote I would give it 
6.5/10

I got this game for free with the vive, but I would recommend to wait more episode are out before buying this unfinished game.
but I still recommend this game as it's really polished compared to a lot of different games you can find on vive.

Tolle Umsetzung, abedr recht seichte Adventure-Kost. Ein mancher mag sagen, dass das Erlebnis mit knapp 2h recht kurz ist, aber ich finde das ist genau die richtige Zeit. Länger möchte man die Brille sowieso nicht auf dem Kopf haben (zumindest am Anfang). Nur der Preis...... bei 10,-€ würde ich jedem raten zuzuschlagen.... Also rafft euch auf. Unterstützt VR und vor allem gutes Spielmaterial dafür. Daumen hoch!

review: Possibly the best VR game yet, can't wait for episode 2 so I can get lost in this world once again. author: {'steamid': '76561198102212320', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 282, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 87, 'last_played': 1511489074}
review: One of the first professional level VR game out. I'm playing this with my young daughter and it's been a blast so far. We take turns and help each other solve the puzzles. There are many incredible environments to move through and explore. The puzzles are a bit hard. I don't think I could have solved many of them without my daughter's help.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970714547', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 105, 'playtime_forever': 254, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 234, 'last_played': 1525353068}
review:
Wirklich umfangreich ist die erste Episode nicht und von daher ist der geforderte Preis etwas happig. Doch von all den zahlreichen VR-Titel ist dieser hier eher ein Spiel statt eine Tech-Demo. Die Macher versuchen den Unterschied zu regulären Games hervorzuheben und zeigen durchaus Potential wohin die VR-Reise gehen kann und warum diese Technologie (obwohl sie noch in den Kinderschuhen steckt) die Welt verändern könnte und eine besondere Erfahrung ist. 

Das Spiel eignet sich auch um Freunden in die ersten VR-Schritte einzuführen, da er optisch wie akustisch toll ist. Stichwort: Feuerwerk, Leuchtpistole, Walkman (falls die Leute noch wissen was das ist).

Das Spiel selbst ist ein kleines, harmloses Abenteuer mit ein paar witzigen Ideen. Die Art der Bewegung klappt mit dem "blinzeln" ganz hervorragend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085145380', 'num_games_owned': 110, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 86, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33, 'last_played': 1491777970}

author: {'steamid': '76561197973992422', 'num_games_owned': 440, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 226, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 106, 'last_played': 1496786145}
review: I was lucky to get this free with my HTC Vive, but even if you have to pay for it, I totally recommend this game. It really does feel like you are there, the environments are really interesting to explore and the puzzles quite fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988649491', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 249, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 188, 'last_played': 1612641376}
review:
Hands down my favorite Vive game so far. Immense, deep, clever, really just a perfect example of what VR can do. I couldn't contain my joy when I picked up a roman candle and lit it, or my legitimate worry near the end. Right when the end came up and the credits rolled, I said the same thing everybody else is saying. "... NO! Come on! There has to be more!"

Fantastic experience, and I highly look forward to the next chapter. I got it as part of the Vive bundle when I purchased, but I will happily pay for the next chapter.

author: {'steamid': '76561198236330728', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 97, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 97, 'last_played': 1486435706}
review: Boyfriend loved this game cannot wait for next episode to come out

author: {'steamid': '76561198000830591', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 102, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 84, 'last_played': 1490486491}
review:
I received this game for free as part of an special offer when purchasing my Vive. I also played a little bit with a friend of mine prior to purchasing my Vive and obtaining the game myself (like, I beat the first puzzle, that's it. x3)

This is a good game, I'll definitely say that. The story is immersive and there are a few neat little puzzles you have to pursue. The controls feel natural and I didn't have any problems with the locomotion. However, the issue with it is that it's not a long game, by any stretch of the imagination. I finished this game in one session, from the moment I opened up to the game and the tutorial loaded, to the end of the credits sequence at the end, in less than an hour and a half. It'd probably take me just a little bit longer (say, 10 minutes) if I had never opened it up before. And I wasn't trying to rush through it or anything, either.

It's definitely worth it if you're getting it as a sort of special offer (such as I did.) If, however, you don't have the option of receiving this game for free or anything of the sort, you're going to need to decide if an hour and a half's worth of immersive content is worth $20. It could definitely be considered worth the cost, and if you think it is, then by all means, snatch it up. Otherwise, I'd say wait until it goes on sale or something.

When Episode 2 comes out, I'm gonna have to think long and hard to decide if it'd be worth paying for. I mean, I wouldn't imagine it'd be much longer than Episode 1, and I'm sure it's probably gonna be around the same price, but man, the end left me with a lot more questions than I had started with.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066441128', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 68, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 68, 'last_played': 1489346297}
review: I got this game for free with my HTC Vive, and it's really quite a bit of fun, very immersive, has solid controls, and utilizes the strengths of VR well.  However, this is not a game I'd play $20 for, especially for only an hour of gameplay.  When the second episode comes out, if it's $10 or lower I will definitely be buying it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968469733', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 139, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 139, 'last_played': 1489207155}
review:
I had received this game for free with my Vive when I bought it 6 months ago, but was frustrated by some of the initial puzzles on the beach and put it away and hadn't played it since.

I went back to it today, and boy am I glad I did.   The lighting and ambience are fantastic.    Being programmed in Unreal Engine, it's quite hard on the system - on 'high' settings with my GTX 1070 I had to turn off all supersampling to get rid of reprojection, but it ran great after that.   1.4x supersampling was playable with async reprojection on, so long as you don't mind a few jittery spots.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058746445', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 252, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 128, 'last_played': 1636597215}

author: {'steamid': '76561198016610331', 'num_games_owned': 387, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 97, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 97, 'last_played': 1489010763}
review:
Le seul problème du jeu c'est qu'il n'y a aucun support FR et ça casse clairement l'ambiance.
Le premier niveau parait rebutant juste à cause d'une simple action à effectué. Une fois la solution trouvé le voyage commence franchement c'est bluffant.
Une très bonne expérience un peu cher (je l'ai eu avec le HTC en cadeau) mais j'ai hate d'avoir l'épisode 2.
Compter 1h-2h pour faire le tour selon le temps de résolution des énigmes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003125690', 'num_games_owned': 958, 'num_reviews': 144, 'playtime_forever': 51, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 51, 'last_played': 1487649000}

author: {'steamid': '76561198101185579', 'num_games_owned': 104, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 413, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 386, 'last_played': 1490586973}
review: I enjoyed this game, it was a very good one with great graphics and gameplay, and some puzzles were pretty confusing. Still, I just recieved and installed my HTC Vive when I began to play, so this game is the best one I could find for now. The olny two things I did not enjoy were the ending and the length of the game. If it were a game that took at least three or four hours of gameplay (kind of like the half life saga), I would give this a five star.  Still, I would imagine the ammount of coding put into this game, so that is why I am giving this game a 4 stars rating.

author: {'steamid': '76561198356829774', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 111, 'last_played': 1488922918}
review:
Great story, but oh so very very short.

I can't wait for the next episode to find out what happens next, but also can't help but feel that I've been fleeced having paid real money for less than an hour of gameplay and little to no replayability.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993839471', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 139, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 137, 'last_played': 1495416973}
review:
Just finished Episode 1.
It is suprising how in depth and interactive it is. 
Most of the VR games are a 10 minute trip or arcade style. This one made you feel as though you were living an adventure
On one part (minor spoiler) it made me feel as though I had real pain in my hand.
This one is definity hard to put down. Actualy stayed up way late to finish it.
Really looking forward to the next episode.
If there was one complaint ( and this may be my fault) is that had somewhat hard of time following some of the twists of the story. More then likely I was just tired. May play the entire thing again but actually stop this time instead of just going. 
There is autosaves.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985736502', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 162, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 118, 'last_played': 1505151600}
review: Wow, this is exactly the kind of game, wich i would like to see more often in VR. It's more or less a classic adventure but you really are in the middle of it, exploring and trying things out. It's not too complicated, just perfect for VR. The game starts slow, but gets better and better and leaves you with a big cliffhanger. Fans of "Stranger Things" or any 80s SciFi- ans mystery-stuff might like the setting. I just hope the second part will have more playtime, since i completed this one in just 2 hours. But besides this, there is really nothing to complain here for me. One of the best VR-experiences on any plattform. Part 2 will be an instant buy for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999597817', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 111, 'last_played': 1488719132}
review: First half kind of slow and boring, second half amazingly orchestrated. Like being in a sci-fi movie. Looking forward to The gallery: Heart of the Emberstone.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966057942', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 77, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1493498303}

author: {'steamid': '76561197978962100', 'num_games_owned': 2240, 'num_reviews': 516, 'playtime_forever': 133, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 113, 'last_played': 1489339146}
review: This game is my favorite experience and has the best story I've played in VR. The enviroment is beautiful and full of charm. The system for movement and carrying items works well and I hope more games follow it's direction.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983668340', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 143, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 76, 'last_played': 1511579865}

author: {'steamid': '76561198077720967', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 153, 'playtime_forever': 128, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 128, 'last_played': 1488338685}
review: A touch on the short side, but that's to be expected of episodic content. I felt the voice acting, animation, and environments were all well done (and made me a bit nostalgic for a vew VR rides I've tried at theme parks and arcades over the years. I'de definately recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992952060', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 116, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 116, 'last_played': 1488139646}
review:
Utterly superb. Exactly the sort of thing i want to see from VR. Great story, amazing visuals, great music, sweet mechanics. Story is very interesting so far. Puzzles are interesting, fun and not ridculously complex but do require a bit of logic and thought process.

Gave me vertigo a couple of times (in a good way) and was immersive enough that i was so lost in the game my girlfriend tried to get my attention at one point and i soiled myself! I must remember to enable 'Knock-Knock' mode.

I got the game with the Vive bundle i purchase (not sure if that counts as free?) but will definately be purchasing the coming episodes.

10/10 would crap my pants again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198184877561', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 334, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 334, 'last_played': 1487629853}
review:
I was going to write a positive review for this game, the visuals were great, the puzzles were pretty good. And during the decent I was like, WOAH! THIS IS ONE OF THE COOLEST THINGS EVER! But then it ended with a "Well you don't get more story until you pay for our second game that should've been in this game too but we want more money!." (It didn't acually say that, but that's how I felt.) This game was really short and I'm glad I recieved it for free with my vive, yes it was cool but I would've been so angry if I paid $20 (18.97 Euro from what I got off of Google, not sure how correct that is) and I was just shown a few cool things for a short time and then it ended with a "Haha now give us more money"

Sorry, my rant is over now.

author: {'steamid': '76561198365090923', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 250, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 205, 'last_played': 1495248548}

author: {'steamid': '76561197993484516', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 115, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 115, 'last_played': 1487543893}

author: {'steamid': '76561197984444261', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 126, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 126, 'last_played': 1487458574}
review:
Excellente expérience. Le gameplay ressemble à une sorte de "Point&Click" immersif.
J'y vois beaucoup de "plus" et quelques "moins" :

Les plus :
- joli
- beaucoup d’interactions
- immersion très bonne
- final grandiose
- pas de motion sickness
- histoire intéressante, mais...

Les moins :
- histoire en retrait. Pas de sous-titres et le volume des cassettes est trop bas pour comprendre facilement ce qui est raconté
- très court (2h pour l'instant, on attend avec impatience la suite)
- quelques bugs étranges de placement.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970506141', 'num_games_owned': 605, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 145, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 130, 'last_played': 1558682403}

author: {'steamid': '76561198040844781', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 325, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 194, 'last_played': 1493146932}
review: The most immersive game I've played in vr yet. The kind of game that is clearly better in VR and really takes advantage of that "being there" feeling.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002049680', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 83, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 83, 'last_played': 1487425454}
review:
After recieving this game for free with purchase of my vive (as I believe most people will be these days), I was quite surprised. I have played about 15 VR titles before making my way back to this game which is one of the original highlighted games for VR, and this one has some of the most polish to it. This has excellent graphics based in reality (except for the people) compared to the cartoony feel of most games currently available, and it was a great evening spent on a 1.5 hour puzzler adventure.

I'm looking forward to EP2, though insofar as VR games go, $20 is a bit steep. I will definitely be buying the next episodes, though almost certainly waiting for a discounted rate (what's a few more months onto the year gap anyway?) Recommended on sale (or free!) as a great demonstration of VRs potential and well-polished sci-fi adventure.

author: {'steamid': '76561198313709735', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 636, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 435, 'last_played': 1543107878}

author: {'steamid': '76561198125638954', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 140, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 140, 'last_played': 1487307831}
review:
hey_that's_pretty_good.avi

Only really felt worth it because it came free with my VIVE. Not a fan of these "episodic" type games; $20 seems a little excessive for the 2 hours of gameplay (probably closer to half an hour of actual gameplay; I'm just a retard and had to break every object in sight, and at least 30 minutes of cutscenes.)

A complaint I have would really be with the cutscenes, which felt awkwardly long and dragged-on. Seriously, did we have to watch [i]every[/i] little detail [spoiler]of the machine powering up?[/spoiler]

That being said though, I was really excited to FINALLY see someone take a crack at a VR game with some actual plot which wasn't just some arcade thing, and this game definitely set the bar pretty high for any others.

All in all I'd say it's definitely worth playing, but really only if it came bundled with your headset, or you've got obscene amounts of money (which we snobby VR headset owners do, mmmyeeeeess, quite so)

review: After 90 minutes of I managed to leave the first section and enter the sewers. Reaon is that the game will set me back to the tutorial from time to time. I did the tutorial like 5 times now and it is awfully annoying. Why can't you just skip the bloody thing, especially when you've seen it multiple times already?

author: {'steamid': '76561198110670256', 'num_games_owned': 334, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 308, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 224, 'last_played': 1504932889}
review:
This was a great time. It looked good (better than certain screenshots suggest), played well, and the blink system where you can rotate the play area is something I wish every game had. The sense of adventure was great, and each section felt well paced and enjoyable. 
I do have a hangup, though. The puzzles span a variety of styles- basic observation/aim, navigation, depth perception- all of these puzzles fit VR, each one is enhanced by VR. But one of the puzzles was a misfire, in my opinion.  It was the [spoiler]fuse puzzle[/spoiler]. I just feel like that one gained nothing by being in vr- it felt a little awkward to navigate and some rules of the puzzle made no sense.
That puzzle aside, this game was great. Really immersive, good voice acting, GREAT ending. I do recommend and also, cannot wait for episode 2.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982542051', 'num_games_owned': 1305, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 265, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 265, 'last_played': 1480988427}
review:
Hey, it's that game that's like an awkward first date but less kissing and more puzzle solving and character-based plot!

No really, this is a great first experience in the world of VR adventure/story games. The first morsel in what promises to be one of the more interesting episodic formats around, Call of the Starseed is just weird enough and just difficult enough to make you really want to find out what the heck is going on.

It's no graphical wonder but it's pretty enough to be convincing - just remember (that way you never forget) you'll need to pay attention to the clues (audio or otherwise) to solve most of the puzzles involved.

Let's hope they at least get to releasing a part 3.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991388471', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 101, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 101, 'last_played': 1486691823}
review:
Up until I played this, I was not convinced that VR gaming was ready for more involved gaming adventures that you typically see in AAA titles.
But this game has to be one of the most spine tingling and immersive things I've played...  Amazing, great sound design and an ingenious UI for handling inventory.
Some may say $20 is a bit much for a game this short (I beat it first time around in a little under 2 hours), and I'll admit I got it for free with my Vive, but given the amount of effort that went into this game and the enjoyment I have gotten out of it, I'd say it's worth it, and I'll gladly pay $20 a pop for future chapters! 
I cannot wait to see where whis story leads to next!

author: {'steamid': '76561197963724667', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 102, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 102, 'last_played': 1486780889}
review:
An excellent, but short game.  The story and gameplay are excellent though while it includes a couple of puzzles, they are a bit on the simplistic side and the game offers no real challenge. 

Overall, if this was a demo, I'd give it 5/5 stars and wait for anticipation for the rest of the game.  As it is, it feels like I overpaid for the first chapter of a large game.  Hopefully the developers will reward early adopters of the game by providing subsequent chapters at a more reasonable add-on price, but that may be wishful thinking.

author: {'steamid': '76561197976417707', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 33, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33, 'last_played': 1486703354}
review:
Most realistic experience yet.  I was at the very start and there was what appeared to be a puzzle.  A box was attached to a rope and brought up as I approached.  I saw a pair of bottles on the table in front of me and thought "ha ha box I have you now!"  I didn't though.  That box struck back with a fury.  I stood there, box above me, and attempted to throw a bottle.  Next thing you know I'm hearing glass shatter and my hand hurt.  The bottle was broken on the ground.  I took off the head set and glass was everywhere in my room, and my ceiling light was shattered.  That box won this round, but assuming the mercury from the broken CFL doesn't kill me, I'll be back...

Day 2:  Just found out I've been walking on a peice of glass all day, came from the lightbulb that I smashed.  It was in my boot, sharp side down.  Was wondering what the hell that was, thought it was a rock but was't enough to get me to take my boot of and look.  Totally like real life, great job devs!

FYI I got this game as part of a bundle when I got my Vive.

author: {'steamid': '76561198346414157', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 118, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 118, 'last_played': 1486013075}

author: {'steamid': '76561197983019051', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 92, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 92, 'last_played': 1486005923}
review:
I always said VR would be great for point and click adventures and I wasn't wrong. This game was great and I had a great time playing it.

Pros:
- Good atmosphere
- Great controls (simple but good)
- Good audio and music
- Cool backpack thing
- Nifty puzzle ideas

Cons:
- A little short
- Some of the characters voices got out of sync here and there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198108165823', 'num_games_owned': 612, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 18, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1485977608}

author: {'steamid': '76561198273947199', 'num_games_owned': 52, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 189, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 189, 'last_played': 1485913120}
review: This game is just remarkable, i wont spoil anything so play it for yourself

author: {'steamid': '76561197962992864', 'num_games_owned': 551, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 105, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 105, 'last_played': 1485736145}
review:
Pretty awesome.  I suppose it is rather short for the price, but the quality is excellent, and I certainly do NOT regret the purchase (and will be snapping up the next episode).

The sense of immersion is wonderful, it's great just moving around marvelling at the environment.  The art and the sound are both top notch.  The game also has an excellent movement system.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977366904', 'num_games_owned': 576, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 94, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 91, 'last_played': 1491591336}
review: Damn.  That was a fun ride!  Nothing too difficult from a puzzle standpoint and the whole thing was over in 90 minutes, but what a great 90 minutes they were.  Can't wait for episode 2!

author: {'steamid': '76561198091772661', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 105, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 105, 'last_played': 1485709004}
review:
Genial! VR funktioniert perfekt, ich spiele Stundenlang ohne Motionsickness. Die Interaktion mit der Welt fühlt sich echt an und trägt dazu bei, das man sich voll auf die Rätsel konzentrieren kann. Ich hatte einen echten Endorphinrush als ich den Safe endlich auf hatte. Wer früher point&click Adventures geliebt hat kennt das Gefühl.
Der letzte Part war dann einfach nur episch, wobei jemand anderes das vieleicht eher als langweilig beschreiben würde, ich denke das ist dann Ansichtssache.

Pros:
- sehr immersive Welt
- interaktion ist sehr intuitiv und Funktioniert!
- die Rätsel sind Abwechslungs- und Einfallsreich (zugegeben, es sind nicht sehr viele).
-die Story wird interessant erzählt

Contra:
- sehr sehr kurz. ICH WILL MEHR !!
- hier und da kleinere Bugs (beim blinken mit dem Kopf in einer Wand gelandet, durch das Kanalisationsgitter geblinkt)


Im Großen und ganzen mal etwas anderes als die ganzen Horde-shooter und Techdemos die sonst geboten werden.
Aktuell das Spiel, welches in meinen Augen das Potential von VR am besten ausnutzt.

ICH werde Episode 2 auf jeden Fall sofort kaufen

author: {'steamid': '76561198017900133', 'num_games_owned': 135, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 17, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1484789563}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561197993584028', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 169, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 169, 'last_played': 1485709600}
review: Only downside? Too short perhaps...  Episode 2 please!

author: {'steamid': '76561197972013281', 'num_games_owned': 600, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 109, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 106, 'last_played': 1487349487}
review:
E' il primo gioco per Vive che ho provato, e devo dire che mi è piaciuto molto.

L'atmosfera passa dal piacevole della prima parte all'intrigante nella seconda, spero continui così anche nel seguito.
L'avventura scorre bene, pur avendo soltanto i dialoghi in inglese (non ho trovato la possibilità di avere dei sottotitoli) sono riuscito a seguire gli indizi ed a proseguire senza intoppi; se avete problemi con la lingua potrebbe essere uno scoglio.
Gli enigmi sono gradevoli, non esageratamente difficili, grazie alla r.v. quello più divertente risulta l'unico in cui c'è un po' di componente fisica e meno ragionamento; ne avrei graditi di più con questa formula, per l'originalità del meccanismo rispetto ad altre avventure farebbe la differenza.

L'ho ricevuto in bundle con il Vive, non sono in grado di valutare il rapporto qualità/prezzo, tenete conto che anche facendo con calma sono un paio d'ore di gioco. Aggiungetene un'altra se volete fare tutti gli achievement, magari in una seconda partita.

Consiglio di giocarlo, la r.v. è ancora giovane, ma questo mi sembra uno dei prodotti ad oggi su Steam che valga di più la pena di provare.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030445884', 'num_games_owned': 301, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 120, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 87, 'last_played': 1489339123}
review: Un must-have si vous possédez un casque de réalité virtuelle. Le jeu est court mais très bien fait. Les puzzles sont très bien mis en scène !

author: {'steamid': '76561198081741115', 'num_games_owned': 55, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 282, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 272, 'last_played': 1498581119}
review:
Habe das Spiel im HTC Vive Bundel bekommen.
Grundsätzlich hat es mir gut gefallen. 
Die Umgebung wurde gut dargestellt, es gibt viele Gegenstände, mit denen man hantieren und experimentieren kann.
Die Handhabung der Controller sowie die Steuerung wird im Tutoriel und im Spiel gut erklärt.
Die Story verspricht spannend zu werden und macht Lust auf Mehr.
Gundsätzlich also genau die Art von Spiel welche ich mit der Vive spielen möchte...

ABER: keine deutschsprachige Unterstüztung (weder Ton noch Untertitel)
Finde aber, dass bei einem Adventure dieser Art für mich unerlässlich ist, wenigstens einen Untertitel in meiner Sprache zu haben. Habe die Hinweise auf den Kassetten nur sehr schwer verstanden.

Aus diesem Grunde werde ich mir die weiteren Episoden nicht zulegen, solange für mich keine Sprachunterstützung vorhanden ist.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970916422', 'num_games_owned': 1059, 'num_reviews': 146, 'playtime_forever': 127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 101, 'last_played': 1496672609}
review:
Great. just Great. Good graphics, good performance, very clever interface.
Locomotion is beaming (i played with room scale). 

You choose where to go by looking and you have the possibilty to rotate the view before you beam there. 
Thats kinda cool cause you dont need to worry about the cable to much.

I played the first level "the beach" and the mechanics are great. 

Looking foward for more of this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198179689122', 'num_games_owned': 1073, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 373, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 146, 'last_played': 1503204043}

author: {'steamid': '76561197981105457', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 201, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 119, 'last_played': 1528587613}

author: {'steamid': '76561198021550506', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 125, 'last_played': 1485367211}
review:
I got this game for free when I bought the Vive and I am so glad I tried it because these mysterie-puzzle games are usually not the type of games I play. Although I can agree that the 20€ pricetag is way too high, I can also agree that it's a brilliant experience.
My playtime was, from start to finish, 1.2 hours and I am not that great at solving puzzles.

The story itself starts off pretty unremarkable (find your lost sister) but evolves into a very entertaining and exciting adventure. (I'll only say, as the title might suggest, that sci-fi fans will most probably love it)

The graphics are really good and I didn't get a headache because of washed out/blurred textures. The whole world actually is just great to look at and explore. It happened more than once that I just had to stand somewhere admiring the scenery until I forgot what I was actually supposed to do.

The controls, using standart teleportation, are very accurrate and the game didn't loose tracking accurracy regardless of how stupidly i tried to reach something.

All in all, it is well worth playing and I am looking forward to the second part but I really hope that the new part is either a lot cheaper or a lot longer in terms of story/playing time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198183431071', 'num_games_owned': 40, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 198, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 198, 'last_played': 1485464852}

author: {'steamid': '76561198155922463', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 209, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 168, 'last_played': 1477246926}
review: This was one of the games that was bundled in with my vive, But if it wasn't i would be happy to hand over $20 for this game. It's a little on the short side at about a hour and a half to two hours. but the game is VERY well done and super polished. author: {'steamid': '76561198031962487', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 242, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 242, 'last_played': 1485228693}
review: The worst part of this game, is now I have to wait for Episode 2.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031037093', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 257, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 257, 'last_played': 1485207811}
review:
Tolle Grafik, innovativ, atmosphärisch und perfekt auf VR abgestimmt!

Call of the Starseed ist ein richtig gutes Adventure. Nicht unnötig kompliziert wie die Point-and-click-Adventures, in denen man 100 Dinge finden und sammeln muss und versuchen, jeden Mist mit jedem zu kombinieren, aber dennoch mit interessanten Rätseln, die mit etwas logischem Denken aber kein Problem darstellen.

Einziger Kritikpunkt: Das Spiel ist sehr kurz. Nach spätestens 2 Stunden ist man schon durch. Das Ende ist fulminant und bombastisch, aber man wünschte sich, dass Episode 2 gleich folgen würde und bitte nicht erst in einem halben Jahr und dann womöglich nochmal für 20 $.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970991900', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 164, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 163, 'last_played': 1486190932}
review: A great game that shows how fun and engaging VR can be. Fun puzzels to solve, great music, and amazing voice acting. My only complaint is that it isnt longer. Game takes about 2-3 hours to beat at this point.

author: {'steamid': '76561198327349204', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 425, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 264, 'last_played': 1487371664}

author: {'steamid': '76561197970541793', 'num_games_owned': 1190, 'num_reviews': 330, 'playtime_forever': 76, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 76, 'last_played': 1484885841}
review:
Sooo.. does it come with the next episodes included? Cause $20 was a lot for this experience. 
It is still interesting.. but feels like a demo. Ummm.. I can't say thumbs down, but it is pretty pricey for the length of time and the number of actions you take in the "game". 

Try it out, but when it is REALLY on sale. It is pretty, but for the cash there are other experiences.

author: {'steamid': '76561198334540513', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 385, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 385, 'last_played': 1485473875}
review: The Gallery is an episodic fantasy exploration game, inspired by dark 80’s fantasy films. Episode one takes you on a series of amazing adventures. The gameplay involves encountering and solving various puzzles on the quest to find your missing sister. The gameplay is immersive, the puzzles are of medium difficulty; there are four short puzzles and you unravel more of the story with each of the puzzles alongside meeting a quirky character (no spoilers), and finally a dramatic cliffhanger of an ending unfolds. The graphics and surrounding environments are stunning and detailed, and the voice acting is perfect, making the game extremely immersive and enjoyable to play. My only criticism could be the price point because it is an episodic game… However, I really enjoyed playing this first episode and being in this world and feel the price of this episode is reasonable as even though the content is short it is a truly high quality VR game. I can't wait for ep 2.  https://youtu.be/dje_sEfX7_g

author: {'steamid': '76561198040588236', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 57, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 56, 'last_played': 1504729031}
review: I got this game bundled with Vive. The visuals are great and really immersive. The puzzles are interesting though some interactions are a bit clunky, but overall the controls are pretty intuitive. I really liked the hidden easter eggs too.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984079533', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 316, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 213, 'last_played': 1486205200}
review:
Ce jeu est certes, perfectible, mais il est déjà excellent! L'immersion est là, il y a de superbe idées pour la VR, l'histoire (bien que simple pour l'instant) est prenante. On a déjà envie de jouer à l'épisode 2!
Pour rester constructif, notons quand même que le temps de jeu est assez cours, et que le jeu en lui même est très simple et linéaire (même si pour le coup, l'immersion VR compense bien), j'espère que l'épisode 2 prendra en compte ces points à améliorer!
Pour moi une référence parmi les tout premiers jeux VR!

author: {'steamid': '76561198041734580', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 142, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 142, 'last_played': 1484509706}
review:
Too short to be worth the price point, especially when so much of the time I'd spent waiting for someone to finish talking or riding on elevators/platforms. The "story" of the game barely gives you any clue as to what's going on and is mostly told through difficult-to-hear audiotapes. The puzzles are mundane. They're mostly a set of "pick up these thinges and put them here" tasks or a "find the numbers" games.

I'm just glad this came bundled with my Vive. I doubt I will be playing any future episodes if they don't drop the price or significantly change the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964032481', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 309, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 298, 'last_played': 1694273554}

author: {'steamid': '76561198060962469', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 38, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38, 'last_played': 1484618551}
review:
Wow....Was holding off playing this game after I bought the Vive, I guess I wanted to experience all the cool shooters/games that seemed to have a large wow factor with VR. The game I should have checked out earlier is this one. Really unique experience that capitalizes on what VR does well and doesnt just rest on its laurels as being another game with one cool feature. Production values are top notch and so is story telling. Even the basic mechanics and use of world interaction are above most of the other games.

Worth the price of admission...do yourself a favor, you spent a ton on this whole vive vr thing. Go one step further and get this game. 

*drops mic*

author: {'steamid': '76561198041988789', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 220, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 148, 'last_played': 1485901123}
review:
Pretty well made "point and click" adventure game. The environment is pretty immersive and the story unfolds in a clever way in that you have to listen to tape casettes that your sister left behind for you.

Not a difficult game and I really wish that the rest of the episodes were out so I could see the rest of the story.

Also, wish there were legit save slots so that my wife could play without having to make wild guesses at the title screen.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964578747', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 261, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 97, 'last_played': 1499306645}
review:
I have only played for a few hours since getting the vive and wanted to do it without reading anything or listening to any walkthroughs so it will take me a while as I see the achievements on the beach level and I missed alot.   Super grafix in this game and enough to keep you looking around.  The maps I find are from southern BC on Vancouver Island close to where I grew up and this alone adds a bit of interest.  The label on the beer can drew a few laughs ... now I just need to find all those damn starfish and free them !!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198085217854', 'num_games_owned': 208, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 206, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 206, 'last_played': 1484588028}

author: {'steamid': '76561198005178286', 'num_games_owned': 1533, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 117, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 117, 'last_played': 1481573977}
review:
A really great adventure game with some nice easter eggs.

It has really good controls (you can even rotate your playarea), some nice challenges and is perfectly optimized for VR. 
Your inventory is a backpack. You want to put something in it? Just put it in the back like you would do wearing an open backpack in real live. You wand to get something from the inventory? Just grab the backpack, bring it to the frond and open it. (Probably the best inventory system I've seen so far in VR Games.)

The first eposide is a bit too short (more like a demo) but introduces to a probably great game series and I can't wait to play further episodes.

I got the game for free in the game bundles inclded with my vive.

The game is a must-play for VR in my opinion.

author: {'steamid': '76561198089946326', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 191, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 167, 'last_played': 1498786527}
review:
The Gallery Call of the Starseed (Episode One) Ended up on my VR Playlist when I was looking for narrative story games in VR. This is what I found so I added it. So when you drop the $20 dollars to play the VR game on steam your expecting quality, as $20 is quite expensive for a VR game. And Gladly when you boot the game up that is what you get. The graphics are very good for a VR game and the graphics settings are adjustable in game. The game is loaded with cool depth of feild effects, bloom, and other various visual gags. and it also runs very smoothly. 
                  The game starts off with a tutorial, and it lasts for about 5 to 10 min and teaches you the basics of how to move around the enviroment and pick up objects. I Liked the tutorial and it had a good voice over. then it moves on to the area selection which is done by playing tapes in a tape player (The models of which have stunning detail I might add) I like the idea of playing tapes more then hitting a button. Its an unessesary detail for the game devs to include, but they did it anyways. It was creative. 
                  The game then goes on to take a semi long but pretty average loading screen. After its done loading it drops you on a drop dead gorgeous rocky beach with lots of little things to pick up and play with. Now when your wlaking on the beach there will actually be an area where there are two paths to explore one to a sewer and one farther into the beach, now the game doesnt tell you the correct path to it just allows you to explore for yourself. It does not hold your hand. eventually you go down the beach farther and it actually has a mini tutorial kind of thing to show you how to use your back pack and tools then you go up a stair case to find a workshop in the rocks with many interesting areas to explore and things to look at and throw around. However the main quest items to actually start telling the story are on the table now like I mentioned before there are actually more tapes and you have a tape player so the story is told through the tapes. You hear the character's voises but you do not actually get to see the characters until later and you only get to see two of them at that. I really enjoyed this hyping up of the characters it invests me more in the story for some reason. 
                  Anyways, you read a paper get a flare gun then it is on to the first large puzzle. the puzzle is opening the gate to the sewer, and to do the puzzle you have to shoot three bells with the flare gun. Now I didn't listen to any of the extra tapes the professor recorded so the solution to the puzzle may have been in those. But if it wasnt for youtube playthroughs, I would have had no idea to shoot the bells.  but eventually you get it then move on to the sewer.
                  Now I'm going to cut the review short here, because I don't want to spoil the rest of the game and I will be here all day if I go over the whole thing. But in the end I got around 3 hours with the first episode. Now I was hoping for more but I guess we will have to wait for the next episode right? I just hope I don't have to buy it because The game is already pretty expensive for a 3 hour game. Anyways in short the VR implementation was excellent, the puzzles were well thought out and difficult but not too difficult, and the story has me hooked and kind of ends on a cliff hanger. Can't wait to play more! and I give it a 9.2/10 (Played on HTC Vive)

author: {'steamid': '76561198001794713', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 427, 'playtime_forever': 136, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 136, 'last_played': 1484005227}
review:
It came bundled with the Vive, so I paid for it.
And this one is a hard one to judge, as its not really a bad game.

[h1]Pros:[/h1]

+ on a technical side the game is fantastic, great physics and overall VR mechanics
+ not only can you teleport, but reorientate your playspace, by rotating it while blinking, very intuitive
+ graphics look nice
+ one of the best inventory systems in a VR game today, you get out your backpack from your back and place it, to then put stuff in or take something out, very cool

+ after the game was finished I kinda wanted more

[h1]Cons:[/h1]

- its very very short, you will get through it in 1,5 hours
- at the end of the game there is a puzzle that is insanely difficult and really needs a guide to be solved
- the whole game is basically a demo for the Vive and VR mechanics, this is the stuff that should be free or at least very cheap

- the price tagg is insane compared to the numerous better games that are out there and ultimatley made me decide to thumb it down. Its hard to believe that this 1,5 hour game not only costs a lot more than other very replayable games, but they are also going for an episodic system, which is downright greedy.

- no replayablility whatsoever

I did like the games story and overall storytelling, but the greedy marketing is enough for me to thumb this one down.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066957115', 'num_games_owned': 13, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 27, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 27, 'last_played': 1484257323}
review: Ainda descobrindo, pois se for só isso, o jogo é muito chato.

author: {'steamid': '76561198204798857', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 211, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 190, 'last_played': 1503535125}
review:
I got this game for free with the Vive. It has some of the best graphics I've seen in VR, and some of the best, immersive narrative also. The only problem is that I didn't care much about the story, or get drawn into it until the end. I didn't even really know what was happening the entire time. It was still worth the play through, being as immersive and polished as it is compared to other VR games that are out.

If I had somehow known how much enjoyment I'd of gotten out of this game, I think that $15 would be the most I would pay. For someone who really likes puzzles (light puzzling here) or is just super interested in this type of game then maybe $20 would be worth it to them.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969448581', 'num_games_owned': 291, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 204, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 136, 'last_played': 1561300069}

Attendez une promo ou le jeu complet.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020170695', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1151, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 999, 'last_played': 1508344865}
review:
Fantastic immersion and sense of adventure throughout this beautiful piece of art. I got this bundled with my Vive, so my only comment on the price is that it may be a little high for the length of the game.

+ Beautiful atmosphere
+ Sound design is excellent
+ Perfect 1:1 tracking
+ Polished VR that truly feels like an actual game
+ lots of little extras that you'll no doubt miss on your first play through
+ Really liked the backpack and the way it worked
+ Puzzles aren't too hard and a good sense of progression

- On stairs the camera can go up and down and cause a nauseous feeling.
- Pretty short with only a few puzzles
- Putting items down can be quite fiddly.
- Music / audio doesn't automatically drop when listening to audio logs, but the intuitive ability to hold the tape recorder closer to your ear does make it louder and clearer.

-/+ If you want to get all the achievements, there is one that'll take you 7 hours of leaving your Vive on (hence my playtime) 
-/+ Audio logs, you'll either love them or hate them. I personally really like them, nice Bioshock feel.

Overall, really enjoyable game and really look forward to Episode 2. The experience far outweighs the length of this game. Highly recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960780797', 'num_games_owned': 737, 'num_reviews': 113, 'playtime_forever': 147, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 142, 'last_played': 1484000953}
review: The only negative thing about this game is that it is episodic.  I just want more.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079306670', 'num_games_owned': 210, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 39, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 39, 'last_played': 1487815363}
review:
★★★★★ 5/5

TLDR;
Can throw starfish.

☺Pros
- Can throw starfish.
- Putting a conch shell up to your ear plays the sound of the ocean. Sweet one guys <3
- The first storyline-oriented VR game i've played, and it's beautiful.
- Scenery is of amazing quality and maps feel real.
- Puzzle mechanics are fun, requires you to use your brain rather than faceplant the keyboard to complete the game.

☹Cons
- At times it was hard to figure out what to do, or where to go. (This can be put down to me, so not really a con)
- Not enough starfish.

I'll update this review regularly. :)
For more VR game reviews and recommendations, check out my profile. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197977167116', 'num_games_owned': 715, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 99, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 46, 'last_played': 1515265226}
review:
I got this free with my Vive and so far the experience has been fantastic. Out of all the VR titles available at the moment, this is probably one of the best examples of a VR game and what can be done. From the start I was sucked in and immersed, walking around and just trying everything and being in awe of little things like using a torch ingame to find my way around or accessing your backpack. The standout for me was picking up a big sea shell on the beach and holding it to my ear and hearing the ocean, like you would with a real shell. It was the little things like this that blew me away. I feel like I'm in a classic adventure game instead of just doing a point and click around the screen. 

The only criticism is that I know this game is part of a series, and I am hesitant to spend £15 on each episode for what only amounts to about 2-4 hours of linear gameplay. For a lower price point I would say absolutely, but for £15 I think I would wait till a Steam sale or until you can buy all the episodes together. 

On that note, I can't wait to get home tonight to pick up where I left off

author: {'steamid': '76561197961220293', 'num_games_owned': 148, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 321, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 296, 'last_played': 1486186885}
