author: {'steamid': '76561198015265677', 'num_games_owned': 138, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 118, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 118, 'last_played': 1483995139}
review:
Just finished my first playthrough - wow. This is pretty much what I imagined when I thought about VR. The Environments are beautiful. The story is somewhat strange, but then again this is only the first episode.
I did get the game for free with my Vive-purchase, I would, however, recommend buying it if you haven't got it already. Playtime isn't very long, so I am a little worried about the pricetag. Will Episode 2 be similarily priced? And 3 and so on? I think the game has next to no replay value due to the nature of the riddles. I'd say a 10-euro pricetag ot something along those lines would be ok für upcoming episodes.
Aaaaaaaanyway, long story short: get this game and play it, you won't regret it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986941284', 'num_games_owned': 324, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 152, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 121, 'last_played': 1487196872}

author: {'steamid': '76561197964352654', 'num_games_owned': 3098, 'num_reviews': 92, 'playtime_forever': 117, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 117, 'last_played': 1483941488}
review:
The production quality of this game is good, and I really liked the music. That's about it. 

The game is short, there's barely any story, and only a handful of puzzles, only one of which actually took me some time to solve. The VR mechanics are basic environmental interaction.

Not to mention this is just part one. If you want a good adventure game, this isnt it. If you want a cool VR experience, this also isn't it. I'm glad this came free with my Vive. Don't waste your money.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982137442', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 135, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 135, 'last_played': 1483062088}
review:
J'ai beaucoup apprécié ce jeu même s'il est vrai que le début n'est pas forcément des plus accrocheur. Cela change au fil de notre avancement dans le jeu, avec des environnements fort sympatiques et des enigmes et casse-tête toujours plus pointu. La fin est de toute beauté et me donne vraiement l'envie d'acquérir le prochain chapitre.

20 euros, oui cela fait un peu cher mais en même temps il offre une belle qualité de réalisation donc ça se discute. Pour ceux qui ne seraient pas sur de leur coup, peut-être attendre une promotion pour se laisser tenter, en tout cas je le conseil.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059069448', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 160, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 75, 'last_played': 1492636366}
review: This game is hands down the most profound experience I have had in the many months of owning my vive. The visuals are absolutely stellar, the story is incredibly intriguing and there is so much polish with this game's design. The backpack should be the gold standard for VR inventory systems and there are so many clever ways the developers kept the narrative going around you and kept you engaged. The Gallery has me very excited for the upcoming episodes and any narrative driven VR title.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033806692', 'num_games_owned': 85, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 618, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 425, 'last_played': 1496555062}
review: My favorite game on VR to date.  I can't wait for the next 3 to come out!  Some of the best graphics so far on VR, puzzles were fun, the ending was incredible and really shows what these guys are capable of.  My only "dislike" was that it takes anywhere from 3-4 hours or so to complete depending on how much you like to explore or play around between puzzles.  Still, this is a must have game in my opinion.

author: {'steamid': '76561198345667092', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 47, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47, 'last_played': 1482965507}

author: {'steamid': '76561198036598487', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 165, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 109, 'last_played': 1641938182}
review: The Gallery - Episode 1: Call of the Starseed really surprised me. I received a copy free with my Vive and neglected playing it for a while in favour of more well-known titles such as Audio Shield and Job Simulator. When I finally booted it up, I did not stop playing until the credits were rolling and I loved every minute of it. The mysterious narrative and gloomy setting of the first chapter was an instant hook and I remained engaged throughout the story. The game is predominently a puzzle-based adventure where atmosphere and story take centre stage. The puzzles were well thought out and challenging, though I felt that the '3Bs on the B' puzzle was a little too tricky to be the first challenge of the game. The soundtrack is outstanding and the high graphical fidelity really shows off the potential of the Vive hardware. I loved the ending and how quickly the game changed its tone as the mystery was revealed, however, the cliffhanger was painful and I hope the next episode is in the works and scheduled for release soon. My main criticism of the title would be the game's length. It took me just over 90 minutes to reach the credits, though considering the game's price tag this is understandable and to be expected. Overall a fantastic experience and I would recommend this to every Vive owner.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043658776', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 153, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 153, 'last_played': 1483804783}

author: {'steamid': '76561197971461224', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 156, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 156, 'last_played': 1483305916}

author: {'steamid': '76561198015519758', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 189, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 137, 'last_played': 1514370873}
review:

Only negative things i can say is price and at times getting glitched into walls. If every episode is going for $20 USD I likely wont pick up the next.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970024745', 'num_games_owned': 102, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 339, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 339, 'last_played': 1483223500}

author: {'steamid': '76561197971577535', 'num_games_owned': 255, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 146, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 146, 'last_played': 1483201151}
review: A quand une suite !

author: {'steamid': '76561197967450014', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 137, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 137, 'last_played': 1483185544}
review: Un jeu dont j'attendais beaucoup...un myst like en VR. Le trip total, la gestion de l'inventaire qui consiste à allez chercher votre sac à dos derrière votre tête, au top, les quelques (trop) raers énigmes, au top, les graphismes, au top, la durée de vie...Sic...en tout et pour tout, 2 énigmes...sinon du dialogue et du déplacement, quel dommage...alors oui, c'est pas fini, mais quand même...quand on vvoit tout le travail accompli et sa qualité, agrémenter la durée de vie de mini-jeux aurait été si simple...faites venir un mec de Cyan et vous serez au top....allez, je reste positif, d'autres chapitres arrivent, mais j'ai peur payant (??). durée de vie vs tarif un peu trop limite, mais bon on vous encourage pour une suite plus hardue !

author: {'steamid': '76561198021387442', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 103, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 103, 'last_played': 1483165316}

author: {'steamid': '76561198008499069', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 295, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1588707205}
review:
J'ai eu le jeu avec le Vive et je viens de le terminer.
Je dois dire que c'est une très belle expérience sur le point graphique, narration, interaction avec le décors et les objets.
[u]C'est l'un des meilleurs jeux en VR que j'ai essayé[/u] même si la durée de vie est assez courte, mais il y a un Episode 2 :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198044553542', 'num_games_owned': 324, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 166, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1483061062}
review:
Magic. The only word to describe it, it reminds me of a more adult Disney movie. This is the definite real experience for VR, this debunks all the non-believers of VR saying they are just 'tech demos', this plays like a full game, looks like a full game and there is only more to come! I beated the game in about 2 hours, mainly because I sucked at the puzzles. I still had a fucking blast though, I can't wait for the second episode!

Pros:
 + Great atmosphere/writing
 + Great voice acting
 + Geniuinly puzzling puzzles!
 + Great professional graphics
 + Story rich with great immersion

Cons:
 - Not really a fan of the episodic formula
 - The backpack system is a little faulty, you can't have two items from your backpack in each hand because you still need to put the backpack on your back. 
 - [spoiler]On the final part of the game, when you are moving down the elevator and twisting and turning in different directions to the starseed. It is REALLY nausiating, i had to cover my eyes because I was ready to throw up. This only lasted for a very short bit, however.[/spoiler]

REALLY good game for VR, 9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198072994774', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 296, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1494789819}

author: {'steamid': '76561197964310540', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 38, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38, 'last_played': 1477594909}
review: TG is by far one of the best VR experiences and impressively demonstrates what VR is able to do. Imagine a point & click adventure with you being the main character - making it a walk & grab adventure. Exploring a mysterious story in a vivid setting has never felt so good before VR.

author: {'steamid': '76561197965395684', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 224, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1508688772}
review: Amazing game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015155847', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 131, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1483061272}
review:
This game  was bundled with my Vive and is a good showcase of what a VR game can be. Essentially it's a narrative driven exploration game, with light puzzle elements. Story is intriguing and the game makes great use of VR controls and fuction. The final act literally gave me chills it's so awe inspiring.

Can't wait for the next installment!

author: {'steamid': '76561197992864169', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 118, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1483033820}
review:
A really well made VR game (one of the best VR experience so far for me).
The game possess very good ideas, the inventory/backpack and the teleportation mechanic for example.
The different enigmas are complex enough. The story is interesting.
It can be short for the price you pay but it's a VR tittle, you won't stay 5h standing up anyway.

I want to know the end!

For people who have motion sickness: there are scenes with elevators near the end (up/down movements and also forward). It's a strange sensation but nothing to feel sick about.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052987134', 'num_games_owned': 167, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 312, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1484352395}
review:
This game came with my vive but I had it setting in my library for a few days as I played through some other free games I downloaded through the market. After playing 15min long demo styled games of poor quality and sharing those experiences with friends and family I finally got the chance to try this game out. This game was amazing! Compared to the garbage that's on the market for VR this game was well thought out, well narrated and easy to control. 

For someone newly experiencing VR gaming I highly suggest you try this game out as it not only gives you a great story, some puzzles and awesome voice acting; it gives you the proper setting to learn how to operate your new device with enjoyment and ease.

I will for sure grab Ep.2 when it releases!

author: {'steamid': '76561197960698799', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 74, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 74, 'last_played': 1479624280}
review: Got this game for free with my Vive. Played the first chapter and a little more and I never went back to it. It just didn't hook me. It's kind of like a VR version of a point-and-click adventure.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042515230', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 298, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 106, 'last_played': 1483068063}
review: This was a great game for VR.  The storyline was interesting, the puzzles were interesting, the interactions with various / misc. objects within the game were well thought out.  There were a few issues related to gameplay that was a little clunky at times but most of this was fixed with a reset of the VR system.  The only thing I wished were different with this game is the length and the price. While I received this game as part of a package when purchasing the Vive, I still looked at the cost of the game. I know this is a relatively new space for game development, so I get why the price for this is a bit high, but I am hoping chapter 2 is either a bit cheaper or a little longer.  Keep up the good work!

author: {'steamid': '76561198326368113', 'num_games_owned': 73, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 236, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 236, 'last_played': 1473515814}
review: finished this first chapter in just 3.9 hours according to steam - it's a nice, 'pretty' game that came bundled with Vive purchase...  I don't know if it is worth the full asking price yet.  With some more content, though, with some more complex 'mission structure' to require visiting some locations multiple times, then it would be a lot better! :-)

author: {'steamid': '76561197971215728', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 236, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 170, 'last_played': 1482909770}
review:
This was one of two promotional games I received with my Vive. 

At first, the puzzles were a bit strange, but once I got the hang of the storyline, it was fine. There's beautiful eye candy all around, very cinematic... it's much like being in a movie with puzzles to solve.

Though somewhat short, I really enjoyed it, and loved the end chapter. I look forward to more of The Gallery.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986036893', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 124, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 124, 'last_played': 1482597012}

author: {'steamid': '76561197994752073', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 187, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1482874395}
review:
*This game came free in a bundle when I bought my Vive.

Wow! This is a lot of fun. I have made it to the third level so far, and I will definitely continue playing.

The good:
1. Very creative storytelling
2. Good writing and great voice acting
3. Puzzles. Not extremely challenging -- you won't feel like a real genius -- but they're fun and fitting.
4. Good graphics; Runs smooth on my i4790K and 980 GTX (no overclock); Even upped the game's HMD multiplier to 1.5 (I think it says 15 in game)
5. Lots of environmental interaction fun.
6. The best "blink" transportation systems I've seen in a VR game so far. It allows you to rotate your direction while blinking and helps you align your placespace with the world space. This takes a lot of the frustration of spinning too much out of games where you have 360 degrees to play with.
7. The inventory system is great.

The bad:
1. Sometimes blink is disabled. Stupid complaint, since it's to avoid game-breaking movements (I assume), but I dislike being told I can't do something especially in a disruptive way. I'd prefer the game world make it clear that I physically don't have a movement option instead of seeing a "blink disabled" message.
2. Some of the items in the world react very strongly to seemingly small touches. None of this breaks the game, only a bit of immersion. Weighted items in VR must be difficult because I see so many heavy looking models (think a large telescope -- no spoiler, this is just an example) that you reach out to touch and it goes flying across the room or falls down like it's superlight cardboard.
3. Minor bugs like certain items sometimes float above a surface (feet, not inches)

The ugly:
1. Yer ma

Overall, I'm excited to continue playing this game, and I'm already looking forward to the next episodes and other projects that Cloudhead Games is working on.

My opinion on the purchase value is that $20 seems very reasonable for this production quality.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970560874', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 203, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 203, 'last_played': 1482581376}
review: Epic VR experience, would recommend to anyone interested in a decent storyline.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009585222', 'num_games_owned': 936, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 88, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 88, 'last_played': 1471721313}
review:
While the game is great, it is not worth the $20 price tag.
I beat the game in just under an hour and a half, but there's no replay value to justify the price. I understand that this is only episode 1, I don't know if episode 2 comes for free if you purchased ep.1 (if that's the case then get the game).

Now the price aside, the game is fun. Graphics are beautiful and life like. The UI is simple and actually pretty neat, probably the best inventory managment I've seen in a VR game. The story is interesting and gets REALLY crazy/cool/interesting at the end, so much that I eagerly look forward to episode 2. 

So you can be the judge, it's price vs. content for me. I'm giving it a thumbs up because it's an excellent example of what we can expect for first person narrative VR titles, but if you don't have a pile of cash you can blow away I highly suggest waiting for the game to go on sell and instead invest your $30 on a title that has a higher replay value.

Pros:
+ Great graphics for a VR title
+ Easy UI
+ Interesting story
+ Awesome setting and enviroment

Cons:
- Way too short
- No replay value

author: {'steamid': '76561198084569857', 'num_games_owned': 147, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 337, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 198, 'last_played': 1510267292}

author: {'steamid': '76561197965560727', 'num_games_owned': 596, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 156, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 131, 'last_played': 1482944404}
review:
Las aventuras de exploración y puzzles se viven diferente en rv, un juego simple como puede ser en pantalla se vuelve trepidante y emocionante en rv, ahora eres el autentico protagonista, una historia emocionante que va cogiendo color poco a poco, si no sabes ingles no lo cojas pierde gracia si no te haces con la historia.

Buena ambientación.
Buen sonido.
El entorno muy conseguido.
Jugabilidad regular te puedes hacer con ella o no.
Historia que mejora por momentos.
Entretenido pero muy corto, no llega a dos horas.
15€ es caro.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043353587', 'num_games_owned': 152, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 163, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 163, 'last_played': 1481960751}

review: So much fun! Highly recommended! It has some puzzles you have to solve to progress which I enjoyed. The game lasted for over 1.5hrs. I'm looking forward to the future episodes to complete the story.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968549394', 'num_games_owned': 207, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 238, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 125, 'last_played': 1485118321}
review:
Absolutely amazing and breathtaking! Since buying the  Vive on Black Friday, I've mainly played the typical shooter games as well as The Lab. Tonight I've decided to give this a try since many of the other games I've played were getting quite boring for me. 
This game sucks you into it's dreamlike world where you are attempting to find your lost sister. You arrive on a reciently abandoned beach scattered with clues on what occured reciently. The feeling of loneliness quickly consumes you in the first few minutes of the game. Eventually you meet someone; I'll not disclose who he is; but there's much mystery to this story,
Overall, I strongly recommend this game, it plays as a novel where you are the main character. Little details are given to begin with, but once the story unfolds, you'll crave the next episode!

author: {'steamid': '76561198057146152', 'num_games_owned': 2110, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 132, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 132, 'last_played': 1481956071}
review: This game is incredibly polished, I recommend it as a 2 hour long movie-like experience. It is short but very high quality. It feels like part 1 of a trilogy, but it doesn't feel like a demo. The only issue I had with this game was the last puzzle, it felt like it was made just to pad out the game length without any meaningful gameplay. I ended up finding a guide for it and I kept going. Other than that, it's a buy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020440057', 'num_games_owned': 1041, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 111, 'last_played': 1480959474}

author: {'steamid': '76561198166163043', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 114, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 114, 'last_played': 1481772876}
review:

If you get it for free I guess it is fine. REally good graphic. Sort of ok story. Grab some things that are being thrown at you. solve one puzzle. Watch the long ass end video.

Do not buy it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992371273', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 98, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 98, 'last_played': 1481679365}
review:
This game is a great example of where vr games should be heading in the future. it is not the "stand still and shoot stuff coming at you" kind of game you often find today.

pros:
- looks good
- well done inventory
- step of an edge and you actually fall down (yes of course i tried it)
- controls are intuitive
- wtf ending makes you want more
- decent story ...

cons:
- ... that you have to look for (think bioshock 1 audiologs)
- the rest of the sound isnt dimmed when listening to a tape
- short (about 90 minutes)
- sometimes the collision detection (for the floor) gets confused and you bounce up and down
- price (although its fair to say, that the vr market is very small today and almost all games are still a lot more expensive compared to non vr games)

if you are looking for a game thats more than just point and shoot or a reflex test this game is well worth a look.
i finished it once and i will definetly play it again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198144330896', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 265, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 170, 'last_played': 1509337148}

author: {'steamid': '76561198138945477', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 160, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 124, 'last_played': 1482019736}

author: {'steamid': '76561197973003924', 'num_games_owned': 309, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 162, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 80, 'last_played': 1490961070}
review:
A great example of how VR games should be made.
Nice interaction options, fancy graphics and an interesting story!

author: {'steamid': '76561197978133681', 'num_games_owned': 1056, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 161, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 118, 'last_played': 1524356881}
review:
I absolutely love this game. The inventory system is fluid and intuitive, the puzzles were difficult but not frustrating and the VR movement ("blink") meshed well with the design of the puzze spaces. The production values are among the best I've seen in a VR title.
The plot of the game doesn't move very far along, and there are mechanics that are hinted at, but not explored. And while this was a short experience it left me wanting more. 
 I'm very excited about the prospect of episode 2!

author: {'steamid': '76561197970327587', 'num_games_owned': 3369, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 143, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 143, 'last_played': 1481677661}
review: A 2 hour VR experience that represents room-scale done right and sets the stage for narrative exeriences in VR. The fairly simple puzzle and discovery game mechanics are bolstered by a no-cutscene approach to storytelling while excellent visual and sound direction lend to the atmosphere. Recommended for all Vive owners.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993567904', 'num_games_owned': 240, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 143, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 143, 'last_played': 1478993462}
review:
One of the best VR games to date. It's a nice adventure game with puzzle elements, interesting story and just the right dark atmosphere without being scary. Rather short play-through though, can't wait for the next episodes!

Locomotion is great: Blink teleportation with the possibility to rotate the play space.

author: {'steamid': '76561198348724717', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 476, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 471, 'last_played': 1512201006}
review: this game is amazing, very nice graphic and rich story, buy this game you cannot go wrong for Vive user, because of the room scale. actually this is my first VR game, it comes with Vive I purchased. after I played couple of games, this game still the one of the best in my list. just because of the experience and story line. I play this game very smooth except the first chapter I spend a little bit more time to guess out the "3B on the B" I missed the Bell on the wall, other than that very straight finish and enjoy. again I strong recommend this game for the price you wont go wrong. it worth every penny. I usually not write reviews and this is my first review on Steam, the reason just simply this game so great and I tell myself should spend times for this review just for appreicated.

author: {'steamid': '76561198094045630', 'num_games_owned': 138, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 171, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 42, 'last_played': 1513387457}
review: freaking amazing

author: {'steamid': '76561197965386123', 'num_games_owned': 261, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 198, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 145, 'last_played': 1488245156}
review:
De momento este es el mejor "juego" al que he jugado. Digo "juego" entre comillas porque es mas una historia interactiva que un juego. 
El la RV hay que reinventar y estas 2 horitas que he pasado han sido muy buenas.
Este juego venia con el Vive incluido, no he pagado.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970520926', 'num_games_owned': 212, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 167, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 121, 'last_played': 1543708227}
review: I don't generally write reviews, but this game was a total trip to experience. It's a little on the short side, but the experience was amazing.It's a very well done game, and I usually hate puzzle games. As far as I'm concerned it was money well spent. Next up, I need to get my wife to take a run in it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961212946', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 39, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 39, 'last_played': 1481383285}

author: {'steamid': '76561197994528483', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 111, 'last_played': 1481239762}
review:
I really enjoyed the game, found it to have almost a half life like feel to it at times (minus the shooting).
Probably wouldn't have tried it if it wasn't for being free with the VIVE, but I'd say its definitely worth the 15£ that their are asking for.
Replay-ability for the achievements but other then that I would probably leave it a long while before playing it again.
Looking forward to more tbh, hopefully soon.

author: {'steamid': '76561198168121338', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 366, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 129, 'last_played': 1588814270}

author: {'steamid': '76561198349743429', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 42, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 42, 'last_played': 1481312218}

author: {'steamid': '76561198052113424', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 153, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 131, 'last_played': 1558811131}
review: Not sure if this is worth the money, but this is so far the best VR experience I have had. I truly felt like I was in another world. Also, the visuals are stunning.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116970475', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 158, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 158, 'last_played': 1481176283}
review:
This has to be the best experience I have had in VR yet. I'm so glad this came free with the Vive because otherwise I would have been skeptical on it's premise. Boy was I wrong. 

If anyone didn't get this game free with their Vive, I highly recommned that you get this game. It's short, but completely worth it. 

I can't wait for the sequel.

author: {'steamid': '76561198292691963', 'num_games_owned': 824, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 170, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 170, 'last_played': 1481324105}
review: Interesting

author: {'steamid': '76561198110444098', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 142, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 142, 'last_played': 1481166103}
review: So far, this has been the VR game/experience I've enjoyed the most. There's something really charming and adventurous about the world you find yourself immersed in, and it also gets quite psychedelic towards the end which I'm a big fan of. Of course, it's painfully short, but all VR titles are right now. Overall this is def a good puzzle experience. Recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198120830756', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 263, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 263, 'last_played': 1481158714}
review:
I've just finished the game (in a couple of hours) and I thought it's amazing. The graphics, the concept, the puzzles, the narrative, basically everything is very well done, so short but  so nice, surely one of the best games for the Vive so far. It stands out even against Arizona Sunshine, and that one is also a nice game, very new too.

I can't understand however, where is the sequel (episode 2) for "The Gallery" ???

author: {'steamid': '76561198021000922', 'num_games_owned': 463, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 150, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 150, 'last_played': 1463418722}

author: {'steamid': '76561198016109660', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 118, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 101, 'last_played': 1482023648}
review:
played about 24 titles on Vive so far. this is hands down the best. 

looks, sounds, and plays like a full on AAA title from big budget studio. full immersion and ingenius use of Vive. cant wait for more. love that the graphics are adjustable. at max settings my system struggles, but i can set it pretty high and it looks great.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043190287', 'num_games_owned': 326, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 461, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 72, 'last_played': 1482464580}
review:
I don't write a lot of reviews, so I'd emphasize this one
Cons: It's short
Pros: It's an experiance WORTH having (even at 20$, or more realistically on sale. It's steam)
You bought a vive, paid the big up front cost. It's worth having this experiance, and you can share it
and its just...amazing
Movement is fun, while some dislike the blink I find it far superior to point-and-click teleport, it's more immersive and takes me where i want to go easily
The physics are fun to play with (fireworks <3)
the story is enough that I'll probably get episode 2 as soon as its out
It is just fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997982221', 'num_games_owned': 109, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 117, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 108, 'last_played': 1481051833}
review:
I loved playing it but finished it from start to end in about 1,5 hours. So i dont think it is worth 20 euro and will not buy sequels if they cost the same amount of money. Its just to expensive to pay 10+ euro for each hour. So lets see what the next episodes will cost :-) 

Altrough pricy it really looks nice (not graphically amazing but really intense!

So no i do not recommend paying 20 euro for a game you finish in max 2 hours. Yes i do recommend this game if it was less expensive or had a longer story.

author: {'steamid': '76561198184522275', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 21, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1480760676}
review:
Un juego muy cuidado y estudiado para ser usado en rv. Desde el tutorial te das cuenta que esta todo muy trabajado.
Si eres español, no lo compres, no te enteraras de nada ya que todo esta en ingles y en este tipo de juegos eso es un detalle muy feo.

If you are Spanish, do not buy it, without subtitles in Spanish this game is not worth anything.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000047955', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 118, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 118, 'last_played': 1480982956}
review:
I'd say, as VR gaming continues to evolve this feels like a natural way to go. Almost got a little Monkey Island feeling at a few times, but without all the fun that made MI funny. This is much more serious. Some stuff like inventory feels very thought through with a great backpack solution, which is a little tricky the first minutes, but then you get a hang of it.

With that said, for an episode - it's short. Like, last night I started out just before midnight and got to bed after beating it by 01:30. And I didn't rush I can tell you that. In a replay I'd do it in like 30 minutes. 

Some game mechanics needs a little work if I'm gonna state my opinion. Movement isn't that easy to grasp in the beginning. You gotta give it like half an hour before you can really get your head around how to keep your IRL north true to game north. There was like 20 times I had to check outside my Vive just to see where the heck I was facing.

Also, when getting many items to juggle with, the backpack and hands gets to work alot. And when using flashlights and listening to tapes and stuff, your hands get crowded, and it feels kind of awkward. 

If you, like me, got it for free - by all means try it. 
If you want to buy it, and have played alot, you might be disappointed in one way or another.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998918994', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 155, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 70, 'last_played': 1591520779}
review: This was a fun experience. The teleportation takes some getting use to but the UI is great overall. I look forward to the next Episode. $20 might be a push unless the price also includes future episodes but I received it bundled with the Vive.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997378050', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 91, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 91, 'last_played': 1480895706}
review:
Wow. As far as puzzle games go, this one was pretty cool. Object interaction is good.

Beware that if the ground is uneven and you turn, the camera has the tendency to move either up or down as it's trying to change your vertical position in the world (it seems). Quickly induces nausea. 

The story is very interesting...but I wish the game had gone farther. I messed around with stuff and still got it done in 1.5 hours. If it hadn't come for free with the Vive, I'd be pretty pissed. I understand this stuff is hard to develop for, but come on! $20 per game, they say 4 episodes total...that'd be $80 for what amounts to a full game!

Will I buy episode 2? Maybe...but episode 1 ending left me with more questions than I've had since Lost aired on NBC. 

Unfortunately these short games seem to be all the rage in VR right now, so hopefully in the future we'll start seeing things a bit more fleshed out as studios get more and more comfortable with the dev cycle. I'm recommending this because 1) It was free 2) the story is interesting 3) gameplay has a lot of promise

author: {'steamid': '76561197970664089', 'num_games_owned': 538, 'num_reviews': 219, 'playtime_forever': 196, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 158, 'last_played': 1483146693}
review: The most well-made game I've found for the Vive. A must-play.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991942615', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 106, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 106, 'last_played': 1480901634}
review:
Sadly I can't recommend this game for it's current length and price. The game is beautiful and flows nicely, and has some interesting puzzles, but for $20 for a game I finished in under 90 minutes without rushing just doesn’t scream worth to me. In addition it’s episodic so I assume that the rest of the games are going to be like this as well. 

A lot of the reviews are saying the story is great, but considering the game is 90 mins and you barely do much I don’t see much story at all. The few characters you meet aren’t that exciting, and at best it leaves off way too open ended. Maybe if all the episodes come out at once in a decent bundle price it’d be worth considering, but for now I can’t recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046389621', 'num_games_owned': 1091, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 134, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 134, 'last_played': 1480826851}
review:
TL;DR: The game is overall pretty good, but is way too short to be worth 20 € in my opinion (and I'll be unsure about 10 € too). I call this a demo. I played longer demos in the past.

I got this for free with my vive, but i was left kind of disappointed. There are some really great mechanics (like the inventory management), but, while playing, I often felt like the experience was "stretched". VR is a new media and I was unsure if that was the case, but as the game ended quickly, I'm now pretty sure it was intentional.
As an example, the tutorial felt way longer than needed. Ok, I did play other experiences before, but then again there's no need for me to smash every single botte. The Lab just tells you how to teleport and grab stuff and you are done. Felt like they really wanted me to be ready before jumping into action, so I did take my time to ensure I was ready. Except, there is no action at all in the whole game so you have plenty of time to practice later in a non-time-critical environment. There are many more examples but I will just stop here to avoid spoilers.

I really cannot suggest this to anyone at this price. A few really easy puzzles, lots of teleporting, a huge deal of standing still and listening (good voice acting, though). I really took my time looking around, checked pretty much everything out, played a lot with useless objects (example I spent a good 15 minutes playing with an hammer inside the magnetic field), and still did a full run in under 2 hours.

I may be interested in the next episode, but I'll wait for other people's reviews, and no way I'd spend 20 € for an experience like this. Pretty well done, but there is already way better and longer stuff to do in VR for this price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198295790052', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 165, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 129, 'last_played': 1482850501}
review:
Just finished Episode 1. Amazing!
Everything is really well done. The puzzles are on the right level to not stop you from progressing but still need to figure for a while. The environments are nice, especially further on and the ending of the episode was really cool. 
Can't wait for episode 2 - will be a certain buy for me, once released!
Polished all around!

Going to go back and do all achivements as well to get some more hours out of the game. 

Well done everyone involved in making this game!

author: {'steamid': '76561197965045571', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 151, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 151, 'last_played': 1473822342}
review:

Great atmosphere

author: {'steamid': '76561197970739973', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 16, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1480764583}
review: The "blink" teleport movement mechanic is a terrible alternative to the usual point and click teleport. I do like that it includes the ability to rotate your heading during the teleport, but the controls for that are confusing/poory explained. (I expected the arrow to point in the direction my north would end up at. Instead, it's rwlative to your current facing so it's not really possible to move and rotate to the desired facing without some mental gymnastics.)

author: {'steamid': '76561197975314706', 'num_games_owned': 349, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 153, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 153, 'last_played': 1480843379}
review:
I usually do not post reviews, but in this case had to. 

Got this included in the vive when I purchased it a few months ago, but forgot about trying it out till today. Wish had done so sooner. 

The graphics are fairly good, mechanics fairly good, story line could use some tweaking but the ending is great. 

And tha tis one gripe with this. The ending comes much to soon. 

Well that and when I jumped to grab a fuse, forgot I had a low ceiling. Thats how immersive it is. 

Good game.

review: Fun game. Starts off slow then picks up speed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031008673', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 162, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 162, 'last_played': 1480798301}
review: This game was ok. If it weren't for the stunning visuals and world interaction I would have given this a bad review. The story is short and not particularly compelling. The puzzles are more random or tedious than interesting but the production quality is good. This game is also very light on content.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008985600', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 296, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 132, 'last_played': 1658040276}
review: I don't normally give reviews and I have just purchased the Vive to see what it was all about. Let me tell you what if you are looking for an experience this game is definitely the one for you. I have played a few other VR games, but none of them give you the indepth hands on experience as this game does. I had to take my headset off a few times to remember where I actually was. Only thing I was disappointed about was the fact that I have to wait till the next episode. These Devs are doing an amazing job with this game and look forward to seeing what happens next! CHEERS!

author: {'steamid': '76561197983270366', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 290, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 105, 'last_played': 1555210897}
review: Fantastic look into what a VR RPG could be in the future. Was disappointed when it ended, can't wait for episode 2.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010021225', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 293, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 240, 'last_played': 1697268180}
review: This is the best experience I have had on the vive yet! I say experience cus it's hard to compare something so immersive and unique to a video game. My only critique is that it is way too short. That aside I would suggest anyone with a HTC Vive to get this and play through the two hour story. I can't wait till ep. 2 releases

author: {'steamid': '76561198041939996', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 128, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 128, 'last_played': 1480731935}
review: The production quality on this game was fantastic! Extremely well done with lots of great dialogue and a few little puzzles to figure out. Can't wait for the next one!

author: {'steamid': '76561198293933565', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 112, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 112, 'last_played': 1480670254}
review: This came with my Vive, but I would gladly pay $20 for it. Little to no replay value, but incredibly immersive and a great first chapter of the story. I'm very excited to see where it goes from here!

author: {'steamid': '76561197993348045', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 149, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 149, 'last_played': 1480795287}
review: I've played a small handful of VR games and The Gallery has really stood out on it's own as an amazing use of virtual reality.  Using the HMD for tracking your teleport movements is incredibly easy to acclimate to. I also thought the backpack inventory was wonderfully done and I hope to see similar implementations by future developers as it is a really good way to manage items in a vr game. I look forward to ep2.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975275284', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 275, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 192, 'last_played': 1524967809}

author: {'steamid': '76561197980567939', 'num_games_owned': 1059, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 108, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 95, 'last_played': 1495718638}

author: {'steamid': '76561198047524528', 'num_games_owned': 883, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 126, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 126, 'last_played': 1473656195}

author: {'steamid': '76561198063799018', 'num_games_owned': 621, 'num_reviews': 160, 'playtime_forever': 233, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 217, 'last_played': 1480779457}
review:
This game really shows how to create a "real" game in VR. Cannot wait to see how it continues! I love the more story and less gameplay driven approach, this works really well in VR. Graphics is among the best I've seen in VR games so far, and although I find the movement ("blink") a bit awkward, controls in general are very well implemented.
It's just way too short!

author: {'steamid': '76561198038212838', 'num_games_owned': 179, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 109, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 109, 'last_played': 1480309131}

author: {'steamid': '76561198030788633', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 125, 'last_played': 1480283773}

author: {'steamid': '76561198023998166', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 160, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 122, 'last_played': 1557193747}

author: {'steamid': '76561198101305188', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 259, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 166, 'last_played': 1623764649}
review: This changed the way i viewed exploration and puzzle solvers in a way like Myst and Riven opened my eyes before, please please please hurry Heart Of The Emberstone i cannot wait!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198021236894', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 100, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 100, 'last_played': 1477651554}
review:
* Very short game (done in less than two hours, even explored the levels a lot)
* The small number of puzzles that were present weren't great, only one was a true puzzle (the lock), the rest were simple  'do this', 'plug this in' or 'shoot that' actions.
* Story is pretty generic/bland, ended up rolling my eyes a bit too many times
* Pricy. If I didn't get this free with the Vive, there's no way this would be worth 20USD.

Literally the only thing going for this game is the fact that it's the only 'walking' simulator available for VR.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022914015', 'num_games_owned': 854, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 160, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 111, 'last_played': 1603045350}
review:
Offert avec le HTC Vive
Très bonne imersion mais se qui serai bien c'est après la VR il fasse la VF ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561197987739383', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 132, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 132, 'last_played': 1475378504}
review: The game is a huge step in the right direction for VR puzzle and adventure games. It feels like a handcrafted experience all the way through. It's not perfect but it got so many things right in such an uncharted territory that it may as well be. I'm sure that there will be better VR games like this in the future but if you talk to the developers I'll bet you that they will tell you they got a lot of inspiration and direction from The Gallery.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076541317', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 217, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 217, 'last_played': 1480138972}
review: Es el primer juego de VR que termino, para un jugador experimentado puede ser bastante corto, para mi que es la primera vez me resultó muy inmersivo y claro que espero la segunda parte. Lo recomiendo, me vino gratis en la compra del Vive, pero sin duda compraré el segundo episodio.

author: {'steamid': '76561198346302454', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 173, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 107, 'last_played': 1482385026}
review: I got this game for free when I purchased the Vive.  I give it a thumbs down because the game itself is really short (I beat it in 1 hour 47 minutes).  It was fun in some ways, and some of the effects were pretty cool, but I dont think I'd personally play it again.  $20 is the retail price for this, and I doubt I'd pay $20 for Episode 2.  Maybe $20 for Episodes 1-6 would be worth $15-20.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971269384', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 300, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 287, 'last_played': 1482899380}
review:
Call of the Starseed provides an interesting story, well told, and the puzzles and level of interactivity make it more than a walk-em-up. It's gives you an idea of where VR can take us in terms of story telling and it has a great pay off. The game is perhaps a little short - although it's longer than many other VR games. 

I hope there are more episodes to come, because it leaves you wanting more.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004695071', 'num_games_owned': 355, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 372, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 372, 'last_played': 1466574573}

author: {'steamid': '76561197969492323', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 305, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 194, 'last_played': 1534695831}

author: {'steamid': '76561197997702847', 'num_games_owned': 394, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 27, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 27, 'last_played': 1479854815}
review: Amazingly immersive experience!

author: {'steamid': '76561198063563156', 'num_games_owned': 5134, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1192, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 991, 'last_played': 1497668209}
review:
One of the best VR games to date, it is a VR adventure game done right, with fabulous visuals, room scale movement smoothly mixed with blink control for larger steps, and a great atmosphere. It is only the first part of a larger story, which leads to the first negative: it is a fairly short game. You'll likely spend more time just exploring the surroundings, but for a play-and-finish type, it isn't as long as it should be. The second negative, is that there aren't really that many puzzles. It's more about exploration and some minor manipulation, with only a handful of spots where you might have to think your way through to a solution (and there are generally clues scattered about to make it even easier).

Make no mistake, though: this is still a great VR experience, way ahead of most of the competition, released at the same time the headsets went commercial (more-or-less). Also, as part 1 of 4 (or 5?), it is hopefully setting up even better games to come...

author: {'steamid': '76561197971508566', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 109, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 109, 'last_played': 1477082714}
review:
This game is simply fantastic!

It introduces the amazing possibilities of VR with an engaging story and amazing surroundings. The interactivity of objects with the Vive Controllers is spot on and the puzzles/challenges make for a really great experience. 

Highly recommended - I can't wait for the next episodes.

review: This Game Showcases the VIVE amazingly well. with excellent scenery, puzzles, movement, control and stunning visuals to boot! This is deffinetly a game I will be showing off to my friends. Also, the story is MINDBLOWING!!! i can not wait to get into part 2!

author: {'steamid': '76561198033528349', 'num_games_owned': 246, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 193, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 193, 'last_played': 1479907293}
review:
Overall its the best VR game I played so far. Very realistic, epic animations and scenes. But why I voted thumb down? The stuff which you see in the trailer is the END of the game. So you can't continue after you received your gift. Also I played the game within 2 hours. (Without watching any tutorials or videos about that game before and while I was playing). The puzzels are too easy. They even give you hints, so that you can solve it even faster.

It is worth to buy it, but not for 20$. 2 hours of gameplay is not worth that. It actually feels like a demo

author: {'steamid': '76561197976519916', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 133, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 133, 'last_played': 1479682330}
review:
Core i5 2500k, GTX 970, 16GB DDR3, HTC Vive

Runs smoothly on my hardware.

I can see this becoming a well known VR RPGs.  The story is engaging, and I find myself longing for the next episode now that I've finished it.  Figuring out a couple of the puzzles might be difficult, but I can promise you that it's doable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067911350', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 243, 'playtime_forever': 222, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 177, 'last_played': 1482881067}

author: {'steamid': '76561198020353001', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 656, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 352, 'last_played': 1508521486}
review: I received this game as part of a software bundle when I purchased my Vive and I can see why. This game showcases the immersion of VR. The blink teleport is the best I've seen. I especially like how you can rotate the volume and precisely control where to teleport. I wish every other game had this now. It really enhances the immersion as you can walk the entire game as if you were actually in it by walking back and forth in your play space and just rotating when required. The graphics, physics and lighting are AAA. I Always to look forward to playing and replaying this title. Can't wait for the next episode!

author: {'steamid': '76561198322374745', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 171, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 171, 'last_played': 1479343815}
review: Very cool game/experience.  I took my time to explore and take in the as much of the world as I could explore.  The entire experience lasted about two hours.   I got a tad lost with the story line but it apparenlty wasn't vital to reaching the end.  Speaking of the end: very cool experience.  Overall, the game isn't very re-playable and the price may seem steep for a game you'll spend 2 hours in, but a lot of effort and thought went into this and I'd say it's a fair price vis-a-vis the other VR experiences out there right now.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040739737', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 50, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1478236202}

author: {'steamid': '76561197999226832', 'num_games_owned': 1306, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 926, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 179, 'last_played': 1663000041}
review: After having a second go at this, after having set my lighttowers up correctly so I wasn't fighting the controllers, I played it all the way through and it's probably my favourite VR experience so far. I particularly like the blink mechanic and being able to realign your playspace in the virtual world. Super excited for the next episode.

author: {'steamid': '76561198137218479', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 239, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 239, 'last_played': 1466483051}
review:
Absolutely awesome. A few glitches but nothing worse than a non-VR game. Intuitive controls. Interesting tasks and puzzles (although nothing particularly difficult). Captivating story. Good controls.

The game reminded me of a Myst-lite type experience but in VR. The only issues are not game specific and are problems with everything in VR (motion/teleporting problems, room-scale problems, graphical fidelity, etc.) and those they handled better than most games.

My only hope for the next installments is that they present progressively more difficult tasks. Since there isn't a death mechanism the difficulty of tasks is going to be key for replayability.

review: One of the best games I've ever played and yes a large part of that is because it's one of the first VR games I've played but also because it uses that VR so well and also because it's simply a great begining to a story I can't wait to play more of. The ending is simply an amazing VR experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198100158765', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 81, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 81, 'last_played': 1478461845}
review:
Got this free with the VIVE. Its a fun game, with a few interesting but simple puzzles to work through. Looks promising, and then thats it, done, finished.

With this looking like its going to be released in 'episodes' There could be a long wait inbetween, and then having to buy the next one, and the next one, and the next one. With it being free I would reccomend it, just be aware that you are not getting a full game, more of an expensive 90 minute demo for what could be.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029571343', 'num_games_owned': 135, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 192, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 144, 'last_played': 1478471126}
review:
I had no real exceptations when I started to play this title. It was free to play for my new Vive and I thought I'll test it out as the other free 2 play titles. But damn it got me immediately hooked. 

The tutorial shows you the simple to use controls and how to "blink" (teleporting allowing you to move further , but still only within your line of sight) in a good way allowing  for a smooth ride that makes it fun to explore and expirence the wonderful world around you.

The world is pretty detailed and allows interaction with enough things to make it fun to just stay and play around for a while at certain spots.

The story is interesting and it unfolds in a good way, giving enough hints to let you move along at a good pace but still leaves some things to figure out by yourself. To a pretty large degree it's puzzel solving that takes you to the next step, and in there was no fighting at all in this episode, but it was not needed to get you you excited and build up a tense feeling.

This was simply a great first episode of a game that I hope will continue to provide as great episodes, but that hopefully are a bit longer (I played this episode from start to end in less than an hour). It really made me want to buy the next episode, not only to contue to explore, but also to see how the story unfolds (it hints of a quite different direction, but that might not be a bad thing if the game play and environment is of the same quality as in this first episode).

I do strongly recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972838486', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 122, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 122, 'last_played': 1471805403}
review:
My decision not to recommend has a lot to do with price. It feels like a polished tech demo that was stretched long enough to call it a game, and just barely reaching outside of the two hour window Steam gives you to return a game.

Pros:
* Runs decently on the Vive
* Looks and sounds great, and has decent immersion
* The bag interface is novel, and the tapes for saving are a good innovation
* The voice work is very professional

Cons:
* For the price of USD$19.99 it is too short at ~2 hours.
* The writing is really nothing special. It actually kinda bugged me. It would have been utterly tedious if the voice work wasn't so good
* I can remember about 4 actual puzzles. The rest were find-thing, use-thing-with-thing

If the price went down to USD$9.99 I could give it a recommendation. Short polished games are in no way a bad thing, if priced right. I'm still meh on the writing and puzzles, which are the most important parts of an adventure game, but technically it looks and feels great.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993813979', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 107, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 100, 'last_played': 1478316170}
review:
$20 is a steep price to pay for what little time you spend in this game. $15 would be a fair amount seeing as this is episode 1 and the developer will be charging for the new episodes to come.

At first the game was very glitchy and stuttered constantly, but those issues seem to be resolved now and it is a solid Intorductory Chapter to what will be a fantastic story. The graphics are very nice and the immersion is definitely there. I esspecially liked the fuse puzzle whch is saying something since I don't go for puzzle games normally.

I am still sceptical, however, since the original price was (I believe) around $30. I will not be paying $30 per episode to complete this journey. For those that argue that it is a small developer and they need the money, just remember that this game comes with the Vive now. Which means they recieved some sort of lump sum on top of all the purchases from the early adopters.

I really look forward to episode 2, but if it carries the same price tag there should be much more content.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995861028', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 104, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 104, 'last_played': 1478320075}
review: Fun game. Finished it in 100 minutes without reading any reviews or tutorials (so pretty short). The puzzles remind me of Myst. Take the game time into consideration when considering the cost.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038051248', 'num_games_owned': 134, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 239, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 134, 'last_played': 1484507759}
review: Very nice!

review: It came free with the Vive for me but I would of paid £14.99 for it any day! Polished game, Tracking and interaction is perfect. This game shows a bright future in VR!!! EP02!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561197978614434', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 182, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 158, 'last_played': 1465662002}
review: VR is not perfect, but the inventory system is great. Has some puzzles that really make you appreciate VR.

author: {'steamid': '76561197962128575', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 123, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 123, 'last_played': 1478117458}
review:
Short (2-3 hrs) but so, so sweet. Very polished from start to end, intuitive and "realistic" game mechanics (like pulling your backpack from your shoulder) and especially the last chapter really leaves you awestruck and wanting more. Bet I looked ridiculous standing in the middle of the room with an open mouth for 5 minutes...

A few things could be improved (e.g. some kind of collision for things in your hand and a bit more to explore aside from the main story), but nonetheless a must-have for the Vive!
For about 20 USD/EUR (new regular price) I enjoyed it very much while it lasted and am happy to support the developers in making more episodes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001930184', 'num_games_owned': 72, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 271, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 271, 'last_played': 1477928908}
review:
Good game, good graphics and mostly good puzzles. Downside is it doesn't take long too complete.

My one crticism is no consideration for coloured blind people in one of the puzzle. If you have to involve colours why cant they be bright blue, orange, white and black.  But apart from the colour thing and being too short, overall a good game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012141232', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 336, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 239, 'last_played': 1514748364}
review:
This came bundled with the HTC Vive I purchased, so after The Lab was one of the first VR games I have played.

This does bring with it one negative effect, which is that having started on this game, it kinda ruined all other following games as not a single one has been as immersive or as enjoyable as this one.

This really is something special.  Things such as actually picking up a piece of paper, then finding it's too dark to read and so picking up a candle and holding it all at an angle so that the light falls naturally on the text such that you can read it - this sounds so mundane, but it really is brilliant.  Everything you do feels so natural, even the superb mechanic of reaching over your shoulder to get your inventory backpack is so well thought out.  The graphics are not hyper-realistic - although they are extremely good - but with all these little well thought out interactions and mechanics you really do feel fully immersed in the game world.  Like other gamers I am sure, I have been so immersed on occasion that I have fallen foul of leaning on an imaginary object and almost falling to the floor - which I imagine is most amusing to the outside observer of me playing!

I don't think I have ever been more exited waiting for a second part/sequel to a game to come out.  I cannot praise this enough.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975728643', 'num_games_owned': 63, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1815, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1072, 'last_played': 1656975338}
review:
Genau dafür ist VR gemacht...

gleich als ich das Tutorial hinter mir hatte wußte ich das sich da Jemand mächtig ins Zeug gelegt hat,
da kamen Erinnerungen zu "Half-Life 1" auf...Habe damals das Intro von "Half-Life 1" bei einen Freund gesehen
und wußte: "Genau das ist es was ich will !"
Sehr gute Soundeffekte passend zum Spielgeschehen und eine virtuelle Welt mit guter Grafik und Interaktivität,
die Steuerung ist unprobelmatisch und schnell in "Fleisch & Blut" übergegangen.
Die Story ist gut und löst eine Stimmung aus Neugier und Unbehagen aus was einen da wohl erwartet, 
die Rätsel nicht zu schwer so das Frust aufkommen würde.

Doch das wichtigste für mich ist wenn man merkt das es gelungen ist "Leidenschaft" in das 
Produkt zu packen, es sind viele Kleinigkeiten die so etwas ausmachen können...
Hier merkt man einfach das Jemand bzw. ein Team für eine Sache "gebrannt hat" von der Idee bis zur
Umsetzung.
Habe jetzt 19.99€ bezahlt und das geht in Ordnung für den Umfang und Spieldauer.

Absolute Empfehlung von mir und hoffentlich bald mehr davon...
Übrigens...Ich mag den "Tony Talkman" ;-)

Update 16.04.17
Mittlerweile lese ich immer mehr negative Bewertungen wegen der Preis-Leistunggestaltung...
Das kann ich nicht wirklich verstehen wer 800€ und mehr für eines der ersten VR-Systeme ausgibt und sich dann über 19,99 € aufregt wegen der zu kurzen Spieldauer. Das ganze ist ja eh noch in den "Kinderschuhen", in 10 Jahren wird man wahrscheinlich über die 1. HTC-VIVE müde lächeln.
Wenn ich überlege was man sonst so für 20€ bekommt habe ich keine Bauchschmerzen damit...

author: {'steamid': '76561197961197501', 'num_games_owned': 170, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 901, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 901, 'last_played': 1478580359}

author: {'steamid': '76561198024921789', 'num_games_owned': 399, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 143, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 143, 'last_played': 1477419011}
review: The best VR experience I have had thus far. It brings in great story telling, interactive cinematics, great voice acting, awesome puzzles that were challenging but not impossible. There weren't any bugs, and the sound design was amazing. I can't wait for the next episode. The gallery is exactly what VR needs and when we start seeing this at a bigger scale, it'll be the go to for VR enthusiasts.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960830998', 'num_games_owned': 926, 'num_reviews': 264, 'playtime_forever': 253, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 196, 'last_played': 1606074811}
review:
A short but really sweet initial entry into the series.. 

I have to add that the difference between a GTX 970 and 1080 is out of the ballpark on this game - it really shines on high end hardware , not to say its bad on the minimum either!

Imagine an old school style point and click adventure, adapted for room scale in a walk able 360 degree world where you interact directly with the objects instead of "combine, examine" etc.

Some great little puzzles, I have to admit to resorting to the web when stuck on the beach with the 3 B's to the B - and suggest that you don't! I regret not getting the achievement of working it out.

The game builds really nicely and has a brilliant final level that has me begging for more .... Come on! Bring on Episode 2 already!

author: {'steamid': '76561198012640010', 'num_games_owned': 1138, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 218, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 177, 'last_played': 1483741704}
review:
Absolutna RE-WE-LA-CJA, po ktorej dlugo nie moglem podniesc szczeki z podlogi. Gra robi swietny uzytek z technologii VR, z mysla o ktorej od samego poczatku zostala zaprojektowana. Gatunkowo to tylko prosta przygodowka z kilkoma niezbyt skomplikowanymi zagadkami i delikatnym feelingiem a'la Myst, ale ze akcje ogladamy z perspektywy pierwszej osoby w VR, to imersja jest niesamowita i wrazenia spotegowane.

Tytul zaczyna sie powoli, chodzimy sobie po okolicy, znajdujemy rozne przedmioty i staramy sie znalezc sposob na dostanie sie do kolejnej lokacji. Kiedy juz sie to nam uda, sceneria i klimat gry ulegaja sporej zmianie, a fabula robi sie bardziej tajemnicza. Spacer po kolana w wodzie w plataninie ciemnych korytarzy roswietlanych tylko swiatlem latarki w kanalach w VR robi spore wrazenie, a nastepne lokacje tylko poglebiaja i tak juz spora imersje. Sama koncowka to majstersztyk, ktory zrobil na mnie na tyle duze wrazenie, ze napisy konczace Call of the Starsteed zdarzyly sobie spokojnie w calosci przeleciec, a ja dalej stalem posrodku pokoju z goglami na glowie.

Warto wspomniec, ze kompozytorem muzyki w tej grze jest Jeremy Soule, autor oprawy muzycznej w takich glosnych tytulach jak Skyrim, Oblivion, Morrowind, Dungeon Siege, Guild Wars i kilkunastu innych.

Jest to pozycja obowiazkowa dla posiadaczy gogli VR, swietny tytul oferujacy niesamowite wrazenia, ktory z czystym sumieniem polecam.

author: {'steamid': '76561198150339077', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 569, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 74, 'last_played': 1513644386}

author: {'steamid': '76561197972416553', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 253, 'playtime_forever': 404, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 260, 'last_played': 1501933616}
review:
Wow... just wow... for fans of adventure, half life, just buy it now.

Long story:

I bought this game when it first came out, and had to refund it as it was stuttering like crazy no matter what I did. I left a negative review. I just bought it again now that the price has been lowered. I am blown away.

This is AAA. It starts of rather slow, and seems very cute but nothing to fancy. But by the time this game gets going, there are some trully stunning areas to explore and all running super smooth on my system, enabling some real presence. The issue is, by the time my jaw was hitting the floor, it was over!

I can understand the reason this got some negative reviews however. Even though the last puzzle made me think and I found it very fun, it was basically one of only two puzzles in the entire game. It is also very short... but the quality more than makes up for it in my eyes... this is AAA quality in a bite size package.

Anyway, easily the best game on Vive yet, and it was one of the first. I can't wait to see this slowly become a full game via the future chapters, and will be gladly investing in Cloudheads future work.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009368508', 'num_games_owned': 427, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 330, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 171, 'last_played': 1510593515}
review:
This game is amazing, truly. It's the best VR game I've ever played. Some people call it pricey, because it's quite short - but you have to play this game, if you can. It's worth it. The graphics are nice and it runs well on old graphics cards. The attention to detail is staggering - I put a sea-shell to my ear and heard the ocean! Voice acting is great, the story is very interesting, the mood is fantastic. Jeremy Soule made the music for it, and it's very good as well. 

Additionally, this game on the HTC Vive is one of the first to make me forget that I was in fact standing in my little bedroom with wonky googles on.

I don't have many complaints. Normally I dislike teleport mechanics in VR games, but it serves this game well, honestly. I encountered one bug total (an elevator left without me), but it self-repaired.

If you have a VR device, or a friend who owns one - you HAVE to play this game. It's worth twice its cost.

review:
游戏就一共2个解谜，剧情？什么是剧情？两个小时通关，还让我因为眩晕重头玩了第一章(其他VR游戏都没有过，甚至On Ward)

唯一让我印象深刻的就是最后那个帮主角前往halo的那个老头子撕心裂肺地喊"I gave up everything for this, take me with you"

画质也是渣渣的，主要是采样不够精细，尤其是最后面几个场景，画质和halo 1 一模一样，简直就是回到了十几年前的画质。

author: {'steamid': '76561197970724214', 'num_games_owned': 1526, 'num_reviews': 189, 'playtime_forever': 230, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 230, 'last_played': 1477211955}
review:
TL;DR : If it comes free with your Vive, or if you have access to it via family sharing, or can get it for 7 - 10 bucks, go for it. Otherwise, skip it.

The Gallery: Call of the Starseed isn't really a bad "experience", but it's very short and somewhat rudimentary. The main problem is that, just as things are starting to ramp up, the experience is over. The first setting of the game, the beach, has more mini-distractions than the rest of the game put together, which is almost a beeline if you don't count a small maze as a distraction.

The default method of movement is holding down the left track pad and aiming with your vision. Do yourself a favor and switch this to where your pointing with your hand. It's less of a pain in the neck, more accurate, and faster overall. Like many Vive games, Starseed uses a teleportation mechanic, which is fine, but they have an extra "orientation" feature which never really felt intuitive to anyone I showed it to.

The "grab" of the hands is somewhat cumbersome and you'll pick up things you don't mean to if they are near something else, including picking the section of gameplay you want to start from the title menu/desk thing. It seems like it needs to be tightend up a bit.

There aren't many characters in the game, but neither are animated in a compelling way. What's most compelling is the scale in VR- the characters are a little flat in facial expressions to be honest. One character talks almost nonstop and, for some reason, doesn't have any sort of animation for speaking. It kind of kicks immersion in the teeth.

Otherwise, I like the locals, and the fidelity of the locations is very nice. The sounds aren't bad, but not really a whole lot going on. The puzzles are sort of short and simple, nothing that will keep an intelligent person with some coordination busy for too long.

This game's price recently dropped down to $19.99, but honestly this game could be completed in one sitting at a friend's house. I'm interested in upcoming episodes, but they'd need either a lot more content, a lot more "gameplay", or a reduced pricepoint, as $19.99 for this isn't cutting it for me. I could see $9.99, tops, but it's just so short and simple, and the only replay value is completing achievements (most of which are very easy and are done on the first level).

While I would say it's a very worth Vive experience to showcase what it can do, from a buyer's standpoint: consider something with more depth or more replayability unless this game is discounted.

[quote][h1]For more VR reviews, check out the rest on my Steam Curator page:[/h1]
[b][i][url=store.steampowered.com/curator/31930555/]Auburok's VR Reviews[/url][/i][/b][/quote]
