author: {'steamid': '76561197990568842', 'num_games_owned': 332, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 133, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 133, 'last_played': 1475675520}
review:
[EDIT]

I have changed my recommendation to a YES for the game as a result of the updated price of the game.

[/EDIT]

------------------------------------------------------------------------

I actually really enjoyed my experience on Call of the Starseed. I got the game in the Vive bundle (so essentially for free) but at the moment I cannot recommend the game at the price they are currently offering it for - £22.99 for a game that took me two hours to complete, and not all of that two hours is even game play. The ending sequence is quite long winded and story driven (which is fine) but is largely the player doing nothing while stuff (cool stuff!) unfolds around them.

If the developers shed some light on whether or not a purchase of this episode provides further episodes for free, then I might be able to recommend it - especially if they said how many episodes there will be. 

I want to point out, again, that this game was actually very fun and the world was really well crafted and immersive. The inventory was really cool and quite fun to interact with. There's lots of fluff in their game world if you're into it too. The final puzzle in the game is really interesting and brain testing too.

It just comes down to how much you're spending and how long you're getting in the game. There seems to be little reason to want to replay the game - no choices or consequences etc. - so £22.99 for <2 hours of gameplay just isn't viable at the moment. 

On sale or as a free game it is absolutely worth it - and if you got maybe 3/4 further episodes in the series with your purchase of this one at £22.99 (assuming similar lengths) it would absolutely be worth it because then we can assume it's around 10 hours for £22.99 which becomes a bit more worth it on the VR market.

Unfortunately though, negative review until the price is slashed a bit or there is some light shed on further content and how the pricing will work.

I look forward to episode two.

author: {'steamid': '76561198328111865', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 198, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 163, 'last_played': 1476137875}
review: This is very impressive, if possibly a little short. For me the OMG moment was when things were being thrown to me and I was actually catching them (some of the time but i'm sure it would be better in room scale) in VR. Some good puzzle elements although I found the first hurdle the hardest and nearly gave up. Only reason I would not recommend this is that the price seems a lot for a bit less than 3 hours game play, of course it's free with the VIVE currently and is a great intro to what is possible.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994481368', 'num_games_owned': 516, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 151, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 151, 'last_played': 1468196353}
review: This game is just a glorified walking simulator, with very little interaction and one tiny... kinda... puzzle... It's not worth the $30, and it's extremely short. The entire gameplay lasted about 10 minutes (and that's adding up every interactable thing that wasn't just moving). The other hour or so was listening to an old guy talk.... waiting, on a lift... waiting... on another lift.... and well, 1 entire level, was just you on a lift...... doing nothing, no one talking... nothing but a lift. If it happens to go on sale for $2 then I would say get it, otherwise, don't waste your money on this over priced walking sim.

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561197970471645', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 184, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 184, 'last_played': 1475429103}
review:
In short, this is what an adventure game in VR should be.

Great use of scale and lighting. The environments are pretty rich and interactive (including objects that don't serve real gameplay purpose), but this does mean that when you actually find an object you want to move and can't, it's disappointing. The story is just getting started so I don't know whether it'll be a selling point, but it's a good hook so far imo.

The inventory and locomotion systems take just a short while to get used to and then are pretty good. Stowing items over your shoulder and retrieving them from the backpack handles the large inventory cleanly and is more immersive than a menu.

I hope episode 2 is a bit longer and has trickier puzzles but this is a great introduction.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996400647', 'num_games_owned': 245, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 187, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 187, 'last_played': 1475696474}

author: {'steamid': '76561197972848172', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 283, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 253, 'last_played': 1493046213}

author: {'steamid': '76561198017743963', 'num_games_owned': 457, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 350, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 134, 'last_played': 1576956348}

author: {'steamid': '76561198028536166', 'num_games_owned': 1510, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 267, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 189, 'last_played': 1477296288}
review:
This came with the vive, so I didn't spend any extra money with it. I'm putting that before I make one of my biggest points.
Let me start off with overwhelming praise. This was definitely an experience and I loved the ride until the end. The environment was responsive, and the little interactive touches were great fun. It looked great, and I'm a fan of the mysterious ancient machine too. One One of my favorite games is a mobile game, shockingly, called the Room.
It's cheap and offered hours of puzzles in the same mysterious "bigger forces are at work here" way.
In short, I enjoyed the experience, and was severely bummed out when it was over.

All in all, I'm absolutely excited for the next one. The developers have a very interesting story and a very interesting, if short, game. There's some genuine moments that just feel... wow.

Edited: Price reduced by ten dollars. I think that's fair enough, though as my review previously said, I'm absolutely hoping for more content in the sequel. Hanging on the edge of my seat.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993603151', 'num_games_owned': 646, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 207, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 92, 'last_played': 1611347245}

review: This came with my vive and i put off playing it since it was a small story game. But when i got around to playing it i loved it. author: {'steamid': '76561198045356802', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 163, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 92, 'last_played': 1548273213}
review: Well, I'm torn. On the one hand, I'm extremely looking forward to future episodes so it was clearly a good teaser. On the other hand, $30 is a fairly steep price for such a mere teaser that took me only 90 minutes to complete with as much looking around and playing around as I cared to do. I even wasted maybe 10 minutes trying to shoot seagulls. I really hope future episodes offset the cost of the first by either being cheaper or far more involved. I will recommend with high hopes, however, as it left me longing to see where this goes.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978968208', 'num_games_owned': 611, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 336, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 210, 'last_played': 1604127378}
review:
This is THE BEST VR title I've experienced so far, in terms of prescense, mystery and puzzle games go. It's a bit slow and I wasn't a fan of the sewer maze, but the pay off is epic and I can't wait for followup episodes. This game took me 3 hours to complete, but I found myself playing only for 10 minutes here and there until I solved the first puzzle, then really dived in. 

Above average voice acting. Good music, color scheme and advanced teleporting system compared to Valve's "The Lab," in the way that you can select post-teleport facing direction, which is very helpful.

Nice to have chapter select after game completion and I dig the retro tape recorder motions to listen to audilogs.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996559474', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 132, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 95, 'last_played': 1508381799}
review:
I played for 1.5 hours and just didnt feel right about what I paid for it.  The price was way too high despite the fact that it is beautiful and interesting.  There were not that many puzzles and I was done the game in an hour.  Wasnt trying to go fast either.

For a console game price I expect 6-8 hours of playtime or immense replayability.  Genuinely looking forward to a price drop and fleshed out sequels or new games from this studio.

At 40 dollars - stay away.  Glad the vive bundle gives for free for now.  People need to see this and not get wallet hosemptied out to have a good all-around experience with this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996566428', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 213, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 125, 'last_played': 1549736899}

author: {'steamid': '76561197970522110', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 366, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 206, 'last_played': 1501208939}

author: {'steamid': '76561198057073310', 'num_games_owned': 155, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 203, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 143, 'last_played': 1508628887}
review:
While this game is an excellent showcase of the potential of VR, there isn't enough content to merit the price.  There's only one real puzzle to speak of near the end of the game (but it's a fantastic one).  The final scenes, however, had my jaw dropping to the floor - they were truly incredible.  But it's not foreshadowed very well, and it's a sudden and radical left turn from the tone of the earlier parts of the game.  And of course, it's a cliffhanger.

If you've got $30 extra just lying around, I'd say go for it; but as it stands now (with only episode 1 out), I am not sure it's worth the list price until there's more content.

author: {'steamid': '76561198129082769', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 304, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 191, 'last_played': 1516478972}
review: This is hands down the best VR experience I've had so far on the HTC Vive. Towards the end, it starts to feel like a psychedelic trip, really really amazing visuals and the probably the most complete game on the Vive yet!

author: {'steamid': '76561197964063452', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 125, 'last_played': 1472403183}
review:
Was fun to solve the puzzles, but it was really short. This was one of the first adventure-like games that I've played with my Vive, and I think it really sets a good standard for the coming titles.

I received it as a part of the bundle, so I am not sure that I would be willing to pay $30 for a game I can beat in 2 hours. I support the devs/designers/anyone else and I know how much effort they put into making the game, but it isn't a viable business model if customers will have to drop another $30 for episode 2, then another for 3... however, if all the episodes come with a single purchase... :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197991750299', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 177, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 137, 'last_played': 1474574204}
review: I WANT EPISODE 2!!!!! This is totally wicked!

author: {'steamid': '76561198327030103', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 276, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 229, 'last_played': 1612894327}
review: Wow WOW WOW!! desparately need more. Only thing I would change is to have something to play with during the end credits. Sat on the platform and watched all the messages and then waited and waited and ... you guessed it waited some more. In fact the controllers ran out of battery :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197994527111', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 245, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 138, 'last_played': 1575204720}
review:
Triple A has arrived!

This game is amazing. While it's pretty short, it's (one of) the most polished games on the VIVE right now and has AAA quality. It's made with love, you can see and feel it everywhere. 
The details are awesome, grab a shell and just listen - very nice and there are many more details. The level parts are unique but restricted, you can't explore much which is a bit sad, I hope the following episodes will make it even better. Therefor there are many interactable objects, a mix of both would be ideal.
The voice output and animations of the AI and environment are smooth, clear and well made. 
I really like the inventory system, thus the backpack, but it could need some improvements, e.g. take off/on the backpack with the grip buttons, so you can hold one item in each hand at the same time, like flashlight and map.

This is a must have for the VIVE, very smart to put it into the new bundle, so every new VIVER can experience this masterpiece. I can't wait and I'm really looking forward to the new episodes! 

Thank you devs for this fantastic experience!

author: {'steamid': '76561198037558226', 'num_games_owned': 105, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1631, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 252, 'last_played': 1545073367}
review:
Fantastic.  Easily one of the two best VR experiences I've had since purchasing a Vive.  It's close with "Waltz of the Wizard," but they are entirely different games and each stand on their own.  Truly feel like this game transports you to another place.  I can't wait until another episode comes out, and what may be a more telling review... I can't wait to get back into this one and clear out the rest of the accomplishments.  

There are a few quirks, and I hate the Yes/No rating system, so on a 'grade scale'.. I give it an Easy A or A-.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035767605', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 247, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 247, 'last_played': 1473833365}
review:
Wow - ended way too early.. could have spent much more time in this world and wanted it to go on.. excellent taste on where this series is going - some really epic moments.

Mostly exploration, and a little light on the puzzles, hope to see this deepen a bit in later episodes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041142506', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 90, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 49, 'last_played': 1474360461}

author: {'steamid': '76561197968794967', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 259, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 146, 'last_played': 1511721854}
review: An amazing game that leaves you wanting more.  Not the longest, but possibly, in my opinion, the most engrossing VR experience so far.  Can't wait for episode 2!

author: {'steamid': '76561198067111064', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 843, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 633, 'last_played': 1478100251}
review: Great Game

author: {'steamid': '76561198330957676', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 114, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 114, 'last_played': 1473933759}
review:
This game is now included with the Vive upon purchase and for good reason, it is probably the single best showcase for VR, especially roomscale VR at the moment. The levels are immaculately designed. The devs treat you with intelligence by giving you sophisticated puzzles that enhance the experience. The puzzles are tied to the design of the game so they dont feel out of place. They require that you look for things which enhances the roomscale experience of walking around, yet arent overly simple that you solve them immediately. The ending of the game gave me chills, you really feel like you are sucked into a sci-fi movie, well done guys. 

As has been mentioned numerous times the game is pathetically short. I beat it in exactly 2 hours and I was really taking my time exploring and even struggled with the last puzzle. On that premise I could never recommend a $30 price tag, however this is the best demonstration of VR to date, so on that end I guess it's worth the $30 to see what VR has to truly offer. If you dont love this experience you probably wont ever really like VR.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970878460', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 140, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 140, 'last_played': 1473918131}
review:
Just... Wow!  This goes way beyond just a VR experience.  It whisks you a million miles from your living room and drops you knees deep in muck, with a flashlight, a map and a creepy feeling that you should've gotten a tentanus shot before coming up in here.  There's familiar game mechanics like papers lying about, junk on shelves, notes tacked to the walls.  They all feel VERY different when you get to root thru a life sized cabinet in order to inspect it all.  This will really ruin a lot of my fav games for me - but at the same time I have that old feeling from being a kid when games like Quake and Doom first came out and we all thought "Man - gaming is about to change forever, and right here soon".  Revolution is coming.  Can't wait to play the next episode.

BTW, more than the puzzles or the story or the environments ... the one thing I appreciate the most is the inventory system.  Extremely well done!  If you grip your hand near your shoulder and pull, you will slip off your backpack which can then be parked mid-air anywhere you like (think Deadspace).  A touch of a finger will summon whatever you want from in there - a tape recorder, a flip lighter, some scrap parts or a map.  Grab a strap on the bag and throw it back over your shoulder to put your stuff away.  A+ for immersion whomever designed that part.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998797592', 'num_games_owned': 1315, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 160, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 160, 'last_played': 1473603045}
review:
Got this with the vive and its the most beautiful i have played so far.The story is pretty awsome tho short it doesnt grips you until the end. I love the little detail they put the whenb i started i saw a seashell and was wondering if i could hear the sea if i keep it next to my ear. i Thought no way that would be a thing but it was !. im really looking forward to part 2

tl;dr
[h1]Pros[/h1]
- Amazing visuals 
- interesting story
- got attention to detail
- best inventory if seen in a vr game
- 7 hour sleeping on with headset achievment
[H1]Cons[/h1]
- to short i want more !
- little expensive for what you are getting if im honest.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042272528', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 196, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 153, 'last_played': 1525018026}
review:
Première chose : 30€. A ce prix là, on s'attend à avoir un minimum de contenu dans le jeu. Mais attention, il ne faut pas plus de 2 heures pour finir ce premier épisode. C'est donc chère ! Mais n'oublions pas que la VR est encore un marché de niche avec peu d'acheteurs. Les développeurs ont besoin d'argent malgrès tout, alors on ne peux pas leur en vouloir si ce qu'il font reste bon ...

Ce qui m'amène au jeu en lui même :
C'est le début d'une longue série (on espère) et je doit dire que le début du scénario donne fortement envie de voir la suite.
Ensuite pour l'aspect VR, les sensations sont au rendez-vous et les contrôles bien gérés. Bien qu'il y ai besoin d'un peu de temps de prise en main, on fini rapidement par se perdre dans cet univers et oublier la réalité.
Le final de cet épisode étant assez grandiose, je ne peux que dire : Bravo et vivement la suite !

author: {'steamid': '76561197964053761', 'num_games_owned': 487, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 433, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 246, 'last_played': 1511727740}
review:
This is easily the best VR experience out there right now IMO.  Really looking forward to episode 2!  Its a bit pricey for the length but its also an awesome experience.  If you have a powerful system with at least a 1080 i would turn the super sampling up as high as you can for this game as it makes reading the text in game MUCH easier.  For most people it will be located here: "C:\Program Files (x86)\Steam\config\steamvr.vrsettings" and change "renderTargetMultiplier" from 1 to 2.

This game sold me on what VR will be once developers figure out how to do VR and once the mass market has VR to make the ROI worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975875974', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 172, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 172, 'last_played': 1473605180}

author: {'steamid': '76561198026039278', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 261, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 129, 'last_played': 1700954295}
review: Great introduction to VR.  Took about 2 hours to play and I can't wait for the next in the series. BEAUTIFUL!!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561197996191314', 'num_games_owned': 324, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 345, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 186, 'last_played': 1564408114}
review:
Primero decir que no pagué los 27€ de forma directa si no que me vino al comprar las Vive. Quizá el precio es elevado para la poca rejugabilidad que tiene.

Por otro lado el que no este disponible en castellano dificulta sobremanera el avance pues las pistas del escenario son vitales.

Quizá insertar subtítulos aunque fuesen en inglés ayudaría.

Me han ocurrido un par de bugs que me han obligado a reiniciar el escenario en dos ocasiones: 
- Nada mas abrir la verja el audio de los personajes desapareció pero se escuchaba el ruido ambiental.
- Al entrar en el ultimo "Ascensor" no me transporte al centro de él y se quedó parado en el descenso.

A pesar de todo he disfrutado mucho de terminarlo. 

Me alegraría que el futuro de los juegos en VR tirase por este estilo de juego pero con productos finales y no capítulos.

author: {'steamid': '76561197962821445', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 107, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 107, 'last_played': 1473440417}

author: {'steamid': '76561198132261737', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 165, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 136, 'last_played': 1475273735}
review: Great game, extremely well made. Along with the lab its a show of what VR is capable off. I only wish there were more games as polished as this one out there. Having only the one full quality game to play can get a little boring.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977147041', 'num_games_owned': 439, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 140, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 140, 'last_played': 1472359803}
review:
This is the start of a great game and it introduces an interesting story. 

Unfortunately this game is only the first 10% of a story. I took a ton of extra time examining details and wandering around leisurely but still finished it in less than 2 hours. Thinking back, there are only about 6 points of interest with some very linear paths between them.

I did experience a bug where one of the puzzle pieces disappeared (I think maybe under the floor), forcing me to reload the game.

Overall its one of the best story based games I've seen for VR right now, although I expected it to be 2-3x as long for the $30 pricetag

author: {'steamid': '76561197961409511', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 227, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 227, 'last_played': 1472528311}
review:
I've tried a lot of VR games and this one sticks out as the most amazing experience yet. Being in VR, I played thru this adventure in a completely different way than with traditional games. In traditional games, I tend to rush and try to do everything as fast as possible. It is not so here: I just took all the time in the world.  Is it because VR puts me 'in' the game, so I tend to act more realistically? I can't say.  But one thing is for sure, I enjoyed every second of the experience.

The environment is super polished, the visual effects are great and the story writing is great. I really felt like I was there.  Keep up the good work, can't wait for the next episode!

author: {'steamid': '76561198029837806', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 124, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 124, 'last_played': 1472623904}

But still, it's an amazing VR experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198319643497', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 149, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 149, 'last_played': 1472574031}
review: B.S.

author: {'steamid': '76561198243828632', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 103, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 92, 'last_played': 1474069727}
review:
I received this with the HTC Vive bundle (for free) so I'm giving it a recommendation in that context.  Definitely don't let it collect cobwebs in your library if you get it for free. It took me about 1.5 hours to get through, so at $30 dollars it is a bit short for my taste. The controls and movement were spot on, making my body pretty much mimic what the character in game was doing. The main puzzles in the game were creative and original. The story (while short) kept me from stopping when I normally would have because I wanted to see what was coming next. This game sets a nice precedent for storytelling/puzzle games in VR. 

In my opinion $15-$20 would have been a more reasonable price range for this short of a game.  Hopefully the next episodes are a bit longer to justify the price. I’ll definitely be watching for them!

author: {'steamid': '76561198025738896', 'num_games_owned': 315, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 98, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 98, 'last_played': 1472325241}
review:
Just finished the game. Wow, that was good but short. It does make use of the Vive very well and there's been significant effort put into the locations.
But it's short. The story is good and interesting and it's the core of the game which in turn kills replayability. 
This all wouldn't necessarily be a problem, but they ask for 30 CHF (probably the same in euro/dolar) and that feels like too much for what you get. If you can get it for 5 - 10 euro/dollar it might be worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000307978', 'num_games_owned': 430, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 210, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 135, 'last_played': 1473539734}
review:
The Gallery exudes atmosphere. From what I can tell this is the VR-equivalent of point-and-click adventures or exploration games. I would call it an interactive story, an adventure game, or an exploration game (within limits). There is no combat, the action you take are minimal.

That said you should be prepared to explore this fantastic world. The Gallery has amazing visuals and a great inventory mechanic. I would recommend you go in to experience the story of this game/experience, as that is what the game is all about. 

As people online have said, it is quite short, but very cool nonetheless. For a few minutes at the end I expected some more action, forgetting this was a story experience, so that temporarily disappointed me. But I enjoyed the journey and I am curious what will happen in episode 2!

I will likely play it again and would recommend this game to anyone who enjoys exploration, story, and atmosphere in a game/experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058646625', 'num_games_owned': 490, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 274, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 88, 'last_played': 1495870822}

author: {'steamid': '76561198041667549', 'num_games_owned': 335, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 115, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 115, 'last_played': 1472083151}

author: {'steamid': '76561197978899665', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 542, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 317, 'last_played': 1535675816}
review:
This is definitely in my top two or three games for the Vive. It is visually stunning, has a story, and has brought a lot to the table on the UI and inventory system. 

It is probably about 90 minutes of play for the first episode.

The ending alone is worth the cost of entry, in my opinion. I've also found the ending to fit right into my demo reel - at least when I know the person won't have an opportunity to play it in full. For my friends who have more time, I will have them play through it and give them hints to hurry it up. Usually about an hour to play through doing that.

tl;dr: Game looks great, immersive, really cool environment, and an ending that will knock your socks off.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003015044', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 351, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 351, 'last_played': 1471930667}

author: {'steamid': '76561198291646793', 'num_games_owned': 125, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 125, 'last_played': 1471884693}

author: {'steamid': '76561197970667013', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 223, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 169, 'last_played': 1547767721}
review: I would buy the game even for just the ending alone, which left me absolutely floored. The immersion is ridiculous in this short little adventure game, lovely atmosphere, impressive physics, good puzzles etc. As I said though, the ending is so stunning and it really took me by surprise. The fact that we can create experiences like this on a first gen VR headset is remarkable. If you own a Vive, this game is a must!

author: {'steamid': '76561198080004850', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 157, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 146, 'last_played': 1473490366}

author: {'steamid': '76561198029254758', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 134, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 129, 'last_played': 1657725535}

author: {'steamid': '76561198076518473', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 174, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 133, 'last_played': 1518308229}
review: After reading other reviews I thought this was going to be the closest thing to a AAA title on the Vive.  I was way off.  It is extremely short.  You teleport around and the gameplay only consists of about 3 puzzles.  2 are extremely simple and the third is mostly trial and error.  The graphics are really well done but I still never felt presence in this game.  The ending was actually a let down for me because I was expecting a lot more from the reviews.  I mostly just got tired of standing and sit down while it played out.  Luckily there is more to and hopefully it has potential.  But this just felt like a really boring demo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198318686332', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 81, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 81, 'last_played': 1471210580}
review:
I really enjoyed my time with Call of the Starseed. It is far too short, there aren't enough puzzles and it is too expensive in relation to its length. With all that said it was amazing look at how impressive and immersive a story telling medium VR can be. I thought the game looked fantastic and did a great job with its controls. I was especially impressed with the inventory system which has you reach over your shoulder to grab your virtual back pack.You can then position it somewhere convenient to acces your various items. Once your finished simply grab the bag and put it back over your shoulder. Very simple mechanic but i thought it was a cool way to manage inventory without clunky menus. 

I look forward to more form this team and this story arc but im sure a more realistic pricing structure will have to be reached. If you have the money and want a really cool experience i fully reccomend this. I was a big fan of 90's adventure games and this is a perfect example of just how cool things could be.

author: {'steamid': '76561198105522247', 'num_games_owned': 78, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 94, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 94, 'last_played': 1471785968}

THANKS GUYS FOR MAKING THIS REAL. CANT WAIT FOR THE SECOND EPISODE!

author: {'steamid': '76561198024924941', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 194, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 194, 'last_played': 1471311436}
review:
Very happy to hear that this game is now included with the Vive because I believe that anyone who plays this will immediatly realize that Call of Starseed Ep. 1 and the HTC Vive is the future of gaming. Starseed feels like the Virtual Reality fantasy I have been dreaming about since I was a little kid hearing about virutal reality and obsessing about the day when I could be inside new worlds and gaming experiences.

I can't wait for more episodes and hope that this team continues to break new ground in making gaming and reality blend. It has been a long time since I finished a game where I was not only left breathless but also so excited about the future of gaming. Play Starseed ...you will love being a part of this new world.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077021676', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 149, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 149, 'last_played': 1472329617}

review:

This will probably turn out to be one of my favourite games in VR!

author: {'steamid': '76561198095824872', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 309, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 176, 'last_played': 1581806276}
review: One of the best, if not the best VR game I've played so far. Can't wait for episode 2.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979070528', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 211, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 211, 'last_played': 1471466833}
review:
Fantastic visuals, some of the best scenes currently in VR.

Puzzles are good, mostly because of the use of nicely made objects in the environment and their fit with the narrative.

Like most early VR titles many will say its a bit short / too expensive. I think it's more than ok - quality experience & worth the buy.

Definitely getting the next one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008428603', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 178, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 178, 'last_played': 1471411287}
review:
Before I even begin, buy this now. Hands down one of the best original titles out for VR right now.

Full disclosure, this is episodic content (think comic books). That may or may not be your cup of tea, however, if you venture to indulge yourself here my guess is you will not be disappointed. This episode begins a bit slowly, with the atmosphere seeming a bit understated. Regardless of if that is intentional, it definitely has a sort of way about it that seems very unique and fresh. By mid-episode, you start to get a handle on where things are headed and boy are they headed for an interesting place. I won't disclose any of the details, though let's just say you're headed down the rabit hole. Absolutely cannot wait for the next episode, I am hooked.

author: {'steamid': '76561198098730663', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 201, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 201, 'last_played': 1471281838}

author: {'steamid': '76561198029442474', 'num_games_owned': 532, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 80, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 80, 'last_played': 1471195387}
review:
I've owned my Vive for about a month now so the facination you get of simply being in VR is gone.  This game is not meant for someone who has owned their vive for this long.  Since looking around and playing with objects on the ground doesn't give me the satisfaction of a $30 title.  I can honestly say I didnt attempt to rush through this game before the refund period, there just isn't enough gameplay to keep me within the incredibly small world that has been presented.

While the story is engaging, abiet extremely ambigous, it did give me goose bumps, but there was little interactivity when I did get to those points.  Simply pointing and pulling the trigger does not keep me entertained for the last 15 minutes of gameplay. I sadly can't recommend this title at a $30 price tag.

However, if you enjoy having other people experience the vive for the first time, then this title ranks up there with The Lab in terms of quality with more of a focus on visuals and story experience.  This is quite simply a high quality demo of what can be accomplished on the vive when it comes to telling an interactive story.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960716517', 'num_games_owned': 177, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 198, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 198, 'last_played': 1466266653}
review:
When I first got my Vive, this was already on my list to try because of the comments I had seen on Reddit. I really wasn't disappointed.

If this were a normal, 2D FPS-type exploration adventure, you'd whizz through it in about 45 mins. Because you're immersed, however, you take so much more time to observe and enjoy your surroundings. The world is lovingly made and there are lots of details you'd skip without the abillity to pick things up and look at them from all angles.

At one point, I had the entirely open choice of using my flashlight, a lantern or a candle. I decided to pick up the candle because I enjoyed moving it around and seeing how it realistically affected shadows. This feature isn't groundbreaking in terms of what game engines can do - but when you're *in*it, it's delightful. Shortly afterward, in my other hand, I picked up a note. As I tried to read it, the ambient light was a little muted, so I moved my candle closer. I had just started to read it when the page blackened and set on fire. 

The few puzzles you solve are satisfying, and the final big puzzle experience is mesmerising, and done so well. Nothing particularly mentally taxing, but because you're moving things around with your hands it just *feels* more awesome.

Other, random highlights:
 - Moving things that emit sound closer to your ear to hear them better (hint: try the seashells)
 - Trying to juggle with beer bottles in the tutorial
 - The beach.
 - Being able to rotate your playspace to fit each little nook and cranny you want to explore. It meant I could figure the best fit and not have to teleport to enjoy all the details a particular room/spot was hiding.

If this were a 2D game, you'd be upset to pay over £20 for it. Because it's VR, it's totally worth it. I felt like I was the silent protagonist of a feature length episode of a new JJ Abrams/Damon Lindelof collaboration. I'm really looking forward to Episode 2, and am *really* pleased this will now be bundled with the Vive as I think it's a fantastic intro to what storytelling in a VR experience can be.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999828039', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 248, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 156, 'last_played': 1576250688}
review:
This first episode of The Gallery shows a lot of promise. The story and characters are interesting and the world is very immersive. I'm not going into details, but I do recommend this game... but maybe you shouldn't buy it yet.
You're basically going to pay 30 €/$ for about 1-2 hours of content. The big question is: How much does it cost you to play the other episodes after buying the first one? Hopefully not a lot, as the cost of this first episode is already pretty high. Waiting is propably the best option, unless you really want to experience it now. I don't regret buying the game at this point. Just be aware of the possibility of sky high pricing. It propably won't be like that, but who knows.

One of the best VR experiences so far.

8/10

[url=https://media.giphy.com/media/12P29BwtrvsbbW/giphy.gif] Applauses [/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561198025179007', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 95, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 95, 'last_played': 1471165540}
review:
This is a VERY polished movie-length experience. Flawless consistent graphics and audio, good voice acting, and great uses of motion controls This was the best 1.5 hours I've spent with my Vive and I can't wait for the next installment! This is some seriously impressive work for being this early in the industry.

HOWEVER, a $30 asking price is certainly steep for something this short. I'd expect way more than 2 hours of gameplay for that price, so I'm hoping the following episodes are either longer, cheaper, or both. Unless you have money from gift cards or like giving friends extended disconnected demos (both earbuds in for the duration), it'd be in your best interest to wait for a sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198285819035', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 185, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 181, 'last_played': 1480860870}

author: {'steamid': '76561197962390151', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 57, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 57, 'last_played': 1470935131}
review:
The good: if you like obscure puzzles maybe it's for you.

The bad: Player can materialise inside solid objects. Floor moves up and down sometimes. Can pick some objects up but can't drop them. I don't like solving obscure puzzles for no reason. Or as in this case, failing to solve them and giving up after a while. Over-rated, baffling and pointless waste of money.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036100618', 'num_games_owned': 547, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 113, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 113, 'last_played': 1470233564}

author: {'steamid': '76561198004007778', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 271, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 161, 'last_played': 1637896877}
review:
Starseed is definitely one of the top games available on the Vive right now. The graphics, environment and storyline is better than any Vive games out there right now. 

Pros:
-great environment that changes from one area to the next
-really challenges what VR is meant to be, ie the way the game interacts with the player, the VR-3D aspect, the cinematic experience. 
-very neat backpack interface
-great graphics. Although I think the graphics can be a lot better but it is hindered by the early development limitation of the Vive. 
-great sound effects and voice acting.

Cons:
-expensive for only 1 episode. Reading the discussions around this topic, it sounds like the initial price may be necessary for the development of the game. Though I am definitely looking for later episodes to be more price reasonable.
-gameplay is only 2 hours with very little replay value. This kind of amplifies the first con point.
-due to the game only being 2 hours, there's very little that the player can get out of the storyline. I think the storyline definitely had a good start but just isn't enough since the play time is so short.

Sugguestion:
-playing some of the other Vr games, some other VR games actually automatically rotates the virtual game so that you aren't against the wall all the time. For example, moving into the next scene through a load screen, the game would reposition the player so that in the next area moving forward in the game will direct the player to walk away from the real world wall rather than walking close to the wall. In some scenes in Starseed, I am stuck next to the real wall a lot of times and the virtual wall outline would display removing some immersion.

Looking forward to the next episode but perhaps more in the $15 price point and long play time. The 3 cons mentioned really goes hand in hand and amplifies each other.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055336197', 'num_games_owned': 319, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 114, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 114, 'last_played': 1467413157}
review: Probably one of the most built out puzzle-narrative experiences in VR as of this review. Visually it looks quite good, and there are a bunch of fun interactions to make the story compelling. It isn't overly long, but compared to most VR experiences it offers a good length for the amount of polish it has.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008617858', 'num_games_owned': 281, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 84, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1469925233}
review:
This game was amazing, the graphics were jaw dropping and the control scheme for the vive was ground breaking. Hopefulluy I can continue to support this studio when they can get their pricing model correct. I was able to complete the entire chapter without rushing in 86 minutes. Thats under an hour and a half of gameplay. 

I cannot recommend any game, no matter how nice it is when they are charging $29.99 for something with less than 2 hours of content. 

Again, you will beat this entire chapter in about an hour and a half.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048521060', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 95, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 95, 'last_played': 1469245966}
review: One of the most polished Vive games out there. Even though the mechanics of the gameplay are fairly basic, the ambience and the story make this game incredible. The Gallery - Call of the starseed is currently one of my favorite adventure game, I cannot wait for the next episodes. Highly recommended!

author: {'steamid': '76561197999541111', 'num_games_owned': 433, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 233, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 221, 'last_played': 1490534181}
review: Ich habe das Game auf der HTC  gespielt. Grafik, Sound und Immersion sind eindeutig überzeugend. Die Story ist vielversprechend und macht absolut neugierig auf den zweiten Teil. Wer Adventures liebt, unbedingt ausprobieren!!

author: {'steamid': '76561197973037073', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 118, 'playtime_forever': 23, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1467449391}
review: Lots of depth but I didn't get into this game. Maybe someone else would like this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966406025', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 135, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1471405831}
review:
Absolutely recommended. While short, it's demonstrated the future of VR for me more than any other title by showing how stories and expressiveness can be harnessed by VR developers. I also think the cost is very fair considering the polish and how niche our genre is right now.

The only memorable con is that character animations are pretty basic right now, and I feel like that pulls you out of the experience a little. Still, I definitely recommend The Gallery and can't wait for Ep. 2.

author: {'steamid': '76561198089710449', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 222, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 193, 'last_played': 1573429402}
review: This is like Myst or Riven for the VIVE.  It's a very well made game, immersive, great graphics, good voice acting, and the controls are well polished.  The puzzles were not always easy, but I was able to solve them all without cheating, so I'd say not too hard for an intelligent adult.  This is definitely one of my favorite games for the Vive!  I will definitely buy the next episode.  Although it's a bit expensive for ~3-4 hours gameplay, its a fair price considering how much better it is than other vive games.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996567541', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 134, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 121, 'last_played': 1471614349}
review: A pretty fun adventure game with some nice production values and a lot of promise for future episodes. Too short but recommended nonetheless.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038486281', 'num_games_owned': 593, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 172, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 171, 'last_played': 1470130642}
review: A great game for VR. Can't wait for the next episode!

author: {'steamid': '76561198004410106', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 210, 'playtime_forever': 139, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 139, 'last_played': 1464651177}
review:
Easily one of my most favorite games for VR. It’s not a fast paced shooter like Raw Data or an epic RPG adventure like Vanishing Realms, but it’s just a really fun adventure that reminds me of my times in Myst. The story is really cool, the characters are cool and got me invested and immersed, and the puzzles are simple and grounded which felt very real. The icing on first episode of The Gallery is the ending. I don’t want to spoil it, but the potential of what Episode 2 could have for us is shown at the end of Episode 1 and it has made Ep. 2 one of my most anticipated VR games, even though it hasn’t seen a teaser trailer.

5/5

author: {'steamid': '76561197962696837', 'num_games_owned': 474, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 175, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 175, 'last_played': 1469999723}
review:
This fell well below my expectations and I walked away disapointed. Despite having quite a few visual wows and a well realised inventory system I couldn't recommend it as I just didn't find it fulfilling.

The first puzzle in particular is an unintuitive mess. [spoiler] I spent about half an hour trying to work out a morse code puzzle that didn't exist [/spoiler]. The sewer puzzle isn't really a puzzle [spoiler] You can only go the wrong way by going to the well which lead me to think i would have to put items in the well to get stuff out of the sewer [/spoiler].
Finally in the third and fourth sections the puzzles got more interesting. But after that it was time to sit back and enjoy the ride. 
In general the whole thing felt like the episode once had a lot more content which was cut but the hints of more interesting things were left in. There was never once a point where I got to use knowledge i had learned earlier. There was never a sense of mastery. So what was left was a game that felt like a theme park ride where you get shuffled from one scene to another.
Unfortunately the story doesn't quite make up for the lackluster gameplay. [spoilter] The monolog near the end is painfully long whilst you literally do nothing for 10 minutes with very little happening on screen for most of it[/spoiler].

In general its the gameplay that really needs a step up here. VR adds a 3D spectacle but this game could have been made without it and without it the game would be utterly forgettable.

The controls are well realised and the rotating teleportation works well.  My hope for the developers going forward is now that they have the basics down they really need to double down the gameplay and puzzles for the next episodes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198209264320', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 264, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 228, 'last_played': 1467129063}

Looking forward to future installments.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988608600', 'num_games_owned': 591, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 204, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 204, 'last_played': 1469883471}
review:
[b]The Gallery: Call of the Starseed[/b] is the first episode of a science-fiction adventure game for the Vive.

The player takes the role of Alex, a (presumably) young man following in the footsteps of his vanished twin sister, trying to discover what has become of her.

In terms of gameplay and content, [b]this is exactly the experience the Vive was made for[/b]. The player interacts with everything , even her inventory, in a very natural way, from picking up and manipulating objects to opening and closing containers to loading cassettes into a [strike]Walkman[/strike] Talkman [spoiler]to throwing and catching items to shaking glowsticks to manually loading a flaregun[/spoiler]. Curiosity is encouraged and rewarded, and the player will make use of the full range of her play space, vertical as well as horizontal.

The story is engaging, and the graphical and auditory effects are beautiful and immersive.

The only thing that makes me hesitate to recommend this title is the conjunction of its length and price. At the time of this writing, it is priced at 28€, and it takes 60-90 minutes to play from beginning to end - potentially a bit longer if you take more time to complete the puzzles and dexterity challenges, or if you explore and examine everything exhaustively. If it were either significantly longer or substantially less expensive (both of which I understand that subsequent episodes will be), I would be harping on and on about it to all my friends, relatives, and casual acquaintances, and relentlessly nagging them to buy and play it.

As it is, The Gallery: Call of the Starseed is a fantastic experience, and I heartily recommend it to those who feel it's an adequate value.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972608070', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 212, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 64, 'last_played': 1498871162}
review:
Wow.  Loved it.  Very immersive, and they do some cool things with the VR environment, like adjusting the height of the world as you walk over it, so it feels like you're walking up or down stairs.  I also love the always-present image showing you the center of your play area, as well as the fact that you can rotate the area around yourself when you teleport.  It allows for you to choose where you move and how much space around yourself you want, which is quite nice when playing.

Definitely a must-buy.  Can't wait for future episodes!

author: {'steamid': '76561198030459455', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 210, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 210, 'last_played': 1470118083}
review:
I have to recommend this game despite the short it is, because it´s by far one of the best experiences I have had with VR. I think only elite Dangerous can be compared at this time with this game. The graphics are very good and the story is very interesting. The puzzles could have been a bit harder because they are too easy (the fuse one I hate it until I realize there was a hidden clue (not saying which, of course). But again, it´s too short and it´s expensive for the amount of time you play. The experience is worth it despite all. If you can, support the team so they can continue. But as someone said, I hope they will give some discount for the ones who bought the first one.

About the price, there is an interesting discussion in Reddit about it: https://www.reddit.com/r/Vive/comments/4m9q39/update_on_gallery_episode_2/

Now I understand better the price. Yes, it´s expensive, I have to say it but a wonderful experience, the best in VR so far.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971169995', 'num_games_owned': 528, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 134, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 117, 'last_played': 1471645312}
review:
Despite not recommending this game I do think it's technically a great game and storywise a good enough game, and one of few VR games that really shows what we'll come to expect of the bigger games for the platform in the future.

It's short, depending on how much you'll explore in the game you could probably get 2+ hours out of the game. The puzzles, especially the one with the fuses, are (borderline) tedious but easy enough to not occupy you for too long.

The reasong I'm not recommending it is how it's being sold. Even at a sale I'd say it's a no go. €15-19 (tops!) at full price would be fine. At the moment this isn't even a season pass-type deal but just episode one, if you'd get all future episodes included in the price it would be acceptable, but as it stands now I can assume future episodes will be priced the same as episode one. I really hope though that future episodes will be heavily discounted for owners of episode one.

If you got money to spare and want a glimpse of what the future holds, do consider this, but know that in doing so you're approving the way the developers are selling this game/series.

Or you could just breeze through it, enjoy it and get a refund and in doing so have your cookie and eat it too..!

author: {'steamid': '76561198039219847', 'num_games_owned': 90, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 374, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 283, 'last_played': 1474572827}
review:
Outstanding puzzle-sci-fi-adventure that truly shows what VR is capable of in its first year. 
A quality release by the studio. Although the adventure is bit short, do yourself a favor and avoid spoiling it by googling out all the problems. 
There is just right amount of puzzle solving that can be accomplished merely by looking around and listening all the memos you'll get your hands on. 

Highly recommended. Just waiting for the next release!

author: {'steamid': '76561198026539571', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 321, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 212, 'last_played': 1473200280}
review:
If you're a go-go-go type then this game will probably take you about 2 hours to complete. If you're a take-it-slower type like me, then this game will probably take you about 2.5-3.5 hours. In both cases, just buy it.

*PROS*
-Phenomenal story.
-Excellent graphics.
-Complete immersion (this is the only VR game where I've actually bumped into my wall a couple times reaching for things. it's also the first VR game where I kept stepping prematurely, expecting to be able to walk down a path before remembering it didn't actually exist).
-Intuitive, natural controls.
-Getting a glimpse at the future of VR.
-Spooky and emotive locales, but thankfully no horror.


*CONS*
-It starts with a "look" form of the blink teleport mechanic. Hit the menu button and you can change it to the standard "point" blink teleport found in most vr games.


*Other Stuff*
The primary game themes are: exploration, investigation, discovery, and mystery.

The primary game mechanics involve walking about, collecting and using items, investigating, and some puzzle solving (but thankfully not too much) as you slowly unravel the plot.

The price is not a pro or con. You get what you pay for. This is a better experience than people who wait for an hour in line at Disney World get to see (and those experiences only last 5-10 minutes!). 

The devs are planning 4 episodes and they can't get finished soon enough as far as I'm concerned. This is probably the best VR experience on Steam at this time. If you've got the cash, it's a no-brainer.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999733144', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 166, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 113, 'last_played': 1502746029}

author: {'steamid': '76561198318027589', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 197, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 136, 'last_played': 1469907643}
review:
Having grown up with old-school point and click adventure games like Monkey Island and Broken Sword, there will always be a special place in my heart for puzzle adventure games. With that in mind I hovered over The Gallery a number of times, wanting to play it but not sure if the reported short play time meant I would get my money’s worth as at the time of purchase this is up there as one of the more expensive titles out for VR. Well, having caved in and bought the game and completed it in the same night, I can now confirm that it was totally worth it! 

I like pretty much everything about this game, when it starts you don’t really know what is going on and it doesn’t seem like much is happening. Though as the game progresses the puzzles and interaction gets better and better – it’s like it starts off simple to allow you to get used to the VR controls and then ups the puzzles once you are ready for it. Experiencing this 1st person is amazing too, it makes the puzzles more real and fun. There are number of really cool mechanics in the game too, like the backpack, which sounds simple, but I found I had a grin on my face while using it every time, it’s just really cool. So without diving in to spoilers, if you like point and click adventure games, I would recommend this game.

There were a couple of bugs and bits that could be better, however, they did not massively detract from the experience and the devs are still updating this game. As it happens, one of my main gripes with the game (the backpack didn’t always put away) was fixed about a day after I played it and now works fine. This commitment makes me excited to get Ep 2 when it comes out.

As a side note, this is the first VR game I have ever got completely turned around in. When I took a break I thought I was going to be facing my TV, but no, I was about 120 degrees wrong. Total immersion.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966247510', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 493, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 474, 'last_played': 1483224315}
review:
https://youtu.be/LqlPKqPqKS0
Über das Spiel:
The Gallery - Episode 1: Call of the Starseed ist ein Adventure Spiel welches aus der Ego Perspektive gespielt wird.
Für mich als alter Adventure Fan, welcher mit Spielen wie Myst,ManiacMansion oder Day of the Tentacle gross geworden bin, war diese VR Erfahrung zwar neu aber absolut passend. In Ego Perspektive mit VR ein Spiel zu Spielen macht absolut Sinn. Es zwingt sich fast schon auf, dieses Genre auf die VR zu bringen, weil es sich einfach so natürlich und richtig anfühlt.

The Gallery ist ein Adventure und macht hier fast alles richtig.
Es ist eine gute Story, welche einen dazu bring das Spiel (Teil 1 ) bis zum Ende,  mit viel Elan durchzuspielen.

Grafik:
Die Grafik ist im Verhätniss zu anderen VR Spielen welche ich bis zum heutigen Tag gespielt habe,
überdurchschnittlich gut. 
Die Kantenglättung welche gut funktioniert trägt einen sehr grossen Teil dazu bei.
Die Levels sind sehr sorgfältig gestaltet und laden dazu ein gerne mal einen augenblick stehen zu bleiben um das Level zu bewundern.
Auf dem höchten Grafiklevel kommt meine GTX1080 an ihre Grenzen. Allerdings sehe ich auch bei etwas reduzierter Grafik keinerlei Unterschied.
Die Texturen sind leider nicht so hoch aufgelöst wie man es z.B aus "The LAB" kennt. Sie sind nicht schlecht könnten aber gene noch besser werden.
Die Engine funktioniert sehr gut  und lässt viel Freiraum für tolle Funktionen welche im Spiel sehr gut umgesetzt wurden.
Das macht das Spiel Abwechslungsreich.

Steuerung:
Die Steuerung funktioniert in meinem Fall mit den HTC Controllern sehr gut. 
In Adventure Spielen trägt man gerne mal so einiges an Material zusammen, welches man mitnehmen muss oder sollte.
Das Inventar wurde super gelöst. Man greift hinter sich und zieht einen Rucksack hervor in dem man so einiges hineinpacken kann. Auch das auswählen der Gegenstände zu deren Verwendung wurde sehr gut umgesetzt in dem man das gewünschte Teil aus dem Rucksack herrauszieht.
Riesen Pluspunk- Sehr innovativ!
Steckt man seinen Kopf in eine Richtung in die man nicht sollte. -Etwa durch eine Wand-
Wird dieses Verhalten durch eine unscharfe Sicht verhindert. Zudem wird man nach einigen wenigen Sekunden vom System wieder in eine Korrekte Position gebracht. - Clever
Grundsätzlich kann man sich im gegebenen Bereich frei bewegen und "beamt sich dann zum nächten gewünschten Ort.
Ganz genau wie bei Myst, nur um einiges flexibler.

Sound:
Der Sound (Stimmen) wurde Professionell aufgenommen und lassen einen so richtig in das Spiel Eintauchen.
Gänsehaut garantiert.

Spielspass:
Der Spielspass ist auf jeden Fall gegeben. Es ist KEINE Tech Demo welches hier als Spiel angeboten wird.
Es ist ein Storybasiertes Adventure Spiel welches das Adventure Fan Herz höher schlagen lässt.
Eine "kleine" Perle.
Ich für meinen Teil hatte sehr viel Spass mit dem erten Teil des Spiels.

Fazit:

Pro:
Grosser Spielspass und Spannung
Tolle Story
Sehr schöne Grafik
Gute Steuerung
Sehr innovatives Gameplay und Inventar



Kontra:
Die wenigen Speicherpunkte können einen schon nerven. Gespeichert wird nach jedem Abschnitt automatisch. Schafft man einen Abschnitt nicht an einem Stück, fängt man diesen von vorne an, Ich hatte gefühlte 5 Speicherpunkte. Das nervt.

Ein so Professionell aufgebautes Spiel sollte gerne auch mit weiteren Sprachen untertittelt werden oder gerne zu diesem Preis auch synchronisiert sein.
Sprachmuffel wie ich schaffen es aber trotzdem das Spiel durchzuspielen ;-)

Für jeden Adventure Fan oder diese die es noch werden wollen- EIN MUSS, sofern einen der Preis nicht abschreckt.
Der momentane Preis ohne Rabatt beträgt fast 25.-
Ich hatte mir viel Zeit beim Spielen gelassen und brauchte 5 Stunden bis zum Ende.
Das Spiel kann aber locker in 2 Stunden durchgespielt werden.

Ich würde jederzeit wieder das Geld für den ersten Teil bezahlen, beim nächten Teil dürfte aber gerne etwas mehr Spielzeit dafür drin liegen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016763999', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 120, 'playtime_forever': 243, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 243, 'last_played': 1469970428}
review:
[h1][b] 问：这游戏卖188元，这么贵值吗？
答：本人VIVE所有优秀作品均体验过，此游戏已通关，目前来讲《画廊 第一章：星种召唤》是VR冒险解谜类型里各方面品质最好的，没有之一！值得购买！[/b][/h1]

[h1]游戏性[/h1]
本作是典型的第一人称冒险解谜游戏，正常走走停停的节奏通关时间大概需要2个半小时到3小时左右，节奏稍快一点的话大概2小时左右通关，谜题难度总体并不算难，最后那道谜题可能需要多耗一些时间[spoiler] （耗时也仅仅是因为用排除法过关，其实并不难）	[/spoiler]，建议玩家英语在四级以上水平，这样能看懂最基本的文字提示，英文更好一些的玩家能理解更多的语音对话[spoiler]（多数剧情内容都需要听磁带获取，但这并不会影响解谜进度）[/spoiler]，对剧情的深刻理解大有帮助，如果完全不懂英文其实也可以玩，但剧情方面无法理解是遗憾。
[h1]画面[/h1]
游戏画质分3挡可调，我设置为最高画质，整体表现在目前的VR游戏中算是非常好的，建模还是很逼真的，HUD清晰度也可调整，建议设为最高值20。
[h1]音效[/h1]
音效方面得重点表扬一下，可以用顶级制作电影音效标准来衡量这部作品，在石地、木头、水里可以听到不同的声音，开头部分海鸥盘旋的叫声一直回响在耳边，山洞里也能听到回声，拿在手里的录音机环绕音效也不错，并且这只是用VIVE自带的耳塞听出的音效，如果换上大馒头耳机效果还会更好。
[h1]交互性[/h1]
游戏内大多数谜题都是通过交互性解决，移动是通过一种叫Blink的方式，按住触控板后根据头盔视线所在位置瞬移，背包设计体验感非常棒，开头处有一个场景专门针对交互性设计，可以体验的物品有好几种，具体我就不剧透了。
[h1]缺点[/h1]
虽然结局还算比较过瘾，但总体流程略短，还不是特别尽兴，这也算是目前VR单机游戏的通病，相对于其它同类型作品来讲画廊算流程长的了，期待下一章。
[h1]购买[/h1]
觉得原价贵的可以去淘宝搜，大概130元左右能买到正版。

[b]VIVE控可以加我Steam好友，一起交流游戏心得。[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198213137371', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 390, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 390, 'last_played': 1470127224}
review: This is the first VR game that I've completed and, boy, was it satisfying and enjoyable.  There was only one time that I got stuck and needed to find the answer online.  For people contemplating buying this game, I would say it is what VR is all about.  The level of immersion is the selling point for this game.  You are at a whole new level never experienced before.  In a nutshell, you are watching an interactive movie -   most enjoyable and value for money.  Well done.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000912277', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 129, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 111, 'last_played': 1470568602}
review:
Very pretty even with a 970, also I appreciate the lack of jump scares even though the setting kind of seems suitable for them. Controls and inventory system (backpack) are good, took some getting used to but that could be due to my lack of VR experience so far. Story was interesting and might evolve to something great with the following episodes. 

I did not like the blink-to-where-you-look locomotion, however you can change that back to point-and-blink so no issue there.

The game took me less than 2 hours to finish with slow/moderate speed so people who optimize price per hour for a game might want to consider whether or not this is worth it. This is, however, a very good showcase of what kind of story driven games with clever controls and pretty sceneries we'll hopefully see more in the future.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043843104', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 180, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 180, 'last_played': 1468752773}

author: {'steamid': '76561197970685997', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 156, 'playtime_forever': 141, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 141, 'last_played': 1476476478}
review:
One of the best VR games available so far. Its graphics are the best I have seen so far, puzzle games are simply best suited for VR and this is really well made. Only big drawback is that it is very short for its price.

Positive:
+ very good graphics
+ nice puzzels 
+ well told story

Negative:
- first playthrough took me just 100 minutes, to short for this price
- especially the sewer could have been made longer

author: {'steamid': '76561197996837614', 'num_games_owned': 237, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 694, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 294, 'last_played': 1555621450}
review:
$30 is a lot to spend on any game that will last on average about 2 hours. Still, I can't recommend this title enough.

I've been a VR enthusiast for about two years; ever since I landed an early number DK2. In those two years I tried just about everything on the old Oculus Share and I've bought pretty much any title on Steam VR and Oculus home with a reasonable rating. In all that time, nothing has made my jaw hit the floor like The Gallery.

If you have a Vive do yourself a favor and pick this title up ASAP. And please, don't give up if you get stuck on the beach puzzles. The parts of the game that really shine are the ones that come after you trudge through the sewer.


[b]Pros:[/b]

[list]
    [*]Most breathtaking VR experience I've had. Period.
    [*]Lots of effort put into making most objects interactive
    [*]Very novel backpack inventory management system
[/list]


[b]Cons:[/b]

[list]
    [*]Very short (around 2 - 2.5 hours)
    [*]A bit pricey for the duration
    [*]As others have pointed out, the solutions to some puzzles are not exactly clear. There are hints scattered around, but the world is very detailed so they're easy to miss. It is extremely rare for me to me use any hint or guides but I did need to in order to complete the episode.
[/list]

Overall, I highly recommend this title for any Vive owner.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994361063', 'num_games_owned': 457, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 154, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 154, 'last_played': 1468563728}
review: Fantastic experience, one of the best polished VR games on the market. Next episode now!

author: {'steamid': '76561197969729595', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 176, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 140, 'last_played': 1577813209}
review:
People said it was short for the price, so I waited till the sale to buy it at £18 (£4 pounds discount). But it soooooooooo short. At best I can describe it as three puzzles wrapped up in the beginings of a very nice story. But two of those puzzles aren't really puzzle (follow the arrows and find a 'secret' entrance).

This will be one of the best Vive adventure games (in two years time there will be a ton to choose from) but judging by the length of episode one there will be about five of them to make it even close to AAA length game. THAT MAKES IT A £90 GAME!!!!!!!!!!! and I didn't even pay full price!

author: {'steamid': '76561197984297857', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 549, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 521, 'last_played': 1577983794}
review: Just Finished my First play through.  2.3 Hrs.  I took my time too.  Enjoyed the world ALOT.  So nice to see the detail in the game.  As with any consumer I would love more.  The story needs to be defined a little more.  It left to much open and didn't draw me in.  It feels like the show "Lost".  A lot of questions and not enough basic story.  But you have hooked me enough for the second chapter.  Also more puzzles would be fun.  Its mostly reading and walking around.  I feel that the $24 I payed was a little much for such a short game.  I know the market for VR games is going to be higher so to those on a budget maybe wait for a bundle when all the episodes are out.  Other than that its a fun game and would say go for it if you got the spare $$.  Def another fun VR RPG.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037060524', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 352, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 179, 'last_played': 1665871066}
review:
Ce jeu est m'a vraiment laissé sur le c**.
La première partie est (selon moi) une de meilleurs expériences en roomscale du vive. Souvent décriée, elle nous laisse sur une petite zone remplie d'objets et de possibilitées. L'immersion est vraiment bonne. On se prend même à s'assoir auprès d'un feu de camp pour écouter les enregistrements laissés sur le passage.
La suite est plus classique. Il y a moins d'interactions mais l'ambiance est soignée.
Le jeu se termine sur une séquence tout simplement incroyable. La plus grande claque que j'ai pu avoir en vr. J'ai des frissons à chaque fois que je relance ce dernier niveau. Les images sont complètements folles et la musique, somptueuse (je le refait à chaque fois que j'allume mon vive, juste pour la claque ^^)

Pour pinailler, je dirai que l'histoire est difficilement suivable étant donné qu'il n'y a même pas de sous titre anglais et que les personnages parlent souvent derrière un bruit de fond ce qui les rend difficelement compréhensibles.

En tou cas, j'attends avec grande impatience la suite en espérant que les developeurs en ont de nombreuses idées  pour nous en mettre plein la vue !!

author: {'steamid': '76561197962014553', 'num_games_owned': 482, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 302, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 302, 'last_played': 1467922530}
review:
This game offers a glimpse into the future of VR. Although it's short, it's the first title with a level of polish similar to that of a triple A production. The first half hour will be spent like you are on drugs with you staring at your virtual hands, repeatedly opening then closing them while giggling uncontrollably. The inventory and menu system alone is worth the price of admission. Everything in this world you can touch, pick up and interact with. The eye for detail is simply astonishing. 

There's exploration, mystery, adventure, humor, puzzling and some tense moments. Call of the Starseed has got it all. The finale, the last half hour of the game, will without doubt provide enormous goosebumps. I've finished CotS in one sitting, took me about 3 hours and I'd say it was well worth the 30 EUR I paid for it. When I finally removed my HMD I just sat there wide eyed for a couple of minutes, dreaming of the astounding possibilities this perfect marriage of creativity and technology will enable going forwards. Episode 2 can't get here fast enough!

author: {'steamid': '76561198006941248', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 199, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 194, 'last_played': 1471861947}
review: This is such an interesting game. I can't wait for more puzzles to solve. I love the inventory backpack, fantastic graphics and flow of the game. No time to go on holidays :D. I had no problems with bugs except falling into a wall and the elevator handle was hard to push down.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020525886', 'num_games_owned': 110, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 45, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3, 'last_played': 1466894933}
review:
Fantastic game.

The puzzles aren't terribly difficult, but cool nonetheless. I hope the following chapters do have some varying degree of difficulty though. The environment is a pretty compelling experience in VR, and very stable. I was able to play the last 90 minutes straight through with no issues at all. (Although there was one point in the first zone where you are standing on stairs, and if you move it's very disorienting).

The game is about 4-5 hours long, but I very consciously took my time to take in all of the scenery. If you're turned off by the price, don't be. If you early adopted VR, shoot for quality not quantity. This was easily the most fantastic time I've had in VR to date, and cannot wait for the following chapters.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065676402', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 159, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 153, 'last_played': 1483806835}

author: {'steamid': '76561197985664687', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 129, 'playtime_forever': 94, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 94, 'last_played': 1469501617}
review: This is a really cool interactive story. (not really a "game") The graphics are good, the sound is great, and the mechanics pretty much work.  It needs a little spit-and-polish, but that's what patches are for.  I finished it in about an hour of game time.  Good thing it was cheap.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035664337', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 241, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 192, 'last_played': 1472187515}
review: Awesome. Its only flaw is that it's way too short, but I'm happy to support games like this. We need more experiences like this in VR

author: {'steamid': '76561197972394487', 'num_games_owned': 116, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 148, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 148, 'last_played': 1469408405}
review: A lot of neg reviews based on price.  I think $30 is fair for this game. Having grown up playing Monkey Island and Space Quest point and click adventure games I would have prefered more puzzels that involve the environment like the bell puzzel and less puzzes that require you to manupulate small objects like the transister tube puzzel.  An impressive game considering the small size of the dev team.

author: {'steamid': '76561197974305596', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 130, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 106, 'last_played': 1491522569}

author: {'steamid': '76561198133024594', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 259, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 221, 'last_played': 1469942292}
