author: {'steamid': '76561198138532020', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 76, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47, 'last_played': 1514614590}
review: VR is all about immersive experiences and this title doesnt disapoint.  Yes its short like all VR games now, but worth the price now and to continue to support the developer for more updates.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084342186', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 169, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 169, 'last_played': 1469284218}
review:
I'll keep it short.
I kickstarted this one way back in the days of Oculus DK1.  
It's nothing like the game that was originally promised I don't think, a lot of the stuff is missing, no full torso shadow etc etc
But - it's a good play.
It's very short, took me 2 hours, and I was spending a lot of time looking around and being silly.
The Blink system is clunky, the hands could do with some arms, the puzzles are way too easy.
But - it tells a story, at least the start of one, and creates an atmosphere well.

There's massive, massive room for improvement, but it's a decent start.
At full price I have to say it's overpriced, but it's fun and if it appears in a sale - buy it.
Because - The end sequence is fantastic.  Gives you a real "Wow, THIS is what VR can do that no other medium can do" feeling.  You feel part of something magical, and leaves you gagging for the next part.

The further you get through this first part, the more it feels as though the developers have found their feet, so you have to hope that the next episode is gonna be REALLY special.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116304836', 'num_games_owned': 534, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 134, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 134, 'last_played': 1469242735}
review: A true must have for any Vive owner. Yes it's very short but that ending.. that ending alone was worth the money. Can't wait for episode 2!

author: {'steamid': '76561198082766241', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 137, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 137, 'last_played': 1468782160}
review: I like the game is probably a bit expensive especially considering it is episodic. I enjoyed that it didnt hold my hand and I had to think threw situtaions as if I was in a real life environment.  (puzzles seem to mean more in VR). Minor gripes were playing tapes during Npc dialog. 8 out of 10  for me. I hope they finish the game. Minor Spoliers conisider outlining the Bells blue.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002207103', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 283, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 261, 'last_played': 1493495893}
review: WOW! Just AMAZING!  So immersive VR experience! PS: Warning! - Don't watch the trailer (too many spoilers), just buy the game and enjoy!

author: {'steamid': '76561197988301085', 'num_games_owned': 423, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 94, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 94, 'last_played': 1469012663}
review:
Wonderful VR experience.  I love the way they implemented inventory management and movement.  Great graphics and immersive expeience.  

Short for the price?  Yes, but I don't know their intentions.  Leaves you wanting more, with more "episodes" on the way.  If each episode is $30, maybe not worth it, but if price includes other episodes, or if each episode is cheaper, then it's definitely worth it.  

Probably the best VR game I've played yet.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012915042', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 169, 'playtime_forever': 851, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 629, 'last_played': 1573506212}
review: Good, but a lttle juddery on a highly OC gtx 970 in the first level. upgraded to a gtx 1080 and they just had a major update. No Judder at all. This game was awesome, esp the ending!!!!!!! The most complete game made for VR up to date.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000576503', 'num_games_owned': 588, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 139, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 139, 'last_played': 1468963583}
review:
27,99€ für unter zwei Stunde Spiel. 

Es gab schon mal eine Demo, dessen Content in dem Spiel hier gar nicht enthalten ist. Es drängt sich die Vermutung auf, das das Spiel in Episoden zerhackt wurde um den Gewinn zu maximieren. Wie viele Episoden a ca. 90 Minuten werden wir zum Preis von je 27,99 sehen oder bekommt man die restlichen Episoden dann kostenlos?

Das Spiel selbst ist, sieht man über die Kürze hinweg gut gemacht, Das Inventar als schwebenden Rucksack ist toll, die Bewegung VR typsich. Ab und an hat sich der Boden in meine Richtung bewegt. 
Ich hätte mir eine deutsche Übersetung gewünscht, da die Schwester auf den Tonbändern doch teils schwer zu verstehen ist, vor allem wenn der Professor auch noch meint dazwischen reden zu müssen. 

Hat man das Geld übrig kann man bedenkenlos zugreifen,

author: {'steamid': '76561198312400115', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 101, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 101, 'last_played': 1467045431}

author: {'steamid': '76561198025181914', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 191, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 81, 'last_played': 1470176692}

author: {'steamid': '76561197960448333', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 483, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1598133264}
review:
All the negative reviews forced me to write this quick review.

*sigh* Yes, it is short, but IF YOU DO NOT SUPPORT this specific genre again, it will be like it was on the PC, neglected with a few gems... Despite this being VERY expensive, I still think it's worth it because you can get some friends or family members to experience this epic tale once it's over.

Overall I thought this game was VERY VERY fun and it did have a few glitches but nothing game breaking. I so can't wait for Episode 2 and YES, I will spend another $30 (if it is 30) for episode 2 when it comes out.

Soo support this genre!

author: {'steamid': '76561197972672648', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 296, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 208, 'last_played': 1485010326}
review:
Expérience très mitigé.

Le début n'est pas très bien réalisé. Mais plus on avance dans le jeu et plus l'expérience est bonne. 
La fin du jeu est LA meilleur expérience VR que j'ai vécu pour le moment. Cette immersion a la fin ... juste excellent.

J'adore :
+ la fin du jeu : épique ! (rien que pour la fin du jeu je vous conseille de l'acheter)
+ casse tête
+ système de sauvegarde

J'aime moins :
- le début du jeu (dommage si l'entrée etait aussi bien que la fin cela serait LE jeu de la VR)
- langue : tout en anglais et pas de sous titre
- prix : le jeu est quand même très court pour son prix enfin c'est comme quasi tout les jeux VR ...

Bref c'est un jeu que je recommande mais pas un must have.

author: {'steamid': '76561198295186316', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 312, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 174, 'last_played': 1531211090}
review: 这是一款非常好玩的解谜冒险游戏，但是188的价格只玩一章略贵。因为游戏所需要花费的通关时间并不是特别的长，关卡的数量也不是特别的多。游戏整体内容过少，对比这样一个相对较高的价格并不是很值。所以本游戏只推荐给资金比较富余且热爱冒险解密游戏的玩家。

review: Auf was für eine beeindruckende Reise mich dieses Spiel genommen hat. Leider recht kurz - aber für mich hat sich der Kaufpreis gelohnt. Das tolle Spielgefühl und die Qualität des Spiels haben den Preis rechtfertigt.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970614473', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 168, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 168, 'last_played': 1468350785}
review:
A nicely polished game with a little VR-playground built in, nice graphics and soundtrack... but it's way to short! Paying 30€ for literally four riddles is too much - and no fancy or even awe-inspiring level- or gamedesign can change that, IMHO.  About 8-10€ would be a fair price. 

Note: My 2.8 hrs playtime resulted from two people playing the whole game AND some idle time. 

CONCLUSION: 
Fun and polished game but way too expensive. Buy it anyway and you'll have about one hour fun for your bucks.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999222559', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 152, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 152, 'last_played': 1467772323}
review: While short this game is one of the best VR experiences I have had. Everything works and interacts just as you'd expect it to. The inventory system IS THE BEST there is in any VR game I have played. Story and graphics are great and everything runs smoothly on my very poor system (I'm running the bare minimum for VR). Cannot wait for the next episode!

author: {'steamid': '76561197979741288', 'num_games_owned': 263, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 143, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 116, 'last_played': 1469407956}
review:
The Gallery - Episode 1 is a phenomental demonstration of what we have to look forward to in future VR gaming. It's a 1.5-2 hour adventure (mostly looking at things, with a few puzzles) with lovely graphics, excellent voice-acting, a great soundtrack. The visuals (particularly at the end) can be breathtaking. 

Mechanically, it speaks the "language" of VR very well. Movement and interaction with the world is natural, and the inventory system using a backpack which you "pull" from your back when you want to access the inventory is neat. 

It's not perfect (nothing is). Graphics demands are high, with some juddering on my 6600k/Radeon 480 system, which mostly cleared up when I turned the settings down to low. There are some nausea issues with parts of the terrain where your elevation can change while you're walking in room scale, which can cause discomfort. The puzzles are a little simplistic, and the episode itself is not very long. 

That said, it's a wonderful first effort from this studio. It's a high quality, immersive, adventure, that's worth experiencing if you've taken the plunge into VR. I'm looking forward to the next episode.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970532152', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 117, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 117, 'last_played': 1465768387}
review: Okay, I normally don't post reviews, but I have to counter all the foolish negative reviews out there that almost universally say it's a great, pollshed VR experience, etc. with their only complaint being the $30 price tag, which is realistically NOT a good reason to post a negative review when the experience in the GAME ITSELF is all positive.  I also say this b/c VR game players need to wrap their head around the concept that good VR games are going to by necessity be more expensive than standard games for the simple fact that there is (for now) a much smaller player/customer base for them to sell to and make money on their invested time and effort.  Would I pay $30 for this game playing on a standard non-VR monitor, nope, absolutely not, not worth the money.  For VR, hell yes it is worth it!  It makes me sad to see so many falsely negative reviews that do nothing but praise the game as they vote it down :(

author: {'steamid': '76561198058844292', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 765, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 461, 'last_played': 1666137599}
review:
Probably the best VR experience I've had to date.  In some ways it's a shame that it came out so soon into the VR cycle, because it's going to take better resolution and lenses to see this game for what it is.  Most of the objects in the distance right now the Vive 1 just can't show clearly.

Still an awesome experience, though, especially the last 10 minutes.  Can't fault the developers for a technology limitation.  I'll be going back and playing this one on Vive 2, though, for an entirely new experience.

Looking forward to episode 2.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084373744', 'num_games_owned': 1313, 'num_reviews': 262, 'playtime_forever': 112, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 112, 'last_played': 1468233734}
review:
首先这是我的通关攻略,觉得188贵可以先来看看游戏内容
http://v.youku.com/v_show/id_XMTY0MDA5MDQzMg==.html

作为目前最贵的VR游戏。《The Gallery》是一个慢节奏、叙事题材的冒险/益智类游戏。在游戏中，你将会扮演年轻的主人公Alex，你的目标是在一个荒凉的冰岛上找到你的姐姐。就游戏机制方面而言，这是一个简单的探险类的解谜游戏，没有包括任何的战斗场景，但是这款游戏最令人难忘的地方在于它所创造的沉浸式体验，能够让人感觉身临其境——尤其是其栩栩如生的配音，这些真实的细节无一不让我爱不释手。
《The Gallery: The Call of the Starseed》是一个很简短的解谜探索类游戏，它以叙事的结构为玩家带来令人难以置信的身临其境体验，引人入胜的游戏画面和情节也让人更加期待下一章节的到来。你会发现《The Gallery》是迄今为止最好的VR游戏，绝对会让你意犹未尽。让我们一起来期待后续章节吧！

author: {'steamid': '76561197964126972', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 336, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 268, 'last_played': 1470100981}
review:
I really enjoyed the first episode of The Gallery. A great adventure game reminiscent of Myst. Check out the full review with my fiance here:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=L9z2lKBZO2k

author: {'steamid': '76561198261019870', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 139, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 139, 'last_played': 1462992742}
review:
Ein gutes Beispiel wie man trotz "Roomscale" Übelkeit verursachen kann! 
Wenn man in diesem Spiel eine unebene Fläche entlang läuft verschiebt sich der Spielbereich hoch und runter. Erst dachte ich das Tracking funktioniert nicht - aber dann habe ich den Zusammenhang mit der Bodenbeschaffenheit erkannt. 
Es wird mir schon nach wenigen Sekunden im Spiel schwindelig. 
Schade. Die Graphik ist nett. Die Handlung vielleicht auch... keine Ahnung... ist ja nicht spielbar.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019711488', 'num_games_owned': 290, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 178, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 91, 'last_played': 1480966851}
review:
Okay first and foremost I am so damn glad I didn't watch the Steam trailer before playing this game because I had no idea what to expect. The "Machine" section took me completely by surprise and reminded me so much of the Fifth Element (for some reason). I was completely taken aback!

The voice acting and character animations aren't amazing, nor are the quality of textures or geometry but that is where my negativity ends; this is the kind fo foot in the door that VR needs, the backpack functionality was a breath of fresh air and I thoroughly enjoyed the attention to detail like setting off fireworks and holding a sea shell to your ear (that really made me smile). The sense of wonder I had playing this is unlike anything I have come across in a game so far. I bought it solely on good reviews and I was definitely not disappointed! It is however a little on the short side, I admittedly expected double the length for the price it was, but not complaining though as it was still worth every penny!

I would highly recommend this to anyone who owns a Vive and I'm hugely looking foward to playing the second one, the end of this episode completely and utterly piqued my interest!

author: {'steamid': '76561198301417309', 'num_games_owned': 549, 'num_reviews': 266, 'playtime_forever': 107, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 107, 'last_played': 1464556368}
review: This game was the reason I bought a Vive. Unfortunetely 20$ for less than two hours of playtime with 3 puzzles =not enough content to recommend at this price.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972444771', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 628, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 253, 'last_played': 1560923231}
review: This is the best game on vive I've played.  It combines puzzlers (ala Myst) with a touch of sci fi, in a beautiful emersive world. As many have bemoaned, many games on the vive have an "arcade" feel to them.  This breaks the mold nicely.  And there were a few, "HOLY CRAP" moments that were just amazing.

author: {'steamid': '76561197965743017', 'num_games_owned': 186, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 108, 'last_played': 1471662935}
review:
Bought the game on the Steam Summer Sale.  Can't remember what I paid.  Fourteen, Fifteen, maybe Nineteen dollars.   I proceeded to download, install, load and jump into the game.   Fifteen minutes of exploration go by, then the game decides to crash.  

I gave up on it, until tonight.   I had a nagging feeling to load it up again, so I did.  I was most impressed.  What can I say that hasn't already been said.  You feel completely immersed in this world.   There are many tapes that you will pick up/play to learn more about the setting.   Every mechanic fits together perfectly.  The visuals are breathtaking.  
  There were a few moments when I thought to myself "WTF are they thinking, this scene is going to make me motion sick!"  Well, not once did I feel sick, and that's quite impressive considering the amount of time you spend on elevators and other devices in this game.

 I've gotta say, this is a wonderful experience.   MY only gripe is that it is $29  when not on sale!!   Thats a lot of money for a game that you can rush through in an hour.  On the other hand, you can explore the worlds completely, leaving you with roughtly a three hour playthough.   

I'm actually excited for the upcoming sequels.  I would recommend this game to anyone with a vive.  I would wait until you see it on sale, and snatch it right up.   This right here is how you do VR.  It is quite the teaser for what's to come.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034915842', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 221, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 221, 'last_played': 1464476769}
review: super duper best game

author: {'steamid': '76561198006639376', 'num_games_owned': 432, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 188, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 134, 'last_played': 1477104550}
review: Im about an hour into it and enjoying it. Some of the mechanics are absolutely amazing, such as the best inventory management in VR at the moment. The story is mildly interesting, the puzzles are pretty easy so far. It definitely has a Myst like feel to it, but really it just makes me hope for a VR Myst remake/sequel. Watch for a sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968359421', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 62, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 62, 'last_played': 1467569128}
review:
Had some technical issues with this game, with the screen glitching uncontrollably at points. I noticed that it has a lot to do with optimization oddities with the Unity engine. 

But also... while well acted and I can see a lot of hard work going into it, I find myself [i]desperately wanting.[/i] I would love to have been helping with a playtest in QA because I could have narrowed it down. Perhaps it's that actions didn't have much to offer in a fully physical game? Only certain objects are scripted... and buggily so. Why doesn't the log burn? Why doesn't the soda can burst? Why does the popcorn keep popping? It's nit-picky, I know, but it made me realize I was just supposed to bumble around and move on.

And, while I am usually in love with explore-y puzzlers, I found myself annoyed that the first thing I encountered was "anti-physics" even if it dangled by a chain. Then I was supposed to see another, and I'd even say similiar looking, box and knock it down to advance the puzzle. All my continuity feels broke and I just ... stopped and, mainly because of the buggy refresh and tracking, I returned it. Sorry.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017424817', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 516, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 233, 'last_played': 1484290429}
review:
This is a game where they've pretty much done everything right... Still my favorite and although it's short I have played through it about 4 times and each time I notice more things I missed the last time... The only feature I wish was included was the ability to move normally through space... I know I know it makes some people sick but there are those of us who don't and I think it would add to the immersion level... Even if we could switch between blink and normal mode that would be cool... But other then that I simply can't wait to play episode 2!! If you don't buy this game you don't know what you are missing!! It should be right at the top or your VR wish list!! 

Cheers,

Ghosty

author: {'steamid': '76561197992795009', 'num_games_owned': 406, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 298, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 195, 'last_played': 1468631412}
review: The best VR game I have played so far, the ending just had me awe struck. This shows the potential of VR. A must play, can't wait for the next chapter!!!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198097641030', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 187, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 132, 'last_played': 1481684302}
review: This game is my favorite out if all vr games. Looks great. If you have the space immersion is good. It's like being in a adventure game. Bit short. Really needed to be at least double the size. As with most adventure games you won't play it again for at least sometime.

author: {'steamid': '76561198274595300', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 306, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 252, 'last_played': 1563789064}
review: Good game! A bit short, but otherwise satisfying in VR. I hope Ep 2 will be longer-- looking forwrd to it as Ep 1 is one of the polished games for VR at the moment, and I expect more of the same for Ep 2.

author: {'steamid': '76561198288061232', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 295, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 295, 'last_played': 1466301442}
review: Amazing visuals and great characters make this story-based VR experience rise a step above most of the others available right now. You must use a wide variety of room-scale oriented actions that can take a bit to feel natural but, when they do, and they will, it adds immeasurably to the sense of immersion and 'thereness'. You're the lead character in this adventure-mystery and must solve puzzles, riddles and carefully perform physical actions that are fun and rewarding, though not super challenging. Definitely looking forward to the next chapter!

author: {'steamid': '76561197970177150', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 160, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 131, 'last_played': 1545752514}
review: Die bisherige Episode 1 ist ein herausragendes Beispiel für eine vollwertige VR-Erfahrung samt echtem Gameplay, Story, und allem was dazu gehört - wenn auch mit nur knapp 2 Stunden Spielzeit viel zu kurz. Falls der teure Preis dafür sorgt, dass es weitere und auch günstigere Folgeepisoden gibt, bereue ich jedoch nichts :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198228579776', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 98, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 98, 'last_played': 1467474771}
review: My first review. Felt compelled to tell people that this is definitely a VR experience worth checking out. It's a very solidly built world for you to explore and has an intriguing story going for it. Looking forward to where the story and adventure goes!

author: {'steamid': '76561197972183032', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 307, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 204, 'last_played': 1468459765}
review: Wow amazing! Im suprised this game is only at around 80% positive reviews right now. Most of the gripe is with the $30 price tag, but this is the best experiance I've had so far on my Vive. A mysterious, beautiful, adventure with some good humor thrown in. Felt like I was inside a Pirates of the Caribean movie almost (no pirates though sorry). I did pick during the Steam sale otherwise I might have not dropped the $30 Ill admit. But after having played Id say its worth it. The next best experiance I had was with Vanishing Realms which is $20. If you liked that, Id say pick this one up! Very similar. Minus the combat, but more impressive visually. Will be buying episode 2 when it arrives for sure.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053306908', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 335, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 152, 'last_played': 1619230463}
review: Yes it is short just like people say. But my gosh is it immersive and beautiful! While it seems overpriced for the length of play time offered, this is the nature of games right now while VR is so young. I spent $800+ on my vive plus a new new GTX980. A slightly higher priced game is not going to deter me especially when quality experiences are so hard to come by at this time. I will be buying episode 2 the moment it is released. If you want an immersive first person fantasy adventure game for your Vive, this is a great option!

author: {'steamid': '76561197988844501', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 460, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 198, 'last_played': 1574566803}
review: The end left me wanting more.I hate that it eneded so soon! I am ashamed to say it but I did have to do my own "research" for a part or two but I am not the best problem solver in VR, to many things that keep my eyes busy to concentrate. The graphics are not incredible but they are among the top for this stage of VR I'd say, the gameplay is great and makes you think about your next step. You are not running around shooting at people so dont think youll be spraying and praying quite yet but the future looks promising. I am looking forward to the release of Ep2

author: {'steamid': '76561197991267454', 'num_games_owned': 583, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 194, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 176, 'last_played': 1479245678}
review: Fantastic game. It may be a bit short, but it feels like the right length for an episode 1 of a VR game. Price point might be a bit steep, but if you can get it on sale or have the money to spend I definitly recommend this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561197976553669', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 217, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 217, 'last_played': 1467512938}
review:
By far the best stand-alone VR game there is at the moment for the Vive... however, Episode 1 is very short (1-2 hours) and once you know how to complete all the puzzles the experience is drastically shorter. 

Looking forward to Episode 2 and seeing how the characters and puzzles evolve.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068842589', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 131, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 131, 'last_played': 1467610499}
review: I've been meaning to get this game for a while, but most negative reviews are due to length/price. I decided to get it during the summer sale and it did not disappoint. Yes it is short, yes there isn't a whole lot of play elements, other than a few puzzles, but the atmosphere and environments really immerse you in the story. I can't wait fot the next chapter. I'm hoping that the price is not as steep as this one, so that more people give this game a chance.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998556356', 'num_games_owned': 202, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 62, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 62, 'last_played': 1467577058}
review: So, I'm going to give this a positive rating, however, I strongly recomend thinking about how much money you're willing to spend per hour of gameplay, even if it is VR. I beat the game in almost exactly an hour. The puzzles weren't difficult at all, and there was not 'exploration' due to being very linear. Graphics were fine, not quite at 'The Lab' level but better than some other VR experiences. For me it wasn't worth the ~$25 I paid for it, but it is a great start to something that will hopefully end up being interesting (the game stops on a cliff-hanger, just as it is getting good). That being said, this will be the first (and hopefully last) game I've ever refunded on Steam (I seriously cannont justify $25 for 1 hour of gameplay, since my wife isn't going to be interested in doing a playthrough of this game). If they add episode 2 to this as a paid, or cheap, DLC I'll gladly re-purchase it (perminately) to continue on with the story, but for now it goes back on my wishlist for me to watch as things *hopefully* improve.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993461633', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 286, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 179, 'last_played': 1473121596}
review:
I don't write reviews for games I play, this being very much the exception.

I've had a vive for about a month now, and just like anything else, there's a honeymoon period. Everything is awesome and new, and then after a while, the luster wears off and you see it for what it is--groundbreaking and enjoyable, but not perfect.

This game brought me right back to that first moment of amazement and showed me just a taste of what VR is really capable of. Literally standing, head tilted back, jaw on the floor incredible. There are a few minor glitches and bugs just like everything else new, but the immersiveness is so much better than anything else I've played so far. It's a short experience, but in my opinion, well worth the money.

Well done, Cloudhead. I'm looking forward to more!

author: {'steamid': '76561198302067021', 'num_games_owned': 185, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 102, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 102, 'last_played': 1467599229}
review:
Good game, nice graphics but very short for the cost.
ie Took me a total of 1.5 hours.
Not really any replay value.

author: {'steamid': '76561197965617871', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 245, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 121, 'last_played': 1636807125}
review: simply stunning... a must have for Vive owners. Cant wait for the next episode.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977602321', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 131, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 129, 'last_played': 1478432351}
review:
The biggest issue I had with this game was simply the fact that it was over fast and ended just as it was getting interesting. What it was is a step in the right direction for what we want exploration games to be in VR, and my critique of the game being too short should speak to the enjoyment I had of the game since it implies I wanted it to continue. Sadly it doesn't, and you are left feeling a bit shocked at how quickly you played through the game considering its asking price. As a game starseed is great, but sadly I don't think I'd recommend it (even at the as of writing this steam summer sale discounted price). 

If the price included upcomming episodes then I would have recommended it, but right now I'd probably recomend that you wait and see if you can pick it all up later in a bundle after more episodes are released - that way you'll get more value for your money and more content to enjoy at the same time. So for now this is a wait and buy later in my oppinion. 

PS. It hurts me to give this recommendation because the game itself is really fun and you can see the devs put a lot of love into it.

Edit: With the change of the game being included in the purchase of the vive I am changing my recommendation. The game itself is great, the main concern was always the value/time which is now a non concern.

Great game, great change and I'm eagerly awaiting the new chapter.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076888663', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 463, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 361, 'last_played': 1497721658}
review:
A beautifully crafted game that demonstrates the very best that roomscale VR has to offer.  Worth every penny.

Graphically demanding, so I'm looking forward to further performaance optimizations from the developers.

I can't hardly wait for the next episode to drop!

author: {'steamid': '76561197965768064', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 247, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 184, 'last_played': 1514488902}
review: I highly recommend this one even through I am not a fan of a puzzle games. Luckily there were only few puzzles. The story was really nice and I can't wait for the Episode 2.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006990655', 'num_games_owned': 165, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 177, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 177, 'last_played': 1465628187}
review:
Not worth the money for the amount of content provided. I enjoyed the game when I played it but I had also just received my Vive so the "wow" factor was still in full effect. Environments were nice but the game could use more puzzles and exploration. I also kept running into a bug with the backpack where it would stay stuck to my hand and I could not put it away unless I restarted the game.

Immersive game but the lack of content makes the $38 CAD hard to justify.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039119786', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 147, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 39, 'last_played': 1571106526}
review: at this point a SUCCESS in proof of concept. with the release of the other episodes hopefully a successful game. wait for a sale! or the other episodes to be released, or buy it cause you just cant get enough VR and want to try one of the most highly rated! (like i did!)

author: {'steamid': '76561198084490316', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 72, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 72, 'last_played': 1467502383}
review: Fantastic intro, great story line, too short. This game seemed to end just when it was getting started. I don't know if is worth its price, but I thought it was great. The 2 things that really bothered me were: 1. The hands don't feel liek they are in the right position, and also they dont pivot around your wrist when you rotate the hand controllers, rather they pivot around the top ring of the controller. 2. The Characters mouthes never moved, and their animations were a disaster. These things really killed the immersion, as well as the hand issue. I think that the price will be justified for this game when all of the episodes come out, and they make a bundle deal. Honestly was a great experience, just ended too quickly for the price, and there were issues in game that I listed which weakened the immersion.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035451762', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 145, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 145, 'last_played': 1466628114}
review:
For a front runner of the virtual reality market I give this game a thumps up. It is an interest 'tech demo' that will have you enjoy the sights and sounds of being 'immersed' in a game world. 

However as a 'game' it isnt. Dont expect to be either having your wits or dexterity tested. This is a a point and click adventure without the puzzles. It is a story in a similair vein as Gone Home. Enjoy the ride, just dont press any buttons on the way through.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022515961', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 199, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 156, 'last_played': 1467501037}
review: First VR game that grabbed my attention.  To bad it is a series.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049104695', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 76, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 56, 'last_played': 1469283601}

author: {'steamid': '76561197965576122', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 135, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 96, 'last_played': 1468286018}

author: {'steamid': '76561198125507102', 'num_games_owned': 292, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 309, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 235, 'last_played': 1580953364}
review:
Best VR experience to-date, and I own a good portion of the available VR games on Steam.

Jeremy Soule (Skyrim, Oblivion, Morrowind) did the soundtrack.  Just buy it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085614455', 'num_games_owned': 935, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 120, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 120, 'last_played': 1466744319}
review: Not worth the price. The game needs a lot more fun exploration and less tedious puzzles.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966005479', 'num_games_owned': 541, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 356, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 115, 'last_played': 1553875981}
review:
I just paid £18 for 115 minutes of gameplay and somehow I don't feel ripped off.  WHAT HAVE YOU DONE TO ME VIVE!

The first game I've played on the vive which really felt and looked polished.  The hands line up perfectly with your own and squeezing the back trigger to grab things is incredibly natural.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981222749', 'num_games_owned': 364, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 283, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 169, 'last_played': 1485498680}
review:
By far one of the best experiences I've had on the Vive. I love old school adventure games like Lucasarts & Sierra and this really scratched that itch for a VR game in that style. 

The only con is the length. It is a fairly short experience, especially for the full $30 price. Despite that I still feel that it was worth the investment in a studio that made a beautiful fun VR game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198302549027', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 365, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 356, 'last_played': 1468111323}
review: ummmmmmmmmmmmmmmm.  I just finished.  OMG.  This is something that I would have stood in line for 2 hours at an amusement park just to try.  I would have paid 50 bucks to play it just one time.  You guys are legends.  EVERYONE BUY THIS TWICE SO THEY KEEP MAKING THEM.  Honestly if a person complains about anything in this game, they are a jaded jaded soul.  If a person complains about this game, I think that person would also complain that a real life Back to the Future style hoverboard not being able to ride over water.  Or if they found an old lamp and a genie popped out, they would complain about only getting 3 wishes.  This is magic people.  AMAZING.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978252662', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 282, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 178, 'last_played': 1506794334}
review: Wow.... a short but amazing VR experience!  Think point and click adventure but in VR and you'll get the gist of the game... honestly, I never really got into point and click games before, but when you are immersed in that world it is sooo much better.  And the story on this one... I seriously had chills at the ending, can't wait for the next chapter!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198086763467', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 272, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 91, 'last_played': 1653349391}
review:
Best VR game on the market right now if you're a fan of single-player, story-driven experiences.   This is the game you'll use to introduce people to VR.    Although, as others have said, the price is a bit steep for the length of the game.  Still worth it, in my opinion. 

And to those complaining about it being buggy, I wonder what they're running.  I was running a 780ti and it was choking a bit on this one.   Upgraded to a 1080 and had zero issues.   This one is definitely a GPU hog.

author: {'steamid': '76561198234844036', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 68, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 68, 'last_played': 1467493926}
