author: {'steamid': '76561198009302579', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 87, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 87, 'last_played': 1461979206}
review:
Most buggy game available for the Vive VR headset. I was very excited about this game so I purchased it on the day the Vive was released. Becuase of shipping delays I didn't get my Vive for a few weeks after and then when I played they game and realized how horrible it was I was not able to get a refund. 

Don't waste your money on this disapointing mess.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996209035', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 129, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 129, 'last_played': 1463946695}
review:
One of the most fully realized games I've played on the Vive so far. The way in which inventory and movement is handled is great, and the story is pretty cool... at least so far as it goes.

And that's the one negative to this $30 purchase - it's incredibly short. There's only 4-5 areas to complete, and they're over in the blink of an eye. There's nothing particularly challenging as you make your way through the beautiful environments.

I loved the experience, but in some part that's due to the fact that I'm willing to support pretty much everything that's happening with the Vive right now, and this is something different. A year or two from now, I think I'd be appalled at paying $30 for such a tiny game. But having this product out at launch time? It gives a taste of what's to come, and (IMO) that's well-worth supporting.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961759716', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 120, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 120, 'last_played': 1461777227}
review: Good first experience in VR with that type of game. But I keep it under my arm waiting for the new 1080 to be released. GTX970 is literrally not enough powerfull  to enjoy this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020780825', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 140, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 140, 'last_played': 1463931412}
review: Amazing.

author: {'steamid': '76561197973943567', 'num_games_owned': 90, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 125, 'last_played': 1463895495}
review:
MUST HAVE!!
This game is really impressive and creative with the game mechanics that were created for it. The inventory system is genious and the teleportation is great since it lets you rotate your play space. Graphics are also pretty good. It has a few puzzles along the way to solve, but pretty simple. 

Cons
The game seemed to have some issues between level loading, one time when the level loaded everything was blurry and couldnt do anything, so I had to restart. Another, the level went to loading and remained black screen forever, had to restart. 

There was some black flickering that happened randomly, I wasnt able to pinpont what was causing it, but others have reported similar. While it was happening, it made it unplayable because the frames were distorted and I simply waited 2-5 seconds for it to pass to continue playing.

It was a little precey for the length IMO, but do not regret purchasing and had a very good VR experience with it, so I definitely recommend it to anyone who wants to experience innovative VR gameplay.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034245749', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 170, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 141, 'last_played': 1491508279}
review: Just finished this, and I've been blown away. It's slow, but deliberately so, and action isn't what makes this special (there are plenty of other VR games for that). The atmosphere... the music... the characters and the beautiful mystery into which they're drawn. This is dark fantasy at its best. By the end of this short episode, I am all in; I'm ready to take the next step (literally) with the characters, eager to discover where this tale is headed, driven by a genuine concern for my sister. Towards the end, as I descended into the depths of the earth, I was rendered breathless. An amazing and disturbing journey at once. I've dreamed of this kind of experience since I was a kid. This is what we were promised in the 90's, and it's finally arrived. Kudos to this team for making something truly special, something that many of us have longed after for many years. A few technical glitches aside, this is worth every, single penny.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979367440', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 136, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 136, 'last_played': 1463888289}
review: Rocky start with the controls and trying to reload the flare gun.  After that it was a solid two hours of excellent gameplay.  Got goosebumps at the end.  Excited for more!  If you have a Vive, you need this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035410712', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 459, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 180, 'last_played': 1507989122}
review:
Having spent my childhood exploring point-and-click adventure games this was my go-to title when I got my HTC Vive. And boy, it delivered my first goosebumps VR experience. 

Although the adventure is somewhat short and not completely bug-free, it's overall a great experience with varying levels of difficulty on puzzles. Sceneries are rich, and there's a ton of non-required items to play around with to mix things up (which was fun for a VR-newbie). Without giving too much away the last minutes gave me the kind of dimensions I truly hoped VR would deliver. Can't wait for the next chapter in the series to come out.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992019818', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 346, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 210, 'last_played': 1466709093}

author: {'steamid': '76561197989727248', 'num_games_owned': 229, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 135, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 98, 'last_played': 1469429136}
review:
Hands down the most immersive VR experience currently available. This game is just pure magic. If you own a Vive, you are doing yourself a great disservice is you pass this one by.

My only complaint is that it's shorter than I would like. You can play this game in one sitting (standing?). It's hard to gauge time when you're in VR, but I'd say 2 hours at the most.

author: {'steamid': '76561198278188549', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 241, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 157, 'last_played': 1511113264}
review:
Simply awesome! Last 20 or so minutes blew me away. 

I can't wait until the next episode.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059069181', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 84, 'playtime_forever': 258, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 180, 'last_played': 1494638795}
review: As of May 2016 this game is by FAR the most polished Vive experience. Yes it's pretty short but to me the quality of the two hours is easily worth the asking price. The world is extremely detailed, the story is interesting and I cannot wait to see what awaits us in Episode 2. The last ten minutes have been the best 10 minutes of VR for me so far.

author: {'steamid': '76561198277828523', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1865, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 624, 'last_played': 1583784014}
review:
Awesome game!! Sweet 80's Goonie's vibe, Hands down one of the best HTC Vive games to date. 

The Good
-Graphics, Soundtrack and story are the highlights.
-Blink system to move works well.
-Great voice acting.
-Very immersive, tons of atmosphere.

The Bad
-A little on the short side
-Some frame rates dropped in the beginning of the game.

Can't wait for the next Episode! Congrats Denny and everyone at Cloudhead games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012050838', 'num_games_owned': 303, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 171, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 128, 'last_played': 1486755485}
review: I just finished playing this and I have to say it is by far the best and most immersive VR experience I have tried so far. The visuals, the audio... Audio especially, it seemed to be fully bineaural, and I was able to tell exactly from where a certain sound was coming from, pretty insane. The story is fantastic so far as well, and I am really looking forward to seeing how it will continue! There were a few moments which felt so grand and epic in scale I almost felt like crying. And for those who are afraid you won't be able to run it on a low end GPU, I was able to run it on an AMD R9 270X with only light stutter now and then (medium settings).

author: {'steamid': '76561197969398955', 'num_games_owned': 864, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 206, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 206, 'last_played': 1463690510}
review:
Fantastical, immersive and awe inspiring. One of the best story based games for room-scale VR yet. It's a little bit slow to get started but by the end I found myself completely enthralled. Can't wait for the next installment. 

My one complaint is it's a little pricy for the length of the game. On the other hand, it definitely feels worth the money and I expect the cost of developing a game like this for VR is much more than a traditional title.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970855762', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 130, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 130, 'last_played': 1463724438}
review: One of the most amazing and epic VR experiences.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968673436', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 130, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 109, 'last_played': 1624142031}
review:
I wasn't immediately grabbed by this and wrote it off.    However I went back and gave it another shot and I'm so glad I did. The last 30 mins or so is the coolest experience I've yet had on the vive.   Can't wait for Ep2!

It starts slow, but has great room scale puzzles and fantastic atmosphere that really makes use of room scale VR.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014604732', 'num_games_owned': 102, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 301, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 229, 'last_played': 1470363241}
review: When I first imagined VR I imagined immersive virtual worlds that could allow me to have adventures I'd never get to have in real life.  It blows me away that I found that experience so soon after getting my Vive!!!  OMG!!!  I cannot wait for the next episodes.  You all have hit a homerun!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561197973629136', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 99, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 99, 'last_played': 1461508044}
review: Enjoyed this game a lot. I was disapointed that it ended so soon. I hope the future games likes this are cheaper, or longer.

author: {'steamid': '76561197962242093', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 247, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 158, 'last_played': 1475447797}
review: It feels like you are in a movie. The atmosphere is fantastic and there are shurly some very nice ideas to handle the vr envirorment. Hope to see the next episode soon!

author: {'steamid': '76561198303903499', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 6, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1463441627}
review:

- Stellar voice acting

Cons:

author: {'steamid': '76561197998668538', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 371, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 300, 'last_played': 1483348475}
review:
This is certainly the highlight of anything available for the Vive at the moment.

Game mechanics are brilliant with the backpack inventory system being so intuitive, it is nothing short of genius. 
The story line (so far) was pretty simple and game play was short but still undoubtedly a worth while purchase.
As it has been said before by others, this is the beginning of VR but this game truly showcases how good it already is.
Very much looking forward to Episode 2.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080803241', 'num_games_owned': 583, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 355, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 248, 'last_played': 1483052918}
review:
Одна и самый красивых и качественных игр на данный момент для VR, разработчики хорошо потрудились все сделано на высшем уровне текстуры, музыка, сюжет, концовка меня просто поразила, у игры большой потенциал и я с нетерпением жду следующих эпизодов.
Моя оценка 9/10
9 ставлю потому что игра очень короткая, контента в первом эпизоде на полтора - два часа, но оно стоит того!

Можно обсудить в нашем дискорде  https://discord.gg/d6KpPk

author: {'steamid': '76561197991579915', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 105, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 105, 'last_played': 1463358439}
review:
One of the best games out for the Vive is also one of the shortest and most uneccessarily expensive games available. I spent as much time as I could exploring the region and playing with stuff but could only manage 100 minutes of play time in this game (I haven't gone back to complete any achievements or gather any easter eggs I missed).

I do not recommend playing this game unless it is $5 or less, with more content.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979136400', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 169, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 148, 'last_played': 1480363389}
review: Short but good quality, the Myst og VR

author: {'steamid': '76561197968443590', 'num_games_owned': 402, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 188, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 121, 'last_played': 1481698321}
review: So freaking good, I can not wait for the next episode, I do not care what the haters say I will  pay the same again to play it. I look forward to anything VR Cloudhead Games comes up with.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972589329', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 258, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 98, 'last_played': 1524979890}
review: Excellent "full game" type of experience in the Vive.  Cool, fun game.  Looking forward to additional episodes!  Any gripes about the length are from folks forgetting that generating high quality linear VR worlds is currently still in it's infancy, and the fact that the majority of VR experiences are currently 5-10 minutes and then rinse and repeat with 8 bit style graphics.  This is much more a traditional game that puts the room scale VR capabilities front and center.  Definitely worth the price of admission.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984320916', 'num_games_owned': 526, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 333, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 333, 'last_played': 1463361649}
review:
Hands down best VR expeince I have had to date.
Grasping things can be a tad clunky, but otherwise amazingly polished.
9/10 Will play again.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989449898', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 116, 'playtime_forever': 185, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 177, 'last_played': 1476496353}
review: Wow! What an experience! Can't wait for episode 2!

author: {'steamid': '76561198101890750', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20, 'last_played': 1498366401}
review: I love the concept for the inventory system, this is a great game for the vive, I just wish it was longer it reminds me of the early lucas arts games like loom, and monkey island. The puzzles are fun but not especially challenging or frustrating. I can't wait for episode 2!

author: {'steamid': '76561198002072062', 'num_games_owned': 268, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 109, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 48, 'last_played': 1463317975}
review: Overall, this game went beyond my expecations -- especially at the end. The amount of content to the price is off, a $15 tag is more appropriate, but as with all new hardware releases the first games are going to be overpriced. I am just happy this was a actual game and not a tech demo.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970520745', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 318, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 224, 'last_played': 1479659858}
review:
This is a great chance to catch the game while it's on sale.

Just finished this game, after having paid full price. Wow. 

Yes, it only took about 2 and a half hours to complete. But honestly, I don't get how people can complain about the length of this when the quality was so over the top, and just the fact that this is an entirely new genre!

The last 5 or 10 minutes of this game were especially impressive.

Looking forward to more!

(PRICING RANT: It's not like they just took a normal 2D game, applied a little VR magic, and then upped the price for no reason. The entire design process is new, the interactions are new. Most games or VR products out so far offer 10 to 15 minutes of "gameplay" (i.e., just a VR movie) for 10 or 15 bucks. So at that rate this game would be priced at 120 to 160 dollars just for episode 1! But it's not, it's 30. This is a great investment in the future of VR gaming, if you're willing to take the leap.)

author: {'steamid': '76561198028417820', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 146, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 146, 'last_played': 1463261116}
review: Bella avventura grafica, forse un pò corta per il prezzo che ha ma molto coinvolgente

author: {'steamid': '76561197968804528', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 176, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 176, 'last_played': 1463602891}
review:
I read a lot of good things about this game with the short playtime being the biggest downside. 
I decided to buy it considering i could allways refund it if it is not worth it.
So far I played one hour and i did not come far yet. I take my time.
What i saw so far is nicely done and the quality is a lot higher than pretty much all other early roomscale games. Graphics are great too. It's definatly worth the money for me allready. I will update this review onc i finished the game.

Update: played some more today. As you can see I am taking it slow.I have very little playtime and when I play nowadays I amin no rush. From what i saw today the game really took off. I fear it is over soon since it is known to be short but it is worth the money. Episode 2 is a must buy for me allready.

Update: Finished it just now. I wont spoiler anything but the end is bloody amazing. This is the best experience in gaming i had in a very long time!

author: {'steamid': '76561198032979928', 'num_games_owned': 289, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 31, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1461639837}
review:
Frame drops regardless of settings make the game unplayable. Enough frame drops and you will feel nauseated. This is on a high end system:
3570k @4.5ghz
EVGA GTX980 SC
16GB DDR3 @2133

author: {'steamid': '76561197969967860', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 152, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 134, 'last_played': 1603059019}
review: So, this show why FPS / Adventure games will go roomscale VR, its just amazing just finished it. Did not mind that it was short about 3 hours for me as I took my time, if you want to see the future get this game, note you should have a 980TI for best experience. But can still be played. Just saw WOW.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000720342', 'num_games_owned': 814, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 102, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 102, 'last_played': 1463233046}
review: This was alot of fun! so far its a great game, but this is only the first eps. i hope that I wil have the same experience in the upcoming eps as I had with first one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013949090', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 176, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 176, 'last_played': 1463222721}
review: Well dang. I know there are a couple "real" VR games hitting Steam among the deluge of throwaway tech demos, but this one is a cut above the rest. It feels like the future of VR. Like after we get done standing and spinning around to shoot things and we get past all of that dumb Wii level BS, when we start getting full experiences, they will be like this. Besides the occasional jank, it's a very smooth and polished experience. The elevators will give you vertigo, the fireworks will delight you, the volleyball and basketball hoop will wake up your neighbors above if you are 6'3" and have short ceilings. I want more of this, and not knowing when the next episode comes out makes me sad. It's absolutely worth the money for one episode. Especially considering you just paid $900 (Shipping and handling!) for that headset of yours.

author: {'steamid': '76561197976156605', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 187, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 187, 'last_played': 1463212768}

author: {'steamid': '76561198045822570', 'num_games_owned': 1837, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 147, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 133, 'last_played': 1467584351}

author: {'steamid': '76561198008024021', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 104, 'playtime_forever': 201, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 101, 'last_played': 1576864003}
review: Yes this game is short, but wow is it worth the money. Its like playing in a movie. Even if its only 2-3 hours long. I loved the story and am very excited for more.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970864200', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 100, 'playtime_forever': 395, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 287, 'last_played': 1504737265}
review: What a wonderful game and what a fantastic end to the chapter. If you own a Vive then this game is a no brainer, A truly magical experience, If you ever fancied starring in an adventure movie and thought you could do a better job than Indiana Jones then this is the game for you, Yes everyone is saying it's short for the price, But nothing I have seen comes close so far on the Vive in terms of an actual game, And because of the nature of VR I think it's well playable a few times just like you would go on that roller coaster again and again, Breakout of your dull life and go to another place, you won't regret it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061723671', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 297, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 201, 'last_played': 1476978563}
review: Wonderful!

author: {'steamid': '76561198009054216', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 412, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 338, 'last_played': 1469366429}
review:
I finished it and there is not much left to say, so I keep it short. :-)

I love the game, it´s awesome. The price is absolut fine for this early and great VR experience imo. I think this is a must have title at the moment because it shows absolut stunning the possibilities of VR. I didn´t saw something like this until now. And it´s imo also a must have game because there are more episodes coming. When they make them also so impressive and beautiful you will have to buy episode 1 for knowing the beginning of the story. ;-) The price for next episodes depends mainly on the number of purchases if I understood it right in the disscusions. That´s absolutly ok and understandable to me. The market is very young and it´s not a huge company, so it´s fine to handle it likes this. Better no promises as maybe later wrong promises. 

Have fun! :-)

author: {'steamid': '76561198014818365', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 443, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 280, 'last_played': 1475628787}
review:
By Far this game will be my number 1 pick for what I want to play long term.  It was a bit strange at first was stuck because i was not playing the tapes and taking the hints but once i did and got to the last stage of the game i was almost 10 years old again.  I admit that I went back and keep going back to play around with the Graphic card settings for the last sceen because it is by far super exciting to watch.  I only wish the game was not so short!  The last puzzle was my only issue, it took way to long to complete longer then it takes to get to that point in the game but it was worth completing as the sceen after that up to the end of the Episode was amazing.  
Please release new updates, but not so expensive, the price of this Episode was not worth the gameplay TBH, paying 30 for a game i would expect a decent 8n hours of game.  
But with that said for anyone not sure about this game play it, its worth the money now but if they are going to charge us every episode it is not worth it after the first one.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969819787', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 168, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 168, 'last_played': 1463082055}

-It's important to rememba dat graphics are everythin' 'bout gamin'

author: {'steamid': '76561197975312920', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 135, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 92, 'last_played': 1499019140}
review:
Amazing!  First real "game" I've played in VR.  Not knocking others, Audio Shield is amazball cray cray, but Gallery was the first VR game that felt like a real game.
Picking up what looks like a Roman Candle, going "This looks like a Roman Candle." Picking up a candle with the other hand, and lighting the RC realizing hey, it is!  And firing them around is so cool.
Having to reach behind you to pull out your backpack, go through it for the item you need, and pulling it out feels so smooth and real.
They did amazing work for such a small team!  This is a must have!

11/10(Just like the VR tester goes to!)

author: {'steamid': '76561197988059250', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 173, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 105, 'last_played': 1484277142}
review: The game was great. From start to finish i didnt want to stop. The puzzles wern't to hard. I hope in the next chapter(s) they make them a bit more difficult. It felt alot like I was a protagonist in a novel.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984828042', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 110, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 110, 'last_played': 1463015375}
review: Yes, short. But very awesome. I hope more VR games like this come out.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961320641', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 106, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 106, 'last_played': 1463003581}
review:
Cons
- Very short (90 minutes for me)
- Story is generic... probably because there is only about 20m of story, and the other 70m is exploration/puzzle solving.
- Only 2 real puzzles, and neither is original or that interesting
- Weird developer choice to have the viewport stay consistent with the ground height: This causes the world to move up & down in a weird way (mainly on the Beach) that made me think my Vive was broken. How this didn't cause red flags in QA, I don't know. It feels horrible... so much that you have to limit any moving around and teleport everywhere, which broke my immersion.

Pros
- Good art direction, sound and music
- Really inventive inventory system
- Some really cool visual moments in the last third

I would probably normally return this game because I am under the refund time limit, but I would like to support VR developers in this new market. I'm just hoping I get more for my money next time.

author: {'steamid': '76561197974121313', 'num_games_owned': 577, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 189, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 134, 'last_played': 1479591068}
review:
The final sequence of this episode was worth the £22.99 I paid for it alone.  Very well made adventure game, great looking, great sound/music and polished.  Fantastic sense of atmosphere and the ending, holy crap it completely blew me away.  I've had my Vive for about a week now and I've tried everything available for it multiple times, had to wait on this game because I only had 12GB RAM and found on the highest settings the game would crash after chapter 1 with memory issues.  Upgraded my RAM and finally got to finish this game.  The single most astonishing VR experience for me so far was the final sequence, I can't blabber on about it enough.  

Looking forward to the next episode.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034733683', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 122, 'last_played': 1579893306}
review:
This game can make you very, verysick if you are sensitive to motion sickeness. I was very disappointed because the game has been in developement for very long and it was one of the first to use "blink" teleportation. Incredibly, after you teleport, the floor of the virtual play area moves vertically, up and down, causing severe nausea. 
To be clear, I can play for 6 hours in a row in the HTC Vive and feel perfectly fine with games that are well done (Quar battle gate 18, Jeeboman, Cloudlands minigolf, Final Approach  all have got blink too and I feel very fine inside them).

author: {'steamid': '76561198085955390', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 163, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 163, 'last_played': 1462940134}
review: Gameplay and mechanics are solid! I love how you grab you backpack and put it away. There have been 3 times in VR where I have had a HOLY **** moment. I am proud to say this title was the 3rd one. Characters are pretty cool. Main character could use some more voice presence in my opinion. I can not reccomend this title enough. Episode 2 is highly anticipated!

author: {'steamid': '76561197970923897', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 235, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 123, 'last_played': 1508823061}
review: Easily the best game on the Vive right now.  Incredible experience.  Gave me goosebumps and left me shaken.

author: {'steamid': '76561198288541974', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 186, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 149, 'last_played': 1473031345}
review: A little shorter than I expected but a lot of fun. Looking forward to Episode 2.

author: {'steamid': '76561197973226908', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 169, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 169, 'last_played': 1462930536}
review:
Short story - BUY IT - top notch experience and immersion.

This is by far the most immersive VR experience I have played through yet - especially with the Vive and tracked controllers. The graphics and immersion are amazing, and play time is better than most early VR games as well. Love how the hands are rendered and work in VR (and hope they take advantage of gloves and elbow tracking that will be coming out at some point). This is a throwback to adventure games I loved so much back when they were popular, and this medium makes them so much better. There are achievements in this game as well, so planning to jack back in and finish the achievements! Can't WAIT for the next chapter!

There are some known flickering issues in some spots, but appears to possibly be an nVidia driver issue or STeamVR issue. Shows up in this game because it is much more advanced than many of the launch VR titles. I still had no problems getting through the chapter though.

author: {'steamid': '76561197973855536', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 219, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 162, 'last_played': 1463319878}
review:
Super Grafik und toller Sound!
Alles gut umgesetzt und sehr fesselnd.

Kann ich jedem Vive Besitzer empfehlen! :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198019710766', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 291, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 209, 'last_played': 1490490111}
review:
Someone once told me VR is just a fake world and it will disappear once I turn off the computer, I replied: "But the emotions I felt was real."

Despite its short gameplay, Call of the Starseed truly brings out the raw emotions out of me. Awe, anxiety, fear, and the urge to push forward despite all odds due to the burning curiosity within.

For a first generation VR game, Call of the Starseed is visually stunning. While it does not have the sharpness of modern AAA games due to the limitations of current generation headsets, everything looks surprisingly real, including your own hands. Well animated NPCs and excellent voice acting also helped made this world organic and alive.

The only complain I have is that the price is slightly on the high side for such a short experience, which can be completed around 2 hours if you are not like me and get stuck in almost every puzzle.

However, if you love games that tinges your emotional cord, and doesn't mind paying for future chapters, Call of the Starseed is for you.

tl;dr
[b]Pros:[/b]
[list]
[*] Emotion roller coaster
[*] Visually stunning
[*] Excellent NPCs
[/list]

[b]Cons:[/b]
[list]
[*] Pricey
[*] Short experience
[/list]

author: {'steamid': '76561198018474955', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 676, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 155, 'last_played': 1463332899}
review: The best experience I've seen on the Vive, and one of the best gaming experiences I've had in 30 years of gaming. Great production value, wonderful and interesting story, and nothing much getting in the way or hindering it. Cannot wait for the next chapter!

author: {'steamid': '76561198006030564', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 107, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1464646226}
review: Love these types of games and playing in VR makes it all the more immersive.

author: {'steamid': '76561198117632336', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 41, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1463436474}
review: Beautiful VR experience. I only played for a short time but I'm eager to spend more time in this world and solve the puzzles.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015737462', 'num_games_owned': 458, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 268, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 166, 'last_played': 1611224084}
review:
Zum jetzigen Zeitpunkt gibt es nicht vergleichbares im Steam Store. Ich verstehe, dass es nicht einfach ist Spiele für ein "neues Medium" zu entwickeln. Außerdem gibt es nicht viele Leute die das Spiel überhaupt spielen können. Daher ist zu verstehen, dass es etwas teurer ist. Aber der Presi von 27,99 Euro ist meine Meinung nach etwas zu hoch. Ich habe mich nicht über den Tisch gezogen gefühlt, aber ich wünschte die Entwickler würden  wenigstens einen Rabatt auf die nächste Episode spendieren. Es soll ja 4 Episoden geben - alle zum selben Preis? und alle mit 1,5 - 2 Std Spielzeit?
Unter Strich ist diese "Experience" gut gelungen und empfehlenswert. Besonders das Inventar ist klasse gelöst. Allerdings gibt einige Merkwürdigekeiten beim teleportieren. Wenn man auf einer Schräge anhält und sich dann IRL vor und zurück lehnt, bewegt sich die Kamera als würde einem ein 1m Hals wachsen. Auch ist das Spiel auf einer GTX970 nicht komplett flüssig spielbar, obwohl man schon auf FXAA verzichtet. Dieser Verzicht lässt in der Entfernung die Kanten schimmern und wackeln. Ich hoffe das können die Entwickler noch verbessern.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980672712', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 208, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 113, 'last_played': 1469500955}
review: Call of the Starseed is a great, but short game. Normally, I'd say $30 is a steep price for a 2 hour game, but in this case I consider it an investment in Cloudhead Games' future.  My hope is that they learned a lot from making episode 1, and that in episode 2, they can focus on making more content rather than figuring out what works and what doesn't in a VR game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198140650653', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 25, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1462405422}
review: Refunded it after 30 minutes, nice and quite polished, however not worth 27 euro for 2h demo. Very easy "puzzles". I would keep it for 5 euro.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970510400', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 161, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 161, 'last_played': 1462754808}
review:
I was hesitant to pickup this game, based on some reviews, but decided to go for it, and give it a play through.  
I want to support the devs, so I don't return it or something, like some others have done.  

But with that said, I do agree with others in that, it's very-very short, for the price, and still has some issues.  

The story itself was interesting, the audio was nice, and some of the interactions were cool.   But, I also ran into some bugs that broke immersion and also made me kinda motion sick.  


The Good:

- Intersting story
- Nice Audio in general 
- The backpack storage is cool/better than traditional menus/ect.  
- Some nice iteraions with objects/environment.  


The Not So Good/Bugs:

- Blink Navigation (Default Settings) felt a bit clunky to me.    Trying to rotate the teleport space was a little akward with the touch pad, but that's maybe a hardware/firmware issue.   Also aiming with your head is awkward/kinda uncomfortable.  I really like how Valve had it setup, where you aim with the controller, and press the touch pad to instantly teleport.  You have a delay in this game, as you "walk" to the teleport area or something.  

- Some of the env. art felt a bit in-consistent.   The last env. felt pretty rough.  Geo wasn't too bad, but the textures looked almost placeholder/temp.  Lower res/too large of UV scale/noitceable seams/ect.   

- In multiple cases, when I leaned my body left/right, the whole world seemed to move up and down or something. Which started to get me a little motion sick/unstable.  It wouldn't always move, and in some cases only 1-2".  But the worst was when it moved 6" to 1ft, and I really started to feel un-easy.  Not sure if a bug or what.  

- When I loaded into an area once, maybe since I teleported into a doorway before the load, the loading icon/menu was broken, and I saw 3 large grey planes infront of me.  

- In multiple cases, the Flare Gun ammo got stuck floating in the air attached to my gun.  Or I couldn't drop the ammo/interact anymore.  So I had to load it into the gun to get rid of it, or shoot my flare gun till empty, then reload.

- The backpack, while cool, wouldn't get put away many times, when I thought it did.  So I started to walk away, and it was floating there yet.   Or I could try to drop items into it over my shoulder, and it would miss and fall to the ground.  Unless I wasn't doing something right.  

- The game is very short.  Depending how fast you solve the puzzles.  But, even still maybe only 2-3 hours long.  

- The env was very linear/not really much to explore or checkout.   I probably wouldn't play through a second time. Unless to show friends/ect.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054227881', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 264, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 219, 'last_played': 1464357640}
review:
This was the first game on VR that made me say WOW many times.
Even if it is short i recommend it to my friends.


Pro :
I enjoyed the game a lot

Cons:
pretty short game . after i finished it , have no reason to play again.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963918789', 'num_games_owned': 312, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 217, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 215, 'last_played': 1462082850}
review:
This is probably the most polished narrative game you can find, with great VR mechanics. Great story and visual imagery, but plays a little short. I was left longing for more, and hope the devs will continue and make followup episodes.

My wife was skeptical of the game, seeing how much I paid for it given the amount of content, but after having played it herself, she was impressed, and felt it was one of the most polished experiences she's had.

tl;dr: Buy this if you want to see what a polished VR game would look like and support the developers who make them, and you have a little bit of money to burn. You won't regret it, but you won't necessarily love the price.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971589767', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 45, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 45, 'last_played': 1462773288}
review:
Very well made game, however the blink system, although smart and intuitive, isn't smart enough... having an in game chaperone wall that is present at all times is very immersion breaking... and having to think about which way to rotate your environment with every blink in order to fit in the game world is also immersion breaking...

The way the game "Budget Cuts" manages this is much better, but still not perfect... we need a hybrid of redirected walking and blink... make it so that when I blink, the game chooses the optimal rotation based on if I have to walk somewhere in physical reality (i.e. up to a desk to pickup something in VR).  I understand in games like Budget Cuts, redirected optimal rotation isn't practical because when you teleport you need to be faced a certain direction due to split second decision making... but in an adventure game, it absolutely is practical... and optimal!

Fix this, and I'll definitely recommend this title!

author: {'steamid': '76561197996970006', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 210, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 210, 'last_played': 1462744751}
review: good stuff, one of the best vr games.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983019438', 'num_games_owned': 334, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 412, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 212, 'last_played': 1673902350}
review:
My first steam review. but I wanted to gove this incredible VR experience some credits. What can I say: This is the future of gaming and classic adventures. I just love walking around and picking items up by hand. The inventory is represented by a backpack. What a great idea. You can pick up a lot of stuff and interact with it.

As everybody else already said: The game is very short. It took me 3 1/2 hrs. But hey: It's the first of its kind. So consider that. The graphics are good, the voice acting is very good. The story itself is maybe not the best, but I didn't care. It's just a really exciting exploring adventure. And the end was quite impressive. So I can't wait for episode 2!

author: {'steamid': '76561197963536494', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 266, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 132, 'last_played': 1498931962}
review:
This is my best game for now that i have tryed in the vive so thumbs up.

Pros: good sound,good visuels,good vib

Cons: only con about this game its way to short if it wernt for my oO what is this i would have used a hour on it,

author: {'steamid': '76561197963693462', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 828, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 604, 'last_played': 1490521245}
review:
This game has one of the greatest interaction systems in VR currently.
The teleportation system is very cumbersome, though.

But there's nothing that can justify the $30+ price tag for me, for 1 to 2 hours of gameplay. Especially considering this is just for episode one, meaning the full experience will be $100+ for about 8 hours.

The experience is cool and all, but had I paid for this, I would suffer from buyer's remorse, no doubt.

If money is not an issue for you, by all means, buy this game. But if you don't throw $30 left and right, you may end up wishing you had waited for a discount.

Maybe I enjoyed the experience knowing I hadn't forked out $30 for it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988365551', 'num_games_owned': 1486, 'num_reviews': 342, 'playtime_forever': 184, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 142, 'last_played': 1463493787}
review:
Short adventure. High price. Yes, everbody been saying that. And yes that is also true.

But it is the only real "attempt" of a fully fledged roomscale adventure game.
And it is brilliant. I can't wait to see more of this.

Only get this if the price tag doesn't hurt you for a 2h game/experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970637786', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 312, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 192, 'last_played': 1508809831}
review: Engrossing world and characters, great inventory system with the backpack, this feels like the most complete exploratory game experience yet on the Vive. Highly recommended - the price is indeed on the high side, but the overall experience is so polished and engaging that I believe it's worth it. This developer is pushing the VR game medium forward in all the right ways.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991086649', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 384, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 154, 'last_played': 1511564611}
review: This experience represents the future of gaming, My only con for this game is that I was sad to see it over. Can't wait for the follow up episodes, the sooner the better.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984906169', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 133, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 96, 'last_played': 1467569356}
review:
WHY DID IT HAVE TO END!?

I've never written a serious review of a game before, but after been virtually blown away by this game I had to drop my thanks.

You absolutely nailed an immersive VR game, you had me completely sucked in and I believe that's what the VRers are looking for. It's an awesome showcase of what VR can really be!

Sure the gameplay is short and the puzzles are easy and can be guessed mostly, but you're playing this for a taster and an incredible experience.

GO BUY IT NOW!


Keep at it Devs and I look forward to the next one.

P.S. loved the ending.

author: {'steamid': '76561197962292728', 'num_games_owned': 379, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 134, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 114, 'last_played': 1461525116}
review:
This game suffers from the same problem the mass majority of the other VR content, the devs are not sure how many copies they will sell and are afriad to put too much time into a game right now, so they are realing "episodes" at damn near full retail for a game.

I cannot reccomend this game for the price, the teleport system in this game is one of the least intiative i have used, the graphics are muddy, the game performs very poorly, the character models seem off and small, the puzzles are easy, and there are very few of them.

If this was $40 and all other epidoes are included as they come out id say buy it...
if this was $10 and at least 1 other episode was out they id say buy it...
if they had SLIVR supported and the game didnt lagg so bad i had to turn the graphics to low on my tri-sli 980 with a 4.4ghz cpu i might say buy it...
if the game didnt raise the camera when you look over a higher spot on the ground and make you dizzy when it happens id say buy it...

I did LOVE the inventory system and the flashlight was a wow moment in the sewers, and the last 5 minutes of the game looks bad ass, if they release the next episode i might buy that one to use the "power" you get...

author: {'steamid': '76561197968282704', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 238, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 156, 'last_played': 1465705603}
review: An incredibly immersive experience that sucks you right into their world, with wonderful graphics and voice acting. Loved how natural the interactions felt. Wish it were a bit longer and the puzzles a bit harder, but it does strike a good balance for a launch title / introduction to VR. This is the future - cannot wait for more episodes and VR titles of this style.

author: {'steamid': '76561198087686276', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 166, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 166, 'last_played': 1462753376}
review:
This is the Vive launch title that will be remembered forever. I thought I had a pretty good idea of what VR was capable of but The Gallery just completely changed my perspective on the tech and the future. I don't just mean the future of video games. This goes beyond video games. This is a conciousness game.

If you have a Vive get this. It is everything you want, and didn't know you wanted from a VR experience. Remember when Mario 64 commercials came out and you were like WOAH WHAT THE HELL!? This is that, but like if Mario 64 could also suck your dick.

(It's short though so take your time.)

author: {'steamid': '76561197969524886', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 70, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 70, 'last_played': 1462581826}
review:
Constant tracking jitters while playing, view jumps around. I have not had any issues with any other VR games until I tried this.

I tried everything to get this to work well. Disabling camera, Minimizing desktop window. Resetting with Nvidia control panel and Lower in-game settings. I am on i7 with with GTX 970 drivers are up to date.

Another thing of note is when walking around, the world will rise and fall depending on the level of what you are standing on (really bad on uneven terrain). This vertical motion on top of jittering issue makes me sick. (Note: I am fine playing Hover Junkers) They could easily fix this by locking height when not teleporting.

author: {'steamid': '76561197976704711', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 245, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 157, 'last_played': 1506026785}
review: Thank you, this game made me believe in my Vive! Great clear visuals, incredible sense of presence and fun puzzles.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007810988', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 128, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 128, 'last_played': 1462537048}

review: WOW!! so immersive. Want more and more like this

author: {'steamid': '76561197970423434', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 161, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 93, 'last_played': 1463880419}
review:
I was fairly hesitant to spend so much on a title this short without much replay value, but I finally did and it was very worth it.

Really great scenes. The puzzles are a bit easy, but enjoyable and novel. Awesome finale.

I can't wait for the next episode.. A bit less on the price would be nice.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970319815', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 149, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 101, 'last_played': 1463184583}
review: Loved it!  Can't wait for episode 2.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993273069', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 308, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 292, 'last_played': 1649534785}
review: Must have for the VIVE!

author: {'steamid': '76561197970811303', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 531, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 247, 'last_played': 1622656613}
review:
Like most people have said, this game sets an early high standard and others should look to this game for tips on how it's done.

Even although it's short, I'm doing it again. Can't say many games do that to me often.

This is the only game you should get for VR if you are lost at what to get. Stick with it, the end is more than worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970644168', 'num_games_owned': 417, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 217, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 176, 'last_played': 1543611230}
review: it's truely fantastic

author: {'steamid': '76561197970301255', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 320, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 206, 'last_played': 1471220883}
review:
Pros:
- Visually stunning
- Interesting story
- Bar-setting game mechanices (particularly the inventory system and the flashlight behaviour)

Cons:
- Short (about 2 hours, 3 if you enjoy exploring & marvelling at the scenery)
- I ran into a fairly major bug, but it was solved by reloading the game

With a library of nearly 50 VR games currently in my Steam account, I can safely say that, hands-down, this is the closest you'll currently get to a AAA title on the Vive. The visuals are top-notch and incredibly immersive. Is it expensive? Yes, considering the relatively short playtime; however, I am simply in awe of what the developers have achieved with Call of the Starseed and personally think the price is worth it. If you're a fan of adventure games, this is a must-buy!

author: {'steamid': '76561198006125695', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 111, 'playtime_forever': 102, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 102, 'last_played': 1462454324}
review:
This is an Absolute Must try on the Vive

This Game has restored my faith in VR games

This is and should be a Benchmark for VR Game developers

It looks Fantastic everywhere you look with no noticable BLUR or eye strain and great CLEAR field of View.

Audio is great.

So this is what you should expect qaulity wise from VR made games and if its not this good, you know it's a poorly made and not well optimised. (which I could name a few)

Thats why this game put a big smile on my face.

Highly recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003587074', 'num_games_owned': 2195, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 131, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 84, 'last_played': 1561731446}
review:
Awesome adventure game with great atmosphere and attention to detail. The ending is especially amazing.
The price is pretty harsh though for less than 2 hours of content. I hope the next episodes will be cheaper, or there will be some kind of bundle/season pass.

author: {'steamid': '76561198165611860', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 229, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 125, 'last_played': 1492818547}
review: Hand down this is the most impressive game you can purchase for your new Vive. The controls, sound, graphics, and story telling are all top notch. Yes, it is on the short side as this episode will take you approximately two hours but it will be the best two hours you can spend in VR at this moment in time. A pure joy and I can not recommend it enough.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025316521', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 140, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 140, 'last_played': 1462335567}
review:
First review i've ever written about any game on Steam.
- Goddamn this short adventure just barely touching on what is possible with VR is worth every single penny. 
- Ep.2 cannot come soon enough. Thank you so much for this experience. 
- A must play for everyone.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018559025', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 169, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 98, 'last_played': 1515919593}
review: By far the best game on the Vive right now.

author: {'steamid': '76561198240224206', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 202, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 185, 'last_played': 1668469472}
review: Mindblowing. Probably at the moment the best VR game apart from shooters/reaction games. It was all I hoped for in VR, big compliment to the devs for the mechanics, especially for the walkman and the backpack, just brilliant. All doubts about adventure games in VR are laid to rest - it's great! I can't wait for the next episodes.

author: {'steamid': '76561197965176678', 'num_games_owned': 172, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 167, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 164, 'last_played': 1475703640}
