author: {'steamid': '76561197972380310', 'num_games_owned': 1241, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 138, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 117, 'last_played': 1463027311}
review: Episode 1 was short, took a little over an hour to finish... but loved it! Can't wait for the next episode!

author: {'steamid': '76561198271746774', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 284, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 136, 'last_played': 1473426822}
review: 不会 玩，都打不开门，谁能帮助我吗

author: {'steamid': '76561197993650147', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 152, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 152, 'last_played': 1462117205}
review:
The price might never come down, but surely a bundle will come out eventually. If there ends up being 10 episodes (each lasting about an hour), that would be €300 with no price reduction, and I just can't see them charging that much for a bundle.

So I was going to wait to buy it, but people kept saying: "OMG, the last 10-15 minutes are amazing! This is exactly what is finally made possible by VR!" and I was like: "Ah, that sounds like there's a big twist! I better experience the first big VR twist and have my mind blown, before someone spoils it!" I had all kinds of ideas for twists that could only be done in VR where you suddenly realize everything is different than what you thought.

Well, there's no twist. This is fine, since it's only the very first part of a story, so it doesn't need a twist. But that means it can't be spoiled, so you don't have to buy this now. You're not taking any risk. There's no chance of you having your experienced ruined, because of something you hear or read somewhere.

As many other people have pointed out, everything is high quality, but the game contains one actual puzzle that will take you more than 30 seconds to solve and you will likely finish the entire game in an hour. (I spent longer than that due to technical problems. If you have a GTX 780 make sure you downgrade to driver version 364.51 before playing. This will fix the chaperone frame drop problems.)

So, I would definitely recommend you wait for a sale or for a bundle with multiple episodes to come out before you buy this. It's impossible to spoil, so you're not taking any risks by waiting.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027823854', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 206, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 180, 'last_played': 1474502728}
review:
In a word, Amazing. 

Like many people, I am new to VR, or at least long durations of being in VR. This game will take you somewhere else, and it is gorgeous in its rustic, delapadated environs. At times I was so immeresed I forgot I was in a vertual world. Simply exploring and looking around was as much fun as trying to complete the puzzles, which could be a bit harder, but they aren't so hard that you become frustrated.

Some people complain about the value. But even if you only get a ew hours of gameplay out of the story, it's a better deal than you and a date going to the movies, and certainly going to be a better experience. 

After getting their feet wet with Tilt Brush, I will have my friends play The Gallery as it is currently the best example of the potential of VR.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969692533', 'num_games_owned': 467, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 103, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 103, 'last_played': 1462135077}
review:
The game is great, but imagine Half-Life ending when you finally activate the reactor and the alien dimension spills over. Yeah, it's a tease. It's short and it's a tease.
Very promising, but Episode 2 should be free to everyone who purchased this. They have the mechanics flushed out, now give us the $30 worth of content we payed for. I get VR is a new medium, but it doesn't require twice as much money to make stuff. Look at contemporary equivalents like Firewatch.

author: {'steamid': '76561198191165199', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 411, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 261, 'last_played': 1486681473}
review: Mind blowing. Emotional. Get it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984239659', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 225, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 140, 'last_played': 1536772480}
review: Epic, it's the beginning of what the point and click genre and fans has been waiting for. An astounding VR experience, totally immersive and can't wait for the next episode.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996166678', 'num_games_owned': 350, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 94, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 94, 'last_played': 1461921982}
review:
VR's first AAA game. 

Ok it's a bit short, but if you have a headset you owe it to yourself to play this game.

Characters are interesting and funny, the puzzles are (while a little easy) satisfying and the inventory and menu systems are excellent.

Don't be put of by the seemingly high price, this is one fantastic experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988554488', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 98, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 98, 'last_played': 1462130742}
review:
Das ist mein erster Review überhaupt. Bei diesem Spiel und dem damit zusammenhängenden neuen Medium der virtuellen Realität komme ich nicht drumrum.

Ersteinmal ein Lob an die Entwickler! Was ihr da geschaffen habt, hat mich total in seinen Bann gezogen. Ich bin die 1,5h die ich für den ersten Lauf gebraucht habe komplett gefesselt gewesen und habe kaum an die reale Welt um mich herum gedacht. Ich hatte mich davor überhaupt nicht mit dem Spiel auseinander gesetzt, lediglich die düstere Stimmung war mir bekannt. Super Job! Ich hoffe, es geht weiter und ich kann die spannende Reise demnächst fortsetzen. 

Die Story baut sich nach den ersten Schritten immer mehr auf, dass Gefühl in einem lebendigen Roman zu stecken wurde erstklassig umgesetzt. Durch das lesen von Texten und den Kasetten wird man immer mehr in die Welt gezogen. Der Spannungsbogen geht stetig nach oben. 

Für ängstliche Spieler kann gesagt sein, dass hier ist kein Horrorspiel. Es entsteht an einigen Stellen eine Stimmung, die einem Horrospiel entsprechen könnte, aber ich hatte zu keinem Zeitpunkt wirklich große Angst oder habe mich erschrocken. Hier wurde bewusst auf "Jumpscares" verzichtet, wie es mir scheint. Gute Entscheidung!

Es fällt mir gerade auch schwer etwas negatives über das Spiel zu finden. Bis auf den Preis und die mit der Vive zusammenhängenden Pixeldichte, finde ich nichts. Ich kann das Spiel bedenkenlos für jeden frisch gebackenen Vive Besitzer empfehlen. Deie 28€ sind im Vergleich zur Spielzeit vom ersten Start bis zum Ende relativ hoch, jedoch nicht vergleichbar mit anderen Spielen, die einen 10h oder mehr Storymodus bieten. Für ein solch neues Medium und die neue Art und Weise eine Story zu erzählen ist es das meiner Meinung nach vollkommen wert!


To the DEVS, without spoiling to much: At one point in the game i had some indescribable sort of pain in my hand and my pulse went higher. Wow, what an immersive experience! Thank you!

author: {'steamid': '76561198061025784', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 159, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 132, 'last_played': 1508541142}
review: THIS SHIT WAS INSANE. YOU. MUST. SUPPORT. DEVELOPERS. - YES, it's very short, literally beat it in an hour, without going fast, BUT towards the end YOU WILL LOSE YOUR SHIT. AMAZING! Worth every penny!

author: {'steamid': '76561198021706027', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 130, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 111, 'last_played': 1462134492}
review: I can see the developers have lowered the price so I am giving this a Thumbs up now. Its around 2 hours long, but after almost a year of games, this is one of the better ones around and worth buying. When Episode 2 comes out, I will be buying that as this is very well made!

author: {'steamid': '76561197966476862', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 246, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 246, 'last_played': 1462128729}
review: Wow! This is how I was hoping VR would be. I was reading the creadits at the end of the game and I think it took three years to put this game together. I just what to say thank you for the expirance and the hard work. I will buy and play the next chapter.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978257326', 'num_games_owned': 569, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 150, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 87, 'last_played': 1555355918}
review:
Summary:

Pros
- Looks good
- Immersive
- Inventory system is fantastic

Cons
- Cumbersome teleport mechanic compared to the teleport mechanic in other VR games
- Overpriced
- Short (1-2 hours)
- Puzzles and exploration are the main focus of the game, but the puzzles fall short

In Depth:
This game is very visual, it tries to look good, and succeeds most of the time. There are only a few moments in the game where I noticed poor-quality textures or mesh clipping. The textures could be due to the fact my GPU is the minimum recommended, so it's not a big deal for me. The game ran fine, no graphical lag, no crashes.

At the time of writing Call of the Starseed is probably one of the most graphically appealing vive reality games out, if you want to experience a nice looking game, this is your best bet, but don't expect the earth.

The main pro here, is that the game is quite immersive due to the way it looks and plays. Another main plus point is the inventory system, I think it sets the benchmark for every other future VR game. Hands down. It doesn’t break the immersion, it’s easy to use, I just wish I could put anything in there not just key items. 

However, there are quite a few cons. 

The teleport navigation is bad, when so many games have done it so well, it makes me a little baffled to think what they must have done to make it so counter-intuitive. It’s like trying to drag a cat around. How you move your controller and where the teleportation target moves does not seem to be linked by any logic.

Picking stuff up is questionable. Quite often I found essential or interesting items impossible to pick up. In numerous circumstances the floor was lower than my own, meaning pressing my controller against the floor would leave the item an inch from reach. This is not a calibration issue, there are different heights in some of the in game floors. There also seems to be a bug when in which you are unable to pick anything up if holding the magnet gun. No matter what you try to pick up, a vacuum tube will teleport to your hand from the gun. In general that portion of the game was very frustrating. Tubes got stuck inside objects and are needed to complete the puzzle, placing your hands inside one tube and trying to pick it up would pull up another tube to the right of it. You could argue this could be a tracking issue. 

The game is overpriced. It just is to me. I understand that a developer, or multiple developers worked hard on this and need to make a living, but for 95 minutes of gameplay, I paid £22.99. Which means I would be paying £15 per hour for something I didn’t even get 2 hours into. That 95 minutes includes credits and restarting areas several times due to item bugs. If the experience changed my life that would be no problem, but the game is 90% wandering and interacting and 10% puzzles. I only noticed 2 puzzles in the game, (ones that require you to think and work out the solution); both of which only took 5 minutes to complete. Which leaves this game drastically lacking in the gameplay department. Leaving the game a mostly interactive story experience, but for this beggining of an episodic story, there really isn’t much story to be had, and any tidbits you get are from listening to tapes. The final nail in the coffin for the overpriced status, is this game is Episode 1, that’s right, the game is episodic. I understand developers sometimes need to break up a game in order to fund the development process, but if people are not impressed they’re not going to buy the second part. By the time I finished the game, it felt like I had just paid for a lengthy demo. The end was visually spectacular, but that’s it. 

To finish. I had fun, I played it to the end, would I recommend it? Yep. If you don’t mind the cost. Which may seem counter-intuitive to what I have been saying. 
The fact is the faults of the game could be forgiven if the price was reasonable, and a reasonable price is subject to personal opinion. I will not be asking for a refund, for the following reason. I want the developers to take my money and spend it on the next one, use people’s suggestions to improve the game. I want to see a much longer episode, with more puzzles and more character interactions, but if it falls short again, I will get the episode refunded and wait until the game is a reasonable price. 

Also, the people in the game seem really really small.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970625133', 'num_games_owned': 402, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 154, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 146, 'last_played': 1463919993}
review:
Looking for immersion? Then this. 
Slick, well-designed, atmospheric and polished. The game I was waiting for to really make me play VR for a long period of time. Elements of Half Life, Prey and other great stories. I will be buying the next episode.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052446457', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 134, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 134, 'last_played': 1462311518}
review:
VIVE USER
i5 2500k (not overclocked)
GTX 980
Samsung SSD

I get a bit of jitter from this one but have changed the cpu priorities on the game which makes it run much smoother, visuals are amazing, gameplay is pretty responsive but don't like the teleportation mechanics (even after changing it to hand controlled). The puzzles are great and it is well worth the money.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963931134', 'num_games_owned': 565, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 324, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 132, 'last_played': 1648930649}
review:
Just played through the first chapter. The experience just blew me out of the water.
I dint get the first riddle right away. So i (litteraly) sat down at the bonefire. Looked around enjoying the scenery... than it hit me. I stood up an went ahead. I was never so immersed in an adventure. this is the future of point and click adventures! The bagpack implementation made me smile soooo much! :D

11/10 Would rest at bonfire again

author: {'steamid': '76561198028579449', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 253, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 174, 'last_played': 1468987240}
review: Amazing. Had to pick my jaw up off the floor multiple times. Can't wait till Episode 2. Wish it was a bit cheaper but justfies the price by being the only thing this awesome out right now.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025740440', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 191, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 186, 'last_played': 1465057204}
review:
Wooooww! What a brilliant game! Immersive! The mood set by each "scene" is incredible, where I was properly on edge in certain parts. I had tingles in a lot of it, and it is the only/first game for the Vive that made me jump... Stupid glowstick falling into water behind me...

The story is very well put together, the characters are really well acted/fleshed out considering the minimal contact you have with them. I can't really explain how effective it is.

Considering the graphics, the performance of the game is great. I've had so many problems with other Unity games, but this one ran nicely on a R9 290, i5 6600k. Maybe 5 dropped frames the entire time. I did run the game on low, mind, but it still looked great :)

My only critical review point would be about the backpack. I found myself struggling to juggle 2 items then get the backpack out etc. I don't know how I would improve it though, it was just too real :P

I haven't finished the game yet, but I'm already happy with the purchase. The amount of quality content is 10x to 100x that of a lot of £15 games for the Vive, and I feel bad that the devs are getting negative reviews about the price. My argument goes: at least 5 games in the top 20 Vive games are a single scene, with low quality content but good replayability. Now those are great games and they absolutely have a place, but charging £10-£15 for them just seems wrong when put up against disproportionately  high quality content like this.

Anyway, I hope the next episodes are quick for the devs to produce as they have the format, interactions, optimisations all down now. I'll be buying the next episode and cannot wait.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024917085', 'num_games_owned': 704, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 93, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 93, 'last_played': 1461706152}
review: Excellent and I'm looking forward to more of this. Yes it's an expensive first chapter, but it's really worth it and a great experience. It's this type of game that I really wanted VR for. Immersive and enjoyable as you wander around trying to solve puzzles and following the story. Some interesting mechanics as well that shows how this kind of game should work in VR.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972759475', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 158, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 113, 'last_played': 1463791534}
review:
This game is cool, but a little pricey for the content. 

If this episode was a cheaper ($15 seems fair) or the price included additional episodes I could recomend it. However, $30 for 2 hours of content is pretty steep. The story line is great and I definitely want to find out what happens next, I just can't see myself paying another $30 per episode for so little content.

With that being said, if money is not an issue this game is immersive, the voice acting and sound is great, and the puzzles are fun - I just wish you got more for $30...

author: {'steamid': '76561197969021124', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 198, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 132, 'last_played': 1474628860}
review: This has to be one of the most premium / polished titles currently available for the VIVE. I absolutely love it. There are few glitches here and there and it keeps forcing me to re-do the tutorial but on the whole it is pretty good. Yes it is short for a $30 game but when you consider how much games cost to make VS the installed VR customer base I think this can be easily forgiven. Good work Cloudhead!

author: {'steamid': '76561197971847256', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 152, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 152, 'last_played': 1461123856}
review:
The story, mechanics, and graphics of this game are all great, and I was enjoying it.  However, because this game contains blasphemy (GC & JC), I won't be puchasing any of the new episodes, nor can I recommend or talk about this game to anyone.  The professor could have said everything he said without the bad language.

Seriously though, no one is going to skip a game because it *doesn't* contain blasphemy, so why limit your already limited audience even more by including adults-only language like this?  

It's really sad too, because this is an otherwise great game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982513320', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 99, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 99, 'last_played': 1461910618}
review:
This is absolutely phenominal. Absolutely the best experience home entertainment has to offer. Your mind will be blown, guaranteed. The sound design, the perfectly tuned for VR visuals.. everything about this game reeks of artistry and character. This is the most polished game for VR out at this point that rivals the quality of AAA titles.

This is a must buy. Can't wait for the next episode.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006001633', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 29, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1491501188}
review:
Beautiful game , cool interactions. Until you pass the tutorial, and teleport a few times. Got missed frame all over the board... Stood still for a while then it stopped, teleported a few times then missing frames again...
GTX980 and a framerate that made me spew chunks. I hope they fix this when episode 2 hits. I do want to play this so will give it one more try then.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970778509', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 231, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 211, 'last_played': 1468187956}
review:
Wow! Playing this game was a great experience, it's definitely one of my favorite games for the Vive so far. I haven't played many adventure games since the Sierra days but this game completely re-awakened my interest for the genre. 

Can't wait for the next episode to be released!

It might seem pricey but it's worth every penny, great quality overall!

I think Hollywood will have it's hands full on competing with games like these at some point :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197973306095', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 146, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 146, 'last_played': 1461268340}
review: Yes, it is short but sweet, but the most impressive VR game i've played so far and peaks at the end. It is roughly 2 hours long but you could definately explore the areas longer than that. I can see why people are hesitant about the price but there is not a lot on offer in VR at the moment and even if there was I would still 100% recommend this game! I feel that I cant play a 2d adventure game again!

author: {'steamid': '76561197970495283', 'num_games_owned': 431, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 743, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 117, 'last_played': 1502044106}
review: This is one of the best VR game purchase you can make at the moment. It's more of an exploration adventure, but man the last part of the game gives a breath taking sense of scale and scenery, and it left me excited for the next episode.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975073993', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 35, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35, 'last_played': 1461778046}
review:
This one made me nauseous pretty quick. The problem is that the world raises/lowers based on the position of the headset. Since most of the ground is sloped, shifting your weight or leaning/etc causes the world to raise/lower. Also with the winding map, you're constantly having to turn around and reorient yourself after teleporting. There are a lot of objects close to your player, which isn't comfortable on a Vive. The 'sweet spot' for view distance on a Vive/Rift is at least a few feet from your character. I got this weird sensation after taking it off when physical objects that were close to me felt too close, since the Vive renders near objects as a few feet away. I also found myself impaled by objects several times while teleporting from room to room. That's a little awkward when you're already starting to feel sick.

Overall, a high quality game but they need to apply some VR learnings to their level design. I'll try to work through the rest of this game in small chunks. Hopefully episode two has a little more flat ground..

author: {'steamid': '76561197998788492', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 203, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 203, 'last_played': 1461810125}
review: This game nailed it! Great VR and overall gaming experience. The next episode cannot come soon enough!

author: {'steamid': '76561197961138874', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 375, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 193, 'last_played': 1536475204}
review:
Everything I would have expected and more. This was the first adventure/puzzle game I downloaded for my Vive setup. Once you get used to the controls, they feel extremely natural. The only thing that left me a bit disoriented were areas with major slope changes in the ground. This results in the camera vertical position jumping to the correct height to prevent you from clipping into surfaces; as disorienting as it was, it doesn't happen frequently at all, and I personally don't know of a better solution to that game design challenge. 

My favorite innovation was the inventory system. Once you get used to using the backpack, it feels very natural and fun!

author: {'steamid': '76561197999825207', 'num_games_owned': 787, 'num_reviews': 205, 'playtime_forever': 311, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 162, 'last_played': 1519001980}
review:
Really cool game. It's probably the best "story-driven" game that's available on the HTC Vive right now.

Here are a couple things that disappointed me:

- Lack of subtitles. I'm not a native English speaker and I had some trouble understanding some of the dialogue.
- The game adjusting your height if you move around on sloped terrain. It's really disorientating. I understand why it's like that but it breaks the feeling of presence.
- It's a little expensive for the length, about 2 hours. That said I understand that for a production value of this caliber, and with VR having such a small market base right now, that's a necessary compromise. It was a bit disappointing since the game ends in the middle of a really amazing moment. I also see the "expensiveness" of this as a way to support the funding of the future episodes, so I'm okay with this.

Overall I would absolutely recommend this game unless you were really short on money, but if you bought a VR headset anyway you probably aren't... so go for it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198062088208', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 190, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 146, 'last_played': 1462072324}
review: Its on the short side at 2.5 hours of gameplay, but I certainly had fun. It was super cool to go into the machine. I hope they use the money to make a deeper sequel.

author: {'steamid': '76561197973062740', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 179, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 164, 'last_played': 1470003689}
review: This gaming experience may seem overpriced for 2.5 hours of gameplay, but if you consider it from the perspective of a new entertainment experience, it's cheaper than taking a date to a 3D IMAX movie. I have high hopes for the continuation of this title, and urge others to try it out so continued development gets better and better.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004281923', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 275, 'playtime_forever': 349, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 306, 'last_played': 1478558348}
review: Great adventure game with nice visuals. Must buy for a Vive owner. Short but awesome! The Gallery and A chair in a room are my top favorite Vive games.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970250039', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 198, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 172, 'last_played': 1462055705}
review: Yes, it is short. Yes, it is somewhat expensive given the length. But what an experience! The atmosphere is fantastic, great production values, and the ending sequence just blew me away. This gives us a glimpse of what VR gaming can be in the future. I am happy to support this game and can't wait for the next episode.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043346590', 'num_games_owned': 367, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 411, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 302, 'last_played': 1487023410}
review:
The most incredible VR experience I have had. Wait till you get into the tunnels and beyond.. mind blowing. And unlike other titles this one didnt suffer from low res jaggies eveywhere later on. 10/10 cannot wait for ep2.

Last section in ep1... those eyes.. freaky!!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561197960337322', 'num_games_owned': 720, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 207, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 135, 'last_played': 1506460784}
review:
I really enjoyed this game! Shout out to all GTX 780 Users, the game run without major issues on my card. It only juddered when the bounarys from the vive showed up, just stay away from the walls and you are fine. 

Great game, way to short, but worth the premium! 

Please keep the quality at this level for the next episode, but harden the puzzles a little bit.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030557760', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 135, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 135, 'last_played': 1460994600}
review:
I really enjoyed Call of the Starseed, but its perceived brevity prompted a heated debate with a friend about the price point for VR games.

His opinion is that the price was too high when compared alongside the size of other games in the gaming world, I actually srtongly disagree, you see for me, VR is an experience unlike anything elsewhere in gaming, for e.g. if you compare it to say an IMAX ticket which whilst awesome, that is a watch once, one person only entry fee, wheras this is an immersive, interactive place I can also bring others included in the price.

When I finished playing this I had truly been taken on a special journey in a world that was obviously painstakingly built, voiced, textured and soundtracked, for that you can take my money and bring on Episode 2. Well Done!

author: {'steamid': '76561197970878300', 'num_games_owned': 189, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 376, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 149, 'last_played': 1562188825}
review: Knaller Spiel für die HTC Vive....

author: {'steamid': '76561197970475959', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 287, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 246, 'last_played': 1468595188}
review:
Ciertamente es corto este primer episodio pero es un juego que recomiendo a todos los que tengan HTC Vive. Hay que tener en cuenta que es el comienzo de la VR y es dificil obtener a día de hoy financiación para desarrollos más largos, por lo que la forma de poder tener cada vez más contenidos es ayudar a juegos como este.

El que lo juegue sabiendo que va a ser corto este episodio, va a disfrutar cada paso que de, y algunas de las mejores partes de este episodio (como la parte final).

Muy buen comienzo de la VR.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008787961', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 115, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 115, 'last_played': 1461538022}
review: This was the first VR game I played that actually inspired a sense of genuine awe in me. An amazing experience, and I'm really looking forwards to the next installment.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079165095', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 300, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 211, 'last_played': 1484328536}
review:
Polished, absorbing, and astounding.

If you have an HTC Vive this is the game that raises the VR bar that makes want to come back for episode 2.

I've played a lot of VR games in the last few days but none of these has involved me in the playspace with such intensity.

My GTX 970 chugged a little in the end sequence but I had it cranked to the highest graphics level and it had no issues until that point.

The good:

- story (some reviewers have said its a little lacking in substance but its more of an introduction for the upcoming episodes)
- graphics (textures, animation, and lighting is beautiful)
- interaction with objects and inventory
- sound
- voice acting
- feeling of motion (lifts)

The not so good:

- short (completed in 2 hours)
- puzzles very basic

Defintely a must play for all VR freaks. You won't regret it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972615455', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 145, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 67, 'last_played': 1467207965}
review:
Bisher für mich die wohl rundum gelungenste VR Erfahrung (wenn auch nicht die Beste, da es eigentlich nicht mein Lieblingsgenre ist). Der Entwickler hat sich den Fragen von VR genähert und sehr befriedigende Antworten entwickelt. Ich kann mir nun gut vorstellen, dass "wirkliche Adventures" in VR möglich sind und sogar zu einem der stärksten Genres werden könnten (neben Cockpit Spielen). Persönlich würde ich mir zwar wünschen, das es eher RPGs werden, aber dieser Happen an Adventure ist wirklich beeindruckend. Wie damals in Myst erledige ich Rätsel, nur bin ich hier "mittendrin". Und diese Kombination ist einfach beeindruckend.

Ob es nun das Inventarmanagment, die Einbindung der Spieloptionen, das Rätseldesign, die "Hand"-Steuerung oder das Tutorial ist: Die Antworten von The Gallery überzeugen mich auf ganzer Linie. Ich konnte die ganze spielzeit immer intuitiv und damit äußerst immersiv in die Welt eintauchen. 

Und, mehr gibt es da eigentlich auch garnicht zu sagen: Wer mal wissen will, wie Adventures in VR seien könnten, ist hier gut aufgehoben: Aber Vorsicht, die Spielzeit ist doch recht kurz,  Rätsel eher Mangelware. Und dadurch ist wohl der Begriff "Walking Simulator" besser als (gerade für uns Deutsche, die an Deponia denken müssen) Adventure.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969426595', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 436, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 135, 'last_played': 1590315569}

author: {'steamid': '76561198053056360', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 203, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 174, 'last_played': 1467677217}
review:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GF-VPrQbMAE

Analisis D.I.T.

DIVERSION:

Bueno, pues divertido, divertido, no es. He jugado durante mas de media hora, y no he tenido ninguna sensacion especial, no he resuelto ningun puzzle, y no he hecho algo de lo que me sientiera orgulloso (Cosas que se hacen en este tipo de juego).  Para ser un primer nivel, no dejan claro de que va el juego, ni lo que hay que hacer.

INMERSION:

Graficamente esta bastante logrado, y la ambientacion se aprecia. La sensacion de que las manos virtuales son mis manos de verdad, es increhible. 
Coger objetos mola, la mochila como sistema de inventario es muy original y funciona.

Sin embargo el sistema de control, no es el mejor. El hecho de que te cambien el "frente" desorienta mucho, y no es intuitivo. Ademas no tiene mucho sentido con las VIVE, si todavia fuese un juego para jugar sentado.


TENSION:

La tension es practicamente nula. La realidad virtual de por si genera un minimo de tension, a la hora de explorar sistios desconocidos. Aun asi, aparte del momento en el que oyes una voz dentro de las alacantarilla, por lo demas es bastante tranquilo.

RECOMIENDO:

Pues sinceramente NO, el precio son casi 30 Euros, los puzzles no tienen ningun sentido.
He mirado otro video 

(SPOILER) 
despues y hay que encontrar un Pomo de una puerta, y ponerlo en la puerta de la alcantarilla para abrirla y entrar dentro 
(END SPOILER).

 Con la media hora que he estado jugando no he encontrado ninguna prueba de como resolver ese puzle. NO tiene ninguna ogica y esta basado en prueba y error.

De todas formas esta es mi opinion personal, aun asi si eres de los fanaticos de las aventuras graficas, quizas pueda interesarte este juego, aun asi esperaria a que bajase de precio.

[url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GF-VPrQbMAE] Analisis y Gameplay en Youtube [/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561197997705375', 'num_games_owned': 657, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 238, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 238, 'last_played': 1461773239}
review:
It's a bit pricey but I recommended nonetheless. It is a story, a good one, before you play this: turn off your phone, turn off steam notification, decouple your door bell. Proceed to play the game in one go. It will take 2-3 hours.

I don't want to say to much about the game itself, it would be spoiling it like a good book or film. But it start on a beach and ends somewhere you have never been before. On the way you will discover audiologs, do puzzles and play around with objects and the environment.


VR technical:
- The world is gorgeous!
- When you get to close to walls, your vision starts to blur. At some spots it maybe starts to blur a bit too quick. 
- The ingame movement is a blinking system, you can even rotate your play area.
- There is some automatic height adjustments which is quite uncomfortable. So avoid walking on and off ledges, but just blink. There was one point where I went to close to a ledge to look down and I sort of fell to area below. I had to take a breather to get back on my feet. (Devs try to look at these high adjustment mechanics because they could probably improve)
- There is tutorial area which teaches you how to blink and interact with object, which is quite good but doesn't take to long if you already know all this stuff.
- Moving object around can be a bit flaky and could use some work. Somehow it was quite common to bump the controllers together. Mainly because I wanted to try and manipulate items with two hands, which is not possible.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970508018', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 201, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 201, 'last_played': 1461037176}
review:
I beat this several days ago, and I've been struggling to come up with a conclusion to what I played. On the one hand, it was lovingly crafted, with lots of little details and a great interface and UI. The time I spent with it was enjoyable, and it felt more like a tripple A game than most launch VR titles do... but on the other, it's so pathetically, laughably short for an adventure game it is insulting to those who pay good money for it. There isn't a whole lot here that isn't what you'd expect from an adventure game, but there's so LITTLE of it is what makes it a problem. 

The story barely, BARELY gets started. If this was a book it would have ended halfway through the prologue, it's that short! I don't know what else I can compare it to, but the length is just plain a joke. Is the story good? Who knows? There isn't even a ghost of enough of it here to be able to tell. Should we be excited for the next chapter? Who knows? This one is so short we barely got past the title before it was over.

A serious player can beat this in well under an hour. The only reason I have as much playtime as I do on record is because I spent an unusually long time playing around with the environment... and despite the shortness, I managed to find a bug that wasted my time for over an hour by denying me a clue that was floating around that I needed to progress.

I hate to harp on how short it is but I just can't get past it. To put it another way, fire up an episodic game from Telltale. Watch the intro. Now play for fifteen minutes. Stop, and that's about how much is here. Now look at what they are charging for this. Can this content possibly justify the price? Another way to put it, there are so few areas for screenshots, the store page actually has one from the tutorial room that has nothing whatsoever to do with the game, other than forced padding! That's some seriously bad form.

Is this a cynical cash grab from a company that is exploiting the launch of VR by overcharging for a glorified demo because they know people will buy it due to the lack of titles at launch? I hope not, because I'd heard from the developer and thought they were more passionate about the project than that. More likely, it wasn't anywhere near completed, but the April 5th launch of the Vive was coming close, and they had to lock down what little they had completed and publish.

I love the quality on display. I love the interface and gameplay, and I'd love to play a full-length adventure game using the systems developed here. It hurts me to have to bash something so polished, and I really, really want to give it a good review... But I cannot, and will not overlook the insane price being charged for a piece of game that is so short it is outpaced by demos on the old PC Gamer disks from the 90s.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028734971', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 286, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 172, 'last_played': 1466961298}

author: {'steamid': '76561197960699473', 'num_games_owned': 1280, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 230, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 218, 'last_played': 1491414710}
review:
Welp, i finally popped my review cherry with this game from Cloudhead games. All i can tell you is that if you own the Vive, you need to buy The Gallery: Call of the starseed. I was trying to think of a way of describing how i felt about this VR game and it hit me like a ton of bricks. The Gallery reminds me of PRE-DOTA Valve!!! I am not trying to do Cloudhead games a disservice by comparing them to Valve but their games attention to detail in the environments, the physics of the world and the story completely remind me why i once loved Valve and i think i found my favorite new developer in Cloudhead games. I just started playing The Gallery earlier today and i played for 2 hours straight because they brought their world in this game to life in an amazing way and it sucked me in without any hesitation. I keep reading about people complaining about the price of the game but 30 dollars is a fair price for the best VR game out there right now on the Vive or any other headset bar none. BUY THIS GAME, ENJOY IT, LOVE IT!!

 BTW, the voice acting is top notch, brilliant even.


 Just updating my review of The Gallery to say that i nominated this game for a Steam award for WOOAHHHH DUDE, COOL!!!! It deserves it for the last 20 minutes of the game which blew my mind!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561197968185841', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 546, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 430, 'last_played': 1465184214}
review: The price is a bit high, but oh so worth it. No other game has had me this immersed in a world before, in VR or otherwise. The visuals are beautiful, the mechanics are polished. The story and sound design are exceptional. All of it comes together to feel like the kind of experience you might get at an amusement park with outlandishly expensive screens and audio. It's the only game on the Vive so far to make me want to keep playing for an extended period of time. If the game were 15 hours long, I'd knock it out in one sitting.

author: {'steamid': '76561198298588607', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 212, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 212, 'last_played': 1461077369}
review:
Summary:

+ Very polished, beautiful graphics
+ Nice and fluent user interface
+ Quite atmospheric
- Way too short
- Negligable content
- Generic story

"When I finished this game and put off my headset, it was the first time I left VR with an undeniable feeling of disappointment."

I'll start my review with the most obvious and outstanding positive aspect this game has to offer: It's visuals and atmosphere. You won't encounter the best graphics a PC game has ever offered, but perhaps the best so far incorporated into a VR experience. To stroll around in this environment is a nice pastime in itself, and I really recommend to do so if you want to squeeze some play time out of this game.

This positive impression is even intensified by the relatively large number of interactive objects placed all over the area. Admittedly, most of these items do not allow much more than to grab and view them before you have to put them back or throw them away, others even can just be pushed around. However, in my opinion non-interactive decoration is especially disappointing in VR, so I really approve of this level of detail.

The second big plus of this game is its fluent user interface. The backpack inventory works well and just looks great. Picking up, using and combining items mostly worked like a charm.

If you want a decent example of what is currently possible in the visual department of VR, don't expect more and just have the money, don't read any further and just open your pocket. I suppose in this case your rig also contains at least a GTX 980, which I would more than recommend for this game.

If it is the label "VR puzzle adventure" that caught your attention - like it was for me - then you better prepare for a disappointment that reaches from slight to huge, depending on your expectations. Either Cloudhead Games put a disproportionate strong focus on visuals right from the start, or they just ran out of time, budget or both, and didn't manage to add a decent amount of puzzles and story elements. Taking into account the large number of absolutely useless (in the sense of unused) clues littered all over the walls, I'd vote for the latter.

To put this into numbers: The whole game contains not more than four puzzles that are halfways worthy to be named as such. This is even less than the number of stages or levels, and consequently there are stages without any puzzle at all. Well, if you need a map to navigate from your living room to your kitchen and perceive this endeavor as challenging, your counter might go as high as half a dozen puzzles. To put this lack of content into other words: If you watched the video and screenshots on top of this page, you didn't see a teaser but literally every single relevant scene of the game.

When it comes to the story, there is not much to say, as there is not much story. It is not particularly bad or good, it is just generic. You'll encounter stereotypic video game story elements as the crazy scientist, the alien artefact, the guys that litter the environment with short audio snippets (for whatever reasons, probably because they are just carrying too many audio tapes with them), the sewers (big plus, I love sewers), and some nondescript bad guy. As the story starts to unfold, the game unfortunately ends.

Conclusion: Cloudhead Games put a lot of effort and budget into the visual appearance of this game - with success. Unfortunately they forgot to divert some resources into the creation of a sufficient amount of puzzles so the game could be called a puzzler. Most browser escape games offer more and more challenging puzzles. If you decide to give this game a try, do it slowly. Take your time, enjoy the environment and then even slow down more. If you start to rush, you'll ecounter the credits in less than an hour.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960874439', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 148, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 114, 'last_played': 1468009807}

author: {'steamid': '76561197971287874', 'num_games_owned': 324, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 266, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 266, 'last_played': 1484127925}
review:
Episode terminé en 3 heures en prenant mon temps. Mais quelles heures !! On sent un travail de design méticuleux et une vraie profondeur cinématographique qui rendent ce jeu inoubliable. J'ai pu ressentir une certaine nostalgie des jeux d'aventure des années 90 en le parcourant (Amiga !) le tout allié à une technologie de pointe : la réalité virtuelle en roomscale. Impatient de découvrir la suite. A 27,99 euros vu le travail abattu par les dévellopeurs foncez c'est le plus beau jeu sur HTC Vive !

MAJ du 10/01/2017 : le jeu est désormais à l'excellent prix de 19,99 euros ! il reste ma plus magnifique expérience ludique sur HTC Vive après 9 mois passés sur la VR.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968421592', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 234, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 153, 'last_played': 1466181040}
review:
The game is really well put together and is one of the most compelling experiences on the Vive so far.

But I simply cannot recommend the game based on the amount of content in the game. It took me a fair amount of time to solve the couple of (actually very simple) puzzles that are there, the time taken mostly by not noticing visual clues which lead to the solution of the puzzle. But even with this relatively slow problem solving the whole game lasted 90mins. Its like a single level of a game.

I fully understand the tiny market the developers are dealing with here and they would like to pay their own wages and invest in the future of the platform, but I have come away from this game feeling very impressed with the content that is there but unhappy with the amount of it.

I feel like even within the small level that you play through the developers could have stretched out the content, maybe making it a little more difficult or simply putting more puzzles in each stage of the level.

I think ultimately it comes down to this: Are you prepared to invest $30/£23 in not just your own experience but in the future of the platform and the developers, because you have to want both as the experience itself just isn't worth the asking price in terms of what we are used to as far as games go.

I wouldn't have chosen a 'yes' or 'no' for the recommend option if I didn't have to as I think it hinges on the above question. Personally I think bringing the price down to £17-18 would make it easier to accept and help the game gain wider adoption ultimately resulting in not much loss of revenue, if any at all. Having said this I expect the developers have done more research into the market than my anecdotal guessing.

Edit: Since writing this review the price has dropped down to £14.99. this is about what I would consider 'right' for this game, it remains one of the most polished experiences yet.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995820083', 'num_games_owned': 1832, 'num_reviews': 584, 'playtime_forever': 462, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 209, 'last_played': 1535514209}
review: The Gallery is one of the Vive's big launch titles, and it shows. The game has a very noticeable level of polish and production values, and the visual quality is probably the best I've seen in the Vive so far. There's a lot of things in the environment that can be interacted with, and even if something isn't related to a puzzle it can be a lot of fun just messing with things, like throwing beer cans at rocks and watching them fizz around or cooking popcorn on a campfire. As a first episode of a larger series, a typical playthrough will last maybe 1 or 2 hours, but it can easily go more depending on how much you like to interact with the environment. My only complaint is that the checkpoint system is somewhat lacking, and if you encounter a bug or something that makes you quit the game you can sometimes find yourself replaying a lot of gameplay, particularly in the longer early areas. But the game is so good that you probably won't want to quit anyways, so barring the rare glitch it isn't much of a problem.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079009910', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 253, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 234, 'last_played': 1469236538}
review: That's an epic experience! The ending is just incredible, can't wait for more episodes!!

author: {'steamid': '76561197968283028', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 40, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40, 'last_played': 1460870365}
review:
I'm not usually a fan of adventure games, but I thought maybe VR would add some extra sparkle. If adventure games are your thing, you might enjoy this. Unfortunately I didn't.

The game crashed SteamVR twice and then was very slow and choppy. I didn't enjoy Blinking as a movement mechanic. Frequently when walking up/down stairs, I'd start floating up or down. I had to stop playing and shortly afterwards, had my first bout of VR sickness.

The way you used your backpack, though, was very impressive.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010828741', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 237, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1, 'last_played': 1463900616}
review: In this game I played as Alex, a man in search of his sister. There was one part where I was totally stumped. I, Alex, ended up laid on my back, staring up at the great cavern ceiling playing with electric bolt thingies in my hands like a slack off waiting for a stroke of insight. For the first time in gaming, the game's main character and I were one and the same. It was true presence.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960270543', 'num_games_owned': 299, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 143, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 136, 'last_played': 1561820528}
review:
I recommend this game for people who are willing to spend the extra money to experience something new in VR.  This game is on the shorter side but I believe you get your money worth compared to other games in the VR landscape right now.  The Gallery is detailed and you can tell a lot of work and love went into it's creation.  The environmental puzzles are fun.  I would say they are hard but not unreasonable.

Be aware that this game has the player's head moving around quite a bit unsynchronized with your physical head.  Your tracking system isn't bugged out, realize the game is trying to keep your head the same distance from the terran you are moving on.  I was able to get used to this once I realized what the game was trying to do.

After finishing the game I took the headset off and said "Whoa.  That was something different and awesome."

author: {'steamid': '76561197965684836', 'num_games_owned': 1631, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 158, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 154, 'last_played': 1469329396}
review:
Fantastic interaction and puzzle play but game is a bit short for the price. I'd imagine once all the episodes are done a package deal will be a better option. The story line unfolds as you play, but only a small amount, you're still left with more questions than answers upon completion. 

It's fun and if the budget isn't an issue, worth a pickup.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992925684', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 113, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 63, 'last_played': 1463339047}
review:
I would love to play, but I can't make it past the first area because of the buggyness. I'm not sure what is causing it but I am getting a lot of FPS drops and the screens starts strobing /flickering. Causes extreme discomfort and head aches.Only happens in this game, no idea why. Running a i7 6700k / GTX 970 / 16GB Ram / Win 10

Updated: Quick response from the Dev has me encouraged that the problem will be fixed. Support for good customer service :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198083980617', 'num_games_owned': 81, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 186, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 186, 'last_played': 1460822847}
review:
It is the best VR experience I had so far on the Vive ! 

Short game for the money, Great experience for the money.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009636534', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 155, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 148, 'last_played': 1502004612}
review: Very cool visuals! It's a bit short but if you have a Vive this is a game you need to try. Can't wait for episode 2!

author: {'steamid': '76561198000386448', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 210, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 167, 'last_played': 1463258741}
review:
This game is very short as it is an introduction to a multipart series. Even admiring the beautiful environments didn't get me more than about an hour and a half of game time with no replayability beyond admiring the quality of the production. While I admit that may turn away many thrifty purchasers, I want to give a few more thoughts on the overall value of the experience.

This game was absolutely worth the time spent and was by far the most immersive and visually stunning experience I've had thus far in virtual reality. It was worth the price as a vanguard vr project to help fund well-optimized games with engaging storytelling. If you're an early adopter of the Vive, this story introduction will be well worth your time and money.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961262780', 'num_games_owned': 1169, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 80, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 80, 'last_played': 1460748718}
review:
A Fantastic start of a journey, with a story that will engross you. It is fully voice acted, sound design, an engrossing story and is an experience harkening to the days of Point and Click Adventures; Except that you are fully within the world. You use your own hands to interact with the world through the motion controls. 

It doesnt come with its down faults however, it is marred by some judder issues even with a decent system, and is fairly short for its price, (being double of a movie ticket, and milage which varies): But these should be ironed out as time goes on, and the pricing issues should ease away as we go to future episodes and VR gets adopted further. 

This is the quality of content we should be rooting for,  thus for now, to support development, it is fully worth the price of admission.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970334132', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 305, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 61, 'last_played': 1461142362}
review: great game,everyting in fantastiv  9/!0

author: {'steamid': '76561197967083967', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 57, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 57, 'last_played': 1460483609}
review: Clever puzzles, interesting environments, and great immersion. There are some cons, though; the pricing doesn't match the length of the game, occasional bugs like stuttering animations for no apparent reason (a reboot helps), and somewhat annoying forced camera movements where, for example, you can lean over a rock and suddenly the whole view bumps up, causing discomfort.

author: {'steamid': '76561198195629538', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 216, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 196, 'last_played': 1495995937}
review: Loved it! Soooo immersive and unique. This game and theBlu are my go-to's when showing off how good VR can look with the Vive. Superb graphics and design. Really liked the blink customization options and hope they will become the standard for other games in this genre. Occasionally when teleporting up stairs I would sink into the floor, but the game popped me back up so no big deal. Can't wait for episode 2!

author: {'steamid': '76561197990811656', 'num_games_owned': 108, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 39, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1467746332}

author: {'steamid': '76561197999639087', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 440, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 276, 'last_played': 1492622909}
review:
Never been this immersed in VR. I'm running it on my old, shitty GPU but it's still absolutely gorgeous. It's filled with mystery and i just love everything about it. 

It is however veeery short for it's price, but it's important to understand that the VR market is a subset of a subset of a subset (PC gamers, PC gamers with top hardware, PC gamers with a Vive) so prices reflect that. I also had a bunch of bugs, but none were game breaking. Like sometimes the loading screens are 3x as long as they usually are on that same leve. And graphics options sometimes don't save, and the blink mode never saves. So that's kind of annoying. 

But seriously, this is THE VR game to have because it just gives you such an incredible experience

author: {'steamid': '76561198166287983', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 130, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 130, 'last_played': 1460615284}
review: I've played a couple dozen games for Vive. This one gave me the most epic experience yet. The whole ending sequence is just awesome.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993703914', 'num_games_owned': 452, 'num_reviews': 107, 'playtime_forever': 136, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 136, 'last_played': 1460112821}
review:
I enjoyed my time with the first episode of the Gallery. There has been a resurgence of adventure games recently with Telltale's series and Life Is Strange. This game hearkens back more to those adventure games of the 90s that LucasArts used to make, and the popular Myst series. There is still a strong narrative but it doesn't take as much focus as the more recent adventure offerings which are often small bits of gameplay peppered around long cutscenes and NPC dialogue. Here the emphasis is more on environmental storytelling, with additional exposition being delivered via cassette tapes you'll (perhaps inexplicably) find around the game, and traditional NPC dialogue. 

The game has some of the best interaction with objects I've seen in a game. Most objects you can find in the game are able to picked up, and the way your virtual hands interact with them feel very natural. This game also has the best virtual inventory system I've seen in a game; you pull a backpack out from behind your back and reach to grab the items you want from it. If you want to stow something into your backpack, whilst holding the item you reach behind your back. The occasional puzzles you encounter in the game use this excellent interaction model to great effect. 

This is one of the best launch titles for VR, highly polished with about two hours of content. So the question is is it worth it? Currently it is one of the highest priced games on Steam for VR. Personally I felt the price was worth it, but that opinion is coloured by virtue of this being a VR game. If this was not a VR game, I feel like this game would be better priced at about $20 for the episode. I don't think you can disregard the VR because right now the audience for VR is very small and the developers likely need to charge a higher price to compensate for smaller sales. If you're looking for a VR adventure game in the vein of Myst or The Dig, then I recommend this. If you're on the fence, it might be worth waiting to see how future episodes are reviewed or for price drops.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062469063', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 278, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 234, 'last_played': 1479701300}
review:
Without a doubt this is the best game I have played on the HTC Vive.
Hell this might be the best game experience I have EVER played.
A pure masterpiece in VR,
This game needs the Nobel Peace Prize.

Lets just say its a good time to be a gamer.
Game on my friends.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993894602', 'num_games_owned': 361, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 163, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 163, 'last_played': 1460538998}
review:
It was the single most amazing VR experience by a longshot. The production value was high, the story was great, the ending was so exhilarating I had tears running down my face, not from sadness but from AWE.

This is THE example of what is to come when AAA games meet VR and it is going to be great!

author: {'steamid': '76561198031481703', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 113, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 109, 'last_played': 1471986858}
review: Fantastic game however it is in my opinion not worth $30 due to being episodic and only taking me 1.6 hours exactly to beat. If it were instead priced at $20 it would be a much better investment especially since there'll likely be many more episodes to come since the story is the best there is for any VR game at the moment.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970964299', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 257, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 107, 'last_played': 1471570164}
review: Reason to buy a Vive.  If you like adventure games (Gabriel Knight, Kings Quest, Myst, etc) then prepare to never play one of those ever again.  This is the future.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961530057', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 115, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 97, 'last_played': 1509673069}
review:
Echoing what a few people have already said, this is an adventure game but the fact that it's in VR, you are standing and you can use your hands makes it truly compelling on a level I've never experienced. 
I thoroughly enjoyed myself and constantly lost track of where I was in real life because presence kept kicking in. 

A couple of downsides though. One, the way the camera adjusted up and down in height depending on what you are standing on is extremely uncomfortable with me and the only time I've experienced motion sickness with my Vive. Granted this is the only game that that has different Heights in room scale that I've played but if it's for immersion reasons I'm two floating hands that cast shadows, having my view locked to a height to avoid screwy motion sicknesses on each blink would be OK. 
Two, the price. If it's going to be 30 dollars per episode (!!!) then this will become the classic "wait till it's on sale" game for VR because that's a hilariously high price for what is good, but very short amount of enjoyment.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039380801', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 207, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 174, 'last_played': 1470591712}
review:
Unfortunately my gtx970 had to go to its limit to run the game, and (maybe due to overclocking) the game crashed quite a few times in the beginning. Plus I ran into some bugs, for example entering the sewer system through the gate (after the beach) caused the vision to go black and I was unable to go/turn back, it just stayed like that , so I had to restart the game.

That aside, the game did finally run pretty smooth on the lowest settings with a low-ish resolution (changeable in setting), and sweet jesus the experience is awesome. Well designed and differenciated levels, lots of cool game mechanics.  The game is indeed short (4 chapters that you can each basically rush through in a few minutes), but you can spend much more time exploring the world.
Also, the ending tight as fuck and definitely justifies buying the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197965053789', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 244, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 231, 'last_played': 1464469897}
review: Most of this episode is like the old goonies movie.  but the end, let me tel you the end is so worth it, and you can load (play the tape) after you beat it once for others. It feels like you're literally in a high budget science fiction movie

author: {'steamid': '76561197962386957', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 142, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 142, 'last_played': 1460172014}
review:
This game is a near linear experience with puzzle elements to progress forward like Myst. There are a handful of great moments where the VR experience is very compelling and I thoroughly enjoyed. The backpack the character carries, as simple as that sounds,  is beautiful and highlights some of the unique interactions the VR enables.  The background story is a bit like the TV show LOST as sci-fi elements build.

I definitely recommend it, but bear in mind the content took me about 2.5 hours total (that is an immersive very fun 2.5 hours). The price is steep but I suspect it will come down with some time.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964920950', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 130, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 142, 'last_played': 1500914631}
review:
Unwieldy title aside, The Gallery Ep1 is a great introduction to adventure game conventions in VR.  The blink movement mechanic (with directional selection) took some practice, but once used to it I found little issue exploring.  The puzzles weren't overblown and felt attached to the narrative, each leaving me with a smile on my face.  The story told is a launching off point to a bigger tale and delivers a satifying first episode; leaving me excited for the next one by the time the credits rolled.

My only criticism is that sometimes I didn't notice the colour outline on objects and had to trial and error to see if it was something I could store in my backpack.  Perhaps more distinct/customized colour choices could help in future episodes.

Also note that this game is definitely on the higher-end graphical scale, so you'll want to tweak your graphical settings to ensure you're not dropping frames.  (View this as a plus, nothing about it feels "tech demo/filler", it's a properly designed world.)

author: {'steamid': '76561198040879767', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 198, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 69, 'last_played': 1465316074}
review: This is the beginning of something truly amazing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073068307', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 250, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 170, 'last_played': 1481732985}
