Running on i5-4690K with GTX970.

Otherwise the game is very enjoyable, but is definitely too expensive for < 2hrs game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984477435', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 415, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 224, 'last_played': 1477409367}
review:
This game is the unofficial sequel to Gravity Falls. Based on this game alone, I feel that point and click adventures have reached a new dawn with vr. This is one of the most accomplished, well paced, atmospheric games I have ever played. The puzzles were physical and real, but made perfect sense. The story was mysterious and full of character. It's not just one of the best VR games around right now. it's one of the best games in general, and I cannot wait for episode 2.

That said, two issues. I could blink through a door at the end of the first section, to areas I clearly wasn't supposed to go. Also at the end of the first elevator, the frame rate tanked down to about 8fps. It was tearing my brain apart. I blinked like 3 times along the path and it sorted itself out, but still, needs fixing.

But yeah, 10 out of flipping 10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025302028', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 109, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 74, 'last_played': 1464055671}
review: The beginning is a little tricky and the movement system could use some work as its a bit twitchy (both Look and Point) but the game so far has been a lot of fun since there are quite a few interactable objects.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972287727', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 160, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 141, 'last_played': 1478217211}
review: A brief, enjoyable experience. Probably not worth its high asking price, but if you are yearning for more VR experiences this won't be a poor choice.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009639373', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 170, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 132, 'last_played': 1461268854}
review:
Stunning. On paper it's a straightforward adventure game but, if The Gallery is any indication, VR will be transformative for the genre. The hand tracking makes such a difference. For example, early on you're navigating some dark tunnels. You've got a map and you've got a torch. To look at the map you reach over your back to grab your backpack, get the map out, hold it up to your face and shine the torch on it with your other hand. While these interactions are necessarily a little abstracted (without any kind of finger tracking you're only really able to grab and release), they're enough to really draw you in to the experience. And it is absolutely worth being drawn in to.

Regarding price, I don't have a problem with it at all. Maybe in the future when there are thousands of incredible 10+ hour VR games to choose from at the same price point I would think twice. Right now though this is an experience you can't get anywhere else. Compared to the IMAX, a football match or a theme park I think it’s totally reasonable. If anything it might be too cheap considering the limited user base and the high production values. I hope the developers make enough from it to finish the story. 

In conclusion, the game is great; please buy it so I can play the next one.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966573552', 'num_games_owned': 248, 'num_reviews': 95, 'playtime_forever': 549, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 236, 'last_played': 1511241189}
review:
+ Phenomenal story / artstyle / voice acting / music
+ Dark, gritty atmosphere
+ Perfect balance of puzzles / no leaps of logic nonsense
+ System Shock 2 style audio logs
+ Silent protagnist
+ God Damn Flare Guns
+ Teleport / Chaperon kept the walls at bay
+ Fully baked product that's worth every penny
+ / - Walking on inclines will move camera up / down
- Turning in teleport mode is flakey
- Physics based actions (e.g. putting stuff on tables) are flakey

Call of the Starseed is a bold first step into a new way of telling stories. This isn't just a game. It's not just an interactive movie. This is something new, that cannot be experience outside of VR. This envoked in me emotions of awe / wonder / curiosty to an extent I can't compare to anything else. The massive scale during some sequences left my jaw wide open. The tracked controllers played a pivital role in bringing me into the experience.

This should, without question, be on the top of your VR list.

author: {'steamid': '76561198286190049', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 379, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 355, 'last_played': 1511392774}
review: very good game i love it!!

author: {'steamid': '76561197965934721', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 438, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 307, 'last_played': 1478982625}
review: This is probably one of the best games I've ever played in my life. The perfect VR launch title. It beautifully showcases exactly how VR should be done and the story is incredible. Creates a level of immersion I've never experienced until now.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021083358', 'num_games_owned': 1070, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 111, 'last_played': 1460065693}
review: IMO This game is to VR what Half Life was to PC Gaming. Polished, Innovative, story driven and ahead of its time. The game is exactly what I have been looking for in a VR experience. The controls just work and the inventory system is very innovative. There is a level of polish seen here that is truly breathtaking for a first gen VR game. The real con here is the lack of content on offer. This game doesn’t feel like a $30 piece of content. It took me only 2 hours to finish and that was after having the final puzzle break on me the first time after completing it; albeit The only bug I encountered in my play through. Seeing as the game does not offer much on the replayability front, it is a hard sell at the current price. I strongly recommend this game to anyone once it goes on sale for $25 or less. I am excited to see what the next episode has in store.

author: {'steamid': '76561198180174095', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 114, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 103, 'last_played': 1460609738}
review:
Best VR experience currently available to early adopters.

If you're looking for an "actual game", and not some trumped up tech demos, this is it. If you can afford to buy it, you absolutely should, that said... 30 bucks...? Ehhh... 15 or even 20 may have been easier to swallow, considering I've completed it, and steam shows me at exactly 103 minutes. There's no replayablity, unless you just want to "do it again", or maybe showcase it to a friend.

THAT SAID, it's awesome for that 100 minutes or so. The puzzles are trivial, and you're mostly just plowing through it to do it. Right when it gets interesting, it ends, but it's episodic. I expected that.

All told, 30 bucks isn't a big deal to me, and I think it was worth it. I'm not saving allowances or anything anymore though... so you may be in a different boat.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008935116', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 222, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 88, 'last_played': 1460698154}
review: Wow! I'd heard good things about this game so my expectations were high. It lives up to the positive reviews! If you like adventure games and have a Vive its a must buy.

author: {'steamid': '76561197976091965', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 286, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 157, 'last_played': 1461478304}
review: The best VR game i have played. So immersive i felt as if i was Alex and i just started the most  EPIC adventure. Great voice acting and story telling. The best thing i have done in gaming in along time. This is what i wanted from VR. i cant wait for ep2!!!!!!  10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198000179216', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 250, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 142, 'last_played': 1471552782}
review: This was on of the best story experience I have ever had. I have never felt so immersed in another world holy crap! Fantastic Game would definitely recommend!

author: {'steamid': '76561197995380553', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 82, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1460165121}
review:
Edit: As I've seen this question repeatedly, you need a VR headset. Specifically the Vive until Oculus Touch arrives assuming dev support for the Touch controllers.

At a $30 price point for the time I spent in the game I would be hesitant to recommend this right out, but I think that the quality of the game and the polish I felt while playing it I would definitely suggest giving this a shot. Don't go into this thinking it will be like the old school point and click adventures as the puzzles are generally nonexistant and you rarely interact directly with any characters. Go into this for the feeling of adventure.

Pros:
-Looks and sounds beautiful
-Great acting
-Movement system pretty intuitive and with no motion sickness
-Interacting with everything feels great
-Feels like I'm in a movie

Cons:
-Short, very short. Short enough that I am concerned about the price point.
-Shooting flares was somehow the hardest thing I had to do in the game
-Very subjective, but I wanted significantly more puzzles than I got.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006709426', 'num_games_owned': 1646, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 1643, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1075, 'last_played': 1491863110}
review:
There are plenty of new ideas that this game features using VR in all kinds of ways to give really amazing immersive experience.
It has really unique setting with couple of pretty neat puzzles and overall good feel of presence.
Its short, yes but the experience you are getting from it is pretty unique for an adventure game which uses virtual reality. And letting some friends play it makes it worth the money.

Really worth checking out!
